升阶 (4环级) 如3环级，你也能指出最高环级魔法的来源。如同一种模糊感官（imprecise sense），你不会了解具体的位置，但是可以将来源锁定到5尺立方（或者最近的那个五尺立方，如果来源体积比这个区域更大）。

j67v58b1JnGdHgaW.name: Black Smear Poison
j67v58b1JnGdHgaW.description:
Many calignis use a debilitating poison crafted from subterranean fungi.

Activate T Interact (Injury)

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:16]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 [[/r {1d6}[poison]]]{1d6 poison damage} and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 As stage 1

Stage 3 [[/r {1d6}[poison]]]{1d6 poison damage}, and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} (1 round)

7SNUgV6SLqC5TzXJ.name: 高等黑暗视觉 Greater Darkvision

KFObwL3fuLfRhdtm.name: Death Flame
KFObwL3fuLfRhdtm.description:
When the stalker dies, their body combusts in a flash of white-hot flame. All creatures in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:20] take [[/r {5d6}[fire]]]{5d6 fire damage} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:21|basic:true] save).

The stalker's gear and treasure are unaffected by the flames and are left in a pile where they died.

TBlcp9L0tEkA3jyF.name: Double Slice
TBlcp9L0tEkA3jyF.description: The caligni stalker makes two Strikes against the same target, one with each of their shortswords. The stalker combines the damage of any attacks that hit and applies precision damage, resistances, and weaknesses only once. Both attacks count toward the stalker's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty increases only after both attacks.

Wa8dbVwSNL2tEHKt.name: Encircling Command
Wa8dbVwSNL2tEHKt.description: Each caligni creeper within @Template[type:emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} of the stalker can Step. Each creeper can benefit from Encircling Command only once per round.

MjvAem9y7U9Z9AnV.name: 偷袭 Sneak Attack
MjvAem9y7U9Z9AnV.description:
The caligni stalker deals 1d6 extra precision damage to flat‑footed creatures.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.SneakAttack]

Cassisian.name: 圣盔天使 Cassisian
Cassisian.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. evil creatures
Cassisian.publicNotes:
The weakest of angels, cassisians usually serve as lackey messengers for more powerful angels or as spiritual guides for mortals. Despite their limited intellect, cassisians have a knack for precise recollection, particularly with scripture. Most cassisians are formed from the souls of trustworthy mortals, but some arise from fragments of greater angels destroyed in service to the celestial realms.

The celestial hosts of angels are messengers and warriors, divided into choirs based on their abilities and purviews. The majority of angels are neutral good and live in Nirvana, the plane of virtue and enlightenment. However, some angels, including several angelic deities, have different alignments, and some even dwell on other planes. Regardless of alignment, angels remain benevolent messengers possessed with magical auras to aid their allies.

gQoduyb8g1gthAxV.name: 侦测阵营(随意施法,仅限邪恶) Detect Alignment (At Will) (Evil Only)
gQoduyb8g1gthAxV.description:
当你感受到阵营灵光时，视野中会闪动光芒。选择混乱，邪恶，善良或者秩序。你侦测该阵营的灵光。你不会获得存在或不存在以外的任何信息。你可以选择不侦测你知晓已经有该阵营的生物或者效果。

只有6或者更高等级的生物具有阵营灵光——除非是神术施法者，不死生物，或者外层位面（Outer Sphere的存在）。

升阶 (2环级) 你能了解到各个灵光的位置和强度。

Y0hXaOxr6GsRFfoz.name: +1 Status to All Saves and AC vs. Evil Creatures

3o5i63MTjWyPqXG3.name: Transfer Protection
3o5i63MTjWyPqXG3.description:
A non-evil creature can wear a willing cassisian as a helmet. While it does, the cassisian can take no actions, but the cassisian extends its +1 status bonus to AC and saves against evil creatures to its wearer. At any time, the cassisian can detach itself from its wearer as an action.

@Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-effects.kHRbOHKEedKaBFH5]{Effect: Transfer Protection}

wwQOKHAUPw4ltzVK.name: Change Shape
wwQOKHAUPw4ltzVK.description:
A cassisian can take the appearance of a dove, a winged humanoid, a dog, or a fish. Normally, this doesn't change its Speed or the attack and damage bonuses for its Strikes, but it might change the damage type Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning). Any further changes for specific forms are noted below.

  • Dog
    • Size small
    • Sense Scent (Imprecise) 30 feet
    • Speed 40 feet
    • Melee 1 [[/r 1d20+7 #Jaws]]{Jaws +7}, Damage [[/r {1d6+2}[piercing]]]{1d6+2 piercing} plus @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.BCLvAx4Pz4MLa2pu]{Knockdown}
  • Fish
    • Speed Swim 30 feet

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

BuEcwGM7NH9is0w9.name: Eye Beams
BuEcwGM7NH9is0w9.description:
The cassisian releases beams of heat or cold from its eyes, dealing [[/r {2d6}[cold]]]{2d6 cold damage} or [[/r {2d6}[fire]]]{2d6 fire damage} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:17|basic:true] save) to all creatures in a @Template[type:line|distance:15]{15-foot line}.

It can't use Eye Beams again for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

mDnVfeIEWGgfP7Xq.name: Repository of Lore
mDnVfeIEWGgfP7Xq.description: While the cassisian isn't particularly intelligent, it has perfect memory and can remember everything it sees or hears. This allows it to attempt @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Lore} checks on any topic, provided (at the GM's discretion) the cassisian has encountered the topic in question before. The cassisian's limited intellect often prevents it from acting upon its knowledge, making it a better resource than agent in matters of information use.

Catfolk Pouncer.name: 猫族突袭者 Catfolk Pouncer
Catfolk Pouncer.publicNotes:
Catfolk pouncers travel the world in search of new experiences.

Lithe and agile, with catlike features and long tails, the amurruns are wanderers, explorers, and extroverts who share a gregarious nature and an unbridled curiosity. This latter characteristic leads many individual amurruns into trouble, yet this inquisitiveness is paired with a penchant for good fortune that offsets much of their self-induced peril. They accept the term "catfolk" as a name for their people with grace and a hint of amusement.

Ever eager to explore and learn, catfolk have spread to other parts of the world from their native nations in the southern tropics, yet never in large groups. A lone catfolk can be found anywhere in the world, but it's rare to find a settlement beyond their traditional national borders. This is due to their innate wanderlust and insatiable wonder. As many a catfolk might say, "I've lived with my people my whole life, but you? You're new and different! There's so much to learn from you!"

Longstanding amurrun legends claim the catfolk were first created as guardians and were then charged with protecting the world from those sinister forces that exist at its fringes. Often, this charge manifests as a longstanding opposition to cultists of demon lords, archdevils, and other fiendish demigods. Many catfolk worship the spirits of creation, using serendipitous rituals to attract good fortune and banish ill luck in the spirits' name, while others venerate their own small pantheon of divinities. Those who travel often find comfort in the worship of Desna, whose teachings closely match their own predilections.

Catfolk adapt well to adventuring roles, and can be quite diverse in their areas of study and specialization. Those who follow the traditions of rangers and rogues are perhaps the most commonly encountered, but not overwhelmingly so. Their natural curiosity leads some catfolk to take up mystical arts, training as wizards or following a divine path to become clerics.

0ZKaotgANUyAmZDc.name: Cat's Luck
0ZKaotgANUyAmZDc.description:
Trigger The catfolk pouncer fails or critically fails a Reflex saving throw.

Frequency Once per day.

Effect Reroll that saving throw and take the better result.

LbGQE0qrzbORDYH9.name: Sudden Charge
LbGQE0qrzbORDYH9.description: The catfolk pouncer Strides up to double their Speed. If the catfolk ends their movement within melee reach of at least one enemy, they can make a melee Strike against that enemy.

Cauthooj.name: 迷音鸟 Cauthooj
Cauthooj.publicNotes:
这些巨大的、不会飞的鸟类虽然身体高长、步态滑稽，但其实出人意料的灵活。他们是独行的掠食者，用他们具有迷惑性的鸟鸣让猎物陷入疯狂，操纵他们互相攻击，这样它们就能尽情享用它们的遗骸了。

一些学者将它们成为“人偶师鸟”，另一些人则称其为“尖叫伯劳”。迷音鸟为大多数聪明的类人生物所唾骂，部分原因是因为这些鸟更喜欢狩猎类人生物。当地人目击到迷音鸟之后通常会组织一个捕猎队，在它再次杀戮之前追踪他的行踪，猎人们通常会把耳朵塞满蜡，以免被它的叫声所影响。那些有幸从这种叫声中幸存下来的人表示，这种声音特别让人紧张不安，甚至没有什么声音比它更为可怕。

虽然人们可能会认为迷音鸟是一种愚蠢的动物，但这些生物实际上比它们看起来要聪明的多。迷音鸟会在偏远的定居点外围跟踪孤独的旅行者，以让自己能饱餐一顿。这些有耐心的生物直到填饱肚子之前能一直埋伏很久。他们甚至能理解一些基本的木族语，尽管它们无法清晰地说话，但这不能阻止迷音鸟试图模仿它听到的声音，当它这么做的时候，它的野蛮的原始天性增强了这种行为，这让它拥有了能控制思维并造成混乱的能力，迷音鸟的智力让它足以理解自身这种特性，并乐在其中。

LnCX5HAN8VUMv1f5.name: 跳跃闪避 Hop-Dodge
LnCX5HAN8VUMv1f5.description:
触发 迷音鸟是近战打击的目标，且与另一个同样位于该近战打击触及范围内的敌人相邻。

效果 迷音鸟敏捷地跳跃，使得触发此能力的近战打击的目标变成与迷音鸟相邻的敌人。迷音鸟以半速行走，并且此移动不触发任何反应动作。

q1LhwW1syAxORXNt.name: 颤音打击 Staccato Strike
q1LhwW1syAxORXNt.description: 迷音鸟通过微妙声调变化，可以指挥一个因为颤音之歌而@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{困惑 Confused}的生物进行一次打击。这参照一般陷入困惑的生物进行的打击，只是迷音鸟可以指定打击的目标。如果目标的触及范围内没有目标，或目标因为其他原因无法进行打击，则此能力无效。

21tFYXEcsuyuh5GQ.name: 颤音之歌 Warbling Song
21tFYXEcsuyuh5GQ.description:
迷音鸟发出一种奇怪的悲泣，导致附近的生物变得狂躁和失控。@Template[type:emanation|distance:120]{120尺弥散}范围内的所有生物都必须进行@Check[type:will|dc:32]豁免来抵抗该效果。

大成功 目标不受影响且临时免疫该能力一分钟。

成功 目标不受影响。

失败 目标@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{困惑 Confused}1轮。

大失败 目标@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{困惑 Confused}1轮并立即攻击目标自己（采用困惑状态时通常的攻击方式）。这次攻击并不能让目标因为受伤而尝试用纯骰检定来从混乱状态恢复。

Cave Bear.name: 穴熊 Cave Bear
Cave Bear.publicNotes:
Larger, stronger, and far more aggressive than its smaller cousins, the cave bear is a behemoth that avoids civilized lands, preferring to dwell in remote places. As its name might suggest, the cave bear makes its den in natural caves, and like the grizzly bear, a cave bear is fiercely territorial. Unlike a grizzly bear, however, a cave bear is short tempered and will make sure its foe is dead before moving on, usually feasting on its prey's soft flesh once it has been incapacitated. Cave bears are often regarded as powerful guardian spirits by remote-dwelling people, while they are utilized as beasts of war by orcs or even giants-stone giants in particular have an affinity for keeping trained cave bears as pets or guardians for their homes.

Bears are ferocious predators typically found in cold or temperate woodlands and hills. Many species of bear exist in addition to the two presented below, such as the smaller (but no less dangerous) black bear or the arctic-dwelling polar bear.

deLQWsbCp3jKrpIv.name: Mauler
deLQWsbCp3jKrpIv.description: The bear gains a +4 circumstance bonus to damage rolls against creatures it has @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}.

X9lnoAMRNp4d62Iu.name: Rush
X9lnoAMRNp4d62Iu.description: The cave bear Strides and makes a Strike at the end of that movement. During the Stride, it gains a +10-foot circumstance bonus to its Speed.

Centaur.name: 半人马 Centaur
Centaur.publicNotes:
Centaurs are legendary hunters and trackers who resemble heavily muscled humans with the bodies of powerful horses from the waist down. They are typically reclusive but haughty, quick to assume that their handsome physiques and long history of cultural traditions make them superior to any two-legged folk they encounter. While stories of bloody clashes between centaurs and humanoid settlers are well known, centaurs are neither intrinsically bloodthirsty nor recklessly aggressive. Rather, they are proud and stubborn and do not take kindly to outsiders who encroach on their ancestral grounds, some of which have been ruled by centaurs for thousands of years. Against despoilers of nature who fail to heed their warnings, centaurs do not hesitate to use their finely honed hunting skills to inflict deadly wounds.

Centaurs train with weapons as well as their heavy hooves, and the thunder of centaurs charging across the plains is often mistaken for a stampede or even an earthquake. Despite their insular nature, some centaurs form close alliances with elves, fey, gnomes, and isolated human communities. Such allies are often surprised to learn the depths of centaurs' honor, pragmatism, and wilderness lore. Rarely, a centaur leaves its tribe to travel the wider world. Such lone centaur wanderers more easily integrate into humanoid societies, but other centaurs are quick to assume that some dishonor led to their exile and thus give such vagabonds a wide berth.

Centaurs have incredible variation in their individual size and coloration. Their upper bodies are fairly similar within a tribe and even region, but their lower bodies-like those of horses-can vary widely from parent to child. Most centaurs are at least 7 feet tall and weigh more than 2,000 pounds.

Centaurs live in groups of dozens of members, usually led by an old, powerful seer or battle-hardened warrior who has carried out many noble deeds and earned a lifetime of respect from their comrades. The revered leader guides the habits of their entire group; a wise seer might encourage the tribe to roam far from civilization to preserve the ways of its ancestors, while an aggressive warrior might foster skirmishes with nearby humanoid settlements and even rival centaur groups.

Ceustodaemon.name: 仆役邪魔 Ceustodaemon
Ceustodaemon.publicNotes:
Ceustodaemons are formed from the souls of vile mortals, particularly those who took efforts to hasten their own death, their willingness shaping them into daemonic servants. Their otherworldly senses make them useful for protecting vaults and similar locations on the Material Plane. Ceustodaemons are created to serve, but always seek ways to subvert their bindings, so they can rend their mortal summoners' flesh. The worst type of conjurer calls upon ceustodaemons merely to set them free into the world in hopes of currying favor with the powers of Abaddon.

Denizens of the bleak and terrible plane of Abaddon, daemons are shaped by and devoted to the destruction of life in all its forms. They seek the death of every mortal being by the most painful and horrible means possible, all in service to the apocalyptic entities known as the Four Horsemen. Each kind of daemon represents a different way to die, and their powers are nearly always aimed at spreading that particular form of death. Through the use of these powers, they seek to drag all existence down into a pit of hopelessness and despair, and to commit all souls to oblivion.

While those who summon daemons to the Material Plane usually seek to use the creatures' destructive and corrupting powers for their own ends, daemons always look for ways to spread fear, doubt, and despair wherever they go. Often, daemons disguise their plots as the workings of other fiends, knowing that such confusion compounds mortals' fear.

While all fiends seek to tempt mortals into lives of evil to increase their own numbers and power on their native planes, daemons are further driven by a supernatural hunger for mortal souls and use a variety of methods-not least of which is the cacodaemons' soul gems-to entrap them. On Abaddon and in other forbidding places across the multiverse, souls are simultaneously a delicacy, a trade good, and a source of magical power, and the daemons are among the greatest gluttons, merchants, and abusers of this spiritual "resource."

o5Zxivy6gPz9uwu3.name: 次元门(随意施法) Dimension Door (At Will)
o5Zxivy6gPz9uwu3.description:
你通过开启一扇绕过通常空间的门，将自身以及任何你穿戴和持握的物品从你当前所在的空间立刻传送到你能看见的范围内的开阔空间。如果此时另一个生物会与你随行—即使你使用异次元存储空间—你会失去该法术。

升阶 (5环级) 该射程增加到1英里。你无须看见你的目标，只要你曾经去过那里，并且了解其与你的相对位置和距离。你会暂时免疫1小时。

g2DB6NpjUJNvoMdm.name: 飞行术 Fly
g2DB6NpjUJNvoMdm.description:
目标能够在空气中穿梭，获得等于其速度或者20尺的飞行速度，取较高者。

升阶 (7环) 该持续时间增加到1小时。

7qE6PiM12QgkWctV.name: 识破隐形(随意施法) See Invisibility (Constant)
7qE6PiM12QgkWctV.description:
你能看见 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{隐形 Invisible} 的生物和物体。对你而言它们看起来如同半透明一般，并且对你视为 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{隐蔽 Concealed} 。

升阶 (5环级) 该法术的持续时间为8小时。

@Compendium[pf2e.spell-effects.T5bk6UH7yuYog1Fp]{法术效果：识破隐形}

EnBhUXkHOrsrB0rH.name: 侦测阵营(随意施法,仅限善良) Detect Alignment (At Will) (Good Only)
EnBhUXkHOrsrB0rH.description:
当你感受到阵营灵光时，视野中会闪动光芒。选择混乱，邪恶，善良或者秩序。你侦测该阵营的灵光。你不会获得存在或不存在以外的任何信息。你可以选择不侦测你知晓已经有该阵营的生物或者效果。

只有6或者更高等级的生物具有阵营灵光——除非是神术施法者，不死生物，或者外层位面（Outer Sphere的存在）。

升阶 (2环级) 你能了解到各个灵光的位置和强度。

qf9VkXweMZaEf2DP.name: Breath Weapon
qf9VkXweMZaEf2DP.description:
The ceustodaemon breathes flames in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30]. Creatures in the cone take [[/r {7d6}[fire]]]{7d6 fire damage} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:24|basic:true] save).

The ceustodaemon and each creature that fails the save catch fire, taking [[/r {2d6}[persistent,fire]]]@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Fire Damage}.

The breath weapon can't be used again for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

WI20ZnQYqmSIaz3B.name: Drawn to Service
WI20ZnQYqmSIaz3B.description: When bringing a ceustodaemon to another plane with effects like a @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.2ykmAVKrsAWcazcC]{Planar Binding} or @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.vgy00hnqxN9VoeoF]{Planar Ally} ritual, the primary and secondary skill DCs are reduced by 5, and the ceustodaemon demands only half the normal cost for its service.

5McIXOemuKXFd7Ep.name: Vicious Wounds
5McIXOemuKXFd7Ep.description:
On a successful jaws or claw Strike, the ceustodaemon viciously tears into its victim as similar wounds appear on its own body. The target takes an extra [[/r {1d6}]]{1d6 amount of damage}, and the ceustodaemon takes the same extra damage.

If this extra damage to the target is doubled, due to a critical hit, the ceustodaemon takes double damage as well.

Changeling Exile.name: 流浪替换儿 Changeling Exile
Changeling Exile.allSaves: +2 circumstance to all saves vs. dream and sleep
Changeling Exile.publicNotes:
This changeling exile is the child of a night hag or dreamthief hag.

Children of hags, destined to become hags themselves, changelings face a life of conflict. Born of supernatural creatures who kill and consume the child's father, changelings are deposited into their father's society to be raised. These offspring appear to be members of their paternal ancestry, and changelings have been found among dwarves, gnomes, orcs, goblins, and numerous others, but human-ancestry changelings are by far the most common. Within the normal range for their ancestry, changelings tend toward slighter builds, darker hair, and pale complexions, though their most common feature is a nearly universal heterochromia, leading to widespread superstition about individuals with differently colored eyes.

As changelings come of age, they sometimes manifest abilities granted by their hag heritage. Some gain the ability to see in the dark, some grow fingernails long and hard enough to serve as claws, and others gain even stranger abilities specific to their hag mother. For instance, dream mays, the children of night hags or their cousins the dreamthief hags, can gain an enhanced ability to resist the magic of dreams and sleep. Other types of changelings include slag mays, the children of annis hags; callow mays, the children of green hags; brine mays, the children of sea hags; and others for each type of hag. As beings infused with supernatural power, changelings find themselves able to command various traditions of magic, with many drawn to either the occult magic common among hags or primal magic.

At roughly the same time in their lives, many changelings-women in particular-begin to hear the Call, a psychic urging from their hag mother luring them away from the communities that raised them. If followed, the Call eventually leads the changeling to the hag's coven, where they are subjected to terrible rituals that twist them into hags themselves. Some changelings, especially those who have strong social bonds or embrace druidic traditions, are able to resist this Call and continue on with their mortal lives. The fact that the Call disproportionately targets female changelings has led to a widespread misunderstanding that all changelings are female, while in fact male changelings are simply assumed to be members of their paternal ancestry.

3WumD6XU2ACGghbI.name: +2 Circumstance to All Saves vs. Dream and Sleep

Chimera (Black Dragon).name: 奇美拉(黑龙) Chimera (Black Dragon)
Chimera (Black Dragon).publicNotes: The chimera is the archetypal example of an unnatural monster made up of a monstrous mix of wildly different component creatures: in this case, a lion, a dragon, and a goat. Wild, hateful, and hungry, it tries to eat any creature it sees, but sometimes a strong-willed master is able to compel a chimera to serve as a guardian or even a mount.

5ulvx0zqprJryzvq.name: 借机攻击 Attack of Opportunity

7CQGpLGBAg2Jbtjv.name: Three Headed
7CQGpLGBAg2Jbtjv.description: Any ability that would sever a chimera's head (such as a critical hit with a @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.6xaxxKfvXED6LfIY]{Vorpal Weapon}) severs one head at random. Losing a head doesn't kill a chimera (as long as it has one head left), but it does prevent it from making Strikes with the lost head or using the head's Breath Weapon.

PQMwXaG8Zqcd02Oe.name: Triple Opportunity
PQMwXaG8Zqcd02Oe.description: A chimera gains 2 extra reactions each round that it can use only to make Attacks of Opportunity. It must use a different head for each reaction, and it can't use more than one on the same triggering action. If it loses one of its heads, it also loses one of these extra reactions.

9RDkmFyfywWSOj2V.name: Breath Weapon
9RDkmFyfywWSOj2V.description:
The chimera breathes a @Template[type:line|distance:60] of acid that deals [[/r {9d6}[acid]]]{9d6 acid damage} to all creatures in the area (@Check[type:reflex|dc:26|basic:true] save).

The chimera can't use Breath Weapon again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.

8PkUYYXKF3YdJiBM.name: Draconic Bite
8PkUYYXKF3YdJiBM.description: A chimera's black dragon head deals an extra [[/r {2d6}[acid]]]{2d6 acid damage} (already included).

pEpgPRttHusG3elF.name: Three-Headed Strike
pEpgPRttHusG3elF.description: The chimera makes a Strike with its dragon jaws, lion jaws, and goat horns, each at a -2 penalty and targeting a different creature. These Strikes count as only one attack for the chimera's multiple attack penalty, and the penalty doesn't increase until after it has made all three attacks.

Chimera (Blue Dragon).name: 奇美拉(蓝龙) Chimera (Blue Dragon)
Chimera (Blue Dragon).publicNotes: The chimera is the archetypal example of an unnatural monster made up of a monstrous mix of wildly different component creatures: in this case, a lion, a dragon, and a goat. Wild, hateful, and hungry, it tries to eat any creature it sees, but sometimes a strong-willed master is able to compel a chimera to serve as a guardian or even a mount.

5ulvx0zqprJryzvq.name: 借机攻击 Attack of Opportunity

7CQGpLGBAg2Jbtjv.name: Three Headed
7CQGpLGBAg2Jbtjv.description: Any ability that would sever a chimera's head (such as a critical hit with a @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.6xaxxKfvXED6LfIY]{Vorpal Weapon}) severs one head at random. Losing a head doesn't kill a chimera (as long as it has one head left), but it does prevent it from making Strikes with the lost head or using the head's Breath Weapon.

PQMwXaG8Zqcd02Oe.name: Triple Opportunity
PQMwXaG8Zqcd02Oe.description: A chimera gains 2 extra reactions each round that it can use only to make Attacks of Opportunity. It must use a different head for each reaction, and it can't use more than one on the same triggering action. If it loses one of its heads, it also loses one of these extra reactions.

The chimera breathes a @Template[type:line|distance:60] of electricity that deals [[/r {9d6}[electricity]]]{9d6 electricity damage} to all creatures in the area (@Check[type:reflex|dc:26|basic:true] save).

The chimera can't use Breath Weapon again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.

Choral.name: 科洛天使 Choral
Choral.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic
Choral.publicNotes:
Choral angels are incredible singers who fill the halls of Nirvana with pious chants and sacred hymns. They form from the souls of talented bards and other performers. While they shy away from conflict, they occasionally brave the mortal realm to deliver good omens and auspicious messages. Choral angels often serve the goddess Shelyn, but they can also serve other good deities and empyreal lords.

The celestial hosts of angels are messengers and warriors, divided into choirs based on their abilities and purviews. The majority of angels are neutral good and live in Nirvana, the plane of virtue and enlightenment. However, some angels, including several angelic deities, have different alignments, and some even dwell on other planes. Regardless of alignment, angels remain benevolent messengers possessed with magical auras to aid their allies.

8uigP4T6d8IHuLQL.name: 神圣裁决() Divine Decree (See Harmonize)
8uigP4T6d8IHuLQL.description:
你呢喃你信仰中的一段强大祷词，这是会伤害对立你的信念之人的敕令。选择一个你的神祇具有的阵营。（混乱，邪恶，善良，或者秩序）。如果你没有神祇，或者你的神祇是绝对中立，你无法施放该法术。该法术具有你选择的阵营的特征。你对区域内生物造成7d10伤害；每个生物必须尝试一次强韧豁免。具有你所选择的阵营的生物不受法术影响。阵营既不对应也不对立的目标，将其豁免结果视为更好一级，并且不会承受伤害以外的额外效果。

大成功 该生物不受影响。

成功 该生物承受一半伤害。

失败 该生物承受完整伤害，并且获得 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{力竭 Enfeebled 2}，持续1分钟。

大失败 该生物承受双倍伤害，并且获得 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{力竭 Enfeebled 2} ，持续1分钟。在你的原属位面，一个在豁免中大失败生物生物会如同在 @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.bay4AfSu2iIozNNW]{放逐术 Banishment} 豁免中失败一般被放逐。10级或者更低的生物必须尝试一次意志豁免。在失败时，它会 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{麻痹 Paralyzed} 1分钟；在大失败时，它会死亡。

升阶 (+1) 该伤害增加1d10，并且在豁免大失败时必须尝试第二次豁免的生物等级增加2。

VUC2XUgP1Wl8GP6M.name: 巧言术(恒定法术) Tongues (Constant)
VUC2XUgP1Wl8GP6M.description:
无论什么语言，目标都可以理解其所有的词语，并且向其他生物用该语言交流。当处于一群各异的生物中时，每次目标将要说话，他可以选择一个生物，并使用一种该生物理解的语言来讲述，即使该目标不知道这语言具体是什么。

升阶 (7环级) 持续时间为8小时。

JTC7dqzt6oF49qIZ.name: 英雄气概() Heroism (See Harmonize)
JTC7dqzt6oF49qIZ.description:
你引发了目标内在的英勇，赋予其在攻击骰，察觉检定，豁免骰和技能检定上的+1状态加值。

升阶 (6环级) 该状态加值增加到+2。

升阶 (9环级) 该状态加值增加到+3。

@Compendium[pf2e.spell-effects.l9HRQggofFGIxEse]{法术效果：英雄气概}

XgP4n1zKwtJiZkhR.name: 安定心神() Calm Emotions (See Harmonize)
XgP4n1zKwtJiZkhR.description:
你令区域内的生物强制冷静，令它们进入平和的状态；每个生物必须尝试一次意志豁免。

大成功 该生物不受影响。

成功 对沉静的渴求令该生物在攻击骰上承受-1状态减值。

失败 任何会影响该生物的情绪效果会被压制，并且该生物无法进行敌对行为。如果该目标成为任何其他生物敌对行为的目标，它不再受到安定心神的影响。

大失败 如同失败，但是敌对行为不会结束该效果。

@Compendium[pf2e.spell-effects.Qr5rgoZvI4KmFY0N]{法术效果：安定心神}

psEMpr7a7TZs1sND.name: 隐形术(随意施法,仅限自身) Invisibility (At Will) (Self Only)
psEMpr7a7TZs1sND.description:
目标被幻术包复，变得 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{隐形 Invisible}. 这令该生物对所有生物 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{无踪Undetected} ，但生物可以尝试寻找目标，令其改为 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{藏匿 Hidden}。如果目标使用敌对动作，法术在敌对动作完成后结束。

升阶 (4环级) 该法术持续1分钟，但目标使用敌对动作时该法术不会结束。

L05P9dGXjwURIjtP.name: 移除恐惧(随意施法) Remove Fear (At Will)
L05P9dGXjwURIjtP.description:
你通过一次接触来平缓一个生物的恐惧。你可以尝试反制目标正承受的一个恐惧效果。这只会令目标得到解脱，不包括该恐惧效果的其他目标。

升阶 (6环级) 该法术的射程增加到30尺，并且你能以至多10个生物为目标。

lUx3uVYEFr3kvziO.name: 音鸣爆(随意施法) Sound Burst (At Will)
lUx3uVYEFr3kvziO.description:
刺耳的噪音迸裂而出，造成2d10音波伤害。每个生物必须尝试一次强韧豁免。

大成功 该生物不受影响。

成功 该生物承受一半伤害。

失败 该生物承受完整伤害，并且 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{耳聋 Deafened} 1轮。

大失败 该生物承受双倍伤害，获得耳聋1分钟，并且 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{震慑 Stunned 1}。

升阶 (+1) 该伤害增加1d10。

ZJmFD3ZikLbMpLo8.name: 音鸣爆() Sound Burst (See Harmonize)
ZJmFD3ZikLbMpLo8.description:
刺耳的噪音迸裂而出，造成2d10音波伤害。每个生物必须尝试一次强韧豁免。

大成功 该生物不受影响。

成功 该生物承受一半伤害。

失败 该生物承受完整伤害，并且 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{耳聋 Deafened} 1轮。

大失败 该生物承受双倍伤害，获得耳聋1分钟，并且 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{震慑 Stunned 1}。

升阶 (+1) 该伤害增加1d10。

Q64gJkNmFi1chKiM.name: 反制表演(随意施法) Counter Performance (At Will)
Q64gJkNmFi1chKiM.description:
触发 你或者一个60尺内的盟友掷骰对抗视觉或听觉效果

你的表演保护着你和盟友。进行一次你所知类型的表演掷骰：如果触发源为视觉效果则为视觉表演，如果触发源为听觉效果则为听觉表演。你和该区域内的盟友可以使用你的表演检定和豁免骰中较好的结果。

tuy3OZwjoMaz8V1p.name: 激发表现 Inspire Competence
tuy3OZwjoMaz8V1p.description:
你的鼓舞激励盟友完成任务。这视为进行了完善的准备援助盟友进行你所选定的一个技能检定，无视环境因素。当你之后使用援助动作时，你可以投掷表演检定而非通常的技能检定，如果你投出失败，你会反而获得成功。如果你在表演中为传奇等级，你自动获得大成功。

GM可以规定若你的表演会干涉队友的技能检定，则无法使用这一能力援助队友（比如在安静情况下使用隐匿或者维持易容）。

8cJQY3xEuodUaxz6.name: Harmonizing Aura
8cJQY3xEuodUaxz6.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:20]{20 feet} @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

Allies in the area gain a +2 status bonus to sonic damage rolls and a +1 status bonus to AC and all saves against sonic and auditory effects. Enemies in the area take a -2 status bonus to sonic damage rolls and a -1 status bonus to AC and all saves against sonic and auditory effects.

@Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-effects.tSF9z5VTeevxoww3]{Effect: Harmonizing Aura (Enemies)}

09tr8RqXPJwNExtR.name: Deafening Aria
09tr8RqXPJwNExtR.description: On a critical hit with piercing hymn, the target is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened} for one minute.

kpuj3LrmPskjllD8.name: Harmonize
kpuj3LrmPskjllD8.description:
The choral angel adds its harmony to a choral angel ally within its harmonizing aura.

The ally can cast @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.b515AZlB0sridKSq]{Calm Emotions} or @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.KqvqNAfGIE5a9wSv]{Heroism} on its next turn in place of its 3rd-level @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.wzLkNU3AAqOSKFPR]{Sound Burst} or heighten its 3rd-level @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.wzLkNU3AAqOSKFPR]{Sound Burst} by 1 level.

If five different choral angels use Harmonize on the same choral angel ally, it can instead cast @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.sX2o0HH4RjJDAZ8C]{Divine Decree} in place of its 3rd-level @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.wzLkNU3AAqOSKFPR]{Sound Burst}.

Cockatrice.name: 鸡蛇兽 Cockatrice
Cockatrice.publicNotes:
Ugly and aggressive, the dread cockatrice stalks garbage pits and hillside dumps in search of prey that it can turn to stone with its petrifying beak and subsequently consume piece by broken piece. Cockatrices resemble gaunt and sickly roosters with bat wings and serpentine tails, and they rarely grow more than 2 feet tall and twice as long. Their absentminded clucking gives smart prey ample warning of their presence, and when angered cockatrices let out a shrill crow like that of a rooster. Their peck releases a magical toxin that causes flesh to quickly calcify, and any creature pecked repeatedly by an irritable cockatrice eventually transforms into a stone statue of itself.

The first cockatrice is rumored to have hatched from a rooster's egg incubated on a dung hill by a toad. Whether or not the rumor is true, the cockatrice's monstrous appearance certainly doesn't contradict its strange and filthy origin story, and these creatures are more than capable of propagating on their own. Cockatrices are remarkably fecund and gather in flocks of up to a dozen members. Each flock contains only a few females. The males-which differ in appearance from the females by having warty wattles and gnarled combs- often fight with each other, with lower-ranking males eventually driven away to find their own lairs or compete among other flocks. Most creatures who run afoul of a solitary cockatrice do so with one of these surly outcasts.

Cockatrice lairs are often littered with fragments of statuary from past victims-although these are as likely to be remnants of frogs, lizards, and insects as people. Curiously, weasels and ferrets, who infiltrate cockatrice lairs to steal their eggs, are immune to the creatures' petrifying bites. For unknown reasons, cockatrices are both terrified of and enraged by conventional roosters, and they are equally likely to flee or attack when confronted by one.

Particularly brave individuals sometimes keep cockatrices as pets or guard animals. In their natural habitat among plains, forests, and sewers near humanoid settlements, cockatrices are content to live off vermin or scraps of waste, but their greatest pleasure is consuming warm meals of freshly petrified flesh.

JChdzk7WZ7KUXqF7.name: Calcification
JChdzk7WZ7KUXqF7.description:
A peck from a cockatrice hardens the flesh of the creature struck. The target must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:20] save or become @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} (or @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} on a critical failure). Further failed saves against calcification increase the slowed condition. Once a creature's actions are reduced to 0 by calcification, that creature becomes @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.dTwPJuKgBQCMxixg]{Petrified}.

Every 24 hours after it was petrified, the victim can attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:20] save to recover. On a success, it becomes flesh again, but is slowed 1 for the next 24 hours. On a critical success, the creature recovers and isn't slowed. On a failure, the creature remains petrified, but can try again in 24 hours. On a critical failure, the petrification is permanent, and the creature can't attempt any more saves.

Crimson Worm.name: 红虫 Crimson Worm
Crimson Worm.senses: 黑暗视觉, 震颤感知（模糊）100尺
Crimson Worm.publicNotes:
红虫是最危险的洞穴蠕虫种类之一。除了比蓝虫更大之外，红虫还喜欢在火山地区挖掘洞穴。世代更迭，火山给红虫带来了与火元素位面的超自然联系。红虫在活火山的熔火核心里筑巢，就像在黑暗之地的最深处发现的那大片沸腾的岩浆地脉一样。在古文明、矮人先民以及火元素位面居民的一些传说中，红虫填满了居民点周围的熔岩护城河，这可能是有些事实依据的。但是在这之前，他们首先得有某种方法来控制这些“护城河蠕虫”并避免红虫先把他们自己的堡垒给挖穿了。

红虫经常会出现在火山温泉等地热活动频繁的地表区域，但即便如此，它们还是喜欢用更多的时间来挖洞，无休止地寻找食物。在红虫的领地内的地表土地有相当显眼的特征——到处都堆积着它们挖洞时排出地表的越堆越高的土堆。

洞穴蠕虫是超级巨大的食腐动物，它们钻到世界深处，吞食找到的任何东西。这些蠕虫以各自独特的颜色而得名，它们非常贪婪，且破坏力强大。不同颜色和能力的洞穴蠕虫潜伏在世界上更偏远的角落——比如传说中居住在巨大冰川或冰山中的白虫，和在早已被遗忘的废墟的墓葬中钻洞的灰虫。

IyKWWIgBkLnO2AXB.name: 震颤感知（模糊）100尺 Tremorsense (Imprecise) 100 feet

FsFg8KtMHYPQyyIC.name: 火焰治疗 Fire Healing
FsFg8KtMHYPQyyIC.description: 只要红虫接触到至少和它体型一样大的火焰或岩浆体，它就能获得@Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.fJSNOw4zHGbIm4bZ]{快速治疗20 Fast Healing 20}。当它被除自身之外的任何魔法火焰效果击中时，红虫会恢复相当于该效果造成火焰伤害的一半的生命值。

tphsLfLbrYV16pth.name: 势不可挡 Inexorable
tphsLfLbrYV16pth.description: 当红虫的回合结束时，从@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{麻痹 Paralyzed}、@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed}、@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{震慑 Stunned}状态中恢复。它对减少移动速度和@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{禁足 Immobilized}状态免疫，并且无视困难地形和高等困难地形。

Y5momV4CWpuw5vhk.name: 摆脱 Shake It Off
Y5momV4CWpuw5vhk.description:
频率 每天一次

触发 红虫将要受到某种状态或不利效果影响（例如@Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.dN8QBNuTiaBHCKUe]{恶意变形术 Baleful Polymorph}）。

效果 红虫使触发此能力的效果无效。来自神器、神祇或类似的力量造成的效果无法用此能力避免。

hdZW9dGdp8kUzUjv.name: 吐息 Breath Weapon
hdZW9dGdp8kUzUjv.description: 红虫进行吐息，对@Template[type:cone|distance:60]{60尺锥形}范围内的所有生物造成[[/r {18d6}[fire]]]{18d6火焰伤害}（@Check[type:reflex|dc:41|basic:true]豁免）。红虫在[[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4轮}内无法再次使用吐息。

t1G2FbWy88tYUk7w.name: 红虫毒液 Crimson Worm Venom
t1G2FbWy88tYUk7w.description:
豁免 @Check[type:fortitude|dc:41]

最大持续 6轮

阶段1 [[/r {1d6}[poison]]]{1d6毒素伤害}和@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{流失 Drained 1} (1轮)

阶段2 [[/r {2d6}[poison]]]{2d6毒素伤害}和@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{流失 Drained 1}(1轮)

阶段3 [[/r {2d6}[poison]]]{2d6毒素伤害}和@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{流失 Drained 2} (1轮).

fifv91vxtwlIpzXx.name: 快速吞咽 Fast Swallow
fifv91vxtwlIpzXx.description:
触发 红虫@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{擒抱 Grabs}一个生物。

效果 红虫使用活吞能力。

NBXY2jJ5QKUZlI60.name: 掘洞者 Rock Tunneler
NBXY2jJ5QKUZlI60.description: 红虫能在坚硬的岩石中以20尺的速度掘进。如果它愿意的话，可以在行经路线上留下隧道，事实上红虫通常就是这么做的。

8VCoSCtEbUqhtmnI.name: 活吞 Swallow Whole
8VCoSCtEbUqhtmnI.description:
超大型, [[/r {3d10+10}[bludgeoning] + {2d6}[fire]]]{3d10+10钝击+2d6火焰伤害}, 破裂36

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.SwallowWhole]

D1ZUrE1107HIW39r.name: 连环击 Thrash
D1ZUrE1107HIW39r.description: 红虫能对触及范围内的所有生物进行一次打击。它可以最多进行一次牙咬打击、一次针刺打击和无数次虫体打击。每次攻击都计入红虫的多重攻击减值，但是在此项行动的全部攻击动作都结束之后生效。

Crag Linnorm.name: 峭壁蛇龙 Crag Linnorm
Crag Linnorm.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic
Crag Linnorm.publicNotes:
Despite being among the weakest linnorms, the crag linnorm is a devastating predator, capable of quickly cooking its foes with its magma breath.

Immense, primeval dragons of the northern reaches of the world, linnorms hate those they deem to be lesser creatures and seek to inflict as much suffering as possible upon their unfortunate victims. While these serpentine monstrosities might not be the powerful winged dragons most imagine, they nonetheless possess incredible strength and deadly powers that often rival authentic dragon brutality.

ZbrVT8ZXTW8YYHBJ.name: 真视术(恒定法术) True Seeing (Constant)
ZbrVT8ZXTW8YYHBJ.description: 你可以看见60尺内的事物的本来面貌。GM秘密骰反制检定，对抗区域中的所有幻术或者变形效果，但这只会决定你是否能看破它（例如，如果该检定成功对抗了一个变形法术，你可以看见该生物的本来形态，但你不会结束该变形法术）。

Sp4QTnqBVliDDjlZ.name: 行动自如(恒定法术) Freedom of Movement (Constant)
Sp4QTnqBVliDDjlZ.description: 你驱散可能会阻碍一个生物或者令其移动减慢的效果。当处于该法术效果中时，法术目标忽视会赋予其速度环境减值的效果。当法术目标尝试 @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{逃脱 Escape} 一个令其 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{禁足 Immobilized}, @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{擒抱 Grabbed}或 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{束缚 Restrained}的效果时，它自动成功，除非该效果是魔法性的，并且其环级比行动自如更高。

Q2tEMGeuUtWJQfpV.name: 借机攻击 Attack of Opportunity

xa72ZqFCCn9Ps5lD.name: Curse of Fire
xa72ZqFCCn9Ps5lD.description:
When a creature slays a crag linnorm, it must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:35] save or permanently gain weakness to fire 15.

@Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-effects.VFIVdYmS3XTdd3hj]{Effect: Curse of Fire}

C35zZH9Tm4QXYQ4y.name: Breath Weapon
C35zZH9Tm4QXYQ4y.description:
The crag linnorm breathes out a stream of magma in a @Template[type:line|distance:120] that deals [[/r {12d6}[fire]]]{12d6 fire damage} to creatures within the area (@Check[type:reflex|dc:34|basic:true] save). Any creature that fails its save also takes [[/r {4d6}[persistent,fire]]] @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Fire Damage}.

The crag linnorm can't use Breath Weapon again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.

The magma remains until the start of the linnorm's next turn. If the linnorm was on the ground, the magma remains as a burning line on the ground directly under the line of the Breath Weapon, and if the linnorm was airborne, the magma rains downward in a sheet 60 feet high. Any creature that moves across or through the magma takes [[/r {6d6}[fire]]]{6d6 fire damage} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:34|basic:true] save). At the start of the linnorm's next turn, the magma cools to a thin layer of brittle stone on the ground, or the magma rain finishes falling and turns to harmless pebbles. The cooled magma quickly degrades to powder and sand over the course of several hours.

vwO9JU83wAh6vmts.name: Crag Linnorm Venom
vwO9JU83wAh6vmts.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:34]

Maximum Duration 10 rounds

Stage 1 [[/r {4d6}[fire]]]{4d6 fire damage} and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}

Stage 2 [[/r {6d6}[fire]]]{6d6 fire damage} and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2}

Dark Naga.name: 黑暗娜迦 Dark Naga
Dark Naga.publicNotes:
Dark nagas are wicked, jealous creatures that crave power and wealth. Indeed, the dark naga sees such ideals as spiritual expressions of an essential truth: if one can take something, that something is theirs to have. The dark naga sees other creatures as lessers worthy only of subjugation or as rivals who must be eliminated.

Dark nagas dwell in remote places other creatures have forsaken, searching abandoned ruins for wealth and potent magic items. Those unlucky trespassers into a dark naga's lair typically find themselves as the naga's slaves or playthings, put to sleep with the monster's poison or incinerated by its deadly magic. Some dark nagas are more disposed toward socializing than others; in these cases, they may become wicked despots who rule over enclaves of captive or unsuspecting subjects. Subtler dark nagas, especially those who crave finer luxuries, dwell in or under the wealthy settlements and use their wiles to garner a decadent following, forming something akin to a cult with the naga as the jewelry-bedecked object of worship.

Nagas are serpentine beings with magical powers and keen, nearly inscrutable intellects. Physically, they resemble massive snakes with eerie visages that resemble those of humans. Nagas use their innate magic and poisonous fangs to keep all but the most stalwart foes at bay. Beyond the natural weapons they use to ward away foes, little is understood of the naga's unsettling physiology.

Nagas are intelligent creatures with powerful needs to pursue, be they the accumulation of knowledge, the collection of rare art, or the rule of an entire nation. On Golarion, the nation of Nagajor is one such society-an entire empire ruled by nagas and populated by reptilian humanoids who serve their naga rulers with a patriotic pride that borders on worship.

Still, most adventurers interact with nagas on a much smaller scale, encountering them as dangerous guardians in remote locations or not-so-abandoned ruins. In many cases, these nagas have heard of distant Nagajor, but they are usually unwilling to abandon their own pursuits to seek out a land where they might be worshipped as gods.

6IX4ybw5O0N1oM20.name: 读心术(恒定法术) Mind Reading (Constant)
6IX4ybw5O0N1oM20.description:
你通过一次短暂的心灵接触来尝试阅读目标的想法。它必须尝试一次意志豁免。目标会暂时免疫你的读心术1小时。

大成功 目标得知当施放该法术时你模糊的表层想法。

成功 你得知目标的智力调整值是高于，等于，还是低于你。

失败 你得知当施放该法术时目标模糊的表层想法，并且你得知目标的智力调整值是高于，等于，还是低于你。

大失败 如失败，并且在法术持续时间中，你可以维持该法术来再次侦测目标的表层想法。目标不会获得另外的豁免。

9d7SQu49j4VHTjmf.name: 侦测魔法 Detect Magic
9d7SQu49j4VHTjmf.description:
你发出一股标记魔法存在的脉冲。你不会获得魔法存在或不存在以外的任何信息。你可以选择忽略你完全知晓的魔法，例如你或者你盟友的魔法物品以及持续法术。

仅当幻术魔法的环级低于你的侦测魔法环级时，你才能侦测幻术魔法。但是，具有幻术灵光但是没有在外表上做伪装的物品（例如一瓶隐形术药水），通常能够正常侦测。

升阶 (3环级) 你会了解法术侦测区域中最高环级的效果的学派。如果有相同强度的多个效果，GM决定你了解的为哪一个。

升阶 (4环级) 如3环级，你也能指出最高环级魔法的来源。如同一种模糊感官（imprecise sense），你不会了解具体的位置，但是可以将来源锁定到5尺立方（或者最近的那个五尺立方，如果来源体积比这个区域更大）。

UmeNuzExQLQPFzTE.name: Guarded Thoughts
UmeNuzExQLQPFzTE.description: Dark nagas are immune to any form of mind reading.

PAbtJjm0RNsZSr1R.name: Dark Naga Venom
PAbtJjm0RNsZSr1R.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:25]

Maximum Duration 5 minutes

Stage 1 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} with no Perception check to wake up ([[/br 1d4+1 #minutes]]{1d4+1 minutes})

Deadly Mantis.name: 夺命螳螂 Deadly Mantis
Deadly Mantis.publicNotes:
这些巨大的螳螂在丛林深处或和史前森林里筑巢，在那里它们捕食和自己同样巨大的猎物。

这些体型巨大的可怕昆虫是寂静无声的掠食者，前肢如闪电般敏捷，一咬就能把骨头啃断。

rQVfc5bR7Xpe25cT.name: 抛掷 Fling
rQVfc5bR7Xpe25cT.description: 夺命螳螂将被它@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{擒抱 Grabbed}的生物抛向空中，抛到距螳螂最多30尺高30尺远的地方（该生物正常遭受坠落伤害）。如果被抛掷的生物落在另一个生物身上，被砸中的生物将受到等量的钝击伤害，被砸中的生物可以尝试通过 @Check[type:reflex|dc:31|basic:true]检定豁免来躲避。

vXxTQUxFEXV4Ldxm.name: 跳跃攫抓 Leaping Grab
vXxTQUxFEXV4Ldxm.description: 夺命螳螂能跳跃最多40尺高、20尺远的距离。在跳跃过程中任意时刻，它可以进行一次镰爪打击。如果命中，则自动@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{擒抱 Grabs}目标，并且带着目标移动到跳跃的最终落点。

ZyTjl37PC8e0rtsy.name: 裂甲之颚 Rending Mandibles
ZyTjl37PC8e0rtsy.description: 夺命螳螂对被它@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{擒抱 Grabbed}的生物进行一次虫颚打击，如果打击命中，并且目标生物所穿的护甲硬度为12或更低，此护甲@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.6dNUvdb1dhToNDj3]{破损 Broken}。此打击不会对已经破损的护甲造成更多伤害。

CUZdx9N2AmVtEjB4.name: 突袭 Sudden Strike
CUZdx9N2AmVtEjB4.description: 在战斗第一轮，尚未行动的敌人对夺命螳螂视为@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{措手不及 Flat-Footed}。

Deep Gnome Rockwarden.name: 地底侏儒岩卫 Deep Gnome Rockwarden
Deep Gnome Rockwarden.publicNotes:
Deep gnome rockwardens follow druidic teachings and commune with the natural elemental influences and denizens of the Darklands. They know that not everything that lives below ground is sinister and evil, but they also understand that all primal spirits and entities must be respected.

These distant cousins to gnomes are reclusive, underground dwellers. Svirfneblins, as deep gnomes call themselves, have skin the color of gray or brown stone. While deep gnome males are bald, women have thin, pale-gray hair, and all have the large, expressive eyes typical among all gnomes. A deep gnome is 3 feet tall and weighs approximately 65 pounds. Deep gnomes rarely interact with those outside of their small cavern communities, and they are slow to trust outsiders, sometimes keeping them imprisoned for years simply to prevent them from informing others of the deep gnome settlement.

The first deep gnomes rose in the underground world some time after their early gnome ancestors migrated from the First World to Golarion. A group of these migrants elected to settle underground instead of on the surface, and it was from these gnomes that the svirfneblin came to be. Some believe the gnomes chose the Darklands as their home to watch for and stop any evil fey who might infiltrate the underground region, but much like the exact reasons for the gnomes' relocation, their motivation has been lost to time. Thousands of years of living in subterranean caverns with little to no light transformed the physical characteristics of the gnomes living there into those of the deep gnome of today.

Though deep gnomes may seem dour and recalcitrant at first glance, they retain the fey blood of their ancestors. In fact, deep gnomes are sometimes more emotionally erratic than their gnome cousins, lashing out violently at what seems like the smallest provocation. Such an explosion is often followed by an extended period of quiet brooding. Despite this, deep gnome communities are close-knit, as each citizen knows when to give the others the space they require to process their feelings.

Many deep gnome settlements have clashed with nearby duergar communities for myriad reasons: resources, territory, and even religion and morality. Over the centuries, some of these disputes have evolved into full wars, with many lives lost on both sides. Neither deep gnomes nor duergars are particularly proud of these conflicts, but both insist they were in the right each time. The ferocity with which most duergars fight has left a deep impression on the psyches of some deep gnome communities, leading them to distrust all dwarves and dwarf-like ancestries even more than other strangers. This can result in non-duergar dwarves being driven off from deep gnome cities before being able to explain themselves. A dwarf and even those traveling with a dwarf require patience and tenacity when attempting to deal with deep gnomes holding such views.

Svirfneblins value crafting and many decorate their cavernous homes with paintings on the walls, often incorporating the rock in clever ways. They also value crystals and gems, making jewelry and beads that they string through their hair.

wo3ZDWmKIsp97TiG.name: 侦测魔法 Detect Magic
wo3ZDWmKIsp97TiG.description:
你发出一股标记魔法存在的脉冲。你不会获得魔法存在或不存在以外的任何信息。你可以选择忽略你完全知晓的魔法，例如你或者你盟友的魔法物品以及持续法术。

仅当幻术魔法的环级低于你的侦测魔法环级时，你才能侦测幻术魔法。但是，具有幻术灵光但是没有在外表上做伪装的物品（例如一瓶隐形术药水），通常能够正常侦测。

升阶 (3环级) 你会了解法术侦测区域中最高环级的效果的学派。如果有相同强度的多个效果，GM决定你了解的为哪一个。

升阶 (4环级) 如3环级，你也能指出最高环级魔法的来源。如同一种模糊感官（imprecise sense），你不会了解具体的位置，但是可以将来源锁定到5尺立方（或者最近的那个五尺立方，如果来源体积比这个区域更大）。

Lr9ykhJaIn18XV6L.name: Primal Focus
Lr9ykhJaIn18XV6L.description: Plants of supernatural significance provide a primal focus for primal spellcasters, such as druids, when using certain abilities and casting some spells. A bundle of holly and mistletoe must be held in one hand to use it. Other primal foci exist for druids focused on other aspects of nature.

XWE3mNKb23Clyj7Y.name: Scroll of Nondetection (Level 3)
XWE3mNKb23Clyj7Y.description:
@Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.EoKBlgf6Smt8opaU]{Nondetection}

Casting a Spell from a scroll requires holding the scroll in one hand and activating it with a Cast a Spell activity using the normal number of actions for that spell.

To Cast a Spell from a scroll, the spell must appear on your spell list. Because you're the one Casting the Spell, use your spell attack roll and spell DC. The spell also gains the appropriate trait for your tradition (arcane, divine, occult, or primal).

Any physical material components and costs are provided when a scroll is created, so you don't need to provide them when Casting a Spell from a scroll. You must replace any required material component for that spell with a somatic component. If the spell requires a focus, you must have that focus to Cast the Spell from a scroll.

Note: To create a scroll or wand of a specific spell, drag the spell from the compendium or compendium browser into the inventory of a PC, NPC, or loot actor.

Deep Gnome Scout.name: 地底侏儒侦察兵 Deep Gnome Scout
Deep Gnome Scout.publicNotes:
Deep gnome scouts patrol the tunnels that lead into their settlements. Some scout alone to make the most of their stealth, but others form groups for the sake of safety.

These distant cousins to gnomes are reclusive, underground dwellers. Svirfneblins, as deep gnomes call themselves, have skin the color of gray or brown stone. mGL7tbh4lfdWIVfJ.name: Hidden Movement
mGL7tbh4lfdWIVfJ.description: If the deep gnome scout starts its turn @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected} or @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} to a creature, that creature is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed} against the deep gnome scout's attacks until the end of the turn.

Deep Gnome Warrior.name: 地底侏儒战士 Deep Gnome Warrior
Deep Gnome Warrior.publicNotes:
Deep gnome warriors are quick to charge into battle but focus on defending their kin and their homes over more aggressive tactics when a choice is available.

These distant cousins to gnomes are reclusive, underground dwellers. Svirfneblins, as deep gnomes call themselves, have skin the color of gray or brown stone. While deep gnome males are bald, women have thin, pale-gray hair, and all have the large, expressive eyes typical among all gnomes. A deep gnome is 3 feet tall and weighs approximately 65 pounds. Deep gnomes rarely interact with those outside of their small cavern communities, and they are slow to trust outsiders, sometimes keeping them imprisoned for years simply to prevent them from informing others of the deep gnome settlement.

The first deep gnomes rose in the underground world some time after their early gnome ancestors migrated from the First World to Golarion. A group of these migrants elected to settle underground instead of on the surface, and it was from these gnomes that the svirfneblin came to be. Some believe the gnomes chose the Darklands as their home to watch for and stop any evil fey who might infiltrate the underground region, but much like the exact reasons for the gnomes' relocation, their motivation has been lost to time. Thousands of years of living in subterranean caverns with little to no light transformed the physical characteristics of the gnomes living there into those of the deep gnome of today.

Though deep gnomes may seem dour and recalcitrant at first glance, they retain the fey blood of their ancestors. In fact, deep gnomes are sometimes more emotionally erratic than their gnome cousins, lashing out violently at what seems like the smallest provocation. Such an explosion is often followed by an extended period of quiet brooding. Despite this, deep gnome communities are close-knit, as each citizen knows when to give the others the space they require to process their feelings.

Many deep gnome settlements have clashed with nearby duergar communities for myriad reasons: resources, territory, and even religion and morality. Over the centuries, some of these disputes have evolved into full wars, with many lives lost on both sides. Neither deep gnomes nor duergars are particularly proud of these conflicts, but both insist they were in the right each time. The ferocity with which most duergars fight has left a deep impression on the psyches of some deep gnome communities, leading them to distrust all dwarves and dwarf-like ancestries even more than other strangers. This can result in non-duergar dwarves being driven off from deep gnome cities before being able to explain themselves. A dwarf and even those traveling with a dwarf require patience and tenacity when attempting to deal with deep gnomes holding such views.

Svirfneblins value crafting and many decorate their cavernous homes with paintings on the walls, often incorporating the rock in clever ways. They also value crystals and gems, making jewelry and beads that they string through their hair.

ROihL0GMWnjLTGFx.name: 借机攻击 Attack of Opportunity

Deinonychus.name: 恐爪龙 Deinonychus
Deinonychus.publicNotes:
Deinonychuses are wily hunters that attack in groups of up to a dozen individuals, ripping apart their prey with sharp talons and powerful jaws. They are lean and muscular, and have two powerful legs and a long tail that helps them maintain balance. Although deinonychuses don't use their dexterous clawed forelimbs to attack, the dinosaurs can use them to pull aside small barriers. Although some of these dinosaurs have scaly skin, most have thatches of vibrantly colored feathers as well. A deinonychus is about 6 feet tall and weighs about 150 pounds.

However, larger deinonychuses exist. These creatures-which stand taller than a human-are called megaraptors.

Remnants from the world's primeval era, these enormous reptilian animals still exist in large numbers in isolated and remote wildernesses or far underground within magical Darklands caverns. Lizardfolk, orcs, giants, and other monstrous humanoids sometimes use dinosaurs as mounts, guards, or hunting animals. Humans and other ancestries have also been known to collect dinosaurs, be it to display them in menageries or keep them as exotic pets or guardians. Such activities are generally pursuits of the rich or eccentric, but certain druids and other guardians of nature feel strong kinships with dinosaurs as well and take them on as companions. When dinosaurs establish themselves in regions beyond their normal habitats, it is generally the result of these captive creatures escaping into the wild.

ROtcz4ACRnmedQua.name: Darting Strike
ROtcz4ACRnmedQua.description: The deinonychus Strides up to 10 feet and then makes a Strike, or makes a Strike and then Strides up to 10 feet.

Demilich.name: 半巫妖 Demilich
Demilich.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. positive
Demilich.publicNotes:
Demiliches are formed when a lich, through carelessness or by accident, loses its phylactery. As years pass, the lich's body crumbles to dust, leaving only the skull as the seat of its necromantic power. The lich enters a sort of torpor, its mind left wandering the planes in search of ever greater mysteries. The lich gradually loses the ability to cast spells and its magic items slowly subsume into its new form. Negative energy concentrates around the skull, causing some of its bones and teeth to petrify with power and turn into blight crystals. The resulting lich skull, embedded with arcane gemstones and suffused with palpably powerful magic, forms a creature called a demilich.

Despite its near-constant state of inactivity, a demilich grows restless from time to time, especially when living creatures draw near. Only then does the demilich's hunger for life stir once more, causing it to lash out with terrifying bursts of power in attempts to consume vital energy. Unlike an ordinary lich, should the demilich's skull be destroyed, its bond to the world is permanently severed, although some theorize that even then it is not truly slain. Rather, some think that once the demilich is destroyed, its foul and tormented mind is finally free to wander the planes and find new ways to enact its will. For the short-lived common folk of the Material Plane, this is good enough, though eons later a demilich may reappear in the region it once inhabited with a new—and even more insidious—agenda.

To gain more time to complete their goals, some desperate spellcasters pursue immortality by embracing undeath. After long years of research and the creation of a special container called a phylactery, a spellcaster takes the final step by imbibing a deadly concoction or casting dreadful incantations that transform them into a lich. While most undertake this drastic plan to continue their work or fulfill some long-term plan, others become liches because they fear death or to fulfill some malevolent purpose, such as long-sworn revenge. Regardless, the result is permanent and carries with it the potential to alter history—both that of those who transform themselves and of the countless mortals that will inevitably suffer as a result of a lich's new power.

After its metamorphosis, a lich often finds some quiet place to dwell, typically protected by a variety of guardians and traps, for two primary purposes. First, a lich requires solitude in order to plan its elaborate schemes, and second, few mortals (if any) deign to interact with these legendarily corrupt necromancers. One reason begets the other, as the self-imposed isolation of a lich often drives the lich insane, further solidifying its separation from civilization. The longer a lich lives, the more meticulous a planner it becomes, secreting itself within a labyrinth of deadly puzzles, misdirection, and monsters. A lich's servants and guardians are absolutely loyal, either due to their nature (such as constructs or other undead) or as a result of compulsion using powerful magic. Many liches go mad, in time, and the nature of a lich's lair is a good indicator of the undead's current mental state.

For all the protections it arrays around itself, a lich will go to greater lengths to guard its phylactery, as it knows that the destruction of this magical container spells doom for the lich. A lich is notoriously difficult to bargain with, though the threat of damaging its phylactery is a sure way to gain the upper hand in such a negotiation.

OSbtb7hOIAcilbFJ.name: 法术反转(随意施法) Spell Turning (At Will)
OSbtb7hOIAcilbFJ.description: 该防护法术会将对你施放的法术反射给其施法者。当一个法术指定你为目标时，你可以花费一个反应动作来尝试反射它。此处使用反制该法术的规则，但如果该法术成功被反制，该法术会反射给施法者。无论反制尝试是否成功，法术反转在那之后结束。法术反转无法影响没有目标的法术（例如区域法术）。如果法术反转反射了一个同样处于法术反转影响下的施法者，其法术反转亦可以尝试将它自己的法术再反射给你；如果它们如此做，其反制检定自动成功。

LDs80bqAdM5lXyY1.name: 真视术(随意施法) True Seeing (Constant)
LDs80bqAdM5lXyY1.description: 你可以看见60尺内的事物的本来面貌。GM秘密骰反制检定，对抗区域中的所有幻术或者变形效果，但这只会决定你是否能看破它（例如，如果该检定成功对抗了一个变形法术，你可以看见该生物的本来形态，但你不会结束该变形法术）。

FcJ7lGjvmOJZvtmO.name: 闪现术(随意施法) Blink (At Will)
FcJ7lGjvmOJZvtmO.description:
你在物质位面和灵界位面之间快速闪现。你对所有伤害获得抗力5（除了力场）。你可以维持法术，消失不见并在10尺内由GM决定的随机方位上出现；该移动不会触发反应动作。在你的回合结束时，你会如上文所述地快速消失又重新出现。

@Compendium[pf2e.spell-effects.ZlsuhS9J0S3PuvCO]{法术效果：闪现术}

升阶 (+2) 该抗力提高3。

OFkqgGXYjl87F0Nt.name: 次元门(随意施法) Dimension Door (At Will)
OFkqgGXYjl87F0Nt.description:
你通过开启一扇绕过通常空间的门，将自身以及任何你穿戴和持握的物品从你当前所在的空间立刻传送到你能看见的范围内的开阔空间。如果此时另一个生物会与你随行—即使你使用异次元存储空间—你会失去该法术。

升阶 (5环级) 该射程增加到1英里。你无须看见你的目标，只要你曾经去过那里，并且了解其与你的相对位置和距离。你会暂时免疫1小时。

ljGlIbY53EAJKiBi.name: 念动战技(随意施法) Telekinetic Maneuver (At Will)
ljGlIbY53EAJKiBi.description: 你通过一股猛烈的念动力移动一个敌人或者其携带的事物。你可以对目标尝试卸武（Disarm），推撞（Shove），或者摔绊（Trip），使用法术攻击骰，而不是运动（Athletics）检定；

9KJN3UH8g2nbSWG5.name: Demilich Eye Gem
9KJN3UH8g2nbSWG5.description:
This glowing gem is harvested from a demilich and has an 8th-level spell magically bonded to it. This item has the traits of the spell it contains.

启动 命令，交互

频率 每天一次

效果 The gem casts the 8th-level spell it contains. This activation uses the same number of actions as Casting the Spell. Once the spell is cast, the gem's glow fades, but returns 24 hours later, when the spell can be used once again.

制造需求 Demilich eye gems can't be crafted.

HtPykjM3gCE3oQiR.name: Torpor
HtPykjM3gCE3oQiR.description: Typically, a demilich is inert when encountered and doesn't take actions until its @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.WG91Z5TiR6oO5FOw]{Contingency} reaction has been triggered.

YttgSizfr7L607th.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Positive

xHg8hrfrTg35erxf.name: Contingency
xHg8hrfrTg35erxf.description:
A demilich has one permanent 8th-level @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.WG91Z5TiR6oO5FOw]{Contingency} spell in effect with one of its arcane innate spells of 5th level or lower as the companion spell-typically @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.VlNcjmYyu95vOUe8]{Dimension Door}.

Trigger While the lich is in torpor, a creature disturbs the demilich's remains, touches its treasure, or casts a spell that would affect the demilich.

Effect The demilich ends torpor, rolls initiative, and gains the effect of its contingency's companion spell. The contingency resets after 24 hours.

0RsLlXY365ytSohG.name: Countermeasures
0RsLlXY365ytSohG.description:
Trigger The demilich's turn begins.

Effect The demilich casts @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.zR67Rt3UMHKC5evy]{Blink}, @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.A2JfEKe6BZcTG1S8]{Fly}, @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.OOELvfkTedBMlWtq]{Spell Turning}, or @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.uqlxMQQeSGWEVjki]{True Seeing} on itself. It usually chooses spell turning unless it already has that spell in effect.

19cNQjbQEVxmiger.name: Telekinetic Whirlwind
19cNQjbQEVxmiger.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:20]{20 feet} @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

Telekinetic whirlwind activates when the demilich ends torpor. Loose debris in the area whip up into a whirling storm. This obscures vision, making any creature in the area concealed, and causes creatures in its area (except the demilich) to treat all creatures as @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}. Any creature other than the demilich that enters or begins its turn in the aura takes [[/r {2d12}[bludgeoning]]]{2d12 bludgeoning damage}.

saqRnmZhtXKwqFed.name: Demilich Eye Gems
saqRnmZhtXKwqFed.description: A demilich has gemstone eyes that glow when the demilich is active. Each eye contains an 8th-level spell that targets one creature (usually one eye has @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.Oj1PJBMQD9vuwCv7]{Maze} and the other @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.BKIet436snMNcnez]{Polar Ray}). The demilich can Activate an eye. This uses the number of spellcasting actions the spell requires, and also requires command and envision components. When the demilich casts a spell from a gemstone eye, that eye stops glowing for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Demilich Eye Gem]]{1d4 rounds}, during which time that eye's spell can't be used. Occasionally, one or both of the two @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.Q4o8pEdxSY0bnJQZ]{Demilich Eye Gems} can be harvested from a destroyed demilich as magic items.

1qFhgFYCKIDaF8mk.name: Devour Soul
1qFhgFYCKIDaF8mk.description:
Requirements A soul has been trapped in one of the demilich's blight quartz gems for 24 hours.

Effect The demilich consumes the soul. The soul is utterly destroyed, and the demilich regains HP equal to double the creature's level.

y5Na5QhVKW187D0K.name: Mental Magic
y5Na5QhVKW187D0K.description: A demilich can replace all material and somatic components for casting spells with verbal components, and can replace all Interact components for activating magic items with envision components.

CLQtaRBZzEVhkEpc.name: Staff Gems
CLQtaRBZzEVhkEpc.description: A demilich long ago absorbed the spells from a staff into gemstone nodules embedded in its skull, with larger nodules representing higher-level spells. It can cast any of the spells as though it were Activating the staff, and regains 1 charge per 4 hours spent in torpor, to a maximum of 8 charges. A typical demilich has the spells from a @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.Ab5EjJyoRSec5YrW]{Greater Staff of Necromancy}, but it could have spells from another staff of 8th level or lower instead.

ymEZhbkIeDn7RKGI.name: Trap Soul
ymEZhbkIeDn7RKGI.description:
Frequency once per day per gem

Effect Ten blight quartz gemstones on the demilich's skull can trap the souls of the living. The Activated gem casts @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.GYmXvS9NJ7QwfWGg]{Bind Soul}. This bind soul can target and affect a dying creature instead of a corpse. The dying creature can attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:38] save; if it succeeds, it doesn't die and its soul is not trapped but it's @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} (or is unaffected entirely on a critical success). When the soul of a creature gets trapped, the creature's body swiftly turns to dust.

The gemstones work like the black sapphires used in bind soul, except that they can hold creatures of up to 17th level and have a value of 200 gp apiece. The demilich can Devour a Soul it has trapped.

Dero Magister.name: 癫儒学士 Dero Magister
Dero Magister.publicNotes:
Dero magisters are leaders among dero society. They perform the bulk of the cruel operations and memory-altering procedures inflicted upon their victims.

Deros are short, wiry humanoids with milky white eyes, gray-blue skin, and wild shocks of off-white or gray hair. The descendants of a mysterious type of fey abandoned in the deepest, darkest caverns of Golarion, deros are the subject of fearful legends and folk tales to most of the world's surface races. They skulk beneath major metropolitan areas, performing cruel and twisted experiments on unwilling subjects. A dero is 3 feet tall and weighs approximately 70 pounds.

TAYmc59V4sXfSfw5.name: 黑暗术(随意施法) Darkness (At Will)
TAYmc59V4sXfSfw5.description:
你创造一片黑暗的帷幕，光线无法穿透，并且光源无法在区域中发光。光线无法进入该区域，并且任何非魔法光源，例如火炬或者提灯，在区域中不会发出任何光线，即使其光照可能到达黑暗术之外也是如此。这也会压制等于或低于你的黑暗术环级的魔法光亮。光线无法穿透，所以在区域中的生物无法看到外面。对于外面，这看起来如同一团纯粹黑暗的球。

升阶 (4环级) 即使具有黑暗视觉的生物（但不包括高等黑暗视觉）也几乎无法看穿这黑暗。它们透过黑暗看到的生物视为 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{隐蔽 Concealed}。

Va0XfogT4F60cFwg.name: 侦测魔法 Detect Magic
Va0XfogT4F60cFwg.description:
你发出一股标记魔法存在的脉冲。你不会获得魔法存在或不存在以外的任何信息。你可以选择忽略你完全知晓的魔法，例如你或者你盟友的魔法物品以及持续法术。

仅当幻术魔法的环级低于你的侦测魔法环级时，你才能侦测幻术魔法。但是，具有幻术灵光但是没有在外表上做伪装的物品（例如一瓶隐形术药水），通常能够正常侦测。

升阶 (3环级) 你会了解法术侦测区域中最高环级的效果的学派。如果有相同强度的多个效果，GM决定你了解的为哪一个。

升阶 (4环级) 如3环级，你也能指出最高环级魔法的来源。如同一种模糊感官（imprecise sense），你不会了解具体的位置，但是可以将来源锁定到5尺立方（或者最近的那个五尺立方，如果来源体积比这个区域更大）。

7IjR4hMNtoS1jTfK.name: Aklys
7IjR4hMNtoS1jTfK.description: The aklys is a throwing club with a hook on one end and a lengthy cord attached to the other. Though aklyses aren't available in most shops, one might be purchased for 5 gp from a vendor that specializes in strange weapons.

qtsF75k2Zterahrt.name: Vulnerable to Sunlight
qtsF75k2Zterahrt.description: A dero magister takes [[/r {10}]]{10 damage} for every hour they're exposed to sunlight.

36QKwrAooz1cygR4.name: Cytillesh Stare
36QKwrAooz1cygR4.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The magister focuses their gaze on a creature they can see within 30 feet. The target is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round and must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:24] saving throw or be @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 round.

Dero Stalker.name: 癫儒潜行者 Dero Stalker
Dero Stalker.publicNotes:
Dero stalkers are those charged with exploring the surface world by night and seeking out new victims to abduct.

Deros are short, wiry humanoids with milky white eyes, gray-blue skin, and wild shocks of off-white or gray hair. The descendants of a mysterious type of fey abandoned in the deepest, darkest caverns of Golarion, deros are the subject of fearful legends and folk tales to most of the world's surface races. They skulk beneath major metropolitan areas, performing cruel and twisted experiments on unwilling subjects. A dero is 3 feet tall and weighs approximately 70 pounds.

7vuGsKs2Xq5FsUyw.name: Aklys
7vuGsKs2Xq5FsUyw.description: The aklys is a throwing club with a hook on one end and a lengthy cord attached to the other. Though aklyses aren't available in most shops, one might be purchased for 5 gp from a vendor that specializes in strange weapons.

T8jQXV4jxIhvfS14.name: Nimble Dodge
T8jQXV4jxIhvfS14.description:
Requirements The dero stalker is not @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.D5mg6Tc7Jzrj6ro7]{Encumbered}.

Trigger A creature targets the dero with an attack and the dero can see the attacker.

Effect The dero dodges out of the way, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.

6BFQljbOQZkiMjjS.name: Vulnerable to Sunlight
6BFQljbOQZkiMjjS.description: A dero stalker takes [[/r {4}]]{4 damage} for every hour they're exposed to sunlight.

eI1CqQ6uSb4iGiLS.name: 偷袭 Sneak Attack
eI1CqQ6uSb4iGiLS.description:
A dero stalker deals 1d6 extra precision damage to flat-footed creatures.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.SneakAttack]

Dire Wolf.name: 恐狼 Dire Wolf
Dire Wolf.publicNotes:
Much larger and more foul-tempered than their common cousins, dire wolves haunt primeval lands that accommodate their massive size and proportionately large hunting grounds and appetites. Orcs are fond of using dire wolves as mounts, finding their vicious tempers perfect for hunting and warfare.

Wolves roam forests, hills, and other wild lands, where they hunt in packs to beleaguer and surround their prey before going in for the kill. Like most predatory animals, wolves prefer to attack the weakest or most vulnerable prey they can find.

16mvgME2H3Zp8aMW.name: Jaws
16mvgME2H3Zp8aMW.description: The Dire Wolf can use either Knockdown or Grab on a successful strike.

zFNrz9di2EnI53hz.name: Pack Attack
zFNrz9di2EnI53hz.description: The dire wolf's Strikes deal [[/r {1d6}]]{1d6 extra damage} to creatures within reach of at least two of the wolf's allies.

M0BuH1pWhtWsVIYm.name: Worry
M0BuH1pWhtWsVIYm.description:
Requirements The dire wolf has a creature @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} with its jaws.

Effect The dire wolf fiercely shakes the grabbed creature with its teeth, dealing [[/r {1d10+2}]]{1d10+2 damage} (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:20|basic:true] save).

Dragon Turtle.name: 龙龟 Dragon Turtle
Dragon Turtle.publicNotes:
When sailors warn others of the terrible threats of the open sea, they seldom forget to mention dragon turtles-immense aquatic dragons with rocky shells similar to those of tortoises and flippers powerful enough to overturn hardy vessels. These fearsome creatures enjoy being considered as dangerous as storms or natural disasters by seafaring folk. Dragon turtles delight in amassing treasure, although most prefer to receive tribute from passing sailors and often store their hoards in the shipwrecks of vessels once crewed by those unwilling to surrender their valuables. Dragon turtles are solitary creatures and hunt in regions encompassing a hundred square miles or more. Although they normally eat large fish, they are omnivorous and also eat seaweed or even foolhardy dragon hunters. Experienced sailors keep a keen eye out for dragon turtles, preparing to flee should one approach or offer it treasure in exchange for safe passage.

Most dragon turtles are at least 20 feet wide and 50 feet long, although some can grow substantially larger. These massive, ancient dragon turtles are somnolent, and resemble rocky islands from a distance; their prodigious hoards can be a source of truly ancient sea lore. Legends persist of truly immense dragon turtles who spend centuries drifting on the surface of the ocean, far from established shipping lanes or charted waters, with shells that serve as islands capable of supporting entire ecosystems and even, some claim, small settlements whose inhabitants know nothing of land that doesn't drift across the sea.

TXy3zvlvlJECNrWn.name: Shell Block
TXy3zvlvlJECNrWn.description:
Trigger A creature adjacent to the dragon turtle targets it with a melee attack.

Effect The dragon turtle rolls its shell toward the triggering creature, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to its AC against the triggering attack.

j9R2dejFnXClVzKR.name: Breath Weapon
j9R2dejFnXClVzKR.description:
The dragon turtle breathes a massive blast of steam that deals [[/r {10d6}[fire]]]{10d6 fire damage} to creatures within a @Template[type:cone|distance:50] (@Check[type:reflex|dc:27|basic:true] save). This steam blast affects creatures within the water, as well as outside.

The dragon turtle can't use its Breath Weapon again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds} or until it takes a critical hit (whichever comes first).

BMYNq39vlF0aowNr.name: Capsize
BMYNq39vlF0aowNr.description: The dragon turtle tries to capsize an adjacent aquatic vessel of its size or smaller. The dragon turtle must succeed at an @Check[type:athletics] check with a DC of 30 or the pilot's Sailing Lore DC, whichever is higher.

Vst7qvKg3u5uhWKG.name: Draconic Frenzy
Vst7qvKg3u5uhWKG.description: The dragon turtle makes two Claw Strikes and one Jaws Strike in any order.

Djinni.name: 风巨灵 Djinni
Djinni.publicNotes:
Benevolent genies from the Plane of Air, djinn value art, culture, knowledge, and trade. They also love new experiences, succulent dishes, and heady wines. Of all geniekind, they are most likely to approach humans and other mortals, interacting with them on friendly terms. Still, djinn are proud of their genie heritage and have a tendency to be patronizing toward mortals, a habit that has earned them a reputation for arrogance.

Djinn get along with jann and marids, but they find shaitans too stiff and harbor undying hatred for efreet. Although djinn are formidable combatants, they despise war and prefer to eschew violence in favor of dealing with their opponents using magic or subterfuge (making an exception, of course, when they encounter efreet).

A unique type of genie exists for each Elemental Plane, and the bodies of genies are formed out of elemental matter corresponding to their native plane: djinn are formed from wind, clouds, and storms; efreet are fire made flesh; marids are beings of water; and shaitans are composed of metal, gems, and stone. Lastly, the jann are formed out of all four elements, and are the weakest of geniekind.

GUFkIF2lbvGvkLj5.name: Plane Shift (At Will) (to Astral Plane, Elemental Planes, or Material Plane Only)
GUFkIF2lbvGvkLj5.description: 你和你的盟友穿过位面之间的屏障。目标移动到另一个位面，例如火焰位面（Plane of Fire），阴影位面（Shadow Plane），或者深渊（Abyss）。你必须对目的地位面有所了解，并且使用该位面的材料制作的魔法共鸣音叉作为该法术的器材。多数主要位面的共鸣音叉，如同异界传送法术本身一样，罕贵度为罕见。鲜为人知的位面和半位面的共鸣音叉通常罕贵度为稀有。该法术非常不精确，你会在某个目标（由你选择）上次到达该位面时所在的位置相距1d20×25英里的位置出现。如果对所有目标而言均是第一次旅行到特定位面，你会在位面上的一个随机位置出现。异界传送 不会提供返程的方法，但是通过再次施放异界传送令你能回到你之前所在的位面，除非有什么另外情况。

ztlqtFH0QOR0xEwo.name: 美食调和(随意施法) Enhance Victuals (At Will)
ztlqtFH0QOR0xEwo.description:
你将目标转变为可口的食粮，将水转为啤酒或者其他佳酿，或者增强食物的美味和调料，令其美味可口。

除了这种转变之外，法术也会尝试反制食物和水中的任何毒素。在持续时间耗尽后如果食物尚未被使用，食物会变回原样，但被反制的毒素仍保持移除。

升阶 (+1) 你可以作为目标的水的加仑数增加1，或者你可以作为目标的食物的磅数增加5。

S0TahDKKs9d1dqVY.name: 隐形术(随意施法,仅限自身) Invisibility (At Will) (Self Only)
S0TahDKKs9d1dqVY.description:
目标被幻术包复，变得 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{隐形 Invisible}. 这令该生物对所有生物 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{无踪Undetected} ，但生物可以尝试寻找目标，令其改为 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{藏匿 Hidden}。如果目标使用敌对动作，法术在敌对动作完成后结束。

升阶 (4环级) 该法术持续1分钟，但目标使用敌对动作时该法术不会结束。

OJPKm3WpqeYWDkqt.name: 侦测魔法(恒定法术) Detect Magic (Constant)
OJPKm3WpqeYWDkqt.description:
你发出一股标记魔法存在的脉冲。你不会获得魔法存在或不存在以外的任何信息。你可以选择忽略你完全知晓的魔法，例如你或者你盟友的魔法物品以及持续法术。

仅当幻术魔法的环级低于你的侦测魔法环级时，你才能侦测幻术魔法。但是，具有幻术灵光但是没有在外表上做伪装的物品（例如一瓶隐形术药水），通常能够正常侦测。

升阶 (3环级) 你会了解法术侦测区域中最高环级的效果的学派。如果有相同强度的多个效果，GM决定你了解的为哪一个。

升阶 (4环级) 如3环级，你也能指出最高环级魔法的来源。如同一种模糊感官（imprecise sense），你不会了解具体的位置，但是可以将来源锁定到5尺立方（或者最近的那个五尺立方，如果来源体积比这个区域更大）。

aD6MGcEF5IHZE5vn.name: Whirlwind
aD6MGcEF5IHZE5vn.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:20]{20 feet} @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

All squares in the djinni's aura are difficult terrain for Striding and Flying creatures. Creatures with the air trait are immune.

k0b4P1F8sPglTEue.name: Hurricane Blast
k0b4P1F8sPglTEue.description:
Frequency Once per round.

Effect The djinni all creatures in its whirlwind pushes back 20 feet, or forces all creatures in the aura to move 20 feet clockwise or counterclockwise. Each creature must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:21] save. On a success, it avoids being moved, and on a critical failure it falls @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} in addition to being moved. Creatures with the air trait are immune.

Drakauthix.name: 盗袭瘤菌 Drakauthix
Drakauthix.publicNotes:
The drakauthix is a massive fungus that floats through the heights of the largest Darklands caverns, propelled by bladders that spray air and spores. A voracious but slow-moving hunter, the drakauthix prefers to ambush meaty creatures from above, using its hooked appendages to pull its victims upward to feed. The drakauthix's digestive process is entirely external-it clings to victims, and its spore-laden surface slowly feeds on and grows through the flesh before the spore-infested carcass is discarded. As the infested body strikes the ground below, it bursts and releases a cloud of spores, unleashing a host of young called sporelings that immediately scuttle up the cavern walls to cling to its ceiling and grow.

The drakauthix behaves no more intelligently than most predatory animals, and often uses a sort of symbiotic scavenger method to secure prey by capitalizing on the hunting methods of oozes and vermin found in the large cave systems it frequents. When a relatively mindless creature kills a victim, the drakauthix drifts down, hooks the freshly slain carcass with its tendrils, and reels in its meal. The mindless ooze or other creature that just had its food stolen rarely holds a grudge and simply slithers off to find a new quarry, letting the drakauthix digest the corpse in peace. Of course, the drakauthix isn't above feasting on more active prey as well, and might attack an adventurer who neglects to look upward for danger when exploring a network of mysterious caves.

Some Darklands-dwelling creatures, such as duergars, hunt drakauthixes for their flesh, which has a unique flavor with a peppery aftertaste. Subterranean races also make ink from drakauthixes by burning their carcasses, then grinding and pressing the ashes for a long time until a silvery substance congeals.

piJXVVEPai5UFibA.name: Sporesight (Imprecise) 60 feet
piJXVVEPai5UFibA.description: The drakauthix exudes a cloud of spores that it uses to see. This is an imprecise sense that functions only in areas without strong wind currents. Sporesight does not function underwater.

i3ESVmWhqnA7Sq5u.name: Obscuring Spores
i3ESVmWhqnA7Sq5u.description: Whenever the drakauthix takes at least 10 slashing damage, it releases a cloud of brown spores that has the effect of @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.9XHmC2JgTUIQ1CCm]{Obscuring Mist} for 1 minute, centered around the drakauthix. This cloud of spores does not move with the drakauthix, nor is it displaced by its movement.

DicxiMfpeviQRxSo.name: Reel In
DicxiMfpeviQRxSo.description: The drakauthix pulls all creatures it has @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} 15 feet closer to itself.

OuwilwDvrI1Rqfzi.name: Spore Tendrils
OuwilwDvrI1Rqfzi.description: The tendrils that cover the drakauthix's body reach out and infest adjacent creatures, dealing [[/r {4d6}[poison]]]{4d6 poison damage} and [[/r {1d6}[persistent,poison]]] @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Damage}. A creature can attempt a @Check[type:reflex|dc:27|basic:true] save to reduce this damage, but one @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by the drakauthix takes a -4 circumstance penalty to this save.

fOnFVdptokDlFcTW.name: Whirlwind of Hooks
fOnFVdptokDlFcTW.description: The drakauthix whirls, whipping creatures around it. The drakauthix makes a tentacle Strike against every creature within its reach.

Drider.name: 蛛化精灵 Drider
Drider.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic
Drider.publicNotes:
The first fleshwarping process mastered by the drow remains both their most successful and most infamous: the drider. Fusing the body of a drow with that of a giant spider, driders are a sexually dimorphic fleshwarp-the only fleshwarp known to be able to produce young. While female driders have the upper torsos of elegant drow women with mouths featuring sharp poisoned fangs, male driders have hideous, mutated countenances that further blend the humanoid form with that of a spider; the difference in appearance is perhaps a reflection on the matriarchal nature of drow society.
