In combat, all driders are equally dangerous.

Although the fleshwarping process was originally intended to be a punishment for drow who fell from grace, the significant powers and strengths gained from the horrifying transformation are attractive to some drow, and an increasing number of lower-ranking citizens in drow cities volunteer themselves for the painful procedure. In return for mandatory time serving as a guardian, soldier, or other public servant, such volunteer driders are later allowed to lead their own lives, typically in caverns located in a city's periphery. The painful truth is that for most driders, they do not live long enough to see this reward, for the drow have a penchant for working their fleshwarped slaves to death or deploying them in deadly war missions in which survival is a only a remote possibility.

Most driders use arcane magic, but driders who use divine magic are well known, while a rare few use occult or primal magic. A drider's innate spells remain the same regardless of the magical tradition, but those who use different types of magic as prepared spells may well have entirely different spells prepared than the drider presented below.

Some creatures, notably drow, are not happy with merely killing their enemies. They revel in the total degradation of their foes through the horrifying transformative technique known as fleshwarping. Though the fleshwarping process was not created by the drow, many believe they perfected it. The drow torture their enemies in vats of churning magical reagents, reshaping their flesh and psyche alike into horrid and monstrous things. The reconstitution of flesh results in countless variations of fleshwarps, and the following are just a couple of examples of these horrors.

970NWMlxLf3ar7pG.name: 黑暗术(随意施法) Darkness (At Will)
970NWMlxLf3ar7pG.description:
你创造一片黑暗的帷幕，光线无法穿透，并且光源无法在区域中发光。光线无法进入该区域，并且任何非魔法光源，例如火炬或者提灯，在区域中不会发出任何光线，即使其光照可能到达黑暗术之外也是如此。这也会压制等于或低于你的黑暗术环级的魔法光亮。光线无法穿透，所以在区域中的生物无法看到外面。对于外面，这看起来如同一团纯粹黑暗的球。

升阶 (4环级) 即使具有黑暗视觉的生物（但不包括高等黑暗视觉）也几乎无法看穿这黑暗。它们透过黑暗看到的生物视为 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{隐蔽 Concealed}。

qUukMNLwiLbVk7VM.name: 妖火术(随意施法) Faerie Fire (At Will)
qUukMNLwiLbVk7VM.description: 在你施放该法术时，处于区域中的所有生物在法术持续时间内会被有色的，无热度的火焰所勾勒出轮廓。该颜色由你选择。可见的生物在受妖火术影响时无法获得 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{隐蔽 Concealed} 。如果该生物 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{隐形 Invisible}，在被妖火术影响时为隐蔽（concealed），而不是 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{无踪 Undetected}。

16ZkwJJwa4IBITVD.name: 侦测魔法 Detect Magic
16ZkwJJwa4IBITVD.description:
你发出一股标记魔法存在的脉冲。你不会获得魔法存在或不存在以外的任何信息。你可以选择忽略你完全知晓的魔法，例如你或者你盟友的魔法物品以及持续法术。

仅当幻术魔法的环级低于你的侦测魔法环级时，你才能侦测幻术魔法。但是，具有幻术灵光但是没有在外表上做伪装的物品（例如一瓶隐形术药水），通常能够正常侦测。

升阶 (3环级) 你会了解法术侦测区域中最高环级的效果的学派。如果有相同强度的多个效果，GM决定你了解的为哪一个。

升阶 (4环级) 如3环级，你也能指出最高环级魔法的来源。如同一种模糊感官（imprecise sense），你不会了解具体的位置，但是可以将来源锁定到5尺立方（或者最近的那个五尺立方，如果来源体积比这个区域更大）。

aZNmBtBro1xYaubO.name: Drider Venom
aZNmBtBro1xYaubO.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:23]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 [[/r {1d8}[poison]]]{1d8 poison damage} and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1}

mhBBm02GHgEZ30NR.name: Web Trap
mhBBm02GHgEZ30NR.description: A creature hit by a drider's web attack is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} and stuck to the nearest surface (Escape DC 21).

Drow Rogue.name: 卓尔盗贼 Drow Rogue
Drow Rogue.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic, +2 status to all saves vs. mental
Drow Rogue.publicNotes:
Loners at heart, drow rogues trust no one-least of all fellow slayers. Thees drow rely on awareness and adaptation to survive the cutthroat nature of their society.

The first drow were elves who fled into the depths of the world from a devastating cataclysm thousands of years ago. In their journey below, they fell to bickering and in-fighting, drawing the attention of sinister intelligences beyond their own. Whether it was the influence of a specific demon lord, the Rough Beast Rovagug, or some other fell force is unknown, but in that time the elves transformed both spiritually and physically, tainting their hearts with desires for cruelty, sadism, and violence. The hues of their eyes became sinister red or bleached white, and their flesh adopted an unearthly lavender sheen that made the drow instantly recognizable. The drow also developed potent magical abilities and resistances that further empowered them, if at the cost of their souls.

Over the centuries to follow, the drow developed into a powerful, if violently dysfunctional society, influenced by the worship of demon lords and focused on providing power and glory to a relatively small collection of noble houses. Many of these noble houses are matriarchal in nature and all hold allegiance to a specific demon lord patron-but traditions of worship, warfare, and wizardry help to bind the oft-bickering houses together enough that drow society doesn't simply consume itself from within. Fear of earning the wrath of one's superior-be it a teacher, a parent, a commander, or the demon one worships-is the real bond holding drow society together, and this system is held in esteem by the lowliest drow servant and by the most powerful drow priestess alike.

The drow are infamous throughout the world, but until recently most assumed stories of demon-worshipping, underground-dwelling elves were spooky legends crafted to share around a campfire. Today, the existence of drow is an understood truth, and while their presence in the dark caverns deep below is unsettling, they seem content to leave the surface world alone for now.

N0tdBKYLEcJAPSBf.name: 黑暗术(随意施法) Darkness (At Will)
N0tdBKYLEcJAPSBf.description:
你创造一片黑暗的帷幕，光线无法穿透，并且光源无法在区域中发光。光线无法进入该区域，并且任何非魔法光源，例如火炬或者提灯，在区域中不会发出任何光线，即使其光照可能到达黑暗术之外也是如此。这也会压制等于或低于你的黑暗术环级的魔法光亮。光线无法穿透，所以在区域中的生物无法看到外面。对于外面，这看起来如同一团纯粹黑暗的球。

升阶 (4环级) 即使具有黑暗视觉的生物（但不包括高等黑暗视觉）也几乎无法看穿这黑暗。它们透过黑暗看到的生物视为 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{隐蔽 Concealed}。

ABhY9VZVaL77tgAg.name: 妖火术(随意施法) Faerie Fire (At Will)
ABhY9VZVaL77tgAg.description: 在你施放该法术时，处于区域中的所有生物在法术持续时间内会被有色的，无热度的火焰所勾勒出轮廓。该颜色由你选择。可见的生物在受妖火术影响时无法获得 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{隐蔽 Concealed} 。如果该生物 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{隐形 Invisible}，在被妖火术影响时为隐蔽（concealed），而不是 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{无踪 Undetected}。

GEvdLrMrI8fbxU9C.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Mental

6gO1vT5DmiULZ2Bv.name: Nimble Dodge
6gO1vT5DmiULZ2Bv.description:
Requirement A drow rogue can't use this reaction while @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.D5mg6Tc7Jzrj6ro7]{Encumbered}.

Trigger The drow rogue is hit or critically hit by an attack made by a creature the drow rogue can see.

Effect The drow rogue gains a +2 circumstance bonus to their Armor Class against the triggering attack.

9nfzrmPzAAStRjAe.name: Quick Draw
9nfzrmPzAAStRjAe.description: The drow rogue draws a weapon using the Interact action, then Strikes with that weapon.

NS7yHszQCqQS0Bfj.name: 偷袭 Sneak Attack
NS7yHszQCqQS0Bfj.description:
The drow rogue deals 1d6 extra precision damage to flat-footed creatures.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.SneakAttack]

Doppelganger.name: 变形怪 Doppelganger
Doppelganger.publicNotes:
In their natural forms, doppelgangers are humanoid creatures with flesh of indeterminate color and features that lack fine details, as if unfinished. As masters of mimicry, they use their abilities to impersonate others in devious ways, often infiltrating settlements and residing within them for years without being detected.

Doppelgangers are incredibly secretive, with some nearing outright paranoia. They choose their targets carefully and go to great lengths not to reveal their intentions before their plans come to fruition. Doppelgangers usually infiltrate communities in order to gain some manner of wealth or power, and assume the guises of other persons to allow the creatures they're impersonating to take the fall for any negative consequences that may result from their actions.

Though most are not evil, doppelgangers are manipulative and self-serving. As they don't have their own society and aren't monolithic in their motivations, an individual doppelganger has its own unique interests and impulses, though many are over-indulgent. Some doppelgangers enjoy the thrill of subtlety, while others favor grander schemes, such as manipulating a nation's political infrastructure. Others seek to exploit merchant guilds to gain immense wealth, while others use their shape-changing ability to destroy relationships between close friends or families.

Doppelgangers are careful and patient creatures. They are willing to slowly construct elaborate schemes that may require extended periods of time-even decades-to yield results.

Doppelgangers often work alone, as they don't trust potential cohorts not to ruin their plans. There are rare times when doppelgangers might reveal secrets to high-ranking individuals to ensure a successful infiltration. When they do work with others, it's because they've taken the shape of a target group's leader, unbeknownst to the organization's members.

Doppelgangers can grow in power by learning skills and abilities, and often make excellent rogues, spellcasters, or fighters. A doppelganger that has class abilities can often effectively infiltrate and plague an adventuring group as a powerful antagonist-but using a doppelganger like this in your game should be handled with care.

G8atrV1L3RSnUege.name: 读心术(随意施法) Mind Reading (At Will)
G8atrV1L3RSnUege.description:
你通过一次短暂的心灵接触来尝试阅读目标的想法。它必须尝试一次意志豁免。目标会暂时免疫你的读心术1小时。

大成功 目标得知当施放该法术时你模糊的表层想法。

成功 你得知目标的智力调整值是高于，等于，还是低于你。

失败 你得知当施放该法术时目标模糊的表层想法，并且你得知目标的智力调整值是高于，等于，还是低于你。

大失败 如失败，并且在法术持续时间中，你可以维持该法术来再次侦测目标的表层想法。目标不会获得另外的豁免。

0lvwb1cNAaOUc6Be.name: End the Charade
0lvwb1cNAaOUc6Be.description:
Trigger The doppelganger is transformed with Change Shape and another creature moves adjacent to it or takes a hostile action against it.

Effect The doppelganger reverts to its natural form and can make a Strike against the triggering creature. If the creature was unaware the doppelganger was in disguise, that creature is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed} against this attack.

LJKNy957UOv4LqE5.name: Change Shape
LJKNy957UOv4LqE5.description:
The doppelganger takes on the specific appearance of any Small or Medium humanoid who it has seen and whose appearance it remembers. This doesn't change the doppelganger's Speed or its attack and damage bonuses with its Strikes but might change the damage type its Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning).

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Dryad Queen.name: 木妖精女皇 Dryad Queen
Dryad Queen.publicNotes:
Hamadryads rule over an entire forest, or a portion of an incredibly large forest, leading and protecting all dryads within. Hamadryads often have strange relationships with powerful and deadly fey, working together in a dualistic way despite their differences, with the hamadryad representing nature's wonders and the other fey representing nature's wrath.

Nymphs are a family of fey that take the form of beautiful humanoids with elven features and have a deep association with the natural world. The most common of their kind are the dryads, which are spirits that embody great trees, but many other kinds of nymphs exist, including naiads, who watch over bodies of water. All nymphs are guardians of some element of nature, typically a specific tree or pond, or even-in the case of nymph queens-whole forests or massive bodies of water

Zz7l1FEnkAgV09r6.name: 飞行术 Fly
Zz7l1FEnkAgV09r6.description:
目标能够在空气中穿梭，获得等于其速度或者20尺的飞行速度，取较高者。

升阶 (7环) 该持续时间增加到1小时。

KdYdd17OoSplEhz8.name: 植物交谈(恒定法术) Speak with Plants (Constant)
KdYdd17OoSplEhz8.description: 你可以对植物提出问题，从植物获得回答，但该法术不会令植物比正常更为友好或者比正常更有智慧。大多数通常植物对周围的世界仅有直觉的认识，所以它们无法认出生物的细节，或者了解任何其周围环境以外的世界。聪明的植物怪物喜欢简要直说或者避而不谈，不那么聪明的则通常会做出傻瓜式的回复。

WdZlJxUtjDe77LMQ.name: 暗示术(随意施法) Suggestion (At Will)
WdZlJxUtjDe77LMQ.description:
你的甜言蜜语令生物难以抗拒。你向目标指示一系列动作，其用语对目标而言必须是一系列合理的动作，并且它不可以招致自毁或者明显违抗目标自身愿望。目标必须尝试一次意志豁免。

大成功 目标不受影响，并且知道你尝试控制它。

成功 目标不受影响，并且认为你在和它们正常对话，而不是对其施放法术。

失败 目标立即按照你的指示行动。该法术的持续时间为1分钟，或者直到目标完成一个有终点的指示，或者直到指示变得会招致自毁，或具有其他明显的负面效果。

大失败 如同失败，但基本持续时间为1小时。

升阶 (8环级) 你能以至多10个生物为目标。

2RPJFPnuGdtE3i7O.name: 纠缠术(随意施法) Entangle (At Will)
2RPJFPnuGdtE3i7O.description: 区域中的植物会纠缠生物。该区域视为困难地形。每轮当某个生物在区域中开始回合时，它必须尝试一次反射豁免。在失败时，其在速度上承受-10尺环境减值，直到其离开区域，在大失败时，它也会获得 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{禁足 Immobilized}，持续1轮。生物可以尝试逃脱对抗纠缠术的DC，以移除这些效果。

A130wI05EcUXJPnN.name: 塑木术(随意施法) Shape Wood (At Will)
A130wI05EcUXJPnN.description: 你将目标木头变成你选择的粗糙形状。该塑形能力十分粗糙，无法制造复杂的组件，细致的细节，可动部分，或者其他类似的东西。你无法使用该法术来增加你所塑形的木质物体的价值。

MjQUEa9YSvr5hUp0.name: 树化术(随意施法) Tree Shape (At Will)
MjQUEa9YSvr5hUp0.description: 你变形为一棵大型树。察觉检定不会发现你的本来形态，但是通过成功的对抗你的法术DC的自然（Nature）或者生存（Survival）检定，可以发现你看起来是个树，但对于该区域而言，崭新到奇怪的程度。在树形态中，你可以观察周围所有事物，但除了使用一个具有专注特征的单动作，来结束该法术且结束你的回合以外，你不能进行任何行动。成为树时，你的AC为20，并且只有状态加值，状态减值，环境加值，和环境减值会影响你。你投出的所有成和和大成功反射豁免均为失败。

9PPhZHN8g9n73rD5.name: 魅惑术(随意施法) Charm (At Will)
9PPhZHN8g9n73rD5.description:
在目标看来，你的言语甜蜜动听，你的形象笼罩在梦幻般的光晕中。目标必须尝试一次意志豁免，如果你或者你的盟友最近威胁它或者对它进行了敌对行为，会获得+4环境加值。

你可以解消该法术。如果你对目标使用任何敌对动作，法术终止。当该法术结束时，目标不一定会意识到自己被魅惑了，除非它和你的友好关系，或者你说服它去做的事情与其期望发生冲突。这也即是说你可以通过常规的方法说服目标继续作为你的朋友。

大成功 目标不受影响，并且意识到你尝试魅惑它。

成功 该目标不受影响，但是认为你的法术是某种无害的东西，而不是魅惑术，除非它能识别该法术（通常通过辨识法术（Identifying Spells））。

失败 目标对你的态度变为 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.v66R7FdOf11l94im]{友好 Friendly}）。如果已经是友好，则变为 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.v44P3WUcU1j0115l]{乐于帮助 Helpful}。它不能对你做出敌对行为。

大失败 目标变为乐于帮助（helpful）并且不能对你做出敌对行为。

升阶 (4环级) 该法术持续时间为持续到下次你进行你的日常准备。

升阶 (8环级) 该法术持续时间为持续到下次你进行你的日常准备，并且你能以至多10个生物作为目标。

e4XVQLIRizQiRW08.name: 侦测魔法 Detect Magic
e4XVQLIRizQiRW08.description:
你发出一股标记魔法存在的脉冲。你不会获得魔法存在或不存在以外的任何信息。你可以选择忽略你完全知晓的魔法，例如你或者你盟友的魔法物品以及持续法术。

仅当幻术魔法的环级低于你的侦测魔法环级时，你才能侦测幻术魔法。但是，具有幻术灵光但是没有在外表上做伪装的物品（例如一瓶隐形术药水），通常能够正常侦测。

升阶 (3环级) 你会了解法术侦测区域中最高环级的效果的学派。如果有相同强度的多个效果，GM决定你了解的为哪一个。

升阶 (4环级) 如3环级，你也能指出最高环级魔法的来源。如同一种模糊感官（imprecise sense），你不会了解具体的位置，但是可以将来源锁定到5尺立方（或者最近的那个五尺立方，如果来源体积比这个区域更大）。

B9kPTy7tmWyCtPY6.name: 睡眠术(随意施法) Sleep (At Will)
B9kPTy7tmWyCtPY6.description:
区域中的每个生物昏昏欲睡。由于该法术 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{失去意识 Unconscious} 的生物不会 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{倒地 Prone}，也不会松开其持握的东西。该法术不会令生物无法通过觉察醒来，并因此限制其在战斗中的能力。

大成功 该生物不受影响。

成功 该生物在觉察检定上承受-1状态减值，持续1轮。

失败 该生物失去意识。如果它在1分钟后仍然失去意识，它自动醒来。

大失败 该生物失去意识。如果它在1小时候仍然失去意识，它自动醒来。

升阶 (4环级) 目标在失败时失去意识1轮，在大失败时失去意识1分钟。它们会倒地，并松开其持握的东西，并且它们无法尝试觉察检定以醒来。当持续时间结束时，该生物会正常睡着，而不是自动醒来。

afRIl1Q7FwNUtxuI.name: Nature Empathy
afRIl1Q7FwNUtxuI.description: The dryad can use Diplomacy to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.OX4fy22hQgUHDr0q]{Make an Impression} on and make very simple @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.DCb62iCBrJXy0Ik6]{Requests} of animals and plants.

JYkKoCx49R8WXnXW.name: Tied to the Land
JYkKoCx49R8WXnXW.description: A nymph queen is intrinsically tied to a specific region, such as a forest for a dryad queen. As long as the queen is healthy, the environment is exceptionally resilient, allowing the nymph queen to automatically attempt to counteract spells and rituals such as @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.7yWXx3qC4eFNHhxD]{Blight} that would harm the environment, using her Spell DC with a counteract level equal to the highest-level druid spell she can cast. When the nymph queen becomes physically or psychologically unhealthy, however, her warded region eventually becomes twisted or unhealthy as well. In that case, restoring the nymph queen swiftly heals the entire region.

9OZuMP6qLeoyehVx.name: Nymph's Beauty
9OZuMP6qLeoyehVx.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

On a failed save, the target is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} in awe for 1 minute.

Creatures that start their turn in the aura must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:30] save or suffer an effect described in the nymph queen's entry.

Qzt1bWHKvD7X2ua8.name: Change Shape
Qzt1bWHKvD7X2ua8.description:
Nymph queens can transform between their original form, which looks much like a typical nymph of their kind, and any Small or Medium humanoid form, typically choosing a more humanoid-looking version of their natural form.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

D01DgsftPfTKC645.name: Focus Beauty
D01DgsftPfTKC645.description:
On a failed save, if the target was already affected by the dryad queen's beauty, the target suffers the effects of a failed save against @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.vLA0q0WOK2YPuJs6]{Charm}.

The nymph queen focuses her beauty upon a target within her aura. The creature must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:30] save. On a failure, it is affected as if by the nymph queen's nymph's beauty aura; if it was already affected by the aura, it suffers a greater effect described in the nymph queen's entry. A nymph queen can Focus Beauty on a given creature only once per turn.

jjcSFQRRi1OZjeeX.name: Inspiration
jjcSFQRRi1OZjeeX.description:
A nymph queen can inspire a single intelligent creature by giving that creature a token of her favor, typically a lock of her hair. As long as the creature carries her token and remains in good standing with the nymph queen, the creature gains a +1 status bonus to all Crafting checks, Performance checks, and Will saves.

If a nymph queen grants her Inspiration to a bard and the nymph queen is that bard's muse, the bard gains an additional benefit depending on their muse theme: for lore muse, the bard also gains a +1 status bonus to all Lore checks; for maestro muse, the status bonus to Performance checks increases to +2 for the purpose of determining the effects of compositions; for polymath muse, the bard gains a +4 status bonus to untrained skill checks; and for all other muses, the Will save bonus increases to +2 against fey.

@Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-effects.iSyyR4QVOaY6mxtg]{Effect: Dryad Queen's Inspiration}

7IWkM6MOEOAu4DTP.name: Tree Meld
7IWkM6MOEOAu4DTP.description:
The hamadryad touches a tree within her domain of enough volume to contain her and merges into it for as long as she wishes. She can Cast a Spell while inside as long as the spell doesn't require a line of effect outside the tree. She can hear, but not see, what's going on outside the tree. She can enter or exit her extradimensional domain from any tree in her domain. She can Dismiss this effect.

Significant physical damage dealt to the tree expels the hamadryad from the tree and deals [[/r {3d6}]]{3d6 damage} to her. @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.115Xp9E38CJENhNS]{Passwall} expels the hamadryad without dealing damage.

The hamadryad can also touch a tree within her domain to instead enter her extradimensional domain; Tree Meld gains the extradimensional trait. A hamadryad can bring up to eight other creatures with her when entering her home. The hamadryad can still be expelled from this space as above.

Dryad.name: 木妖精 Dryad
Dryad.publicNotes:
Dryads are fey guardians of the trees and creatures who dwell in wooded areas. They prefer using indirect methods to dissuade those who would harm their sacred groves and beloved forests, but they are not above using enchantments to enlist the aid of allies when evil threats cannot be dissuaded with words alone. In times of peace, dryads happily live secluded lives inside their trees, and a community at harmony with nature might not even realize a dryad lives nearby.

Though they watch over all the woods around them, dryads are inextricably tied to a specific tree, usually an oak. Dryads who are bonded to another type of tree are fundamentally the same, but they may differ in temperament and appearance to match their ward. For instance, kraneiai, or cherry-tree dryads, have beautiful pink coloration and concern themselves with the fragile beauty of life.

Nymphs are a family of fey that take the form of beautiful humanoids with elven features and have a deep association with the natural world. The most common of their kind are the dryads, which are spirits that embody great trees, but many other kinds of nymphs exist, including naiads, who watch over bodies of water. All nymphs are guardians of some element of nature, typically a specific tree or pond, or even-in the case of nymph queens-whole forests or massive bodies of water

hdF0CzgKgx2Zm51h.name: 植物交谈(恒定法术) Speak with Plants (Constant)
hdF0CzgKgx2Zm51h.description: 你可以对植物提出问题，从植物获得回答，但该法术不会令植物比正常更为友好或者比正常更有智慧。大多数通常植物对周围的世界仅有直觉的认识，所以它们无法认出生物的细节，或者了解任何其周围环境以外的世界。聪明的植物怪物喜欢简要直说或者避而不谈，不那么聪明的则通常会做出傻瓜式的回复。

7Gjlo5OkNRJvfb31.name: 纠缠术(随意法术) Entangle (At Will)
7Gjlo5OkNRJvfb31.description: 区域中的植物会纠缠生物。该区域视为困难地形。每轮当某个生物在区域中开始回合时，它必须尝试一次反射豁免。在失败时，其在速度上承受-10尺环境减值，直到其离开区域，在大失败时，它也会获得 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{禁足 Immobilized}，持续1轮。生物可以尝试逃脱对抗纠缠术的DC，以移除这些效果。

NyG8RsXlgvfQa4LP.name: 树化术(随意法术) Tree Shape (At Will)
NyG8RsXlgvfQa4LP.description: 你变形为一棵大型树。察觉检定不会发现你的本来形态，但是通过成功的对抗你的法术DC的自然（Nature）或者生存（Survival）检定，可以发现你看起来是个树，但对于该区域而言，崭新到奇怪的程度。在树形态中，你可以观察周围所有事物，但除了使用一个具有专注特征的单动作，来结束该法术且结束你的回合以外，你不能进行任何行动。成为树时，你的AC为20，并且只有状态加值，状态减值，环境加值，和环境减值会影响你。你投出的所有成和和大成功反射豁免均为失败。

03GLgyeAGjU6XdPt.name: Nature Empathy
03GLgyeAGjU6XdPt.description: The dryad can use Diplomacy to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.OX4fy22hQgUHDr0q]{Make an Impression} on and make very simple @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.DCb62iCBrJXy0Ik6]{Requests} of animals and plants.

8uoOHgzV0mRLhzhE.name: Tree Dependent
8uoOHgzV0mRLhzhE.description: A dryad is mystically bonded to a single great tree and must remain within 300 feet of it. If she moves beyond that range, she becomes @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} and is unable to recover. She must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:18] save every hour or increase the sickened value by 1 (to a maximum of sickened 4). After 24 hours, she becomes @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}, with this value increasing by 1 every additional 24 hours. A dryad can perform a 24-hour ritual to bond herself to a new tree.

nu6HxTKMW550KwDx.name: Tree Meld
nu6HxTKMW550KwDx.description:
The dryad touches a tree of enough volume to contain her and merges into it for as long as she wishes. She can Cast a Spell while inside as long as the spell doesn't require a line of effect outside the tree. She can hear, but not see, what's going on outside the tree. She can Dismiss this effect.

Significant physical damage dealt to the tree expels the dryad from the tree and deals [[/r {3d6}]]{3d6 damage} to her. @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.115Xp9E38CJENhNS]{Passwall} expels the dryad without dealing damage.

If a dryad uses this ability on her bonded tree, she instead enters an extradimensional living space within the tree; Tree Meld gains the extradimensional trait. A dryad can bring up to two other creatures with her when entering her home within her bonded tree. The dryad can still be expelled from this space as above.

Duergar Sharpshooter.name: 灰矮人神射手 Duergar Sharpshooter
Duergar Sharpshooter.publicNotes:
Duergar sharpshooters serve both as ranged support for slaver parties and as snipers posted on towers overlooking quarries and other areas where enslaved workers toil away the hours. Duergar sharpshooters also specialize in nonlethal methods of ranged combat-tactics they are often called upon to use when quelling slave riots or capturing escaped slaves.

Deep beneath the surface, duergars stubbornly claim the ancestral subterranean homelands of the dwarves as their own, having refused to venture to the surface along with their modern dwarven cousins. An exiled dwarven deity named Droskar offered duergars salvation from the horrors of the Darklands, and in exchange duergars endlessly toil in his honor within their subterranean empire. Notorious slavers, duergars regularly raid other Darklands settlements as well as surface communities in constant search of living beings to task with endless amounts of work in their harsh and exhausting settlements.

Duergars are gray-skinned creatures, often referred to as 'ashen' by those surface dwarves willing to speak of them. These subterranean dwarves have a strong natural connection with cave-dwelling vermin, and it's common to see duergar caravans drawn by teams of immense beetles. Most duergars devote themselves to the worship of Droskar, a taskmaster of a god who demands back-breaking toil in addition to regular prayer. Duergar leadership often consists of powerful divine servants of Droskar, along with incredibly stout warriors whose martial prowess ensures they can overcome any direct threat to their rule. Almost every aspect of duergar society is controlled by a strict hierarchy of leadership, with taskmasters directing subordinates across all walks of life.

sYmCAhCfd1mBhKgP.name: 变巨术(仅限自身) Enlarge (Self Only)
sYmCAhCfd1mBhKgP.description:
受到魔法能量的强化，目标增大到大型。其装备随之增大，但是在脱离后会回复原始大小。该生物获得 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{笨拙 Clumsy 1}。其触及增加5尺（或者10尺，如果初始为超小型），并且它在近战伤害上获得+2状态加值。该法术对于大型或者更大的生物无效。

@Compendium[pf2e.spell-effects.sPCWrhUHqlbGhYSD]{法术效果：变巨术}

升阶 (4环级) T该生物改为增长到超大型体型。该对近战伤害的状态加值增加到+4，生物的触及增加10尺（或者15尺，如果该生物初始为超小型）。该法术对超大型或者更大的生物无效。 @Compendium[pf2e.spell-effects.41WThj17MZBXTO2X]{法术效果：变巨术 (升阶 4环级)}

升阶 (6环级) 选择2环级或者4环级版本的本法术，并将其效果应用于10个自愿生物。

VEB7ZWhSHnvPdG3l.name: 隐形术(仅限自身) Invisibility (Self Only)
VEB7ZWhSHnvPdG3l.description:
目标被幻术包复，变得 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{隐形 Invisible}. 这令该生物对所有生物 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{无踪Undetected} ，但生物可以尝试寻找目标，令其改为 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{藏匿 Hidden}。如果目标使用敌对动作，法术在敌对动作完成后结束。

升阶 (4环级) 该法术持续1分钟，但目标使用敌对动作时该法术不会结束。

ZR4nPmliirndqVhC.name: Bola Bolts
ZR4nPmliirndqVhC.description: This shot deals no damage, but on a hit, the target must succeed at a @Check[type:reflex|dc:16] or be knocked @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} until it is freed with a successful DC 15 check to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape}. This check can be attempted either by the target or a creature adjacent to the target.

atH4c29XMbIXGwpG.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

gooqrR0z9rN4mnlN.name: Bola Bolt
gooqrR0z9rN4mnlN.description: This shot deals no damage, but on a hit, the target must succeed at a @Check[type:reflex|dc:16] save or be knocked @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} until it is freed with a successful DC 15 check to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape}. This check can be attempted either by the target or a creature adjacent to the target.

Duergar Taskmaster.name: 灰矮人监工 Duergar Taskmaster
Duergar Taskmaster.allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. magic, iron mind
Duergar Taskmaster.publicNotes:
Duergar priests of the taskmaster god Droskar often assume leadership roles within their communities, advancing the goals of their deity through coercion and displays of force. Often referred to as duergar taskmasters, these leaders often issue commands to duergar subordinates and slaves in the same breath, treating the two almost as if they were interchangeable. As a result, duergar taskmasters are loathed by both slave and slaver alike.

Deep beneath the surface, duergars stubbornly claim the ancestral subterranean homelands of the dwarves as their own, having refused to venture to the surface along with their modern dwarven cousins. An exiled dwarven deity named Droskar offered duergars salvation from the horrors of the Darklands, and in exchange duergars endlessly toil in his honor within their subterranean empire. Notorious slavers, duergars regularly raid other Darklands settlements as well as surface communities in constant search of living beings to task with endless amounts of work in their harsh and exhausting settlements.

Duergars are gray-skinned creatures, often referred to as 'ashen' by those surface dwarves willing to speak of them. These subterranean dwarves have a strong natural connection with cave-dwelling vermin, and it's common to see duergar caravans drawn by teams of immense beetles. Most duergars devote themselves to the worship of Droskar, a taskmaster of a god who demands back-breaking toil in addition to regular prayer. Duergar leadership often consists of powerful divine servants of Droskar, along with incredibly stout warriors whose martial prowess ensures they can overcome any direct threat to their rule. Almost every aspect of duergar society is controlled by a strict hierarchy of leadership, with taskmasters directing subordinates across all walks of life.

Hf8TaBvmNOD8vMvG.name: 变巨术(仅限自身) Enlarge (Self Only)
Hf8TaBvmNOD8vMvG.description:
受到魔法能量的强化，目标增大到大型。其装备随之增大，但是在脱离后会回复原始大小。该生物获得 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{笨拙 Clumsy 1}。其触及增加5尺（或者10尺，如果初始为超小型），并且它在近战伤害上获得+2状态加值。该法术对于大型或者更大的生物无效。

@Compendium[pf2e.spell-effects.sPCWrhUHqlbGhYSD]{法术效果：变巨术}

升阶 (4环级) T该生物改为增长到超大型体型。该对近战伤害的状态加值增加到+4，生物的触及增加10尺（或者15尺，如果该生物初始为超小型）。该法术对超大型或者更大的生物无效。 @Compendium[pf2e.spell-effects.41WThj17MZBXTO2X]{法术效果：变巨术 (升阶 4环级)}

升阶 (6环级) 选择2环级或者4环级版本的本法术，并将其效果应用于10个自愿生物。

HZYAj7VYAUuppbJG.name: 隐形术(仅限自身) Invisibility (Self Only)
HZYAj7VYAUuppbJG.description:
目标被幻术包复，变得 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{隐形 Invisible}. 这令该生物对所有生物 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{无踪Undetected} ，但生物可以尝试寻找目标，令其改为 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{藏匿 Hidden}。如果目标使用敌对动作，法术在敌对动作完成后结束。

升阶 (4环级) 该法术持续1分钟，但目标使用敌对动作时该法术不会结束。

YpTwqBUSQie8kQMu.name: 侦测魔法 Detect Magic
YpTwqBUSQie8kQMu.description:
你发出一股标记魔法存在的脉冲。你不会获得魔法存在或不存在以外的任何信息。你可以选择忽略你完全知晓的魔法，例如你或者你盟友的魔法物品以及持续法术。

仅当幻术魔法的环级低于你的侦测魔法环级时，你才能侦测幻术魔法。但是，具有幻术灵光但是没有在外表上做伪装的物品（例如一瓶隐形术药水），通常能够正常侦测。

升阶 (3环级) 你会了解法术侦测区域中最高环级的效果的学派。如果有相同强度的多个效果，GM决定你了解的为哪一个。

升阶 (4环级) 如3环级，你也能指出最高环级魔法的来源。如同一种模糊感官（imprecise sense），你不会了解具体的位置，但是可以将来源锁定到5尺立方（或者最近的那个五尺立方，如果来源体积比这个区域更大）。

QVSO6xmJIGdqfP0G.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

NUE54wJoG2LAVMO1.name: Iron Mind
NUE54wJoG2LAVMO1.description: Duergar taskmasters automatically disbelieve all illusions of 1st level or lower.

Fuv2PWZEnIbyJ99B.name: Take Them Down!
Fuv2PWZEnIbyJ99B.description:
The duergar taskmaster smashes their maul into the ground and invokes Droskar's name to rally their allies to action. All allied duergars of equal or lower level that are within @Template[type:emanation|distance:20]{20 feet} of the duergar taskmaster gain a +1 status bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls until the end of the duergar taskmaster's next turn.

@Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-effects.u1Z7i2RyL6Sd9OVU]{Effect: Take Them Down!}

Dullahan.name: 无头骑士 Dullahan
Dullahan.publicNotes:
Riding on a horse as black as night, the headless hunter known as the dullahan tracks down and takes the heads of those it deems unfit to continue living. When closing in for the kill, the dullahan first whispers its victim's name, then swiftly collects its prize, casting a pall of dread upon all who witness the grim execution.

A dullahan manifests when a particularly violent warrior is beheaded and the warrior's soul stubbornly clings to material existence (or is refused entry to the afterlife). Most dullahans return to their former homelands, where they can exact vengeance those they feel wronged them in life (or their living descendants). A dullahan's concept of justice is swift and merciless, and once it has selected a target, it is unwavering in its cause.

Perhaps even more than revenge on the living, a dullahan desires its own rotted head. An individual who wields the head of a dullahan is powerful indeed, for a dullahan will grudgingly serve such a master in the hopes of reclaiming its missing skull. Mighty fiends such as devils command dullahans to harvest souls or lead armies for them, while a mortal might use such an undead warrior to fulfill a personal vendetta. No matter its master's rank or station, however, a dullahan won't hesitate to kill its liege and reclaim its head when the opportunity presents itself.

Most dullahan lairs are abandoned, overgrown ruins or other dilapidated places where severed heads and other trophies line the walls. Some dullahans, on the other hand, are content to simply commit their foul deeds and leave the remains of their decapitated victims in the streets, strewn among a copse of dead trees, or unceremoniously tossed in a bog hole.

gYS1Pu6DMoqNba15.name: 借机攻击 Attack of Opportunity

VXiR6GGa6NxxxBMb.name: Head Hunter
VXiR6GGa6NxxxBMb.description: Any slashing weapon a dullahan wields becomes @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.hg3IogR8ue2IWwgS]{Keen}, and any hatchet it wields becomes @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.qlunQzfnzPQpMG6U]{Returning}. If the dullahan kills a creature with a critical hit using a slashing weapon, the target is decapitated as though the dullahan had used Reap on the target. These effects remain only while the dullahan holds the weapon.

pG17snAKOgqgqba1.name: Reap
pG17snAKOgqgqba1.description: The dullahan removes the head of a dead creature within reach. Each creature within the area of the dullahan's frightful presence must attempt a new save, even if they are temporarily immune.

VRVvTkZmbfIqx7uw.name: Summon Steed
VRVvTkZmbfIqx7uw.description: The dullahan summons a @Compendium[pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.Jy2va0NTTbaUH1zP]{War Horse} with elite adjustments and the fiend trait. This steed remains until it is slain, the dullahan Dismisses it, or the dullahan summons another steed.

Duskwalker Ghost Hunter.name: 冥人猎魂者 Duskwalker Ghost Hunter
Duskwalker Ghost Hunter.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. death effects
Duskwalker Ghost Hunter.di: effects that would transform their body or soul to an undead
Duskwalker Ghost Hunter.publicNotes:
Duskwalkers are infused with the same energies as psychopomps. These ashen scions are reborn on the Material Plane to serve as guardians of the cycle of life and death.

Many immortals dwell upon the other planes of the Great Beyond. Some are benevolent and kindly, like angels. Others are cruel and destructive, like demons. And some fit roles outside of morality, like psychopomps. It's far from unheard of that mortals and immortals alike become entangled romantically, and the children of such engagements carry a supernatural element in their bloodlines for generations to follow. After the first generation, this otherworldly influence usually lies dormant, but now and then, the influence can manifest strongly in descendants many years later. These inheritors of extraplanar legacies are known collectively as planar scions.

rh2quedjlo5wYnpP.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Death Effects

NUQlBj6YHAwX4fEr.name: Ghost Hunter
NUQlBj6YHAwX4fEr.description: The duskwalker's weapons have the benefits of the @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.JQdwHECogcTzdd8R]{Ghost Touch} property rune on attacks against incorporeal undead.

5TVlHOsmwK2Om8pu.name: Hunt Prey
5TVlHOsmwK2Om8pu.description:
The duskwalker designates as its prey a single creature that it can see and hear or that it is Tracking. It gains a +2 circumstance bonus to Perception checks when it @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seeks} its prey and a +2 circumstance bonus to Survival checks when it @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.EA5vuSgJfiHH7plD]{Tracks} its prey. It also ignores the penalty for making ranged attacks within its second range increment against its prey.

Lastly, it gains a +2 circumstance bonus to Deception checks, Intimidation checks, and Stealth checks against its prey and to any check to Recall Knowledge about its prey, as well as a +1 circumstance bonus to AC against its prey's attacks. The duskwalker can have only one prey designated at a time.

BVtWjIcXEObj4Rr9.name: Hunted Shot
BVtWjIcXEObj4Rr9.description:
Frequency Once per round

Effect The duskwalker makes two longbow Strikes against its hunted prey. If both Strikes hit, combine their damage for the purpose of resistances and weaknesses.

Eagle.name: 鹰 Eagle
Eagle.publicNotes:
These large birds of prey swoop down from incredible heights to snatch fish and small mammals in their powerful talons. Eagles nest atop high trees or steep cliffs that provide a commanding view of the surrounding area. They avoid nesting too near civilization, but some remote cultures train eagles as hunting companions.

Few avian creatures can match the beauty and grace of the eagle.

63iXwIDFMddnz4kz.name: Eagle Dive
63iXwIDFMddnz4kz.description: The eagle @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.cS9nfDRGD83bNU1p]{Flies} up to double its fly Speed in a straight line, descending at least 10 feet, and then makes a talon Strike.

Elemental Avalanche.name: 元素雪崩 Elemental Avalanche
Elemental Avalanche.publicNotes:
Stubborn and ponderous, elemental avalanches are massive beings of living rock and dirt.

Earth elementals make excellent bodyguards for adventuresome spelunkers and are ideal protectors of important subterranean locations such as vaults and treasuries.

vXYYcxC29lm6Xqml.name: Earthbound
vXYYcxC29lm6Xqml.description: When not touching solid ground, the elemental avalanche is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}, can't use reactions, and can't Trample.

krB0fRntUZ4twRdd.name: Crumble
krB0fRntUZ4twRdd.description:
Trigger The elemental avalanche takes damage from a hostile source while atop rock or earth.

Effect The elemental avalanche crumbles into the ground, Burrowing down 10 feet. This Burrowing does not trigger reactions.

The elemental avalanche can't Crumble again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Crumble]]{1d4 rounds}.

EIOiFljIAD1Zzdzr.name: Spike Stones
EIOiFljIAD1Zzdzr.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:5]{5 feet} @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

Spikes of rock rise up from all stone surfaces in the emanation, creating difficult terrain. A creature moving in the terrain takes [[/r {2d8}[piercing]]]{2d8 piercing damage} for each square of spikes it moves into (a Large or larger creature takes damage only once for each square it moves, even if its space covers multiple squares of spikes). Creatures with the earth trait ignore all effects within the area.

The elemental avalanche can disable or activate spike stones as a single action, which has the concentrate trait.

vCeTTDUcG0aI8C9H.name: Earth Glide
vCeTTDUcG0aI8C9H.description: The elemental avalanche can Burrow through any earthen matter, including rock. When it does so, the elemental avalanche moves at its full burrow Speed, leaving no tunnels or signs of its passing.

Elemental Hurricane.name: 元素飓风 Elemental Hurricane
Elemental Hurricane.publicNotes:
Elemental hurricanes embody the ferocity of violent windstorms.

Hailing from the Plane of Air, these beings appear in a variety of sizes and shapes.

sS1tOJIttfEYCFaT.name: Disperse
sS1tOJIttfEYCFaT.description:
Trigger The elemental hurricane takes damage from a hostile action.

Effect The elemental hurricane disperses.

Until the end of the current turn, it can't be attacked or targeted, doesn't take up space, and any auras or emanations it has are suppressed. At the end of the turn, the elemental hurricane reforms in any space in which it can fit within 100 feet of where it dispersed and any auras or emanations it has are restored as long as their duration didn't run out while it was dispersed.

8ZY3GiKagZnMX8T1.name: High Winds
8ZY3GiKagZnMX8T1.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:40]{40 feet} @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

Air within the emanation is difficult terrain for Flying creatures that do not have the air trait.

sgKONsx24qNmQXvo.name: Breath Weapon
sgKONsx24qNmQXvo.description:
Your eidolon exhales a blast of destructive energy. Your eidolon deals 1d6 damage to all creatures in the area, with a basic Reflex save against your spell DC. The area and damage type of the Breath Weapon are chosen when the eidolon gains this ability.

Your eidolon then can't use their Breath Weapon again for the next [[/r 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

At 3rd level and every 2 levels thereafter, the damage increases by 1d6. [[/r (ceil(@actor.level/2))d6]]{Levelled Damage}

Elemental Tsunami.name: 元素海啸 Elemental Tsunami
Elemental Tsunami.publicNotes:
Elemental tsunamis are huge and destructive.

Water elementals can be very destructive, but often not intentionally so; just as water can bring life to those in need on the Material Plane, its waves can pound shores and rains can flood cities. Water elementals are similarly difficult to predict.

PmcZB53eH1gUzaBq.name: Water-Bound
PmcZB53eH1gUzaBq.description: When not touching water, the elemental tsunami is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.

FTMgXssm5HK4Io0O.name: Vortex
FTMgXssm5HK4Io0O.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:50]{50 feet} @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

Water in the area that is in the same body of water as the elemental tsunami is difficult terrain for Swimming creatures that don't have the water trait.

tEPc3Xc3Pufff6D5.name: Drench
tEPc3Xc3Pufff6D5.description:
The elemental puts out all fires in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:20].

It extinguishes all non-magical fires automatically and attempts to counteract magical fires ([[/r 1d20+20 #Drench]]{+20} counteract modifier).

AiKIcXFJx9lEEfnt.name: Surge
AiKIcXFJx9lEEfnt.description:
The elemental tsunami quickly expands its space to fill the area of its vortex. Creatures within the vortex's emanation take [[/r {5d12+6}[bludgeoning]]]{5d12+6 bludgeoning damage} (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:31|basic:true] save). A creature that fails this save is Pushed 20 feet. The elemental tsunami then retracts to its former space.

The elemental tsunami can't Surge again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Surge]]{1d4 rounds}.

MGX1U8Kv59BVYAOI.name: Push or Pull 10 feet
MGX1U8Kv59BVYAOI.description:
The elemental tsunami can also pull the creature.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Push]

Elephant.name: 大象 Elephant
Elephant.publicNotes:
Those who live near elephants have learned to be wary of angering the beasts, but even with precautions in place, elephants sometimes still rampage. There is little an individual person can do when even a single elephant becomes enraged. Furthermore, a herd of angry or frightened elephants can easily destroy an entire village.

Immediately recognizable by their long, prehensile trunks and impressive tusks, elephants have different characteristics depending on where they are found. Elephants are used as beasts of burden in many regions, but they are extremely clever and must be handled with great care.

5O3D1KLFuAtqX80b.name: Grabbing Trunk
5O3D1KLFuAtqX80b.description: A Medium or smaller creature hit by the elephant's trunk is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}. If the elephant moves, it can bring the Grabbed creature along with it.

Erinys.name: 狂怒魔 Erinys
Erinys.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic
Erinys.publicNotes:
Erinyes exact vengeance and bloody justice for a creature's crimes, torturing and punishing their victims in ironic fashion before allowing them the escape of death. While an erinys appears as a fallen angel and the first erinyes shared that origin, erinyes now originate in myriad ways, some promoted from lesser devils and others shaped from lemures themselves forged from the souls of torturers and persecutors. The erinyes' origin is entwined with Eiseth, herself a fallen angel and one of Hell's most powerful demigods. The first erinyes were all considered to be Eiseth's metaphorical daughters, but erinyes formed since that time are no longer limited to a single gender.

Masters of corruption and architects of conquest, devils seek both to tempt mortal life to join in their pursuit of all things profane and to spread tyranny throughout all worlds. The temptations they offer mortals range from great powers granted by the signing of an infernal contract to twisted favors following a whispered pledge to a diabolic patron, or any number of even subtler exchanges. Those who succumb to these temptations find themselves consigned to an afterlife of endless torment in the pits of Hell, wherein the only hope of escape lies in the chance of being promoted to become a devil in the infernal ranks. Every devil has a specific role to play in the upkeep of the remorseless bureaucratic machine that is Hell, from soldiers and scholars to inquisitors, lawyers, judges, and executioners. Lowly lemures and imps perform subservient labor to more powerful and specialized devils, such as contract devils and erinyes, while the greatest pit fiends command entire infernal armies.

fpyaGQ7nPlsCH1nc.name: 真视术(恒定法术) True Seeing (Constant)
fpyaGQ7nPlsCH1nc.description: 你可以看见60尺内的事物的本来面貌。GM秘密骰反制检定，对抗区域中的所有幻术或者变形效果，但这只会决定你是否能看破它（例如，如果该检定成功对抗了一个变形法术，你可以看见该生物的本来形态，但你不会结束该变形法术）。

lntTBnW0tn7XEMPJ.name: 次元门(随意施法) Dimension Door (At Will)
lntTBnW0tn7XEMPJ.description:
你通过开启一扇绕过通常空间的门，将自身以及任何你穿戴和持握的物品从你当前所在的空间立刻传送到你能看见的范围内的开阔空间。如果此时另一个生物会与你随行—即使你使用异次元存储空间—你会失去该法术。

升阶 (5环级) 该射程增加到1英里。你无须看见你的目标，只要你曾经去过那里，并且了解其与你的相对位置和距离。你会暂时免疫1小时。

mqqrqczmNE7FLbro.name: 恐惧术(随意施法) Fear (At Will)
mqqrqczmNE7FLbro.description:
你将恐惧植入目标；它必须尝试一次意志豁免。

大成功 目标不受影响。

成功 目标获得 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 1}.

失败 目标获得 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 2}.

大失败 目标获得 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 3} 并且 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{逃跑 Fleeing} 1轮.

升阶 (3环级) 你能以至多五个生物为目标。

ZZcgAENc8VCfxb7e.name: 幻象伪装(随意施法) Illusory Disguise (At Will)
ZZcgAENc8VCfxb7e.description:
你创造了一个令你看起来是另一个有相同体型的生物的幻觉。该生物和你相比，身高（6英寸内）和体重（50磅内）相近。该伪装通常足以掩盖你的身份，但不足以让你假扮另一个特定个人。该法术不会改变你的声音，气味，或者仪态。你可以改变你的衣服和佩带物的外观，例如让你的护甲看起来像是连衣裙。持握的物品不受影响，并且穿戴的物品离开你时会回复其本来外观。

施放幻象伪装视为欺骗（Deception）技能的 @Compendium[pf2e.action-macros.k5nW4jGyXD0Oq9LR]{假扮 Impersonate}用法的设立伪装；这忽视任何你可能会从扮作不熟悉生物中获得的减值，并且会赋予你在避免他人看破你的伪装的欺骗（Deception）检定上+4状态加值，并且即使你未受训你也加上你的等级。你可以解消该法术。

升阶 (2环级) 该法术也会伪装你的声音和气味，并且该法术获得听觉特征。

升阶 (3环级) 你可以伪装成任何与你有相同体型的生物，甚至是特定个人。你必须见过该个人才能使用其外观。该法术也会伪装你的声音和气味，并且该法术获得听觉特征。

@Compendium[pf2e.spell-effects.3Ktyd5F9lOPo4myk]{法术效果：幻象伪装}

cQrkrn9uX9hV860V.name: 高等黑暗视觉 Greater Darkvision

vKdhNyXTKHDMUfAc.name: Flames of Fury
vKdhNyXTKHDMUfAc.description: Any weapon an erinys holds gains the effects of a @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.XszNvxnymWYRaoTp]{Flaming} rune while they hold it.

pKPJ4u9g0HQyU7b6.name: Furious Fusillade
pKPJ4u9g0HQyU7b6.description: The erinys hovers in place if they are flying and fires one arrow at any number of creatures in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30]. Each attack is rolled separately. This counts as one attack for the purpose of the erinys's multiple attack penalty.

PVrWJHEarOi9LFbD.name: Rope Snare
PVrWJHEarOi9LFbD.description:
An erinys carries a coil of rope woven of their hair (use the statistics for @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.fyYnQf1NAx9fWFaS]{Rope}) that animates in their hands.

When a creature is hit by the erinys's rope, a segment of the rope tears loose and wraps itself around the creature, imposing a 10-foot circumstance penalty to Speed. The piece that tears off is 10 feet long for a Medium or smaller creature, and doubles in length for each size larger than Medium.

When a creature @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escapes} the effect (DC 26), the detached segment of rope withers away into useless black sludge.

@Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-effects.o0zqsH5kYopRanav]{Effect: Rope Snare}

Ether Spider.name: 以太蜘蛛 Ether Spider
Ether Spider.publicNotes:
Ether spiders are deadly predators from the Ethereal Plane resembling giant arachnids. Rather than building webs of silk, ether spiders shape the raw essence of the Ethereal Plane, weaving it in complex patterns that drift through the misty void. From these ethereal nests, whole families of ether spiders can scout the adjacent Material Plane, watching for easy prey in dark or remote corners of the land of mortals. Once an ether spider has spotted a meal, it anchors its nest and waits on the Ethereal Plane for its prey to draw near. As soon as its victim is within reach, the ether spider shifts to the Material Plane, clamps its fangs onto its prey, then shifts back to the Ethereal Plane to wait as its venom works through the creature's system. Ether spiders move between the planes with ease, making them extremely dangerous to those who cannot see or attack ethereal enemies.

Ether spiders are not mindless or evil-they are simply hungry. If a prospective meal can sate an ether spider's incredible appetite through other means, they might be able to bargain for their life. Ether spiders are especially interested in items, information, or allies who can help them against their enemies.

As many as half a dozen ether spiders might dwell in the same ether web. Although ether spiders enjoy one another's company, they don't form the same bonds as most humanoids, and they are more likely to feast on the corpse of a fallen sibling than save one from certain doom.

Ether spiders dwell in vast nests adrift in the Ghost World, where they are more likely to let down their guard. Travelers who find a floating ether spider commune should have an easier time of making peaceful contact to trade with or even befriend these strange arachnids. The nests drift on metaphysical currents and are rarely seen in the same vicinity twice. Sometimes a point of interest on the neighboring Material Plane compels them to tether their nest to an area, creating a semipermanent home, and those who learn its location can return to it repeatedly.

siaeh3ZOXYXVsYlo.name: Ether Spider Venom
siaeh3ZOXYXVsYlo.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:22]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 [[/r {1d6}[poison]]]{1d6 poison damage} and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 [[/r {2d6}[poison]]]{2d6 poison damage}, @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} (1 round)

Stage 3 [[/r {3d6}[poison]]]{3d6 poison damage}, @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 3} and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} (1 round)

JaEjyp5taeG7YCCo.name: Ethereal Step
JaEjyp5taeG7YCCo.description: The ether spider shifts to either the Ethereal Plane or the Material Plane. The ether spider can remain on the Ethereal Plane indefinitely without ill effect. While there, it can see clearly onto the Material Plane with a range of 60 feet. On its first round in an encounter, the ether spider can use this ability once as a free action.

BMgUFhUSXPid36Be.name: Ethereal Web Trap
BMgUFhUSXPid36Be.description: A creature hit by the ether spider's web attack is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} and stuck to the nearest surface (Escape DC 22).

DG6zH2k37QwOHJ9R.name: Web Burst
DG6zH2k37QwOHJ9R.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The ether spider flings a gout of stored webs in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30]. These webs can pass between the Material Plane and the Ethereal Plane. Each creature in the area is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}, as ethereal web trap, unless it succeeds at a @Check[type:reflex|dc:22] save.

Ettin.name: 双头巨人 Ettin
Ettin.publicNotes:
Two heads aren't always better than one. The slovenly, violent giants known as ettins are proof enough of that.

The origin of these two-headed brutes is unknown, but few who encounter ettins ponder their beginnings for long. Rather, the first priority for most creatures during such a confrontation is escape, which is not easy to accomplish given the ettins' notorious vigilance. In this way, two heads are better than one-ettins regularly find employ in the ranks of giant or orc armies as sentries and guards. The benefits of an ettin security detail are obvious: because it has a shared stomach, an ettin requires only the same amount of food as one typical ogre, yet its two sets of eyes make it twice as observant. An ettin never complains for lack of company, either. The ettin's two heads are uniquely content to squabble and converse between themselves, and though they bicker incessantly, most couldn't dream of life without the other. Much like some twins, an ettin has two individual minds who nonetheless consider the other as much a part of their life as their own self.

Ettins do not resemble a single giant heritage so much as an amalgamation of several. Their tusks are thought to stem from orc ancestry, though their size and dimness suggest hill giant blood. Though they tower over goblins and hobgoblins, ettins are more than at home among tribes of these creatures and enjoy their comfortable stations as camp lookouts or troop rearguards. Their exposure to a wide variety of goblinoids and giants is evident in their language; ettins speak a pidgin tongue of Goblin, Jotun, and Orcish, and their diction is mostly good enough to get across the general meaning of their short sentences and bumbled sayings-although most interlocutors simply nod their heads while conversing with an ettin anyway. The monsters are notoriously short tempered and, despite their heightened visual perception, short sighted in matters of keeping their allies alive.

fs49A2QDgfg74MTh.name: Independent Brains
fs49A2QDgfg74MTh.description: Each of an ettin's heads rolls its own initiative and has its own turn. Neither head can @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.A72nHGUtNXgY5Ey9]{Delay}. At the start of a head's turn, that head gets 2 actions and 1 reaction. Each brain controls one of the ettin's arms, but both can move the legs. Any ability that would sever an ettin's head (such as the @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.6xaxxKfvXED6LfIY]{Vorpal} weapon property) doesn't cause the ettin to die if it still has its other head, but does cause it to lose the turns, actions, and reactions of the severed head. Mental effects that target a single creature affect only one of the ettin's heads.

lUtqPs1qhhuLgmEE.name: 借机攻击 Attack of Opportunity

Envyspawn.name: 嫉妒罪生怪 Envyspawn
Envyspawn.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic, +4 status to all saves vs. mental
Envyspawn.publicNotes:
Sinspawn were created by one of seven ancient wizards known collectively as runelords-each of whom embraced and embodied one of seven sins. The first sinspawn was created by the Runelord of Wrath, utilizing techniques that have since gone on to influence fleshwarping practices. It wasn't long before the technique used to create sinspawn fell into the hands of the other runelords, and while each tried their own hand at crafting variants of their own design, today sinspawn of wrath remain the most numerous and notorious of their kind. Bearing only a vague resemblance to the humanoids from whose flesh they were formed, sinspawn generally appear horrifically emaciated and have unnaturally long arms and digitigrade legs, each with a trio of stubby, taloned digits. Veins bulge across sinspawn's bodies in sanguine patterns that suspiciously resemble twisted runes, and their flesh is pale and hairless. Their heads are elongated, bearing only slits for a nose, red eyes, and disturbing lower jaws that split in half at the chin, revealing pedipalps that end in tiny, three-fingered hands and framing a long, lolling tongue. Sinspawn stand 6-1/2 feet tall and typically weigh as much as an emaciated human of their size. They behave in a manner consistent with their associated sin and have physical characteristics that hint at these qualities. For example, greedspawn's veins appear to run with gold while envyspawn appear even more wasted than the rest of their kin.

Envyspawn tend to be shorter and thinner than other sinspawn.

hk7qH9BpvzM7rFGe.name: Sin Scent (Imprecise) 30 feet
hk7qH9BpvzM7rFGe.description: A sinspawn can smell creatures that reflect its sin, as the scent ability. The GM determines which creatures are appropriately sinful.

WnjXiMvqjEQAuxnZ.name: +4 Status to All Saves vs. Mental

pJ5VmBxu1TYtLUuZ.name: 借机攻击 Attack of Opportunity

MpNlJrdPvv9bECNE.name: Sinful Bite
MpNlJrdPvv9bECNE.description:
A creature hit by the jaws of a sinspawn must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:18] save as it is assailed by sinful thoughts.

Critical Success Unaffected

Success @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}

Failure @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}

Critical Failure sickened 2 plus @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} for 1 minute

Faerie Dragon.name: 妖精龙 Faerie Dragon
Faerie Dragon.publicNotes:
Although they are much smaller than their larger dragon cousins, faerie dragons have the many of the same physiological attributes, including long necks, toothy maws, sinuous tails, and sharp claws. They flit about on iridescent butterfly wings, the coloring of which changes based on where they live, giving them a natural camouflage. Unlike their larger kin, an adult faerie dragon remains the same size throughout its lifespan. The only visual clue to the age of a faerie dragon is the sheen on its scales, a glimmer that becomes more lustrous the older it gets.

Faerie dragons usually exhibit pleasant and good-natured temperaments, though they have a mischievous streak that leads them to play tricks on those around them. In search of an amusement, they prefer harmless annoyances to wounding malice. While often spontaneous, they may also spend months if not years planning the perfect prank. Especially responsive targets endear themselves to faerie dragons and may create a lifelong bond. A faerie dragon's reputation as a trickster leads many to associate them with fey, with whom the tiny dragons have cordial relationships.

Peaceful by nature, faerie dragons do not enjoy confrontation. If faced with hostility, they prefer to remain at a distance and breathe euphoric gas at their foes, diffusing the skirmish by creating an atmosphere of bliss. If conflict escalates, they target their opponents with spells, using their renowned trickery to escape. If their companions are in danger, however, their desire to remain out of combat changes. Faerie dragons protect their friends by any means available, including physical combat.

Sometimes as faerie dragons grow older, their connection to the First World grows stronger. In addition to growing more lustrous and vibrant in appearance, these faerie dragons gain an increasing amount of magical primal power. Such faerie dragons increase in strength as appropriate-a faerie dragon of 20th level or even higher is possible, but it is exceptionally unusual to encounter a faerie dragon of 9th level or higher beyond the most remote regions of the First World. When creating a more powerful faerie dragon, change its tradition to primal and grant it a number of primal spells known appropriate for a druid of its level. Faerie dragons don't grow much larger, regardless of how powerful they become. Those who would seek to torment or vex a faerie dragon would do well to consider this, as it's often difficult to tell how powerful one of these tiny dragons truly is at a simple glance!

eN762ag1BwsEj2mG.name: 隐形术(仅限自身) Invisibility (Self Only)
eN762ag1BwsEj2mG.description:
目标被幻术包复，变得 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{隐形 Invisible}. 这令该生物对所有生物 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{无踪Undetected} ，但生物可以尝试寻找目标，令其改为 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{藏匿 Hidden}。如果目标使用敌对动作，法术在敌对动作完成后结束。

升阶 (4环级) 该法术持续1分钟，但目标使用敌对动作时该法术不会结束。

2vBMTexIigEtaKt3.name: Breath Weapon
2vBMTexIigEtaKt3.description:
The dragon breathes euphoric gas in a @Template[type:cone|distance:10]. Each creature in the area must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:18] save or become @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for [[/br 1d4 #Duration Euphoric Gas]]{1d4 rounds}; on a critical failure, the duration is 1 minute.

The faerie dragon can't use Breath Weapon again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.

Fire Giant.name: 火巨人 Fire Giant
Fire Giant.publicNotes:
The most militaristic of all giants, fire giants focus obsessively on learning combat techniques, mastering the arts of forging weapons and armor, and finding new ways to dominate their enemies. As a result, their social and political structures are grounded firmly in martial hierarchies, with a strict emphasis on following the orders of one's superior, no matter if you are accountable to a lowly soldier or report to a powerful officer. As soon as a fire giant can walk, they are fitted with their first suit of forged armor. This armor is constantly remolded and replaced as the fire giant matures, both to ensure they are comfortable with steel against their skin and also to teach the giant as early as possible that they bear the burden of fighting to protect their traditions and way of life. To a fire giant, death is the flame in which the future is forged.

Fire giants are usually identified by their powerful stature, bright-orange hair that flickers and dances as if it were aflame, and heavy steel armor worn over garments of crimson, amber, or black. Most fire giants are covered in scars and refuse to conceal or obstruct them, as each jagged mark serves as a reminder of a valuable lesson they learned in battle. A typical fire giant stands 12 to 16 feet tall, weighs about 7,000 pounds, and lives to be 350 years old.

Giants are massive humanoid creatures who live in remote regions throughout the world. They are divided into a number of subtypes.

O99DLEbVCEWFTial.name: +1 Half Plate
O99DLEbVCEWFTial.description: Half plate consists of most of the upper body plates used in full plate, with lighter or sparser steel plate protection for the arms and legs. This provides some of the protection of full plate with greater flexibility and speed. A suit of this armor comes with an undercoat of padded armor and a pair of gauntlets.

5I2ELiZx1Aa9j37J.name: 借机攻击 Attack of Opportunity

XGMdT1ANHdPUE8UO.name: Flaming Stroke
XGMdT1ANHdPUE8UO.description: The fire giant imbues its blade with flames and makes a greatsword Strike with a -2 circumstance penalty against each creature in a @Template[type:line|distance:15|damaging:yes]{15-foot line}. It makes only one attack roll and compares the result to each creature's AC. This Strike deals an additional [[/r {1d6}[fire]]]{1d6 fire damage} and counts as one attack for the fire giant's multiple attack penalty.

ZpVuzT55hKotfiRz.name: 投石 Throw Rock
ZpVuzT55hKotfiRz.description:
A rock thrown by a fire giant deals an additional [[/r {1d6}[fire]]]{1d6 fire damage} on a hit.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ThrowRock]

Fire Mephit.name: 火魔蝠 Fire Mephit
Fire Mephit.publicNotes:
Fire mephits are conniving and quick to anger. They aren't evil, but they delight in inflicting pain, and their love of burning things pushes them the closest to this alignment of all mephits. They have bright-orange skin, and wisps of flame flicker along their wings as they flap through the air. The rivalry between fire and water mephits is notorious, and these creatures loathe working together for any amount of time.

Mephits-sometimes known as elemental scamps-are little bipedal critters with bat-like wings who serve stronger elementals on the Elemental Planes or neophyte spellcasters who summon them to the Material Plane. All mephits have an inkling of magical power as well as a breath weapon.

Tji1ev92INkjtI3U.name: Smoke Vision
Tji1ev92INkjtI3U.description: The fire mephit ignores the @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from smoke.

5Rd1LNWiczurzj0C.name: Breath Weapon
5Rd1LNWiczurzj0C.description:
The fire mephit breathes flames in a @Template[type:cone|distance:15] that deals [[/r {2d4}[fire]]]{2d4 fire damage} and [[/r {1d4}[persistent,fire]]] @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Fire Damage} to each creature within the area (@Check[type:reflex|dc:17|basic:true] save).

The fire mephit can't use Breath Weapon again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.

Firewyrm.name: 炎龙 Firewyrm
Firewyrm.publicNotes:
Firewyrms live in tubes of molten lava found throughout the Plane of Fire.

Fire elementals are destructive manifestations of the scorching Plane of Fire.

e5zu7QFkUzeeeoVM.name: Smoke Vision
e5zu7QFkUzeeeoVM.description: The firewyrm ignores the @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from smoke.

hQNxvkHklgW9fvpf.name: Explosion
hQNxvkHklgW9fvpf.description: When the firewyrm dies, it explodes, dealing [[/r {6d6}[fire]]]{6d6 fire damage} to each creature in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10|traits:fire,damaging-effect] (@Check[type:reflex|dc:28|basic:true] save).

5k5qe7LZeapjusIM.name: Breath Weapon
5k5qe7LZeapjusIM.description:
The firewyrm breathes a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] of fire dealing [[/r {7d6}[fire]]]{7d6 fire damage} and [[/r {2d8}[persistent,fire]]] @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Fire Damage} to every creature within the cone (@Check[type:reflex|dc:28|basic:true] save).

The firewyrm can't use Breath Weapon again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.

Faceless Stalker.name: 无面潜伏者 Faceless Stalker
Faceless Stalker.allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. auditory and visual
Faceless Stalker.publicNotes:
Among the subtler of the alghollthu creations were the ugothols-also known as faceless stalkers. These twisted beings used shapeshifting to infiltrate settlements and assassinate key targets. They sowed discord and replaced leaders, causing unwanted organizations to implode and bothersome people to lose face and eventually disappear. Entirely terrestrial in nature, ugothols can easily extend alghollthu plots above the waves for extended periods of time, giving their aquatic masters enhanced reach into these unpleasantly dry realms. Today, most faceless stalkers-like the less dangerous ulat-kinis-pursue programmed goals without the guidance of alghollthu rule. Faceless stalkers prefer to live as close to the sea coast as possible, although they are not aquatic creatures themselves. Most dwell in tiny tribes in marshlands. Others live in the sewers of coastal towns.

By instinct, faceless stalkers seek to sow discord. They replace leaders in humanoid societies, then guide infiltrated settlements down paths of destruction. Among humanoids who have wicked tendencies, a faceless stalker can become a prominent trailblazer, leading a group to new heights of depravity and violence. Inevitably, however, faceless stalker infiltrators lead their followers to ruin. The ugothol eventually moves on-either because its true nature is about to be discovered, or because it has despoiled or devastated all local resources.

An ugothol gains nourishment only through its long, bloodsucking tongue. Their prey bear distinctive triple puncture wounds near major arteries. Corpses bearing such marks are typically the first clues found to uncover a faceless stalker's presence, though sometimes they are overlooked as marks belonging to a vampire or chupacabra.

In bygone millennia, aquatic monsters known as alghollthus used their occult powers to conquer and rule vast parts of the world. Their empires contained countless mortal slaves treated as little more than cattle. Alghollthus shaped their slaves and other creatures using mental manipulation and physically transformative magic. Aberrant horrors from faceless stalkers to mimics can be traced back to this meddling. The rulers of the alghollthu race, the so-called veiled masters, further shaped entire societies by assuming the forms of those they controlled. From the heights of power to the shadows of poverty, the veiled masters manipulated these societies according to their own dark designs, enslaving, killing, or horrifically transforming those who discovered their plans or acted against them.

In time, the alghollthus grew frustrated with their increasingly upstart slave societies and sought to wipe the slate clean-both starting anew and punishing those who had become too willful and rebellious. They used incredible magical power to call forth a cataclysm, hoping to destroy the rebellious societies they'd manipulated. Yet they miscalculated the strength of faith and will to survive of their pawns and slaves, and in time the world and its empires recovered and grew strong once again-this time without alghollthu influence.

Today, the alghollthus have retreated from their mass-scale manipulation of the surface world, and they have mostly remained within the deep aquatic realms where they still rule without question. Yet they have not abandoned their plots entirely, and the reemergence of servitor races like ugothols points to a frightening possibility-that the alghollthus have turned their hateful eyes to the surface once again.

r3lAOkFyEmPI0FDI.name: 巧言术(恒定法术) Tongues (Constant)
r3lAOkFyEmPI0FDI.description:
无论什么语言，目标都可以理解其所有的词语，并且向其他生物用该语言交流。当处于一群各异的生物中时，每次目标将要说话，他可以选择一个生物，并使用一种该生物理解的语言来讲述，即使该目标不知道这语言具体是什么。

升阶 (7环级) 持续时间为8小时。

ZCRCrZQCOFtODRBG.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Auditory and Visual

K2pwGyKWkDm1x4Xh.name: Assume Form
K2pwGyKWkDm1x4Xh.description: The faceless stalker spends 10 minutes reshaping its appearance to take on the shape of any Small or Medium humanoid. It gains a +4 circumstance bonus to Deception checks to pass as that creature.

PHSSOZNHO0AKJt1q.name: Blood Nourishment
PHSSOZNHO0AKJt1q.description: The faceless stalker uses its three-pronged tongue to drink the blood of an adjacent @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} or @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} creature. The creature gains @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}.

u5ZGQOwAVraOXVuo.name: Compression
u5ZGQOwAVraOXVuo.description: When the faceless stalker successfully @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.kMcV8e5EZUxa6evt]{Squeezes}, it moves through the tight space at full speed. Narrow confines are not difficult terrain for a faceless stalker.

yxQPTCjmsUlWSm7n.name: Revert Form
yxQPTCjmsUlWSm7n.description:
Requirements The faceless stalker is in an assumed form.

Effect The faceless stalker resumes its true form. Until the start of its next turn, it gains a +2 status bonus to attack rolls, damage rolls, saving throws, and skill checks.

@Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-effects.SA5f54t1dVah5fJm]{Effect: Revert Form}

KjBveNLcC22szBCP.name: 偷袭 Sneak Attack
KjBveNLcC22szBCP.description:
The faceless stalker deals 1d6 extra precision damage to flat-footed creatures.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.SneakAttack]

Ghost Commoner.name: 平民幽灵 Ghost Commoner

dr.exceptions: except force, ghost touch, or positive; double resistance vs. non-magical

Ghost Commoner.publicNotes:
The ghost commoner is an ordinary person who believes they died unjustly, usually due to foul play or betrayal.

When some mortals die through tragic circumstances or without closure, they can linger on in the world. These anguished souls haunt a locale significant to them in life, constantly trying to right their perceived wrong or wrongdoings.

CfzB5r8CSHETuXfA.name: Site Bound
CfzB5r8CSHETuXfA.description: A typical ghost can stray only a short distance from where it was killed or the place it haunts. A typical limit is 120 feet. Some ghosts are instead bound to a room, building, item, or creature that was special to it rather than a location.

HvOzFzF3j47WTzIv.name: Rejuvenation
HvOzFzF3j47WTzIv.description:
Setting right the injustice that led to the commoner's death allows it to move on to the afterlife.

When a ghost is destroyed, it re-forms after [[/br 2d4 #days]]{2d4 days} within the location it's bound to, fully healed. A ghost can be permanently destroyed only if someone determines the reason for its existence and sets right whatever prevents the spirit from resting.

uYQrEbjjw3XIQ1cO.name: Frightful Moan
uYQrEbjjw3XIQ1cO.description: The ghost laments its fate, forcing each living creature within @Template[type:emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} to attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:21] save. On a failure, a creature becomes @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} (or @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3} on a critical failure). On a success, a creature is temporarily immune to this ghost's frightful moan for 1 minute.

1h9v3vILKQYAVpKr.name: Dwelling Lore (applies to the place the ghost is bound to)

Ghoul.name: 食尸鬼 Ghoul
Ghoul.publicNotes:
Ghouls are ravenous undead who haunt graveyards and eat corpses.

Few creatures are more ubiquitous to sinister locations such as lonely graveyards and ruined crypts than the flesh-eating undead known as ghouls.

7RTjFlVzsxhjtwX4.name: Consume Flesh
7RTjFlVzsxhjtwX4.description:
Requirements The ghoul is adjacent to the corpse of a creature that died within the last hour.

Effect The ghoul devours a chunk of the corpse and regains [[/r {1d6}[healing]]]{1d6 Hit Points}.

It can regain Hit Points from any given corpse only once.

oa6JQCeL4B2WQMPI.name: Ghoul Fever
oa6JQCeL4B2WQMPI.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:15]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 [[/r {2d6}[negative]]]{2d6 negative damage} and regains half as many Hit Points from all healing (1 day)

Stage 3 as stage 2 (1 day)

Stage 4 [[/r {2d6}[negative]]]{2d6 negative damage} and gains no benefit from healing (1 day)

Stage 5 as stage 4 (1 day)

Stage 6 dead, and rises as a @Compendium[pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.LHHgGSs0ELCR4CYK]{Ghoul} the next midnight.

9TCF9GcaMoTKkPSj.name: Paralysis
9TCF9GcaMoTKkPSj.description: Any living, non-elf creature hit by a ghoul's attack must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:15] save or become @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}. It can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns, and the DC cumulatively decreases by 1 on each such save.

rvraBop9oOSwcjkq.name: Swift Leap
rvraBop9oOSwcjkq.description: The ghoul jumps up to half its Speed. This movement doesn't trigger reactions.

Ghost Mage.name: 法师幽灵 Ghost Mage

dr.exceptions: except force, ghost touch, or positive; double resistance vs. non-magical

Ghost Mage.publicNotes:
A wizard who died with a major project left undone might become a ghost mage, constantly seeking to finish its task in undeath.

When some mortals die through tragic circumstances or without closure, they can linger on in the world. These anguished souls haunt a locale significant to them in life, constantly trying to right their perceived wrong or wrongdoings.

CENeiOS2cCnr2SQc.name: 侦测魔法 Detect Magic
CENeiOS2cCnr2SQc.description:
你发出一股标记魔法存在的脉冲。你不会获得魔法存在或不存在以外的任何信息。你可以选择忽略你完全知晓的魔法，例如你或者你盟友的魔法物品以及持续法术。

仅当幻术魔法的环级低于你的侦测魔法环级时，你才能侦测幻术魔法。但是，具有幻术灵光但是没有在外表上做伪装的物品（例如一瓶隐形术药水），通常能够正常侦测。

升阶 (3环级) 你会了解法术侦测区域中最高环级的效果的学派。如果有相同强度的多个效果，GM决定你了解的为哪一个。

升阶 (4环级) 如3环级，你也能指出最高环级魔法的来源。如同一种模糊感官（imprecise sense），你不会了解具体的位置，但是可以将来源锁定到5尺立方（或者最近的那个五尺立方，如果来源体积比这个区域更大）。

SzaJgzszNSa3qiDA.name: Site Bound
SzaJgzszNSa3qiDA.description: A typical ghost can stray only a short distance from where it was killed or the place it haunts. A typical limit is 120 feet. Some ghosts are instead bound to a room, building, item, or creature that was special to it rather than a location.

huAbJHogJo4HKgXV.name: Rejuvenation
huAbJHogJo4HKgXV.description:
Completing the ghost mage's project allows it to move on to the afterlife.

When a ghost is destroyed, it re-forms after [[/br 2d4 #days]]{2d4 days} within the location it's bound to, fully healed. A ghost can be permanently destroyed only if someone determines the reason for its existence and sets right whatever prevents the spirit from resting.

YqWqB6EYv3yk0LPh.name: Frightful Moan
YqWqB6EYv3yk0LPh.description: The ghost laments its fate, forcing each living creature within @Template[type:emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} to attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:29] save. On a failure, a creature becomes @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} (or @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3} on a critical failure). On a success, a creature is temporarily immune to this ghost's frightful moan for 1 minute.

M7mGcRgzVr9C3wsW.name: Telekinetic Assault
M7mGcRgzVr9C3wsW.description: The ghost cries out in pain and anguish as small objects and debris fly about in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30]. Creatures in this area take [[/r {6d6}[bludgeoning]]]{6d6 bludgeoning damage}, subject to a @Check[type:reflex|dc:29|basic:true] save.

Fungus Leshy.name: 真菌莱西 Fungus Leshy
Fungus Leshy.publicNotes:
Fungus leshys guard caves, bogs, and damp, dark places. Their fungus gardens are bizarre by most standards, but fungus leshys are extremely proud of their works.

Leshys are intelligent plant creatures that guard areas of primeval wilderness or earthly power. Originally created by powerful fey, they manifest when a skilled practitioner of primal magic-typically a druid-combines a nature spirit with a body carefully grown from local vegetation. The rites and materials required to create a leshy vary depending on the type of leshy. They are typically given life in an area of great natural significance, such as an arboreal's grove, a druidic circle, a fairy ring, or a great natural wonder.

Y2DikEsO4R95MHFo.name: Verdant Burst
Y2DikEsO4R95MHFo.description: When a fungus leshy dies, a burst of primal energy explodes from its body, restoring [[/r {2d8}[healing]]]{2d8 Hit Points} to each fungi creature in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30]. This area is filled with fungi, becoming difficult terrain. If the terrain is not a viable environment for this fungi, they wither after 24 hours.

ki3C4xNREH5G9Knv.name: Change Shape
ki3C4xNREH5G9Knv.description:
The fungus leshy transforms into a Small giant mushroom or patch of fungi. This ability otherwise uses the effects of @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.dileJ0Yxqg76LMvu]{Tree Shape}.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

LCFMKpxw0iDxWGXu.name: Spore Cloud
LCFMKpxw0iDxWGXu.description: A fungus leshy can unleash a cloud of spores that irritates the eyes and throats of non-fungi creatures in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:15]. Each creature must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:16|traits:damaging-effect] save or take [[/r {1}[persistent,poison]]] @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Poison Damage}. A creature has its vision reduced as long as the persistent damage continues and can see only within 20 feet (or 10 feet, on a critical failure).

ARWbmjbxbCd0JMUv.name: Spores
ARWbmjbxbCd0JMUv.description: A creature that takes damage from a fungus leshy's spore pod Strike must attempt a saving throw with the same DC and effect as its Spore Cloud ability.

Gancanagh.name: 爱语者 Gancanagh
Gancanagh.publicNotes:
Gancanaghs are lovers, revelers, and dashing duelists of Elysium. Embodiments of free love, they eagerly throw themselves into courting targets for brief but earnest flings until their quicksilver passions change their desires. They serve Cayden Cailean as well as other bacchanalian deities and empyreal lords of Elysium who understand their desires for love and parties. Gancanaghs hate evil beings that profane the spirit of romance and passion, as such creatures reinforce stigmas against open and free love. One can give no greater insult to a gancanagh than to mistake him for such a creature, and more than one hotheaded gancanagh has challenged a misinformed paladin or other champion of good to a duel over such a slight.
