While they enjoy drinking and carousing, gancanaghs can't stand smoke. Nonetheless, many gancanaghs carry whimsical-looking smoking pipes because they think it makes them look dapper. They cherish their silver flutes, for they enjoy the beauty of flutes' music and its ability to sway the heart.

The majority of gancanaghs present themselves as male, but the concept of gender to a creature like a gancanagh, which can change its shape freely, is much more fluid and open to interpretation than for many mortals. Gancanaghs enjoy using this flexibility to confront and test mortals' convictions when faced with fear or prejudice, but when encountering mortals who themselves are open-minded about sexuality or gender identity, they can become lifelong allies. For those who are persecuted for such reasons, gancanaghs are tireless defenders and eager supporters, quick to provide safety and to punish those who would attempt to impose narrower beliefs upon a world that deserves more diversity than it often gets. If possible, a gancanagh seeks to educate and redeem those who hold destructive beliefs or prejudices, resorting to combat only to defend themself or an endangered mortal, or when no other option seems tenable-yet even then, they fight with sadness.

Azatas are manifestations of freedom-kindly celestials with a penchant for curious exploration, spontaneous revelry, and whimsical quests. Born of the untamable wilds of Elysium, azatas are passionate and mercurial, but also fiercely loyal to those they hold dear. Azatas act quickly and directly against fiendish and otherworldly influences, but they tend to stay out of mortal affairs otherwise, allowing them the ultimate freedom to choose their own destiny. While all azatas cherish freedom, each type exemplifies a particular freedom above others. Many of their kind hold strange knightly and courtly titles that defy mortal classification and shift and change with time and on different occasions rather than following a strict hierarchy. This baffles archons and other more lawful creatures who haven't had much contact with azatas. In actuality, the azatas use their titles as personal flourishes and points of pride, rather than as excuses to order each other around.

SaFV0KJG5qfiJ37S.name: Tongues (Constant)
SaFV0KJG5qfiJ37S.description:
The target can understand all words regardless of language and also speak the languages of other creatures. When in a mixed group of creatures, each time the target speaks, it can choose a creature and speak in a language that creature understands, even if the target doesn't know what language that is.

Heightened (7th) The duration is 8 hours.

yp6FkMK5s9kORjtU.name: Mirror Image (At Will)
yp6FkMK5s9kORjtU.description:
Three illusory images of you swirl about your space, potentially causing those who attack you to hit one of the images instead of you. Any attack that would hit you has a random chance of hitting one of your images instead of you. If all three images remain, there is a 1 in 4 chance of hitting you (1 on 1d4). With two images remaining, there is a 1 in 3 chance of hitting you (1-2 on 1d6). With only one image, the chances are 1 in 2 (1-3 on 1d6).

Once an image is hit, it is destroyed. If an attack roll fails to hit your AC but doesn't critically fail, it destroys an image but has no additional effect (even if the attack would normally have an effect on a failure). If an attack roll is a critical success and would hit one of the images, one of the images is destroyed and the attack roll becomes a success against you. Once all the images are destroyed, the spell ends.

vdcGFn6EEbN3R7lP.name: Charm (At Will)
vdcGFn6EEbN3R7lP.description:
To the target, your words are honey and your visage seems bathed in a dreamy haze. It must attempt a Will save, with a +4 circumstance bonus if you or your allies recently threatened it or used hostile actions against it.

You can Dismiss the spell. If you use hostile actions against the target, the spell ends. When the spell ends, the target doesn't necessarily realize it was charmed unless its friendship with you or the actions you convinced it to take clash with its expectations, meaning you could potentially convince the target to continue being your friend via mundane means.

Critical Success The target is unaffected and aware you tried to charm it.

Success The target is unaffected but thinks your spell was something harmless instead of charm, unless it identifies the spell.

Failure The target's attitude becomes @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.v66R7FdOf11l94im]{Friendly} toward you. If it was Friendly, it becomes @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.v44P3WUcU1j0115l]{Helpful}. It can't use hostile actions against you.

Critical Failure The target's attitude becomes Helpful toward you, and it can't use hostile actions against you.

Heightened (4th) The duration lasts until the next time you make your daily preparations.

Heightened (8th) The duration lasts until the next time you make your daily preparations, and you can target up to 10 creatures.

MFz1cM1MqbifkyHH.name: Vulnerable to Smoke
MFz1cM1MqbifkyHH.description: A gancanagh's lungs can't tolerate smoke. They take a -2 circumstance penalty to saving throws against effects that create some form of smoke.

fxVaypsTZKjHprzh.name: Change Shape
fxVaypsTZKjHprzh.description:
The gancanagh can take on the appearance of any Small or Medium humanoid. This doesn't change their Speed or their attack and damage bonuses with their Strikes, but might change the damage type their Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning).

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

RQyE6xYaEg8W7C38.name: Invigorating Passion
RQyE6xYaEg8W7C38.description:
The gancanagh embraces or kisses a willing creature, infusing that creature with their invigorating passion. The creature gains a +1 status bonus to attack rolls and 10 temporary Hit Points for 10 minutes. After that time, the target becomes @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} for 10 minutes unless they succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:21] save.

@Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-effects.5syHrFGAE6lo0FUr]{Effect: Invigorating Passion}

Gargoyle.name: 石像鬼 Gargoyle
Gargoyle.publicNotes:
Gargoyles are monstrous hunters made of elemental stone. They use their resemblance to decorative statues to hide in plain sight in cities during the day and descend upon unlucky pedestrians at night. Their most common form is that of a horned humanoid with bat-like wings, but individual gargoyles show a great deal of variation, with some appearing more or less humanoid and others resembling no known creature. A gargoyle's features are not flxed; city-dwelling gargoyles who remain in the same locale long enough slowly morph, day by day, to match the style of the local architecture. These patient monsters can stay disguised for long stretches of time as they patiently await an opportunity to strike.

Gargoyles tend to be lone hunters, though sometimes they band into fearsome tribes called "wings" for protection or sport. On rare occasions, wings become relatively stable communities, and gargoyles in wings may even ally with other creatures such as demons and intelligent aberrations, though these alliances exist on a razor's edge. The majority of gargoyles are treacherous, vindictive, and petty-traits that preclude lasting partnerships. Many tend to be obsessive and compulsive. Some are collectors, focusing on anything from books to grim trophies, while others are ritualistic or overly passionate about niche intellectual subjects or certain artistic motifs. These tendencies often contribute to the dissolution of wings as individuals' obsessions and compulsions clash.

DsvyLX53TeuZHMQ3.name: Clawed Feet
DsvyLX53TeuZHMQ3.description:
Trigger The gargoyle is Flying, and a creature moves into an adjacent square below it.

Effect The gargoyle makes a claw Strike against the triggering creature.

9bomxaBEHSLvRrkq.name: Statue
9bomxaBEHSLvRrkq.description: Until the next time it acts, the gargoyle appears to be a statue. It has an automatic result of 32 on Deception checks and DCs to pass as a statue.

Gelatinous Cube.name: 胶质怪 Gelatinous Cube
Gelatinous Cube.publicNotes:
Found underground or in dungeons, these quivering cubes of slime continuously scour their domain for food. The acid in their bodies is weak enough that many gelatinous cubes still contain the gear of their victims, as they're unable to break them down.

Slimes, molds, and other oozes can be found in dank dungeons and shadowed forests. While not necessarily evil, some grow to enormous sizes and have insatiable appetites.

InkIGrftuKGUgSoo.name: Motion Sense 60 feet
InkIGrftuKGUgSoo.description: A gelatinous cube can sense nearby motion through vibration and air movement.

nXQUyl9JGuo2YBLG.name: Transparent
nXQUyl9JGuo2YBLG.description:
A gelatinous cube is so clear that it's difficult to spot. A successful @Check[type:perception|dc:23|traits:action:search] check is required to notice a stationary cube, and a creature must be @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.TiNDYUGlMmxzxBYU]{Searching} to attempt this check.

A creature that walks into the cube is automatically Engulfed (this usually causes the GM to call for initiative).

PHrmAQv1FUnGiNrw.name: 包卷 Engulf
PHrmAQv1FUnGiNrw.description:
@Check[type:reflex|dc:19|traits:damaging-effect], [[/r {2d6}[acid]]]{2d6 acid}, Escape DC 19, Rupture 7

A creature Engulfed by the gelatinous cube must also attempt a saving throw against paralysis.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Engulf]

OUrfzECO9Dy3ncIO.name: Paralysis
OUrfzECO9Dy3ncIO.description: A creature Engulfed by the cube or hit by its attack is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} unless it succeeds at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:20] save. A victim can attempt a new save to recover at the end of each of its turn.

L8QPL1ttGhwzsJOz.name: Weak Acid
L8QPL1ttGhwzsJOz.description: A gelatinous cube's acid damages only organic material-not metal, stone, or other inorganic substances.

Gelugon.name: 冰魔 Gelugon
Gelugon.allSaves: 对所有魔法效果的豁免有+1状态加值
Gelugon.publicNotes:
昆虫般样貌的冰魔是地狱军队的军师和参谋，使用它们卓越的智慧打击敌人，并将地狱的影响力散播至各个位面。冰魔很少会打破自己的战略构想，坚决不移地执行已经预定的计划。除此之外，它们只能被那些日后能够确保的交易所吸引，增加它们在棋盘上可以使用的棋子。偶尔，某个杰出的凡人战略家会取悦冰魔让它同意参加一场战略竞赛，通常是通过向国际象棋这样的战略性棋盘游戏，来一决高下。如果魔鬼输掉了比赛，它们不可避免地会竭尽全力地为那个凡人服务，以实现它们自己的可怕目的。

作为散播腐败和征服的大师，魔鬼们试图诱惑凡人生命加入它们对亵渎事物的追求中来，并将暴政传播到各个世界。它们向人类提出各种条件，从签署一份地狱契约而获取的强大力量，到向邪神低语换来的扭曲恩惠，甚至还有许多更微妙的交易。那些屈服于这些诱惑的人，会发现自己死后会在地狱的深坑中遭受无尽的折磨，在那里唯一逃脱的希望就是晋升为地狱中的魔鬼。从士兵、学者到检察官、律师、法官和刽子手，每一种恶魔在维持冷酷无情的地狱官僚机器上扮演着特定的角色，这就是地狱。低级的劣魔和小魔鬼服从于更强大和专业的恶魔，比如契约魔和狂怒魔，做着卑下的工作，而最强大的深狱炼魔指挥着整个地狱军团。

pugIMNhBHc9VHl1z.name: 神术内在法术 Divine Innate Spells

YzVY8LfTkSAM0SMG.name: 次元门(随意施法) Dimension Door (At Will)
YzVY8LfTkSAM0SMG.description:
你通过开启一扇绕过通常空间的门，将自身以及任何你穿戴和持握的物品从你当前所在的空间立刻传送到你能看见的范围内的开阔空间。如果此时另一个生物会与你随行—即使你使用异次元存储空间—你会失去该法术。

升阶 (5环级) 该射程增加到1英里。你无须看见你的目标，只要你曾经去过那里，并且了解其与你的相对位置和距离。你会暂时免疫1小时。

codfFNHqT8HXOyAY.name: 飞行术(恒定法术) Fly (Constant)
codfFNHqT8HXOyAY.description:
目标能够在空气中穿梭，获得等于其速度或者20尺的飞行速度，取较高者。

升阶 (7环) 该持续时间增加到1小时。

COesoRf5oc4fLJhF.name: 高等黑暗视觉 Greater Darkvision

8H68KpZMl3WGb1NP.name: 借机攻击 Attack of Opportunity

LUZas9EK4qLmUsox.name: 减速冻寒 Slowing Frost
LUZas9EK4qLmUsox.description: 冰魔能身躯的极度冰寒引导到武器或肢体上。被冰魔近战武器或徒手近战攻击击中的的生物必须尝试@Check[type:fortitude|dc:32]检定，否则陷入@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1}，持续[[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4轮}。冰魔所持握的武器视同于获得@Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.M5M1WJ5KzbYfRGsY]{冻寒符文 Frost rune}的效果，并且冰魔可以将此武器投掷出去，射程增量20尺，沿途洒下一片冰尘。

RWLfly211783dq5i.name: 柯希图斯战术家 Tactician of Cocytus
RWLfly211783dq5i.description: 冰魔完美的记忆和逻辑思维给与了它天才般的战术能力。它能用心灵感应的方式向盟友传达战术布置，让心灵感应范围内所有由它统帅的或作为盟友的邪恶生物立即行走（或掘进、攀爬、飞行或游泳，如果目标生物有相应的速度）。

Ghaele.name: 伽乐 Ghaele
Ghaele.publicNotes:
Ghaeles are fiend-hunting knights of Elysium and champions of the freedom to take up arms against oppressors and other evils. Ghaeles rarely engage directly in mortal wars, but where fiends are involved they make an exception. A ghaele might assume the guise of a mortal to fight fiends alongside others, hoping to bolster morale and teach good tactics against such supernatural foes. Ghaeles serve various deities and empyreal lords of Elysium, though many have an affinity for Cayden Cailean in his capacity as a champion of freedom and defender of the downtrodden. Among azatas, ghaeles are generally the quickest to shift to violence as a method of solving problems, but even then they seek to minimize pain and suffering when they can.

Azatas are manifestations of freedom-kindly celestials with a penchant for curious exploration, spontaneous revelry, and whimsical quests. Born of the untamable wilds of Elysium, azatas are passionate and mercurial, but also fiercely loyal to those they hold dear. Azatas act quickly and directly against fiendish and otherworldly influences, but they tend to stay out of mortal affairs otherwise, allowing them the ultimate freedom to choose their own destiny. While all azatas cherish freedom, each type exemplifies a particular freedom above others. Many of their kind hold strange knightly and courtly titles that defy mortal classification and shift and change with time and on different occasions rather than following a strict hierarchy. This baffles archons and other more lawful creatures who haven't had much contact with azatas. In actuality, the azatas use their titles as personal flourishes and points of pride, rather than as excuses to order each other around.

jJ8SC2rd2xXCFTiy.name: 巧言术(恒定法术) Tongues (Constant)
jJ8SC2rd2xXCFTiy.description:
无论什么语言，目标都可以理解其所有的词语，并且向其他生物用该语言交流。当处于一群各异的生物中时，每次目标将要说话，他可以选择一个生物，并使用一种该生物理解的语言来讲述，即使该目标不知道这语言具体是什么。

升阶 (7环级) 持续时间为8小时。

0h0uqGkDaifDECB9.name: 不灭明焰(随意施法) Continual Flame (At Will)
0h0uqGkDaifDECB9.description:
一团魔法的火焰从物体上喷出，如同火炬一般明亮。它不需要氧气，不会与水反应，也不发出热量。

升阶 (+1) 消耗按照后文增加：

  • 3环级16gp；
  • 4环级30gp；
  • 5环级60gp；
  • 6环级120gp；
  • 7环级270gp；
  • 8环级540gp；
  • 9环级1350gp；
  • 10环级3350gp。

IIuFfE9guAYmy0QA.name: 解除魔法(随意施法) Dispel Magic (At Will)
IIuFfE9guAYmy0QA.description: 你干扰法术或者效果中的魔法力量。尝试一次反制检定，对抗目标。如果你成功对抗一个法术效果，你将其反制。如果你成功对抗一个魔法物品，该物品成为该类型的普通物品，持续10分钟。这不会改变物体的非魔法性质。如果目标是一件神器或者类似的物品，你自动失败。

tVIy0kx6j3AyRLhC.name: 隐形术(随意施法,仅限自身) Invisibility (At Will) (Self Only)
tVIy0kx6j3AyRLhC.description:
目标被幻术包复，变得 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{隐形 Invisible}. 这令该生物对所有生物 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{无踪Undetected} ，但生物可以尝试寻找目标，令其改为 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{藏匿 Hidden}。如果目标使用敌对动作，法术在敌对动作完成后结束。

升阶 (4环级) 该法术持续1分钟，但目标使用敌对动作时该法术不会结束。

S1A2oxm7chP51Hhb.name: 识破隐形(恒定法术) See Invisibility (Constant)
S1A2oxm7chP51Hhb.description:
你能看见 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{隐形 Invisible} 的生物和物体。对你而言它们看起来如同半透明一般，并且对你视为 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{隐蔽 Concealed} 。

升阶 (5环级) 该法术的持续时间为8小时。

@Compendium[pf2e.spell-effects.T5bk6UH7yuYog1Fp]{法术效果：识破隐形}

iMgpmBiunrNQEx9Y.name: 侦测阵营(随意施法,仅限邪恶) Detect Alignment (At Will) (Evil Only)
iMgpmBiunrNQEx9Y.description:
当你感受到阵营灵光时，视野中会闪动光芒。选择混乱，邪恶，善良或者秩序。你侦测该阵营的灵光。你不会获得存在或不存在以外的任何信息。你可以选择不侦测你知晓已经有该阵营的生物或者效果。

只有6或者更高等级的生物具有阵营灵光——除非是神术施法者，不死生物，或者外层位面（Outer Sphere的存在）。

升阶 (2环级) 你能了解到各个灵光的位置和强度。

p8K9hkGgK44YHdOt.name: 侦测魔法 Detect Magic
p8K9hkGgK44YHdOt.description:
你发出一股标记魔法存在的脉冲。你不会获得魔法存在或不存在以外的任何信息。你可以选择忽略你完全知晓的魔法，例如你或者你盟友的魔法物品以及持续法术。

仅当幻术魔法的环级低于你的侦测魔法环级时，你才能侦测幻术魔法。但是，具有幻术灵光但是没有在外表上做伪装的物品（例如一瓶隐形术药水），通常能够正常侦测。

升阶 (3环级) 你会了解法术侦测区域中最高环级的效果的学派。如果有相同强度的多个效果，GM决定你了解的为哪一个。

升阶 (4环级) 如3环级，你也能指出最高环级魔法的来源。如同一种模糊感官（imprecise sense），你不会了解具体的位置，但是可以将来源锁定到5尺立方（或者最近的那个五尺立方，如果来源体积比这个区域更大）。

ADTDXJfN5pg4yTij.name: 幻象伪装(随意施法) Illusory Disguise (At Will)
ADTDXJfN5pg4yTij.description:
你创造了一个令你看起来是另一个有相同体型的生物的幻觉。该生物和你相比，身高（6英寸内）和体重（50磅内）相近。该伪装通常足以掩盖你的身份，但不足以让你假扮另一个特定个人。该法术不会改变你的声音，气味，或者仪态。你可以改变你的衣服和佩带物的外观，例如让你的护甲看起来像是连衣裙。持握的物品不受影响，并且穿戴的物品离开你时会回复其本来外观。

施放幻象伪装视为欺骗（Deception）技能的 @Compendium[pf2e.action-macros.k5nW4jGyXD0Oq9LR]{假扮 Impersonate}用法的设立伪装；这忽视任何你可能会从扮作不熟悉生物中获得的减值，并且会赋予你在避免他人看破你的伪装的欺骗（Deception）检定上+4状态加值，并且即使你未受训你也加上你的等级。你可以解消该法术。

升阶 (2环级) 该法术也会伪装你的声音和气味，并且该法术获得听觉特征。

升阶 (3环级) 你可以伪装成任何与你有相同体型的生物，甚至是特定个人。你必须见过该个人才能使用其外观。该法术也会伪装你的声音和气味，并且该法术获得听觉特征。

@Compendium[pf2e.spell-effects.3Ktyd5F9lOPo4myk]{法术效果：幻象伪装}

DmZnAZGJF17LOU4y.name: Free Blade
DmZnAZGJF17LOU4y.description:
Trigger The ghaele ends its turn while unable to act or attempts a greatsword Strike that would take a circumstance or status penalty.

Effect A ghaele's blade is implacable in the pursuit of freedom, and its energies can overpower any effect that would interfere with its swordplay. The ghaele attempts to counteract each effect that prevents it from making a greatsword Strike, gives it a penalty to its greatsword Strike, or prevents it from acting. The ghaele can use this ability even if it's otherwise unable to act.

Cti6KJQlr8VT1UaM.name: Light Form
Cti6KJQlr8VT1UaM.description: A ghaele's body is partially corporeal and partially composed of light, with a color corresponding to the elemental energy currently residing in its blade (see Choose Weakness). It can move through solid objects but can't end its action within a solid object.

uTobNtEZnb13t0PA.name: Choose Weakness
uTobNtEZnb13t0PA.description:
A ghaele attempts to Recall Knowledge about a foe it is facing. If successful, it can change the elemental damage dealt by its greatsword and light ray to acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sonic, usually to match the a foe's weakness. It can also change its energy resistance to any of these energy types (this can be a different type than for its attacks). The choices remain until it next uses Choose Weakness.

@Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-effects.PJxUFFeAvQJ4l52f]{Effect: Choose Weakness}

HOMxdkDlcB6S1y9k.name: Ghaele's Gaze
HOMxdkDlcB6S1y9k.description: When a ghaele fixes its gaze upon a non-good creature, the creature suffers the effects of @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.sX2o0HH4RjJDAZ8C]{Divine Decree} (@Check[type:will|dc:33] save). If it survives, the creature is temporarily immune to Ghaele's Gaze for 1 minute.

7XN2uoXvAP0XCvYn.name: Holy Blade
7XN2uoXvAP0XCvYn.description: Any weapon becomes a +2 @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.DH0kB9Wbr5pDeunX]{Holy} @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.DxCuJKynlnMQZHgp]{Striking} weapon while the ghaele wields it.

Ghast.name: 妖鬼 Ghast
Ghast.publicNotes:
Ghasts-feral, foul-smelling, and constantly hungry-are the more powerful kin of ghouls. They are relentless in the pursuit of their prey.

Few creatures are more ubiquitous to sinister locations such as lonely graveyards and ruined crypts than the flesh-eating undead known as ghouls.

dALR9L0wlW2puqiD.name: Stench
dALR9L0wlW2puqiD.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:10]{10 feet} @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

A creature entering the aura or starting its turn in the aura must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:16] save or become @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (plus @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} as long as it's sickened on a critical failure).

While within the aura, the creature takes a -2 circumstance penalty to saves against disease and to recover from the sickened condition. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune for 1 minute.

@Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-effects.wX9L6fbqVMLP05hn]{Effect: Stench}

mkwN7Fgq3DRnThOV.name: Consume Flesh
mkwN7Fgq3DRnThOV.description:
Requirements The ghast is adjacent to the corpse of a creature that died within the last hour.

Effect The ghast devours a chunk of the corpse and regains [[/r {3d6}[healing]]]{3d6 Hit Points}.

It can regain Hit Points from any given corpse only once.

IdfK6A7UpGkscuOG.name: Ghast Fever
IdfK6A7UpGkscuOG.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:16]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 [[/r {3d8}[negative]]]{3d8 negative damage} and regains half as many Hit Points from all healing (1 day)

Stage 3 as stage 2 (1 day)

Stage 4 [[/r {3d8}[negative]]]{3d8 negative damage} and gains no benefit from healing (1 day)

Stage 5 as stage 4 (1 day)

Stage 6 dead, and rises as a @Compendium[pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.VC7rtYR4hLxwg7WZ]{Ghast} the next midnight

GBiarRqqq8qwyZtJ.name: Paralysis
GBiarRqqq8qwyZtJ.description: Any living creature hit by a ghast's attack must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:16] save or become @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}. It can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns, and the DC cumulatively decreases by 1 on each such save.

e7CxhtU5yoASkey8.name: Swift Leap
e7CxhtU5yoASkey8.description: The ghast jumps up to half its Speed. This movement doesn't trigger reactions.

Giant Scorpion.name: 巨蝎 Giant Scorpion
Giant Scorpion.publicNotes:
These massive, terrifying arachnids are typically 8 feet long from head to the base of the tail. Giant scorpions are the favored pack animals and war beasts of various desert-dwelling monsters, particularly gnolls. They are most commonly encountered in the wild, however. There they lair in mountainside caves or burrow beneath shallow layers of sand where they lie in wait for prey to wander near. Sleek, pallid subterranean scorpions also exist, as do still larger species.

Chitinous scourges of deserts, forests, savannas, and badlands, scorpions are deadly arachnids with powerful pincers and a painful sting. Scorpions can be found in nearly every climate, where they hunt their prey with a mixture of patient stealth and raw strength. Most scorpions live in underground burrows, either as lone hunters or part of a larger colony. These arachnids are so feared and dangerous that in many cultures, they are treated as deities or dualistic symbols of both death and protection from said death.

urDSEWopXr5z3krl.name: 借机攻击 Attack of Opportunity

WuUxcHe2LEnb3BVQ.name: Giant Scorpion Venom
WuUxcHe2LEnb3BVQ.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:18|basic:true]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 [[/r {1d10}[poison]]]{1d10 poison damage} and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 [[/r {2d10}[poison]]]{2d10 poison damage} and enfeebled 1 (1 round)

Stage 3 [[/r {2d10}[poison]]]{2d10 poison damage} and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} (1 round)

Giant Stag Beetle.name: 巨锹甲虫 Giant Stag Beetle
Giant Stag Beetle.publicNotes:
The giant stag beetle is larger than a horse, and the sight of one flying on great buzzing wings is unnerving. Its enormous mandibles are used to impress mates, intimidate rivals, and discourage predators, for they can deliver deadly blows. While giant stag beetles are deadly predators, they can be domesticated by skilled wranglers. In such a capacity, these beetles serve well as beasts of burden or even as mounts.

Giant stag beetles can be a serious menace in marshes, cavern complexes, and heavy forests. More than one logging camp has attracted a cluster of giant stag beetles and had to be completely abandoned, yielding all its lumber to the hunger of the giant insects.

Not all beetles are harmless creatures that can be easily crushed underfoot. Oversized and ravenous giant beetles can be found throughout the temperate and tropical regions of the world. They are often benign creatures, though when threatened or roused, giant beetles are quite dangerous. Their powerful mandibles and tough exoskeletons make for a challenging combatant.

Gimmerling.name: 屁孩精 Gimmerling
Gimmerling.publicNotes:
Gimmerlings are small, shapeshifting fey who stage ambushes to sate their endless hunger and childish greed. These cruelly curious fey obsess over finding and making unusual traps and sadistic weapons, and their favorite amusement is se eing these traps sprung or the weapons wielded. When on the Material Plane, they are frequently found in urban areas, particularly slums or other parts of town where they can either go unnoticed or be easily forgotten-and have plenty of victims to choose from.

A typical gimmerling disguises itself as an endangered child, doing so in hopes of drawing creatures close enough to rob. The gimmerling puts itself in apparent danger using a trap, construct, or bribed ally, or even a coerced monster like a @Compendium[pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.BAD7npndaooB3Pz1]{Redcap}.

Because gimmerlings sometimes trade obscure smithing or trapping techniques in exchange for gifts that sate their curiosity, their greed, or their hunger, they have at times been worshipped as minor gods of the forge. Some disciplined gimmerlings work as honored artisans, elite guards, or spies for the demigods known as the Eldest who dwell in the depths of the First World.

rGbtqEmUFQBjGvOd.name: Hungersense (Imprecise) 30 feet
rGbtqEmUFQBjGvOd.description: Hungersense allows the gimmerling to sense creatures that require food to live.

BleHEEpt3dwEMeDo.name: Treacherous Aura
BleHEEpt3dwEMeDo.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:15]{15 feet} @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

Tangled roots, jagged divots, sharp rocks and other hazards appear on surfaces in the aura, creating difficult terrain.

4QNftOG1O0v3IrVA.name: Trip Up
4QNftOG1O0v3IrVA.description:
Trigger A creature critically fails a melee attack to hit the gimmerling or moves into a space within the gimmerling's treacherous aura.

Effect The triggering creature must attempt a @Check[type:reflex|dc:32|traits:damaging-effect] save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed} until the start of its next turn.

Failure The target takes [[/r {2d10}[bludgeoning]]]{2d10 bludgeoning damage} and is flat-footed until the start of its next turn.

Critical failure As failure, and the target is knocked @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

0uxUMo5bNxKA5eIg.name: Change Shape
0uxUMo5bNxKA5eIg.description:
The gimmerling changes into its natural form or that of any humanoid. In humanoid form, it loses its treacherous aura, and its equipment appears to be trinkets or toys. As a humanoid that lacks claws or fangs, it loses the matching Strike. If it loses its claw Strike, it gains a fist Strike that is identical except that it deals bludgeoning damage.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

qtXj0TB36n30L7my.name: Disarm
qtXj0TB36n30L7my.description:
Requirement The gimmerling's last action was a success with a Strike that has Disarm in its damage entry.

Effect The gimmerling knocks a held or carried weapon to the ground in the target's space.

FdQL1f8wOuuy69Tz.name: 偷袭 Sneak Attack
FdQL1f8wOuuy69Tz.description:
The gimmerling deals 2d6 extra precision damage to flat-footed creatures.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.SneakAttack]

VdlfnhKj8BudHVMB.name: Trickster's Step
VdlfnhKj8BudHVMB.description: The gimmerling ignores difficult terrain and doesn't trigger traps with its movement.

Giant Eagle.name: 巨鹰 Giant Eagle
Giant Eagle.publicNotes:
No mere animals, giant eagles have a keen intellect and a strong sense of honor. As guardians of their mountain homes, giant eagles attempt to prevent the encroachment of civilization upon wild land and the predations of wicked humanoid settlements. Unlike ordinary eagles, which tend to be solitary creatures, giant eagles congregate within aeries holding up to a dozen members and work together to protect their domains.

Giant eagles have wingspans up to 30 feet across and weigh up to 500 pounds. These impressive birds cannot be easily broken or cowed. A giant eagle may allow trusted terrestrial friends to ride it, but they invariably resist saddles, harnesses, or other equipment that might suggest they are mere beasts of burden rather than trusted companions. Giant eagles are long-lived and take debts and oaths very seriously, often remembering slights for years and remaining slow to forgive.

Few avian creatures can match the beauty and grace of the eagle.

Wf7eTH5SNYNO98tC.name: Evasion
Wf7eTH5SNYNO98tC.description: When a giant eagle rolls a success on a Reflex save, it gets a critical success instead.

KWrM4BkUQ8ldHG0I.name: Eagle Dive
KWrM4BkUQ8ldHG0I.description: The giant eagle @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.cS9nfDRGD83bNU1p]{Flies} up to double its fly Speed in a straight line, descending at least 10 feet, and then makes a talon Strike.

jJ0nUZ8hgrpWlXtS.name: Snatch
jJ0nUZ8hgrpWlXtS.description: A giant eagle can @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.cS9nfDRGD83bNU1p]{Fly} at half Speed while it has a creature @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} in its talons, carrying that creature along with it.

Giant Flytrap.name: 巨捕蝇草 Giant Flytrap
Giant Flytrap.publicNotes:
Because they blend in so well with surrounding foliage, giant flytraps can use the element of surprise to make quick strikes against unsuspecting adventurers and forest travelers.

Flytraps are dangerous creatures as eager to feed on humanoids and larger prey as they are monstrous insects.

A7AIAW82kyBDKhWn.name: Quick Capture
A7AIAW82kyBDKhWn.description:
Trigger A creature hits or touches the flytrap.

Effect The flytrap makes a leaf Strike against the triggering creature. If it hits, the creature is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} in that leaf.

CBZgnwJ9S03gtLHf.name: Focused Assault
CBZgnwJ9S03gtLHf.description: The flytrap attacks a single target with all four of its leaves. The flytrap makes one leaf Strike. On a success, the flytrap deals the damage from one leaf Strike plus an additional [[/r {1d8}]]{1d8 damage} for every leaf beyond the first. On a failure, the flytrap deals the damage from one leaf Strike, but it can't use Improved Grab. It deals no damage on a critical failure. This counts toward the flytrap's multiple attack penalty as a number of attacks equal to the number of leaves the flytrap has.

rZ6DDkGMLvCQH70m.name: Hungry Flurry
rZ6DDkGMLvCQH70m.description: The flytrap makes four leaf Strikes at a -2 penalty, each against a different target. These attacks count toward the flytrap's multiple attack penalty, but the multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after it makes all its attacks.

FEiMSx6vAjQ1oKaY.name: 活吞 Swallow Whole
FEiMSx6vAjQ1oKaY.description:
Large, [[/r {2d8+3}[bludgeoning]+{2d6}[acid]]]{2d8+3 bludgeoning damage plus 2d6 acid damage}, Rupture 17

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.SwallowWhole]

Giant Frilled Lizard.name: 巨伞蜥 Giant Frilled Lizard
Giant Frilled Lizard.publicNotes:
Found in warm and tropical forests and savannas, these immense lizards are a deadly threat to the unsuspecting traveler. When they aren't sleeping or stalking prey, giant frilled lizards bask in the sunlight for hours at a time. Explorers sometimes mistakenly think them related to dragons due to their large size, elaborate neck frills (which, when displayed in a show of aggression and dominance, can be mistaken for wings), and ferocious hissing vocalizations used to frighten away creatures too large to eat.

A giant frilled lizard's primary food sources are oversized arthropods and other invertebrates, but it won't hesitate to augment its diet with vertebrates, including other lizards, monkeys, and just about anything it can fit into its mouth-even humanoids. Although capable of short bursts of speed, a giant frilled lizard normally lies perfectly still while hunting, hoping to ambush its prey.

Lizards have a wide range of appearances and abilities, but most share a basic reptilian shape-long tails, wide toothy mouths, and four legs. While a few species are capable of movement on two legs for short periods of time, most are strictly quadrupedal. The three species presented here represent the most common and well-known of the larger species.

ONIHyZ3rL5vCjJod.name: Intimidating Display
ONIHyZ3rL5vCjJod.description:
The giant frilled lizard Strides. If it ends that Stride adjacent to at least one other creature, it suddenly displays its colorful neck frills and issues a frightening hiss. Each adjacent creature must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:21] save or become @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} (or @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3} on a critical failure).

The creature is then temporarily immune to Intimidating Display for 1 minute.

Giant Gecko.name: 巨壁虎 Giant Gecko
Giant Gecko.publicNotes:
These roughly human-sized reptiles have amazing feet capable of clinging tenaciously to any surface. Giant geckos are typically docile and shy but can be aggressive when cornered or defending their territory. These large-eyed lizards are found in a wide variety of habitats, from rainforests and deserts to mountain slopes or even underground caverns. They spend most of their time climbing around in large trees or on rocky cliffs, whether hunting for small animals or hiding from predators. A giant gecko's scales are often quite brightly colored or decorated in intricate patterns. Giant geckos span nearly 8 feet in length from head to tail, and they weigh about 120 pounds.

Giant geckos are sometimes used by smaller humanoids as guardians or mounts, as their docile nature makes them relatively easy to tame and train. Their superior climbing skills make giant geckos particularly popular within societies that dwell underground or near cliffs, such as goblins and kobolds. Their bright coloration also makes them favorite exotic pets in high society.

Lizards have a wide range of appearances and abilities, but most share a basic reptilian shape-long tails, wide toothy mouths, and four legs. While a few species are capable of movement on two legs for short periods of time, most are strictly quadrupedal. The three species presented here represent the most common and well-known of the larger species.

VMzhTqEkTw0QRQvq.name: Uncanny Climber
VMzhTqEkTw0QRQvq.description: A giant gecko's feet allow it to climb virtually any surface, no matter how slick or sheer. If a giant gecko attempts an Athletics check to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.pprgrYQ1QnIDGZiy]{Climb} and critically fails, it gets a failure instead.

Giant Monitor Lizard.name: 巨蜥 Giant Monitor Lizard
Giant Monitor Lizard.publicNotes:
Large and seemingly ponderous, a monitor lizard is a deceptively swift and ruthless predator. It ambushes its prey by rushing out from cover and biting the target with its powerful jaws. A giant monitor lizard's saliva is venomous, allowing it to bring down prey larger than it can easily haul away in its jaws. Giant monitor lizards grow up to 14 feet long, including their long tails, and they weigh about 350 pounds. Their bodies are normally dark brown with patches of yellow or green. When nesting, a giant monitor lizard digs a deep burrow to hide in. The burrow serves as both a safe haven and a location from which the lizard can ambush larger prey such as deer, boars, or even humanoids. A giant monitor lizard can consume nearly its own body weight in a single meal, and its loosely articulated jaws allow it to swallow surprisingly large prey.

Lizards have a wide range of appearances and abilities, but most share a basic reptilian shape-long tails, wide toothy mouths, and four legs. While a few species are capable of movement on two legs for short periods of time, most are strictly quadrupedal. The three species presented here represent the most common and well-known of the larger species.

QKo6NtH208FCd8UB.name: Gnashing Grip
QKo6NtH208FCd8UB.description:
Trigger A creature @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by the giant monitor lizard's jaws fails a check to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape}.

Effect The giant monitor lizard's jaws deal [[/r {1d6}[piercing]]]{1d6 piercing damage} and the triggering creature is exposed to monitor lizard venom.

B2QWyyEvVmWZPUkk.name: Lurching Charge
B2QWyyEvVmWZPUkk.description: The giant monitor lizard Strides twice and then makes a jaws Strike. If the lizard moved at least 20 feet away from its starting position, it gains a +2 circumstance bonus to this attack roll.

Giant Moray Eel.name: 巨海鳗 Giant Moray Eel
Giant Moray Eel.publicNotes:
Giant moray eels dwell in warm, tropical waters and build lairs in narrow, twisting caves made of coral. Their size, speed, and powerful bite make them dangerous to divers and fishermen. Giant moray eels have rubbery hides that secrete a layer of mucus, making them difficult to harm with some weapons.

Although these long, narrow fish share similarities in appearance, eels are a diverse group of creatures.

VYGyp2X6IJdSS0b2.name: Monitor Lizard Venom
VYGyp2X6IJdSS0b2.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:17]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 [[/r {1d6}[poison]]]{1d6 poison damage} and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} (1 round)

Pgjjt3dWPTpOGD8c.name: Ambush
Pgjjt3dWPTpOGD8c.description:
Trigger A target creature passes within 20 feet of the giant moray eel's hiding place and has not detected the giant moray eel.

Effect The giant moray eel lunges out of its hiding place, Swims directly toward the triggering creature, and makes a jaws Strike against it. The target creature is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed} to this attack.

sIfVG6GaZyAaZ3xW.name: Pharyngeal Jaws
sIfVG6GaZyAaZ3xW.description:
Requirements The giant moray eel has a creature @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} in its jaws.

Effect The giant moray eel uses its second set of jaws to pull the prey into its gullet. The eel deals [[/r {1d6+4}[piercing]]]{1d6+4 piercing damage} to the grabbed creature and gains a +2 circumstance bonus to its Swallow Whole attempts and to the DC for the creature to Escape. This effect ends if the target Escapes or the giant moray eel Swallows it Whole.

Giant Octopus.name: 巨章鱼 Giant Octopus
Giant Octopus.publicNotes: Giant octopuses are found in the heart of deep, dark oceans.

4fZp6kK5h1WOCAAq.name: Compression
4fZp6kK5h1WOCAAq.description: A giant octopus can move through a gap at least 2 feet wide without Squeezing, and can @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.kMcV8e5EZUxa6evt]{Squeeze} through a gap at least 1 foot wide.

PgvThxPk7tH5CoXV.name: 紧勒 Constrict
PgvThxPk7tH5CoXV.description:
[[/r {1d8+9}[bludgeoning]]]{1d8+9 bludgeoning}, @Check[type:fortitude|dc:26|basic:true]

Note: A DC was not provided for this ability by Paizo. The DC present here is a moderate DC for the creature level according to the Gamemastery Guide creature building Tables.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Constrict]

XK9Va6QKy2g8z1dZ.name: Giant Octopus Venom
XK9Va6QKy2g8z1dZ.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:26]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 [[/r {2d6}[poison]]]{2d6 poison damage} and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed} (1 round)

Stage 2 [[/r {2d6}[poison]]]{2d6 poison damage}, @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1}, and flat-footed (1 round)

Stage 3 [[/r {2d6}[poison]]]{2d6 poison damage}, @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2}, and flat-footed (1 round)

jsgHC6kdtZdnAJMT.name: Ink Cloud
jsgHC6kdtZdnAJMT.description:
The octopus emits a cloud of black ink in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30]. This cloud has no effect outside of water. Creatures inside the cloud are @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected} and can't use their sense of smell. The cloud dissipates after 1 minute.

The octopus can't use Ink Cloud again for [[/br 2d6 #Recharge Ink Cloud]]{2d6 rounds}.

3H0tPL2AeonSy2gM.name: Jet
3H0tPL2AeonSy2gM.description: The octopus moves up to 200 feet in a straight line through the water without triggering reactions.

coknqLEZIU2gBBH1.name: Writhing Arms
coknqLEZIU2gBBH1.description: The giant octopus makes up to four Strikes with different arms, each against a different target. Each attack counts separately for the octopus's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase the penalty until the octopus has made all the attacks. If the octopus subsequently uses the @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Tkd8sH4pwFIPzqTr]{Grab} action, it can Grab any number of creatures it hit with Writhing Arms.

Giant Rat.name: 巨鼠 Giant Rat
Giant Rat.publicNotes:
Rats are a ubiquitous menace, scurrying through the sewers and on the streets of nearly every settlement the world over. Though a regular rat darting underfoot might startle or even frighten the average passerby, giant rats and rat swarms are far more dangerous.

Giant rats are enormous versions of the common vermin. They are typically found in abundant numbers, but since they cannot fit in the nooks where mundane rats typically hide, they are much easier to locate and exterminate. They mostly live in sewers where they can scavenge from the streets above, but some families of giant rats live in more remote locations, such as dank caves or forests and hills. Rats are incredibly adept survivors and can be found nearly anywhere in the world, though they tend to favor temperate or warm climates as opposed to cold regions.

Although its bite alone is not lethal except to the very young or very old, the giant rat carries the filth fever common to rodents around the world-a pestilence more than capable of ravaging rural communities.

Mjlek9OZ25Tga7Cg.name: Filth Fever
Mjlek9OZ25Tga7Cg.description:
The @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened} and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} conditions from filth fever don't improve on their own until the disease is cured.

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:14]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect ([[/br 1d4 #hours]]{1d4 hours})

Stage 2 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (1 day)

Stage 3 Sickened 1 and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} (1 day)

Stage 4 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} (1 day)

Stage 5 dead

Gnoll Cultist.name: 豺狼人邪教徒 Gnoll Cultist
Gnoll Cultist.publicNotes:
Gnoll cultists serve as their clans' spiritual guides and conduits to the divine. As often as not, their influence drives entire gnoll civilizations to commit atrocious acts of violence and enslavement. Lamashtu and Rovagug are favored deities of gnoll cultists, and many gnolls believe their kind was in fact birthed from the womb of the Mother of Monsters. Some gnoll clans worship lesser-known demon lords or entire pantheons of sinister patrons.

Gnolls are short, hyena-headed humanoids who dwell in warm grasslands, savannas, and arid hills. Given their appearance, their affinity for hyenas should not be surprising; gnolls share their homes, food, and even many of their own behaviors with these animals. Much like hyenas, gnolls have a notorious reputation-they are known as bloodthirsty gluttons and slavers who worship demons or other reprehensible powers. Though these rumors are often true, the behavior of gnoll clans varies widely. Some groups are composed of capable hunters who rarely clash with other humanoids unless there is a conflict over territory. Others hew closer to the unsavory stories, preferring to raid settlements and enslave innocents, snatching the fruits of others' hard labor by strength of arms and forcing their victims to perform the hard, demeaning labor necessary to maintain the brutal clan.

Gnolls lack any particular reverence for the remains of the dead, which adds to their reputation as scavengers or even cannibals. They willingly eat nearly any other creature, including dead gnolls, which can evoke strong reactions from people and cultures with a strong taboo against cannibalism or desecrating the dead. To a gnoll, it is almost more offensive to not eat a dead body, no matter its origin; gnolls see no point in wasting precious meat in a harsh and challenging world. Worse still is the refusal to eat the flesh of a dead gnoll, which they consider an insult to that gnoll's memory and sacrifice and an implication that the gnoll's flesh is unworthy of consumption. In fact, they refuse to eat the bodies of particularly hated foes; particularly warmongering gnolls even spike the bodies or heads of such despised enemies on tall spears, which they place around their tribal holdings to dishonor the dead and intimidate would-be invaders.

Gnoll women are far stronger and more aggressive than gnoll men and are typically considered the leaders of their hunting packs and clans. Though gnolls tend to be disorganized when it comes to practical matters or negotiations, they are extremely efficient at working together to hunt down prey or overwhelm a group of foes. Much like hyenas, they prefer to hunt in packs, and are exceptionally skilled at setting up ambushes or separating individual targets from larger groups.

eEUuX9rY6z75X42h.name: 侦测魔法 Detect Magic
eEUuX9rY6z75X42h.description:
你发出一股标记魔法存在的脉冲。你不会获得魔法存在或不存在以外的任何信息。你可以选择忽略你完全知晓的魔法，例如你或者你盟友的魔法物品以及持续法术。

仅当幻术魔法的环级低于你的侦测魔法环级时，你才能侦测幻术魔法。但是，具有幻术灵光但是没有在外表上做伪装的物品（例如一瓶隐形术药水），通常能够正常侦测。

升阶 (3环级) 你会了解法术侦测区域中最高环级的效果的学派。如果有相同强度的多个效果，GM决定你了解的为哪一个。

升阶 (4环级) 如3环级，你也能指出最高环级魔法的来源。如同一种模糊感官（imprecise sense），你不会了解具体的位置，但是可以将来源锁定到5尺立方（或者最近的那个五尺立方，如果来源体积比这个区域更大）。

jfJXOP78x7xyHplx.name: Pack Attack
jfJXOP78x7xyHplx.description: A gnoll cultist deals [[/r {1d4}]]{1d4 extra damage} to any creature that's within reach of at least two of the gnoll cultist's allies.

1TgSjt8UKPwTjAH9.name: Rugged Travel
1TgSjt8UKPwTjAH9.description: A gnoll ignores the first square of difficult terrain it moves into each time it Steps or Strides.

Gluttonyspawn.name: 暴食罪生怪 Gluttonyspawn
Gluttonyspawn.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic, +4 status to all saves vs. mental
Gluttonyspawn.publicNotes:
Sinspawn were created by one of seven ancient wizards known collectively as runelords-each of whom embraced and embodied one of seven sins. The first sinspawn was created by the Runelord of Wrath, utilizing techniques that have since gone on to influence fleshwarping practices. It wasn't long before the technique used to create sinspawn fell into the hands of the other runelords, and while each tried their own hand at crafting variants of their own design, today sinspawn of wrath remain the most numerous and notorious of their kind. Bearing only a vague resemblance to the humanoids from whose flesh they were formed, sinspawn generally appear horrifically emaciated and have unnaturally long arms and digitigrade legs, each with a trio of stubby, taloned digits. Veins bulge across sinspawn's bodies in sanguine patterns that suspiciously resemble twisted runes, and their flesh is pale and hairless. Their heads are elongated, bearing only slits for a nose, red eyes, and disturbing lower jaws that split in half at the chin, revealing pedipalps that end in tiny, three-fingered hands and framing a long, lolling tongue. Sinspawn stand 6-1/2 feet tall and typically weigh as much as an emaciated human of their size. They behave in a manner consistent with their associated sin and have physical characteristics that hint at these qualities. For example, greedspawn's veins appear to run with gold while envyspawn appear even more wasted than the rest of their kin.

Gluttonyspawn are obese, but hardy and strong.

hk7qH9BpvzM7rFGe.name: Sin Scent (Imprecise) 30 feet
hk7qH9BpvzM7rFGe.description: A sinspawn can smell creatures that reflect its sin, as the scent ability. The GM determines which creatures are appropriately sinful.

SCGxYeDTWb4Hznwu.name: +4 Status to All Saves vs. Mental

DuOMgloNkM9gTAZj.name: 借机攻击 Attack of Opportunity

MpNlJrdPvv9bECNE.name: Sinful Bite
MpNlJrdPvv9bECNE.description:
A creature hit by the jaws of a sinspawn must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:18] save as it is assailed by sinful thoughts.

Critical Success Unaffected

Success @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}

Failure @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}

Critical Failure sickened 2 plus @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}

Goblin Commando.name: 哥布林指挥官 Goblin Commando
Goblin Commando.publicNotes:
The theoretical leaders of goblin raids are called goblin commandos. In practice, goblin commandos rarely continue to lead their comrades once a battle has begun. Most shirk their responsibilities in favor of wading into the fray and claiming more glory from their tribe-mates.

These small humanoids have green or gray skin and large heads with wide ears. While some goblins are civilized and have worked hard to be considered upstanding members of humanoid communities, most are impetuous and vicious creatures who delight in wreaking havoc. These goblins think nothing of slaughtering livestock, stealing infants, or burning down a building purely for momentary delight. They revel in playing malicious tricks on taller humanoids, whom they call "longshanks."

Goblins are superstitious, with an intense awe of magic and a fascination with fire; goblins who master magic or fire earn great respect from their kin. Most other humanoids find it difficult to understand goblins' outlook: they hate canines but eagerly share their lairs with so-called "goblin dogs," they fearlessly attack larger creatures but are terrified of horses, and they despise vegetables yet consider pickles a delicacy. To a goblin, of course, these are all perfectly sensible life choices.

YdD2kpKW2TNfcupL.name: Goblin Scuttle
YdD2kpKW2TNfcupL.description:
Trigger A goblin ally ends a move action adjacent to the goblin.

Effect The goblin @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.UHpkTuCtyaPqiCAB]{Steps}.

Gnoll Sergeant.name: 豺狼人军士 Gnoll Sergeant
Gnoll Sergeant.publicNotes:
When gnolls band together to form hunting or raiding parties, the strongest among them is often designated the leader or sergeant. These gnolls train extensively in the art of war. Their skill at arms and the respect they command make them powerful adversaries. In smaller clans or single family units, a gnoll sergeant might also serve as the group's leader in other affairs, such as sorting out domestic disputes or negotiating with rival gnoll clans.

Gnolls are short, hyena-headed humanoids who dwell in warm grasslands, savannas, and arid hills. They willingly eat nearly any other creature, including dead gnolls, which can evoke strong reactions from people and cultures with a strong taboo against cannibalism or desecrating the dead. Gnoll hunters serve their clans by hunting for food in the wilds, marauding along well-traveled roads, and tracking down escaped slaves.

Goblin Dog.name: 地精犬 Goblin Dog
Goblin Dog.publicNotes:
Goblins' eponymous pets aren't true canines at all, but rather large, blunt-nosed rodents with thin bodies and long legs. As cowardly as they are ugly, goblin dogs prefer to lurk behind bushes or in deep shadows, pouncing upon lone or wounded prey. Goblin dogs frequently lair and roam in packs, but they are likely to flee from a fight if injured, even if it means abandoning their pack-mates.

Goblin dogs take their name from their long association with goblins, who breed the beasts as guard animals and mounts. Most goblins take issue with the name, as the average goblin is appalled at the suggestion that these, their favored mounts, have anything at all to do with actual dogs. Of course, being goblins, they haven't bothered to come up with their own, unique name for goblin dogs.

Even the most pampered goblin dogs have itchy mange and prolific dander that tenaciously affects those who come in contact with them. This "goblin pox" causes itchy hives and festering sores that are as unsightly as they are irritating and distracting. Goblin dog dander causes allergic reactions in nearly all other creatures that don't share the goblin dogs' terrible hygiene-with the notable exception, of course, of goblins, who remain entirely immune to the disease regardless of cleanliness.

Hunger can drive goblin dogs to bouts of uncharacteristic violence; many goblins purposefully starve their pets to make them more aggressive in battle. Goblin dogs subsist on whatever organic material they can scavenge, and they particularly enjoy fresh carrion. Although goblins are far from picky eaters, they value goblin dogs as pets because the noisome animals will consume food that even goblins won't dare to eat. "Will it eat?" is one of several games goblins enjoy playing with their goblin dog pets, where a wide range of mouth-sized morsels (not always edible or safe to consume) are dangled before a goblin dog's snout. "Will it die?" is often a game played after "Will it eat?" Goblin dogs who survive the second game earn renown for their digestive prowess and often become favored tribal pets treated better than most of the rank-and-file goblins.

WU4cXLzhnoCczalO.name: Irritating Dander
WU4cXLzhnoCczalO.description: A creature that hits the goblin dog with an unarmed attack, tries to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} it, or otherwise touches it is exposed to goblin pox.

OWImE1DpRm2byzUX.name: Juke
OWImE1DpRm2byzUX.description:
Requirement A creature must be mounted on the goblin dog.

Trigger The rider issues a command to the goblin dog.

Effect The goblin dog Steps before following the command.

1AbBtZhPY7lYpSm0.name: Goblin Pox
1AbBtZhPY7lYpSm0.description:
Goblins and goblin dogs are immune to goblin pox.

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:17]

Stage 1 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 sickened 1 and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} and can't reduce its sickened value below 1 (1 day)

oEnTmvBRzYBAWuou.name: Scratch
oEnTmvBRzYBAWuou.description: The goblin dog vigorously scratches itself, exposing all adjacent creatures to goblin pox.

Goblin Pyro.name: 哥布林火焰兵 Goblin Pyro
Goblin Pyro.publicNotes:
Some goblins take their people's admiration of fire fully into the realm of deadly obsession. These pyromaniacs can be a great boon to a band of goblin raiders eager to torch their enemies and wreak havoc. More often, however, their presence is a double-edged sword; in the heat of the moment, goblin pyros sometimes lose sight of their tribe's goals and simply set fire to anything that will burn-including their own allies.

These small humanoids have green or gray skin and large heads with wide ears. While some goblins are civilized and have worked hard to be considered upstanding members of humanoid communities, most are impetuous and vicious creatures who delight in wreaking havoc. These goblins think nothing of slaughtering livestock, stealing infants, or burning down a building purely for momentary delight. They revel in playing malicious tricks on taller humanoids, whom they call "longshanks."

Goblins are superstitious, with an intense awe of magic and a fascination with fire; goblins who master magic or fire earn great respect from their kin. Most other humanoids find it difficult to understand goblins' outlook: they hate canines but eagerly share their lairs with so-called "goblin dogs," they fearlessly attack larger creatures but are terrified of horses, and they despise vegetables yet consider pickles a delicacy. To a goblin, of course, these are all perfectly sensible life choices.

Goblin War Chanter.publicNotes:
While all goblins enjoy singing, goblin war chanters pride themselves on mastering the art of vocal performance. Their ballads and jingles are undeniably catchy, though whether they are actually enjoyable is entirely subjective.

This has the usual traits and restrictions for a Performance check.

Critical Success The target takes a -1 status penalty to Perception checks and Will saves for 1 minute. @Compendium[pf2e.feat-effects.bIRIS6mnynr72RDw]{Goblin Song (Critical Success)}

Critical Failure The target is temporarily immune to Goblin Song for 1 hour.

Goliath Spider.senses: 黑暗视觉, 蛛网感知
Goliath Spider.publicNotes:
巨硕蜘蛛生活在丛林的最深处，在那里它们织出神殿那么大的网，捕食像河马那么大的猎物。

很少有害虫能像声名狼藉的蜘蛛那样让人如此恐惧。

oXZ3YdyxyoVGRGJs.name: 蛛网感知 Web Sense
oXZ3YdyxyoVGRGJs.description: 巨硕蜘蛛可以通过@Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.j2wsK6IsW5yMW1jW]{震颤感知 Tremorsense}（模糊感官）来感知到生物触碰它蛛网时产生的振动。

aAGnyUk4Vj6iSM7n.description:

效果 猎蛛自动注意到该生物，并在投掷先攻前，可以在蛛网上进行行走、攀爬或下降动作。

巨硕蜘蛛用网绳把自己吊在空中，可以垂直下降最多120尺。它可以挂在蛛网上，也可以从蛛网上坠落。它从蛛网上下降的距离不计入坠落伤害。

如果一个生物成功击中蛛网（AC20，硬度5，20HP）时，可以砍断蜘蛛网，导致蜘蛛坠落。

豁免 @Check[type:fortitude|dc:30]

最大持续 6轮

阶段2 [[/r {2d6}[poison]]]{2d6毒素}和@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 2} (1轮)

阶段3 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{麻痹 Paralyzed}，持续[[/br 2d4 #hours]]{2d4小时}

Eu72dpTXiYJQD7Hm.name: 蛛网捆缚 Web Tether
Eu72dpTXiYJQD7Hm.description:
被巨硕蜘蛛蛛网打击命中的生物被@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{束缚 Restrained}，并且和巨硕蜘蛛拴在一起，无法拉开和蜘蛛的距离。

巨硕蜘蛛一次只能拴住一个生物。@Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{逃脱 Escape}或@Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.SjmKHgI7a5Z9JzBx]{破拆 Force Open}蛛网的DC为30。蛛网可以被一次打击切断（AC 20，硬度5，HP 20），但这不能释放被束缚的生物。

Gorilla.name: 大猩猩 Gorilla
Gorilla.publicNotes:
Gorillas can be territorial creatures, particularly if provoked by hunters or the presence of more dangerous monsters. A gorilla uses its fangs and powerful arms to bite and pummel trespassers with wild abandon.

While many apes exhibit peaceful or reclusive behavior, gorillas can be territorial, and the megaprimatus is especially aggressive and dangerous.

7PQkG1Vfc7aynb2X.name: Frightening Display
7PQkG1Vfc7aynb2X.description:
The gorilla beats its chest in a terrifying display. Creatures within @Template[type:emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:20] save.

While a creature is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} by this ability, it is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed} to the gorilla.

Critical Success No effect and temporarily immune for 1 minute.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Critical Failure The creature is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.

Great Cyclops.name: 独眼巨怪 Great Cyclops
Great Cyclops.publicNotes:
Gigantic, dim-witted loners, the great cyclopes embody their lesser kin writ large. They are both stronger and more violent, but their uncontrolled vision into possible futures has driven them beyond reason. They see every moment as a potential storm of uncontrollable fury, and out of a desperate desire for peace, quiet, and an end to their hunger, they lash out at all who come near. Wise creatures avoid great cyclopes at all cost.

Debate has long raged over the origins of these massive, destructive giants. They are so large that it had long been assumed they were used as beasts of burden by their lesser kin, but they are now free to hunt and kill without restraint. Other scholars believe the great cyclops is the ultimate fate of the entire cyclops species. Whatever foolish decision or wayward curse caused the end of their civilization is still playing out, occasionally causing a cyclops to withdraw from its own kind, lose all semblance of intellect, and mutate into a lumbering, feral colossus. It is fortunate indeed that the great cyclops prefers to dwell far from humanoid settlements, because its immeasurable bloodlust inspires it to destroy virtually anything that moves, from dinosaurs and other monsters to the occasional explorer or soon-to-be-lost caravan.

The cyclopes are violent giants with a tragic past. Although they possess only one eye, they could once see far more than most, possessing occult wisdom and divinatory magic that gave them the mystic ability of foresight. But their legendary oracular powers failed to prevent the fall of their society, and the vast kingdoms of the cyclops long ago collapsed into ruin. Today, cyclopes have forgotten much of what they once knew, and they skulk among the crumbling remains of their fallen cities like forgotten kings and queens gone mad.

3uMuKyVKQxpFxP0o.name: Flash of Brutality
3uMuKyVKQxpFxP0o.description:
Frequency once per day, and recharges when the great cyclops uses Ferocity.

Trigger The great cyclops succeeds at an attack roll.

Effect The attack becomes a critical success.

kjpNSY1WlZHMXIS6.name: Powerful Charge
kjpNSY1WlZHMXIS6.description: The great cyclops Strides twice and makes a horn Strike. If it moved at least 20 feet away from its starting position, the Strike's damage is increased to 3d10+20.

Great White Shark.name: 大白鲨 Great White Shark
Great White Shark.publicNotes:
An apex predator among the coastal surface waters where it hunts, the great white shark is one of the largest shark species. These silent killers glide gracefully through the ocean, always in search of their next meal.

Sharks of all shapes and sizes have stalked the oceans, largely unchanged, since primordial times. They are efficient, ruthless predators with multiple rows of razor-sharp teeth capable of rending prey in an instant. Their uncanny ability to smell blood in the water means sharks might show up at any scene of aquatic carnage.

V45K2AmQDPCGIMET.name: Blood Scent
V45K2AmQDPCGIMET.description: The shark can smell blood in the water from up to 1 mile away.

CEngjOQBRH1DpQeo.name: Breach
CEngjOQBRH1DpQeo.description: The shark Swims up to its swim Speed, then @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.d5I6018Mci2SWokk]{Leaps} vertically out of the water up to 25 feet high, making a Strike against a creature at any point during the jump (this lets it attack a creature within 30 feet of the water's surface). After the Strike, the shark splashes back down into the water.

6inoR3FiOAzUbSZ8.name: Savage
6inoR3FiOAzUbSZ8.description:
Requirement The shark hit with a jaws Strike on its most recent action this turn.

Effect The creature the shark hit takes [[/r {1d12}[slashing]]]{1d12 slashing damage}.

BbFyjI0o6Aed5DYL.name: Strafing Chomp
BbFyjI0o6Aed5DYL.description: The shark Swims up to half its swim Speed, makes a jaws Strike, and then Swims up to half its Speed further. The Strike deals half damage.

Greater Barghest.name: 高等犬魔 Greater Barghest
Greater Barghest.publicNotes:
Once a barghest has eaten enough to grow into a greater barghest, it typically seeks a method to leave the Material Plane and return to the Abyss, there joining other fiends as yet another of that plane's horrors. As barghests have no innate ability to travel the planes, though, the time it takes for most greater barghests to engineer such a return can usually be measured in years, if not decades. During that time, greater barghests continue to play the roles of gluttons, hunters of humanity, and tyrants of goblinoid tribes. More than a few grow accustomed to such lives on the Material Plane and wholly abandon the end goal of returning to the Abyss, despite the fact that those who do make such a return home often grow even more powerful over time, gaining eerie new abilities and qualities absorbed from the raw chaos of the Abyss itself.

In addition to greater barghests being more powerful than typical barghests, the process of transforming into a greater barghest results in hideous mutations that often grant deadly abilities. Some barghests grow large bat-like wings upon their transformation. Others develop toxic breath or vestigial limbs. The options detailed in the stats below represent only the tip of the proverbial iceberg for barghest mutations-feel free to use these as inspiration for coming up with new mutations of your own design.

Barghests are lupine fiends with goblinoid faces and humanoid hands. They stalk the Material Plane in search of souls to sate their demonic hunger. Eons ago, barghests dwelled in the pits of Hell and served Asmodeus, but after Lamashtu abducted and adopted the four most powerful of their kind to serve as pets (and in time, as a pantheon of hero-gods worshipped by evil goblins), barghests' loyalties and philosophical nature changed significantly. Today, while barghests retain their connection to goblinoids, they serve none but their own appetites.

jcx4KGQO0eO1X2yD.name: 闪现术(随意施法) Blink (At Will)
jcx4KGQO0eO1X2yD.description:
你在物质位面和灵界位面之间快速闪现。你对所有伤害获得抗力5（除了力场）。你可以维持法术，消失不见并在10尺内由GM决定的随机方位上出现；该移动不会触发反应动作。在你的回合结束时，你会如上文所述地快速消失又重新出现。

@Compendium[pf2e.spell-effects.ZlsuhS9J0S3PuvCO]{法术效果：闪现术}

升阶 (+2) 该抗力提高3。

2sVva7C3aRsTfi3F.name: 浮空术(随意施法) Levitate (At Will)
2sVva7C3aRsTfi3F.description:
你移去重力，令目标漂浮距离地面5尺。在法术持续时间中，你可以通过一个单动作移动目标上或者下移10尺，这具有专注特征。因浮空术而漂浮的生物在攻击骰上承受-2环境减值。漂浮的生物可以花费一个交互（Interact）动作来稳定自身，并在其回合剩余时间里取消该减值。如果目标邻接一个固定的物体，或者足够稳定的地形，他可以通过攀爬（如果平面是垂直的，例如一堵墙）或者匍匐（如果平面是水平的，例如天花板）沿着该平面移动。GM决定具体什么表面可以攀爬，什么表面应当匍匐。

@Compendium[pf2e.spell-effects.JqrTrvwV7pYStMXz]{法术效果：浮空术}

pI4YRwa86fcwb3E9.name: 隐形术(随意施法) Invisibility (At Will)
pI4YRwa86fcwb3E9.description:
目标被幻术包复，变得 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{隐形 Invisible}. 这令该生物对所有生物 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{无踪Undetected} ，但生物可以尝试寻找目标，令其改为 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{藏匿 Hidden}。如果目标使用敌对动作，法术在敌对动作完成后结束。

升阶 (4环级) 该法术持续1分钟，但目标使用敌对动作时该法术不会结束。

zIyme0AGuphXNgSa.name: 借机攻击 Attack of Opportunity

HzOfOnqjDdkk5Alq.name: Change Shape
HzOfOnqjDdkk5Alq.description:
The barghest takes on the shape of a goblinoid (a goblin, hobgoblin, or bugbear) or a wolf, or it transforms back into its true form. When the barghest is a goblinoid, it loses its jaws and claw Strikes, it becomes Small if it is a goblin, and its Speed changes to 20 feet. When the barghest is a wolf, its Speed changes to 40 feet and its jaws gain @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.BCLvAx4Pz4MLa2pu]{Knockdown}. Each individual barghest has only one goblinoid form and one wolf form.

@Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-effects.o6ZI01zZBQDASuaw]{Effect: Wolf Shape}

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

zGEOz9aVguJujbSi.name: Mutations
zGEOz9aVguJujbSi.description:
The process of consuming corpses to evolve into a greater barghest results in odd and unpredictable physiological changes. A greater barghest has one mutation, typically chosen from the following options.

  • @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.wlhvSroB6r5cSd8Y]{Fangs}
  • @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.KcUHCVhHnkMD8j3k]{Toxic Breath}
  • @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.mwEig0MYM7EIibSU]{Vestigial Arm Strike}
  • @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.OD3VPUalSKDTYFmF]{Wings}

Gogiteth.name: 高基特斯 Gogiteth
Gogiteth.publicNotes:
A gogiteth is a slavering nightmare of teeth, eyes, and hairy spiderlike legs, and its appearance is invariably seared into the minds of any who witness it. Hives of these skittering monsters haunt the lowest reaches of the Darklands, competing with cave worms and other subterranean horrors for food and resources. A gogiteth is rarely seen alone, as these oversized vermin learned long ago that the best means of survival is sticking close to others of their own kind. Even the haughty drow know to seek cover when a gogiteth is spotted, for where there is one, a swarm is sure to follow.

Gogiteths make a clacking sound as they move about. The joints in their many legs pop and crack with each movement, though they can suppress this sound voluntarily so that they can hunt without giving away their presence. The odd creatures can also make a high-pitched whistling sound that echoes throughout the caverns where they live. Some Darklands natives report that groups of gogiteths sometimes join together in eerie, discordant songs.

Gogiteths' alien anatomies have inspired no shortage of speculative origin stories. Some believe they are the result of a fleshwarping experiment gone horribly wrong. Others think they may be related in some way to the Dominion of the Black-possibly the distant cousins or some strange exile of that alien entity; according to this mythos, once they made their way to this planet, the gogiteths crawled into the depths of the earth, shying away from the blazing sun above.

Gogiteths are a menace to every other denizen of the Darklands. Drow and duergars in gogiteth-infested regions of Sekamina or Orv frequently organize hunting parties to eradicate the terrors, even calling for temporary truces with unlikely allies in times when a gogiteth presence must be addressed. Since even an average gogiteth hive can host up to two dozen of the horrors, missions to eradicate them when they become established are dangerous quests indeed.

Qj4erun9wbqBExS0.name: Skittering Reposition
Qj4erun9wbqBExS0.description:
Trigger A creature that starts its move outside the gogiteth's reach moves into its reach.

Effect The gogiteth moves 10 feet. This does not trigger reactions.

drMUmP8Z6LhZyhRI.name: Carry Off Prey
drMUmP8Z6LhZyhRI.description: The gogiteth can move at its full Speed while it has a creature @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} in its jaws, bringing the grabbed creature along.

fRkzUI9I50wuPJvX.name: Skittering Assault
fRkzUI9I50wuPJvX.description: The gogiteth Strides three times. Once per Stride, it can attempt a leg Strike against a creature in its reach at any point during the Stride; it must make each attack against a different creature, but it doesn't apply its multiple attack penalty until after making all its Strikes. If any of the Strikes result in a critical failure, Skittering Assault ends.

Greater Nightmare.name: 高等梦魇战马 Greater Nightmare
Greater Nightmare.publicNotes:
The enormous greater nightmare is a more dangerous variety of nightmare, particularly valued for its ability to invade other realities with its rider.

Nightmares are flaming equine harbingers of death.

yxACAkCMYt76qy2Y.name: 幻化灵体(仅限自身和骑手) Ethereal Jaunt (Self and Rider Only)
yxACAkCMYt76qy2Y.description:
你进入灵界位面，这是一个与物质位面重叠的位面。物质位面的生物无法看见你，并且你可以穿过物质位面的事物。你以你通常速度的一半移动，但是可以向任何方向（包括上下）。你可以看见60尺半径内的物质位面；它是灰色且朦胧的，对你具有 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{隐蔽 Concealed} 。你无法影响物质位面，并且你不会被物质位面影响，除了从物质位面发出的力场效果以及防护系效果。当法术结束时，你回到物质位面。如果你在空中，你会坠落（除非你能飞），并且如果你在物体中，你会被推离到最近的开放空间，并且你每被推离5尺会承受1d6伤害。如果你施放该法术时不处于物质位面，你失去该法术。

升阶 (9环级) 你能以射程30尺内的至多另外5个自愿生物为目标。该持续时间为至多10分钟。

ALc0LqW9wBY9yrEJ.name: 异界传送(仅限自身和骑手) Plane Shift (Self and Rider Only)
ALc0LqW9wBY9yrEJ.description: 你和你的盟友穿过位面之间的屏障。目标移动到另一个位面，例如火焰位面（Plane of Fire），阴影位面（Shadow Plane），或者深渊（Abyss）。你必须对目的地位面有所了解，并且使用该位面的材料制作的魔法共鸣音叉作为该法术的器材。多数主要位面的共鸣音叉，如同异界传送法术本身一样，罕贵度为罕见。鲜为人知的位面和半位面的共鸣音叉通常罕贵度为稀有。该法术非常不精确，你会在某个目标（由你选择）上次到达该位面时所在的位置相距1d20×25英里的位置出现。如果对所有目标而言均是第一次旅行到特定位面，你会在位面上的一个随机位置出现。异界传送 不会提供返程的方法，但是通过再次施放异界传送令你能回到你之前所在的位面，除非有什么另外情况。

FOakiHyYV4zfX0lj.name: Smoke
FOakiHyYV4zfX0lj.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:20]{20 feet} @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

The greater nightmare continually exhales black smoke that creates @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealment} in an aura around it. Nightmares and their riders can see through this smoke. A creature that begins its turn in the area becomes @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:28] negates) and is then temporarily immune sickness from the smoke for 1 minute. The greater nightmare, its rider, any creature currently holding its breath (or that does not need to breathe), and any creature immune to poison are immune to the aura's sickened effect but not the concealment.

JhurblUzrKIPeUrP.name: Flaming Gallop
JhurblUzrKIPeUrP.description: The greater nightmare Strides or Flies up to triple its Speed. Its hooves burst with intense flame, dealing [[/r {6d6}[fire]]]{6d6 fire damage} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:30|basic:true] save) once to each creature other than the greater nightmare's rider that the greater nightmare moves adjacent to during its gallop.

Greater Shadow.name: 高等幽影 Greater Shadow

dr.exceptions: 除力场、幽冥或正能量；对非魔法双倍抗力

Greater Shadow.publicNotes:
在阴影界长时间停留并吸收魔法力量的幽影会变成高等幽影。

被称为幽影的神秘不死生物潜伏在黑暗中，以那些远离光明的人为食。那些躲在发光武器的光芒庇护之下和幽影进行交涉的人往往能了解很多秘密，因为幽影是理想的间谍。

kppTcx5TylWkpfF1.name: 光亮弱点 Light Vulnerability
kppTcx5TylWkpfF1.description: 发出魔法光亮的物品（例如施加了@Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.WBmvzNDfpwka3qT4]{光亮术 Light}）在攻击幽影时视为具有魔法特征。

zadQdUq4eeiDSHSq.name: 幽影衍体 Shadow Spawn
zadQdUq4eeiDSHSq.description: 当一个生物的影子被窃影（Steal Shadow）能力抽出时，幽影能将其创建成一个听命于自己的@Compendium[pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.XrmHgbKgcHDi4OnK]{幽影衍体 Shadow Spawn}。此幽影衍体没有窃影能力，并且永久陷入笨拙2（clumsy）状态。如果被窃影的生物死亡，则该衍体成为完全体、具有自主意识的幽影。如果生物从@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{力竭 Enfeeblement}状态中恢复，则影子会回到它身上，并且幽影衍体会消失。

VB81WcGgMngyyh3E.name: 潜于阴影 Slink in Shadows
VB81WcGgMngyyh3E.description: 幽影可以在生物或物体的影子中@Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{躲藏 Hide}或作为@Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{潜行 Sneak}的终点。

UluC5rRvQl0yriAj.name: 神术内在法术 Divine Innate Spells

Xj2woyiQHPYlP7Uc.name: 黑暗术(随意施法) Darkness (At Will)
Xj2woyiQHPYlP7Uc.description:
你创造一片黑暗的帷幕，光线无法穿透，并且光源无法在区域中发光。光线无法进入该区域，并且任何非魔法光源，例如火炬或者提灯，在区域中不会发出任何光线，即使其光照可能到达黑暗术之外也是如此。这也会压制等于或低于你的黑暗术环级的魔法光亮。光线无法穿透，所以在区域中的生物无法看到外面。对于外面，这看起来如同一团纯粹黑暗的球。

升阶 (4环级) 即使具有黑暗视觉的生物（但不包括高等黑暗视觉）也几乎无法看穿这黑暗。它们透过黑暗看到的生物视为 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{隐蔽 Concealed}。

Green Hag.name: 绿鬼婆 Green Hag
Green Hag.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic
Green Hag.publicNotes:
Green hags hate beauty and purity, so they use disguises and treachery to lure and murder innocents, corrupt the pure of heart, and shatter the minds and morals of their victims. Green hags create imaginative schemes to utterly ruin anyone who crosses them, as well as good or righteous folk whose very existence insults the hag's twisted sensibilities. The complicated scandals perpetuated by green hags involve impersonation, mistaken identity, the seduction and betrayal of loved ones, or all these things in combination.

Malevolent crones who lurk at the edges of civilization, hags use their deceptive, magical abilities to prey upon humanoids, manipulating and corrupting them. Some say hags arose from fey that became twisted by their inner selfishness. Hags gather together in covens for greater power, craft unique magical items known as @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.ACa9QlFqdmW4s2Th]{Hag Eyes}, and are known to replace infant humanoids with their own offspring-these children are @Compendium[pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.bAjHCeyNcPRqOmLv]{Changelings} who have the potential to become hags themselves.

pNlVk6Eq16L9OBYt.name: 巧言术(恒定法术) Tongues (Constant)
pNlVk6Eq16L9OBYt.description:
无论什么语言，目标都可以理解其所有的词语，并且向其他生物用该语言交流。当处于一群各异的生物中时，每次目标将要说话，他可以选择一个生物，并使用一种该生物理解的语言来讲述，即使该目标不知道这语言具体是什么。

升阶 (7环级) 持续时间为8小时。

shLOwiLG3ulSYKdF.name: 卜筮术 Augury
shLOwiLG3ulSYKdF.description:
你瞥见未来的模糊片段。在施放该法术时，询问一个特定行为的结果。该法术可以预测30分钟内的未来的结果，并且会揭示GM认为最为可能的后续结果。

  • 吉 该结果将会是好的。
  • 凶 该结果可能不妙。
  • 吉且凶 该结果好坏参半。
  • 平 不会有明显好或坏的结果。

GM暗骰@Check[type:flat|dc:6|traits:secret]检定。如果失败，结果永远是 "平" 。这令 "平" 的结果究竟是否准确无法被判明。如果任何人询问和先前施放的卜筮术相同的主题，使用第一次施放时得到的暗骰结果。如果环境情况发生变化，有可能会得到不同的结果。

x9smkTQ1YyyY2Zcx.name: 隐形术(随意施法) Invisibility (At Will)
x9smkTQ1YyyY2Zcx.description:
目标被幻术包复，变得 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{隐形 Invisible}. 这令该生物对所有生物 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{无踪Undetected} ，但生物可以尝试寻找目标，令其改为 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{藏匿 Hidden}。如果目标使用敌对动作，法术在敌对动作完成后结束。

升阶 (4环级) 该法术持续1分钟，但目标使用敌对动作时该法术不会结束。

I9tYnS5FyCSmLBYY.name: 树化术(随意施法) Tree Shape (At Will)
I9tYnS5FyCSmLBYY.description: 你变形为一棵大型树。察觉检定不会发现你的本来形态，但是通过成功的对抗你的法术DC的自然（Nature）或者生存（Survival）检定，可以发现你看起来是个树，但对于该区域而言，崭新到奇怪的程度。在树形态中，你可以观察周围所有事物，但除了使用一个具有专注特征的单动作，来结束该法术且结束你的回合以外，你不能进行任何行动。成为树时，你的AC为20，并且只有状态加值，状态减值，环境加值，和环境减值会影响你。你投出的所有成和和大成功反射豁免均为失败。

Q6aECCBC8XJs3Eke.name: 水中呼吸(恒定法术) Water Breathing (Constant)
Q6aECCBC8XJs3Eke.description:
目标可以在水中呼吸。

升阶 (3环级) 该持续时间增加到8小时。

升阶 (4环级) 该持续时间增加到直到你的下次日常准备。

uq6NvrLNEXMkTsQf.name: 行踪无迹(恒定法术) Pass Without Trace (Constant)
uq6NvrLNEXMkTsQf.description:
你令留下的痕迹模糊不清，并令其他人追踪你非常困难。追踪（Track）你的检定DC获得+4状态加值，或者等于你的法术DC，取较高DC。你同时只会从一个行踪无迹中受益。

升阶 (2环级) 该持续时间增加到8小时。

升阶 (4环级) 该持续时间增加到8小时。该法术射程为20尺，并且具有20尺弥漫区域，影响该区域中至多10个由你选择的生物。

4n19omVeZZAAGXBk.name: Coven
4n19omVeZZAAGXBk.description:
A green hag adds @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.J6vNvrUT3b1hx2iA]{Entangle}, @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.KSAEhNfZyXMO7Z7V]{Outcast's Curse}, and @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.KsWhliKfUs3IpW3c]{Wall of Thorns} to her coven's spells.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Coven]

hZbArhODPV9EmZ0m.name: Sound Imitation
hZbArhODPV9EmZ0m.description: A green hag who succeeds at a Deception check to Lie can mimic the sounds of any animal found near her lair. She has a +4 circumstance bonus to this check.

LxhUmOCBKZi7FNfa.name: Betraying Touch
LxhUmOCBKZi7FNfa.description: The green hag touches a creature that doesn't realize the hag is an enemy. The betrayed creature is affected by the hag's enfeebling humors and takes a -4 circumstance penalty to their saving throw against that effect.

aTtxivkD4mgfosfH.name: Change Shape
aTtxivkD4mgfosfH.description:
The green hag can take on the appearance of any Medium humanoid woman. This doesn't change her Speed or her attack and damage bonuses with her Strikes, but might change the damage type her Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning).

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

9S7ODMh2ZM6NXVpF.name: Enfeebling Humors
9S7ODMh2ZM6NXVpF.description: A creature damaged by a hag's claw must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:20] save or be @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for 1 day. On a critical failure, or if it gets hit again and fails its save a second time, it's @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} for 1 day.

8W67Bxaonilv5KO0.name: Exhale Miasma
8W67Bxaonilv5KO0.description:
The green hag exhales a miasma of green vapors. Each living creature in a @Template[type:cone|distance:15] is affected by her enfeebling humors (attemping a save as normal).

She can't use Exhale Miasma again for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Greedspawn.name: 贪婪罪生怪 Greedspawn
Greedspawn.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic, +4 status to all saves vs. mental
Greedspawn.publicNotes:
Sinspawn were created by one of seven ancient wizards known collectively as runelords-each of whom embraced and embodied one of seven sins. The first sinspawn was created by the Runelord of Wrath, utilizing techniques that have since gone on to influence fleshwarping practices. It wasn't long before the technique used to create sinspawn fell into the hands of the other runelords, and while each tried their own hand at crafting variants of their own design, today sinspawn of wrath remain the most numerous and notorious of their kind. Bearing only a vague resemblance to the humanoids from whose flesh they were formed, sinspawn generally appear horrifically emaciated and have unnaturally long arms and digitigrade legs, each with a trio of stubby, taloned digits. Veins bulge across sinspawn's bodies in sanguine patterns that suspiciously resemble twisted runes, and their flesh is pale and hairless. Their heads are elongated, bearing only slits for a nose, red eyes, and disturbing lower jaws that split in half at the chin, revealing pedipalps that end in tiny, three-fingered hands and framing a long, lolling tongue. Sinspawn stand 6-1/2 feet tall and typically weigh as much as an emaciated human of their size. They behave in a manner consistent with their associated sin and have physical characteristics that hint at these qualities. For example, greedspawn's veins appear to run with gold while envyspawn appear even more wasted than the rest of their kin.

Greedspawn are the tallest of sinspawn, often 7 feet in height, and with gold-tinged veins.

hk7qH9BpvzM7rFGe.name: Sin Scent (Imprecise) 30 feet
