X5DctZ32pPLyBZnM.description: A keketar can anticipate the most likely presence of a creature through a supernatural insight into chaotic probabilities and chance. This grants it the ability to sense creatures within the listed range. A creature under the effects of @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.EoKBlgf6Smt8opaU]{Nondetection} or that is otherwise shielded from divinations and predictions cannot be noticed via entropy sense.

7tWhbtD4uoAp2v5H.name: 借机攻击 Attack of Opportunity

hZqtsipwFmuBYwC2.name: Protean Anatomy
hZqtsipwFmuBYwC2.description:
A protean's vital organs shift and change shape and position constantly. Immediately after the protean takes acid, electricity, or sonic damage, it gains the listed amount of resistance to that damage type. This lasts for 1 hour or until the next time the protean takes damage of one of the other types (in which case its resistance changes to match that type), whichever comes first. The protean is immune to polymorph effects unless it is a willing target. If @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} or @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened}, the protean automatically recovers at the end of its next turn as new sensory organs grow to replace the compromised ones.

@Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-effects.c6SiBB3mzV8lZUQr]{Effect: Protean Anatomy}

0rf640gBxRc7gfuM.name: Spatial Riptide
0rf640gBxRc7gfuM.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

A creature using a teleportation ability within the aura or arriving in it via teleportation must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:38] save or wink out of existence for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds} before completing the teleport. The creature can't act, sense anything, or be targeted. On a successful save, the creature completes the teleport normally but is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}. Keketars are immune to this effect.

AniyCnlqZmw3IO9L.name: Change Shape
AniyCnlqZmw3IO9L.description:
The keketar can take the appearance of any Huge or smaller creature. This doesn't change its Speed or its attack and damage bonuses with its Strikes, but might change the damage type its Strikes deal.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

KCUHGmNla57hO2ZK.name: Reshape Reality
KCUHGmNla57hO2ZK.description: When the keketar casts @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.HBJPsonQnWcC3qdX]{Hallucinatory Terrain}, it infuses the illusion with quasi-real substance. Creatures that do not disbelieve the illusion treat structures and terrain created through the spell as though they were real, ascending illusory stairs, becoming trapped by illusory quicksand, and so on.

BudK3JDDVjbWqw8G.name: Warpwave Strike
BudK3JDDVjbWqw8G.description: A creature struck by a keketar's jaws or claw Strike must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:36] save or be subject to a @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.HKFoOZZV4WdjkeeJ]{Warpwave}.

Kobold Scout.name: 狗头人斥候 Kobold Scout
Kobold Scout.publicNotes:
Most kobolds encountered outside of a well-defended warren or lair are kobold scouts, creatures trained for stalking and the hunt.

Kobolds are small, reptilian humanoids who carry physical similarities to true dragons. They lurk in dark spaces, usually tunnels and mines beneath the earth, in either warrens of their own design or complexes discovered and colonized after the original builders have moved on. Though kobolds are far more pragmatic than they are courageous, they use every inch of their cunning to even the playing field between themselves and other, stronger creatures. They attack from the darkness and at range, and kobold artificers and engineers master the art of simple but effective traps, which they use to protect their lairs. Kobolds are skilled at working together by necessity, and they often set up ambushes or hit-and-run assaults that allow them to do the most damage possible without being harmed in return.

Kobolds are diligent and hardworking creatures, though they often turn these virtues toward selfish ends. While some kobolds live in communal collectives that maintain neutral relations with the creatures around them, they can be easily swayed into serving malevolent powers or megalomaniac leaders. This is in part due to kobolds' innate pragmatism, as they would rather concede to servitude than risk being killed, but it is also in part due to a reverence for the power that kobolds generally lack. Dragons in particular are viewed with a deferential awe, and kobolds eagerly offer their services to such mighty and glorious creatures when they can. While kobolds may scheme against other leaders, especially those that control them via subjugation, dragons are usually viewed with adoration, no matter how brutal they might be to their kobold minions.

0qvSsLdTulsncbsi.name: Hurried Retreat
0qvSsLdTulsncbsi.description:
Requirements The kobold scout is adjacent to at least one enemy.

Effect The kobold scout Strides up to its Speed plus 5 feet and gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against reactions triggered by this movement. It must end this movement in a space that's not adjacent to any enemy.

MO9W8NpBALoHHtTS.name: 偷袭 Sneak Attack
MO9W8NpBALoHHtTS.description:
The kobold scout deals an extra 1d6 precision damage to flat-footed creatures.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.SneakAttack]

Kraken.name: 海怪 Kraken
Kraken.publicNotes: A kraken is an enormous, squid-like leviathan with a cruel intelligence. It hunts ships, whales, and heroes alike. The hatred and envy krakens hold for their rivals, the alghollthus, has led many krakens to make their lairs in sunken cities, where they can sift through ancient lore for long-lost arcane secrets.

bTOywO9RTYBgmCfo.name: 支配术(仅限动物) Dominate (Animals Only)
bTOywO9RTYBgmCfo.description:
你操控目标，强行令其服从你的命令。如果你赋予一项明显是自灭的命令，目标不会行动，直到你下达新的命令。该效果基于其意志豁免。

大成功 目标不受影响。

成功 目标 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{震慑 Stunned 1} 以抵抗你的命令。

失败 你控制了目标，其获得 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.9qGBRpbX9NEwtAAr]{被控制 Controlled} 状态，但在每轮结束时可以尝试一次意志豁免。成功时，法术结束。

大失败 如同失败，但是仅当你施加违抗其天性的命令，例如杀害其盟友时，才会获得新的豁免。

升阶 (10环级) 该持续时间为无限。

ri68Bk0TcV1k9lqS.name: Altered Weather
ri68Bk0TcV1k9lqS.description:
@Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

A kraken reshapes the weather within 2 miles of it, with the effect of the @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.XkDCzMIyc0YOjw05]{Control Weather} ritual centered on the kraken and based on its emotional state, at the GM's discretion. If the kraken dies, the weather returns to normal immediately.

DtiXNG3ROuAaBhN3.name: 紧勒 Constrict
DtiXNG3ROuAaBhN3.description:
[[/r {2d10+17}[bludgeoning]]]{2d10+17 bludgeoning damage}, @Check[type:fortitude|dc:40|basic:true]

On a failed save, a creature that is holding its breath loses [[/br 1d4 #Lost Rounds]]{1d4 rounds} worth of air.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Constrict]

95k2q11INtOhFqCd.name: Double Attack
95k2q11INtOhFqCd.description: The kraken makes two Strikes with two different arms or tentacles, each limb targeting a different creature. Double Attack counts as two attacks toward the kraken's multiple attack penalty for further actions, but the penalty doesn't increase until after both attacks are made. If the kraken subsequently uses the @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Tkd8sH4pwFIPzqTr]{Grab} action, it Grabs any number of creatures it hit with Double Attack.

heW1rCJfQ2KMmuqd.name: Ink Cloud
heW1rCJfQ2KMmuqd.description:
The kraken emits a cloud of black, venomous ink in an @Template[type:emanation|distance:80]. This cloud has no effect outside water. Creatures inside the ink cloud are exposed to kraken ink poison and are @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected} while inside the cloud.

The kraken can't use Ink Cloud again for [[/br 2d6 #Recharge Ink Cloud]]{2d6 rounds}, and the cloud dissipates after 1 minute.

I3pFXc7fvS41popk.name: Jet
I3pFXc7fvS41popk.description: The kraken moves through the water up to 280 feet in a straight line without triggering reactions.

EkSi5KM6hOWO5WxD.name: Kraken Ink
EkSi5KM6hOWO5WxD.description:
Krakens are immune to this poison.

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:39]

Maximum Duration 10 rounds

Stage 1 [[/r {3d6}[poison]]]{3d6 poison damage} and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 [[/r {4d6}[poison]]]{4d6 poison damage} and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} (1 round)

Kobold Warrior.name: 狗头人战士 Kobold Warrior
Kobold Warrior.publicNotes:
The typical kobold trains with agile weaponry, favoring the light pick for its use in crafting new tunnels to expand their domains through underground reaches. Kobolds are capable of landing sneaky strikes against unsuspecting foes but are just as quick to scamper off to safety when they don't, as a group, outnumber their enemies at least two to one.

Kobolds are small, reptilian humanoids who carry physical similarities to true dragons. They lurk in dark spaces, usually tunnels and mines beneath the earth, in either warrens of their own design or complexes discovered and colonized after the original builders have moved on. Though kobolds are far more pragmatic than they are courageous, they use every inch of their cunning to even the playing field between themselves and other, stronger creatures. They attack from the darkness and at range, and kobold artificers and engineers master the art of simple but effective traps, which they use to protect their lairs. Kobolds are skilled at working together by necessity, and they often set up ambushes or hit-and-run assaults that allow them to do the most damage possible without being harmed in return.

Kobolds are diligent and hardworking creatures, though they often turn these virtues toward selfish ends. While some kobolds live in communal collectives that maintain neutral relations with the creatures around them, they can be easily swayed into serving malevolent powers or megalomaniac leaders. This is in part due to kobolds' innate pragmatism, as they would rather concede to servitude than risk being killed, but it is also in part due to a reverence for the power that kobolds generally lack. Dragons in particular are viewed with a deferential awe, and kobolds eagerly offer their services to such mighty and glorious creatures when they can. While kobolds may scheme against other leaders, especially those that control them via subjugation, dragons are usually viewed with adoration, no matter how brutal they might be to their kobold minions.

dF7ibA1On3Nvjxqk.name: Hurried Retreat
dF7ibA1On3Nvjxqk.description:
Requirements The kobold warrior is adjacent to at least one enemy.

Effect The kobold warrior Strides up to its Speed plus 5 feet and gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against reactions triggered by this movement. It must end this movement in a space that's not adjacent to any enemy.

D0BJOT03V2FE7mKT.name: 偷袭 Sneak Attack
D0BJOT03V2FE7mKT.description:
The kobold warrior deals an extra [[/r {1d4}[precision]]]{1d4 precision damage} to flat-footed creatures.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.SneakAttack]

Merfolk Warrior.name: 人鱼兵卒 Merfolk Warrior
Merfolk Warrior.publicNotes:
Merfolk warriors form the bulk of the militias of their vast underwater realms and meet potential aggressors head-on with uncompromising force.

Elegant, mysterious, and graceful; all this and more can be said of the merfolk. These enigmatic people resemble humanoids with delicate features from the waist up but with the fins and tail of a massive fish from the waist down. Found in nearly all of Golarion's oceans, merfolk are as varied in appearance as humans, their skin ranging from pale to umber and all shades in between, while their gleaming scales shimmer with the majesty of the sea.

bDogEMyUIoxPMls3.name: Aquatic Dash
bDogEMyUIoxPMls3.description: The merfolk warrior swims and attacks in one of two patterns. They either Swim twice and Strike one opponent at the end of their movement, or Swim once and Strike at any point during their movement.

Merfolk Wavecaller.name: 人鱼唤潮者 Merfolk Wavecaller
Merfolk Wavecaller.publicNotes:
Merfolk wavecallers use their primal power to call forth allies and defend their people with deadly magic.

Elegant, mysterious, and graceful; all this and more can be said of the merfolk. These enigmatic people resemble humanoids with delicate features from the waist up but with the fins and tail of a massive fish from the waist down. Found in nearly all of Golarion's oceans, merfolk are as varied in appearance as humans, their skin ranging from pale to umber and all shades in between, while their gleaming scales shimmer with the majesty of the sea.

IjRP72C2m27oOuG6.name: 侦测魔法 Detect Magic
IjRP72C2m27oOuG6.description:
你发出一股标记魔法存在的脉冲。你不会获得魔法存在或不存在以外的任何信息。你可以选择忽略你完全知晓的魔法，例如你或者你盟友的魔法物品以及持续法术。

仅当幻术魔法的环级低于你的侦测魔法环级时，你才能侦测幻术魔法。但是，具有幻术灵光但是没有在外表上做伪装的物品（例如一瓶隐形术药水），通常能够正常侦测。

升阶 (3环级) 你会了解法术侦测区域中最高环级的效果的学派。如果有相同强度的多个效果，GM决定你了解的为哪一个。

升阶 (4环级) 如3环级，你也能指出最高环级魔法的来源。如同一种模糊感官（imprecise sense），你不会了解具体的位置，但是可以将来源锁定到5尺立方（或者最近的那个五尺立方，如果来源体积比这个区域更大）。

tQ1m9uzdwC96pkCY.name: Hydraulic Asphyxiation
tQ1m9uzdwC96pkCY.description:
Requirement The target is fully submerged in water, within 30 feet of the merfolk wavecaller, and holding its breath.

Effect The merfolk wavecaller commands the tides to crush their foe's throat, rooting the target in place and forcing it to choke up precious air. The target must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:18] saveor become @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} for 1 round and immediately lose [[/br 1d4 #actions]]{1d4 actions'} worth of air (or twice that on a critical failure).

Minotaur.name: 牛头人 Minotaur
Minotaur.publicNotes:
Minotaurs are master hunters that dwell in cunning labyrinths or tangles of underground caverns meant to disorient and demoralize prey. These monstrous tormentors delight in the hunt, in the terror caused by closing in on prey, and in the very moment when the hunted realizes that they have lost the game. Only then will the minotaur charge in for the kill, cutting foes down with powerful strikes or impaling them on its sharp horns.

Minotaurs are known to dwell in mazes, but they can also be found hiding in old ruins and other forgotten corners of the world. In any case, they are solitary creatures, only rarely sharing territory with others of their kind or even more powerful beings that have cowed them into service. Everyone else is little more than prey to be hunted.

UnFKmdjf3kYOmNvW.name: Natural Cunning
UnFKmdjf3kYOmNvW.description: A minotaur automatically critically succeeds at Survival checks to avoid becoming lost or to find its way, including those from the @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.Oj1PJBMQD9vuwCv7]{Maze} spell.

VdbR3tZZovSqgWq8.name: Axe Swipe
VdbR3tZZovSqgWq8.description: The minotaur swings its axe in a wide arc, making greataxe Strikes against any two foes who are adjacent to each other and within the minotaur's reach. The multiple attack penalty does not increase until after both attacks are resolved.

NoNrnnXaKdOmoBx6.name: Hunted Fear
NoNrnnXaKdOmoBx6.description:
The minotaur snorts and clomps as it hunts its prey, inspiring terror. The minotaur makes an Intimidation check to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} all living creatures within @Template[type:emanation|distance:60]{60 feet} that can hear the minotaur but not see it. Roll once and apply the result to all creatures. If the targets are in a maze or similarly difficult-to-navigate structure, the minotaur gains a +4 circumstance bonus to this check. Creatures that become @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} as a result also take a -2 circumstance penalty to Survival checks to avoid getting lost for 1 minute. This use of Demoralize doesn't have the visual trait. Each target is temporarily immune for 1 minute.

@Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-effects.mFnSXW6HTwS7Iu1k]{Effect: Hunted Fear}

MVKA8eKi1YTMeHKK.name: Powerful Charge
MVKA8eKi1YTMeHKK.description: The minotaur Strides twice, then makes a horn Strike. If it moved at least 20 feet from its starting position, the Strike's damage is increased to [[/r {2d8+10}[piercing]]]{2d8+10}.

Mitflit.name: 怯懦小魔怪 Mitflit
Mitflit.publicNotes:
Mitflits, also known as mites, are self-loathing and pitiful cowards, easily bullied into servitude by other creatures or even slightly more powerful mitflit leaders. They tame insects, spiders, and other such creatures to serve as faithful allies. Mitflits have lost most of their ancestral gremlin magic, leaving these incomplete beings full of doubt and insecurity. Mitflits find companionship in the other base creatures of the world, and forge bonds of friendship with vermin, the only other beings that seem willing to accept them. A social structure, even one in which they are bullied, partially fills the hole within mitflits' personalities, and they rarely rebel or rail out unless their rage hits a breaking point.

Gremlins are cruel fey tricksters and saboteurs who have fully acclimated to life on the Material Plane, finding distinct niches for their inventive destructiveness. All gremlins delight in ruining or breaking things, whether it's something physical like a device or vehicle or something intangible such as an alliance or relationship. A gremlin's greatest joy is watching the collapse of complex creations, preferably after the lightest and slightest, carefully targeted push from the gremlin. Gremlins tend to denigrate, bully, or even slaughter their lesser kin, particularly mitflits, whom gremlins (and many others) derisively call "mites."

QLpCft5YSm98kbx4.name: 动物交谈() Speak with Animals (At Will) (Arthropods Only)
QLpCft5YSm98kbx4.description: 你可以对动物提出问题，从动物获得回答，以对动物及使用交涉（Diplomacy）技能。该法术不会令动物比正常更为友好。聪明的动物喜欢简要直说或者避而不谈，不那么聪明的则通常会做出傻瓜式的回复。

3TfIMe12rJpDf9LZ.name: Self-Loathing
3TfIMe12rJpDf9LZ.description: A mitflit's self-loathing makes it easy to influence. It takes a -4 penalty to its Will DC against checks to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.tHCqgwjtQtzNqVvd]{Coerce}, @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize}, @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.OX4fy22hQgUHDr0q]{Make an Impression}, and @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.DCb62iCBrJXy0Ik6]{Request}.

tvFxmbJKPxnCnTbb.name: Vermin Empathy
tvFxmbJKPxnCnTbb.description: Mitflits can use Diplomacy to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.OX4fy22hQgUHDr0q]{Make an Impression} on and @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.DCb62iCBrJXy0Ik6]{Request} things of arthropods (insects, spiders, scorpions, crabs, and similar invertebrate animals). Most arthropods have a starting attitude of @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fuG8dgthlDWfWjIA]{Indifferent} to mitflits.

CiirPvlIj0ZtuHce.name: Vengeful Anger
CiirPvlIj0ZtuHce.description: As long as it isn't @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened}, a mitflit gains a +2 status bonus to damage rolls against a creature that has previously damaged or tormented it.

Morrigna.name: 摩莉甘猎魂使 Morrigna
Morrigna.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic
Morrigna.publicNotes:
Bounty hunters and investigators, morrignas seek out creatures that thwart death or interfere with the natural flow of souls. Morrignas dress in flowing spider silk and wear masks reminiscent of webs, as they consider patient and watchful spiders to be their spiritual kin.

Psychopomps are guardians and shepherds of the dead native to the Boneyard, the vast plane of graves where mortal souls are judged and sent on to their eternal rewards or damnations. Psychopomps ensure that the dead come to terms with their transition from mortality and are properly sorted into the appropriate afterlife. They also protect souls from being preyed upon by supernatural predators. Nearly all psychopomps wear masks, especially when they're likely to be interacting with mortals, although the types of masks they wear are as varied as the psychopomps themselves. The courts of the Boneyard preside in Requian, a somber yet melodic language spoken slowly with various tonal shifts.

FghvQA4Q7lAFIiEl.name: 巧言术(恒定法术) Tongues (Constant)
FghvQA4Q7lAFIiEl.description:
无论什么语言，目标都可以理解其所有的词语，并且向其他生物用该语言交流。当处于一群各异的生物中时，每次目标将要说话，他可以选择一个生物，并使用一种该生物理解的语言来讲述，即使该目标不知道这语言具体是什么。

升阶 (7环级) 持续时间为8小时。

hZQtHKUw6xKXQCeF.name: 动物交谈(恒定法术) Speak with Animals (Constant)
hZQtHKUw6xKXQCeF.description: 你可以对动物提出问题，从动物获得回答，以对动物及使用交涉（Diplomacy）技能。该法术不会令动物比正常更为友好。聪明的动物喜欢简要直说或者避而不谈，不那么聪明的则通常会做出傻瓜式的回复。

8VZ27iPC1CLKHIH6.name: 蛛行术(恒定法术) Spider Climb (Constant)
8VZ27iPC1CLKHIH6.description:
该生物的手与脚上长出粘附性的细毛，能在几乎任何表面上提供附着力。目标获得等于其速度的攀爬速度。

升阶 (5环级) 该持续时间增加到1小时。

lKjDUFzEfPKRnUOu.name: 侦测魔法 Detect Magic
lKjDUFzEfPKRnUOu.description:
你发出一股标记魔法存在的脉冲。你不会获得魔法存在或不存在以外的任何信息。你可以选择忽略你完全知晓的魔法，例如你或者你盟友的魔法物品以及持续法术。

仅当幻术魔法的环级低于你的侦测魔法环级时，你才能侦测幻术魔法。但是，具有幻术灵光但是没有在外表上做伪装的物品（例如一瓶隐形术药水），通常能够正常侦测。

升阶 (3环级) 你会了解法术侦测区域中最高环级的效果的学派。如果有相同强度的多个效果，GM决定你了解的为哪一个。

升阶 (4环级) 如3环级，你也能指出最高环级魔法的来源。如同一种模糊感官（imprecise sense），你不会了解具体的位置，但是可以将来源锁定到5尺立方（或者最近的那个五尺立方，如果来源体积比这个区域更大）。

vfDqURmKtNWQI7IJ.name: Lifesense 60 feet
vfDqURmKtNWQI7IJ.description:
A psychopomp senses the vital essence of living and undead creatures within the listed range.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Lifesense]

R5LM2Ijl78zvdKkF.name: Change Shape
R5LM2Ijl78zvdKkF.description:
A morrigna can take the appearance of any Small or Medium animal or humanoid. This doesn't change their Speed or their attack and damage modifiers with their Strikes, but it might change the damage type their Strikes deal.

Unless they choose to manifest their web wrappings in their new form, they cannot make web wrappings Strikes.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

4pbTTxqHWnbnAW7T.name: Spider Minions
4pbTTxqHWnbnAW7T.description:
The morrigna summons a @Compendium[pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.9X7hOvCKy1bqw0g6]{Giant Tarantula} or @Compendium[pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.KpxhSWRIhG7ns5NA]{Spider Swarm}. These spiders have the summoned trait and remain for 10 minutes or until reduced to 0 Hit Points, whichever comes first.

The morrigna does not need to Sustain the Spell to direct these summoned creatures, and the morrigna can have any number of summoned spiders in existence at once.

The morrigna can see through the eyes of any of their summoned spiders at any time.

dxLrvmfMtHkddYo4.name: Spirit Touch
dxLrvmfMtHkddYo4.description: A morrigna's Strikes affect incorporeal creatures as though etched with a @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.JQdwHECogcTzdd8R]{Ghost Touch} property rune and deal [[/r {4d6}[negative]]]{4d6 negative damage} to living creatures or [[/r {4d6}[positive]]]{4d6 positive damage} to undead.

qDypnfBHeFgNsDjH.name: Wrappings Lash
qDypnfBHeFgNsDjH.description:
Trigger A creature within reach of the morrigna's web wrappings uses an action to Strike or attempt a skill check.

Effect The morrigna makes a web wrappings Strike against the triggering creature. If the strike is a critical hit, the triggering action is disrupted.

Mu Spore.name: 穆之巨菌 Mu Spore
Mu Spore.publicNotes:
A mu spore is a thankfully rare fungoid monstrosity of vast power and strange intellect. Even the smallest mu spores are never less than a hundred feet long from tentacle tip to tentacle tip, yet despite this vast bulk, they are capable of flying with an uncommon grace, venting jets of foul-smelling spores to guide their flight.

Many societies tell tales of vast mu spores appearing over cities at the dawn of apocalyptic events, but they're more than just ravenous eaters of nations. Mu spores often possess rare or esoteric knowledge, and if peaceful contact can be made, this lore can be quite valuable. Their spores can also be used to craft certain foul drugs or deadly alchemical poisons, but harvesting these ingredients is dangerous, as the spores are not viable for long once they've been shed, forcing alchemists seeking to harvest them to operate in perilously close proximity to the abominations.

Fzou6YacIfdWk8Rx.name: Windsense 240 feet
Fzou6YacIfdWk8Rx.description: The mu spore senses vibrations in the air through its aerial spores.

JrkBo5yZM19wv3KX.name: Enormous
JrkBo5yZM19wv3KX.description: A mu spore is a massive creature and takes up a space of 10 squares by 10 squares (50 feet by 50 feet).

bZ4JNU36mcWHHrmR.name: Grasping Tendrils
bZ4JNU36mcWHHrmR.description:
Trigger A creature within 10 feet of the mu spore moves or attacks the mu spore.

Effect The spore uses @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.i18TlebMzwONyPhI]{Grab} on the triggering creature. There is no limit to how many creatures it can grab with the sticky tendrils that cover its body.

VJqYJwxq4m0v6j2M.name: Spores
VJqYJwxq4m0v6j2M.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:60]{60 feet} @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

A living creature that enters the area or ends its turn within it is corrupted by spores. It must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:42] save or be @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1}, @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1}, and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round. Fungi and plants are immune.

Xm0r5sx1GTiEAKc4.name: Cough Spores
Xm0r5sx1GTiEAKc4.description:
The mu spore releases a cloud of burrowing spores in a @Template[type:cone|distance:400]. The spores deal [[/r {22d6}[piercing]]]{22d6 piercing damage} to all creatures, objects, and wooden structures in the area, but not to plants or fungi (@Check[type:reflex|dc:46|basic:true] save).

The mu spore can't use this ability again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Cough Spores]]{1d4 rounds}.

S9z7EwyzhGnCFZDI.name: Enormous Inhalation
S9z7EwyzhGnCFZDI.description: The mu spore pulls all creatures and objects in a @Template[type:cone|distance:400] 400 feet towards it's mouth. A successful @Check[type:fortitude|dc:43] save halves the distance, or avoids the pull on a critical success. The mu spore automatically attempts to Swallow Whole each creature adjacent to it at the end of the inhalation.

bjN59WI6VS1niQFU.name: Fast Swallow
bjN59WI6VS1niQFU.description:
Trigger The mu spore @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabs} a creature with its jaws.

Effect The spore uses Swallow Whole.

zpUaHpTkfVbbw7sX.name: Overpowering Jaws
zpUaHpTkfVbbw7sX.description: The mu spore still deals [[/r {18}[piercing]]]{18 piercing damage} if its jaws Strike is a failure

Mukradi.name: 三头蜈蚣 Mukradi
Mukradi.publicNotes: Fearsome centipede-like creatures, mukradis are three-headed predators with a devastating array of breath weapons. A Darklands version of the mukradi is rumored to exist. It's said these variant mukradis have black scales, and all of their heads spew a black, acidic goo that animates before being reabsorbed by the mukradis.

GVNTgGaXcebR64nT.name: Partitioned Anatomy
GVNTgGaXcebR64nT.description:
Trigger The mukradi would be @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused}, @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}, @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed}, or @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned}.

Effect The mukradi confines the debilitating effect to a certain portion of its nervous system, ignoring the effect but causing a maw of its choice to go dormant for the effect's duration. That maw can't be used for a Strike or Breath Weapon during that time. This ability can't be used if all the mukradi's heads are dormant.

7JcMtxcKSyHdqEQX.name: Spitting Rage
7JcMtxcKSyHdqEQX.description:
Trigger A creature scores a critical hit on the mukradi.

Effect The mukradi's Breath Weapon recharges. It can use its Breath Weapon immediately as part of this reaction. It can't use this reaction again until it recharges its Breath Weapon naturally.

TwSJCzLZ4KcJKaWT.name: Breath Weapon
TwSJCzLZ4KcJKaWT.description:
The mukradi breathes a blast of energy from one of its three heads; each creature in the area must attempt a basic Reflex save.

The mukradi can't use Breath Weapon again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.

  • Acid Maw (acid) @Template[type:line|distance:60|width:10]{10-Foot-Wide, 60-Foot Line} of acid dealing [[/r {16d6}[acid]]]{16d6 acid damage} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:36|basic:true|traits:acid] save).
  • Flame Maw (fire) @Template[type:cone|distance:60] of fire dealing [[/r {16d6}[fire]]]{16d6 fire damage} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:36|basic:true|traits:fire] save).
  • Shock Maw (electricity) @Template[type:line|distance:120] of electricity dealing [[/r {16d6}[electricity]]]{16d6 electricity damage} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:36|basic:true|traits:electricity] save).

MCe44ome2cf0lQ8W.name: Pull Apart
MCe44ome2cf0lQ8W.description: The mukradi makes two Strikes with different maws against the same target. If both hit, the target takes an extra [[/r {2d12+13}[slashing]]]{2d12+13 slashing damage}, with a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:36|basic:true] save. On a critical failure, the creature is torn to pieces and dies. The mukradi's multiple attack penalty increases only after all the attacks are made.

hk3y1r8nU2o8QA4C.name: Thrash
hk3y1r8nU2o8QA4C.description: The mukradi Strikes once against each creature in its reach. It can Strike up to once with each maw, once with its tail lash, and any number of times with its legs. Each attack takes a -2 circumstance penalty and counts toward the mukradi's multiple attack penalty, but the multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after all the attacks are made.

Mummy Guardian.name: 木乃伊卫士 Mummy Guardian
Mummy Guardian.publicNotes:
The majority of mummies were created by cruel and selfish masters to serve as guardians to protect their tombs from intruders. The traditional method of creating a mummy guardian is a laborious and sadistic process that begins well before the poor soul to be transformed is dead, during which the victim is ritualistically starved of nourishing food and instead fed strange spices, preservative agents, and toxins intended to quicken the desiccation of the flesh. The victim remains immobile but painfully aware during the final stages, where its now-useless entrails are extracted before it's shrouded in funerary wrappings and entombed within a necromantically ensorcelled sarcophagus to await intrusions in the potentially distant future. While it's certainly possible to use other methods to create a mummy guardian from an already-deceased body, those who seek to create these foul undead as their guardians in the afterlife often feel that such methods result in inferior undead-the pain and agony of death by mummification being an essential step in the process.

Regardless of the method of their creation, mummy guardians are more than just physical shells of flesh and bone-they retain fragmented, distorted versions of their minds, with only enough memories of their living personality remaining to fuel their undead anger and jealousy of those who yet live. This burning rage only intensifies over the centuries of waiting within a crypt for the chance to actually act, and thus when most mummy guardians are awoken by tomb robbers or adventurers, they stop at nothing in pursuit of glorious slaughter.

While many cultures practice mummification of the dead for benign reasons, undead mummies are created through foul rituals, typically to provide eternally vigilant guardians.

1ich4lSlipgnuhyC.name: Despair
1ich4lSlipgnuhyC.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

Living creatures are @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} while in a mummy guardian's despair aura. They can't naturally recover from this fear while in the area but recover instantly once they leave the area. When a creature first enters the area, it must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:22] save (after taking the penalty from being frightened) or be @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} for 1 round. The creature is then temporarily immune for 24 hours.

kGKrPttfeXrnHGWr.name: Mummy Rot
kGKrPttfeXrnHGWr.description:
This disease and any damage from it can't be healed until this curse is removed. A creature killed by mummy rot turns to dust and can't be resurrected except by a 7th-level @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.kqhPt9344UkcGVYO]{Resurrect} ritual or similar magic.

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:22]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 minute)

Stage 2 [[/r {4d6}[negative]]]{4d6 negative damage} and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (1 day)

Mummy Pharaoh.name: 木乃伊法老 Mummy Pharaoh
Mummy Pharaoh.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. positive
Mummy Pharaoh.publicNotes:
While mummy guardians are undead crafted from the corpses of sacrificed-usually unwilling victims-and retain only fragments of their memories, a mummy pharaoh is the result of a deliberate embrace of undeath by a sadistic and cruel ruler. The transformation from life to undeath is no less awful and painful, but as the transition is an intentional bid to escape death by a powerful personality who fully embraces the blasphemous repercussions of the choice, the mummy pharaoh retains its memories and personality intact. Although in most cases a mummy pharaoh is formed from a particularly depraved ruler instructing their priests to perform complex rituals that grant the ruler eternal unlife, a ruler who was filled with incredible anger in life might spontaneously arise from death as a mummy pharaoh without undergoing this ritual. Depending on the nature of the ruler, a mummy pharaoh might have spellcasting or other class features instead of its Attack of Opportunity and disruptive abilities-the exact nature of the abilities the ruler had in life can significantly change or strengthen the mummy pharaoh presented here (which represents the least powerful variety of this deadly undead foe).

While many cultures practice mummification of the dead for benign reasons, undead mummies are created through foul rituals, typically to provide eternally vigilant guardians.

rYzzaXPAJ15uHtmD.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Positive

BzrCf46VVV0IyaJb.name: 借机攻击 Attack of Opportunity
BzrCf46VVV0IyaJb.description:
The mummy pharaoh can use Attack of Opportunity when a creature within its reach uses a concentrate action, in addition to its normal trigger. It can disrupt triggering concentrate actions, and it disrupts actions on any hit, not just a critical hit.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.AttackOfOpportunity]

NKPJH9dvADsJ0zhQ.name: Great Despair
NKPJH9dvADsJ0zhQ.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

Living creatures are @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} while in a mummy pharaoh's despair aura. They can't naturally recover from this fear while in the area but recover instantly once they leave the area. When a creature first enters the area, it must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:26] save (after taking the penalty from being frightened) or be @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} for [[/br 1d4 #Paralyze Duration]]{1d4 rounds}. The creature is then temporarily immune for 24 hours.

h4fFfvaiDiqgTpTz.name: Rejuvenation
h4fFfvaiDiqgTpTz.description: When a mummy pharaoh is destroyed, necromantic energies rebuild its body in its tomb over [[/br 1d10 #Rejuvenation]]{1d10 days}. If the re-forming body is destroyed during that time, the process starts anew. A slain mummy pharaoh can be destroyed for good with a @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.Dbd5W6G8U2vzWolN]{Consecrate} ritual.

OaKZ88EQ5UVii9xw.name: Undead Mastery
OaKZ88EQ5UVii9xw.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:100]{100 feet} @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

Commanded or allied undead in the aura that have a lower level than the mummy pharaoh gain a +1 circumstance bonus to attack rolls, damage rolls, AC, saves, and skill checks.

@Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-effects.4M2K16mH4gndHAKa]{Effect: Undead Mastery}

4WUyRzJH8pu1zq5J.name: Channel Rot
4WUyRzJH8pu1zq5J.description: The mummy pharaoh can deliver insidious mummy rot through melee weapons it wields.

I7lbbBC8haIiOXzD.name: Insidious Mummy Rot
I7lbbBC8haIiOXzD.description:
This disease and any damage from it can't be healed until this curse is removed. A creature killed by insidious mummy rot turns to sand and can't be resurrected except by a 7th-level @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.kqhPt9344UkcGVYO]{Resurrect} ritual or similar magic.

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:26]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 minute)

Stage 2 [[/r {8d6}[negative]]]{8d6 negative damage} and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} (1 day)

TRcRCZ4v7cyZtfSF.name: Sandstorm Wrath
TRcRCZ4v7cyZtfSF.description:
The mummy pharaoh exhales a @Template[type:cone|distance:60] of superheated sand that deals [[/r {5d6}[fire]+{5d6}[slashing]]]{5d6 fire damage and 5d6 slashing damage} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:28|basic:true] save).

The mummy pharaoh can't use Sandstorm Wrath again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Sandstorm Wrath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Naiad.name: 水妖精 Naiad
Naiad.publicNotes:
Naiads protect streams, ponds, springs, and other natural bodies of fresh water. While most naiads lead solitary lives close to their chosen ward, sometimes these nymphs congregate in coven-like groups where river tributaries meet, performing great magic and blessing the waters of the land. Because naiads' bonds to their bodies of water permit more flexibility, they are the nymphs most likely to interact with humanoids and even visit their settlements on occasion. Unlike other nymphs, naiads occasionally become adventurers, especially when dark forces seek to despoil nature or otherwise threaten the land, joining forces with others to prevent the corruption of nature.

Nymphs are a family of fey that take the form of beautiful humanoids with elven features and have a deep association with the natural world. The most common of their kind are the dryads, which are spirits that embody great trees, but many other kinds of nymphs exist, including naiads, who watch over bodies of water. All nymphs are guardians of some element of nature, typically a specific tree or pond, or even-in the case of nymph queens-whole forests or massive bodies of water

oLiLZB5JEXhWtE64.name: 动物交谈(恒定法术) Speak with Animals (Constant)
oLiLZB5JEXhWtE64.description: 你可以对动物提出问题，从动物获得回答，以对动物及使用交涉（Diplomacy）技能。该法术不会令动物比正常更为友好。聪明的动物喜欢简要直说或者避而不谈，不那么聪明的则通常会做出傻瓜式的回复。

rL7A4RH2uX8GGbWM.name: Wild Empathy
rL7A4RH2uX8GGbWM.description: The naiad can use Diplomacy to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.OX4fy22hQgUHDr0q]{Make an Impression} on and make very simple @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.DCb62iCBrJXy0Ik6]{Requests} of animals.

XQKbqAKqILs3dbvQ.name: Water Dependent
XQKbqAKqILs3dbvQ.description: A naiad bonds to a spring, pool, pond, or similar-sized water feature. While within 300 feet of her bonded body of water, she can use her innate @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.iAnpxrLaBU4V6Sej]{Tidal Surge} at will. She doesn't recover Hit Points or reduce the @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained} condition when resting beyond that range. Unlike most other nymphs, she doesn't suffer penalties from being apart from her bonded body of water. A naiad can perform a 24-hour ritual to bond herself to a new body of water.

qd9QFtwsgr9c7yLU.name: Water Healing
qd9QFtwsgr9c7yLU.description: While within her bonded body of water, the naiad heals [[/r {1}[healing]]]{1 Hit Point} every 10 minutes.

Naiad Queen.name: 水妖精女皇 Naiad Queen
Naiad Queen.publicNotes:
Naiad queens rule over pristine wildernesses centered on untouched lakes or other bodies of fresh water. Bards' songs and artists' paintings of nymphs tend to depict naiad queens in their slightly more humanoid forms, which they don when they make the rare journey into civilized lands to garner allies or gauge threats.

Most naiad queens treat those who respect their domains with kindness, but they are fierce and quick in eliminating foes. Their blinding beauty and breadth of offensive spells make naiad queens fierce opponents if forced into a fight.

Nymphs are a family of fey that take the form of beautiful humanoids with elven features and have a deep association with the natural world. The most common of their kind are the dryads, which are spirits that embody great trees, but many other kinds of nymphs exist, including naiads, who watch over bodies of water. All nymphs are guardians of some element of nature, typically a specific tree or pond, or even-in the case of nymph queens-whole forests or massive bodies of water

Too6BHEsJmbtAhSy.name: 动物交谈(恒定法术) Speak with Animals (Constant)
Too6BHEsJmbtAhSy.description: 你可以对动物提出问题，从动物获得回答，以对动物及使用交涉（Diplomacy）技能。该法术不会令动物比正常更为友好。聪明的动物喜欢简要直说或者避而不谈，不那么聪明的则通常会做出傻瓜式的回复。

uNLdoUBeazthELMD.name: 侦测魔法 Detect Magic
uNLdoUBeazthELMD.description:
你发出一股标记魔法存在的脉冲。你不会获得魔法存在或不存在以外的任何信息。你可以选择忽略你完全知晓的魔法，例如你或者你盟友的魔法物品以及持续法术。

仅当幻术魔法的环级低于你的侦测魔法环级时，你才能侦测幻术魔法。但是，具有幻术灵光但是没有在外表上做伪装的物品（例如一瓶隐形术药水），通常能够正常侦测。

升阶 (3环级) 你会了解法术侦测区域中最高环级的效果的学派。如果有相同强度的多个效果，GM决定你了解的为哪一个。

升阶 (4环级) 如3环级，你也能指出最高环级魔法的来源。如同一种模糊感官（imprecise sense），你不会了解具体的位置，但是可以将来源锁定到5尺立方（或者最近的那个五尺立方，如果来源体积比这个区域更大）。

T456QjgYhKt7Lzu0.name: 潮汐涌流(随意施法) Tidal Surge (At Will)
T456QjgYhKt7Lzu0.description:
你唤动猛烈的波浪，推动在水体中或者在地面上的目标。目标必须尝试一次强韧豁免。

失败 你沿地面向任意方向移动目标5尺，或者在水体中向任意方向移动目标10尺。

大失败 你沿地面向任意方向移动目标10尺，或者在水体中向任意方向移动目标20尺。

Gm902B0XQR5W4eLu.name: Tied to the Land
Gm902B0XQR5W4eLu.description: A nymph queen is intrinsically tied to a specific region, such as a forest for a dryad queen. As long as the queen is healthy, the environment is exceptionally resilient, allowing the nymph queen to automatically attempt to counteract spells and rituals such as @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.7yWXx3qC4eFNHhxD]{Blight} that would harm the environment, using her Spell DC with a counteract level equal to the highest-level druid spell she can cast. When the nymph queen becomes physically or psychologically unhealthy, however, her warded region eventually becomes twisted or unhealthy as well. In that case, restoring the nymph queen swiftly heals the entire region.

nS51JCooM2dV2JTC.name: Wild Empathy
nS51JCooM2dV2JTC.description: The naiad can use Diplomacy to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.OX4fy22hQgUHDr0q]{Make an Impression} on and make very simple @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.DCb62iCBrJXy0Ik6]{Requests} of animals.

Y44FxT7CY4R6SkdW.name: Nymph's Beauty
Y44FxT7CY4R6SkdW.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

On a failed save, the target is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} for this turn and whenever it begins its turn within 30 feet of the naiad queen for the next 24 hours, even if it can't see her on subsequent turns.

Creatures that start their turn in the aura must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:23] save or suffer an effect described in the nymph queen's entry.

yQ0WKMlep02TPvLi.name: Change Shape
yQ0WKMlep02TPvLi.description:
Nymph queens can transform between their original form, which looks much like a typical nymph of their kind, and any Small or Medium humanoid form, typically choosing a more humanoid-looking version of their natural form.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

P658sPuiyqAqTdkz.name: Focus Beauty
P658sPuiyqAqTdkz.description:
On a failed save, if the target was already affected by the naiad queen's beauty, the image of the queen sears into the creature's mind, allowing no further sight and effectively @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinding} the creature until restored via @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.Et8RSCLx8w7uOLvo]{Restore Senses} or a similar effect, or until the naiad queen chooses to remove the effect using a single action, which has the concentrate trait.

The nymph queen focuses her beauty upon a target within her aura. The creature must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:23] save. On a failure, it is affected as if by the nymph queen's nymph's beauty aura; if it was already affected by the aura, it suffers a greater effect described in the nymph queen's entry. A nymph queen can Focus Beauty on a given creature only once per turn.

lQKrggSbzpvqq4YB.name: Inspiration
lQKrggSbzpvqq4YB.description:
A nymph queen can inspire a single intelligent creature by giving that creature a token of her favor, typically a lock of her hair. As long as the creature carries her token and remains in good standing with the nymph queen, the creature gains a +1 status bonus to all Crafting checks, Performance checks, and Will saves.

If a nymph queen grants her Inspiration to a bard and the nymph queen is that bard's muse, the bard gains an additional benefit depending on their muse theme: for lore muse, the bard also gains a +1 status bonus to all Lore checks; for maestro muse, the status bonus to Performance checks increases to +2 for the purpose of determining the effects of compositions; for polymath muse, the bard gains a +4 status bonus to untrained skill checks; and for all other muses, the Will save bonus increases to +2 against fey.

@Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-effects.iSyyR4QVOaY6mxtg]{Effect: Naiad Queen's Inspiration}

z1Wnid4gCPgKMoV8.name: Water Healing
z1Wnid4gCPgKMoV8.description: While within any body of water in her domain, the naiad queen heals [[/r {28}[healing]]]{28 Hit Points} every 10 minutes.

Otyugh.name: 食腐怪 Otyugh
Otyugh.publicNotes:
Lords of sewers, ditches, and landfllls, otyughs are filthy monstrosities that stomp about on three massive legs in search of tasty garbage and refuse. Using two barbed tentacles to grasp and tear, guided by a third with a proliferation of eyes at the end, the otyugh has perfectly adapted to life in its cramped, disgusting environment, where it uses its appendages to see into tight spaces and grasp hidden prey.

Most assume that otyughs originally evolved in swamps and moved into sewers as civilization encroached on their natural habitats. True or not, they are now one of the larger predators in those dank environs. Otyughs are territorial, but they have been known to form loose collectives, even giving each other important-sounding titles like 'king of offal'; and 'duchess of slime' to indicate their rank and station in their sludgy underworld beneath the streets.

Those who run across an otyugh might be surprised to hear it speak, shouting at intruders to leave its putrid home or demanding tribute in the form of trash or other prizes of dubious nature.

r1SlNgELge3BicQv.name: Stench
r1SlNgELge3BicQv.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:40]{40 feet} @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

A creature entering the aura must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:20] save or be @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (plus @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for the same duration on a critical failure). On a success, the creature is temporarily immune to the sickened and slowed effects of this stench for 1 hour. Regardless of the save, while within the aura, creatures take a -2 circumstance penalty to saves against diseases. An otyugh's stench is due to the oflal and refuse that it wallows in, so cleaning the creature thoroughly (with @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.WzLKjSw6hsBhuklC]{Create Water} and sufficient scrubbing, for example) deactivates the aura, while a sufficiently plugged nose allows an individual to avoid exposure to the stench.

@Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-effects.wX9L6fbqVMLP05hn]{Effect: Stench}

GHuGn3ZCUkbeSFiQ.name: Filth Fever
GHuGn3ZCUkbeSFiQ.description:
The @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened} and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} conditions from filth fever don't improve on their own until the disease is cured.

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:20]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (1 day)

Stage 3 sickened 1 and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} as long as it remains sickened (1 day)

Stage 4 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} (1 day)

Stage 5 dead

nQudJs5Bky0XvlDC.name: Reposition
nQudJs5Bky0XvlDC.description: The otyugh attempts to move all creatures that it has @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} into other spaces within the reach of its tentacles, rolling a single @Check[type:athletics] check and comparing the result against each creature's Fortitude DC. On a failure, the creature remains in place, and on a critical failure, the creature is no longer grabbed.

Pleroma.name: 存灭御衡者 Pleroma
Pleroma.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic
Pleroma.publicNotes:
Among the most powerful of all the true aeons, pleromas are a manifestation of the duality of creation and destruction. Their physical manifestation is a constant state of flux between these two poles, their forms a shifting cloak of black where galaxies and other celestial objects flit in and out of existence, as if depicting the constant life, death, and rebirth of a miniature, self-contained universe.

Pleromas see the multiverse as both eternal and cyclical, doomed and malleable, ending only if these cycles ever become unbalanced. They believe the current Convergence is necessary to obtain this essential balance, and act to ensure that the grand design of the Monad is carried out to the smallest detail.

Aeons have always been the caretakers of reality and defenders of the natural order of balance. Each type of aeon takes on some form of duality in its manifestation and works either to shape the multiverse within the aspects of this duality in some way, or to correct imbalances to the perfect order of existence. Aeons can bring weal or woe when they appear in a region, and their machinations can raise a nation, raze it, or restore it from ruin. Their reasons are their own, and they rarely share their motivations with others-they simply create the results they insist through their strange envisioning communication are necessary to maintain the balance of the multiverse.

As a result of recent shifts in reality, aeons have begun to reassert a presence in the perfect planar city of Axis. To the aeons, this is merely the latest in a recurring cycle, albeit one that mortals have not yet borne witness to. Once regarded as an independent faction, the living machines known as inevitables are now revealed as having been agents of the aeons all along, and while inevitables have their own shared themes and features, they are very much living but constructed manifestations of the aeons' war against imbalance-particularly with regard to how this war is waged against the forces of chaos.

Aeons have a name for this cyclic return, in which they welcome the industrious axiomites back to their fold and bring the inevitables once again under their control: the "Convergence." At the onset of the Convergence, a council of pleroma aeons appeared in the Eternal City of Axis, where they revealed that axiomites were wayward aeons, split off long ago to pursue the act of creation. With the latest cycle of change it was time for the axiomites and their creations, the inevitables, to rejoin the aeon cause. While most axiomites and inevitables fell in line, realizing perhaps on a fundamental level of reality that what the aeons said was the truth, some refused to heed the call and waited for the wrath of the aeons-but that wrath has yet to come. The dual-natured aeons have responded to those who have declined in confusing ways. With some they treat and even bargain, while a handful of others they have destroyed, and a few have been exterminated by the axiomites and allied inevitables. But most of these quiet insurgents they leave alone, allowing these axiomites to continue to create in peace and the inevitables to continue with their duties. How-or if-this Convergence will end is as little understood as the aeons themselves.

8Js0FRMnRTqIViIM.name: 真视术(恒定法术) True Seeing (Constant)
8Js0FRMnRTqIViIM.description: 你可以看见60尺内的事物的本来面貌。GM秘密骰反制检定，对抗区域中的所有幻术或者变形效果，但这只会决定你是否能看破它（例如，如果该检定成功对抗了一个变形法术，你可以看见该生物的本来形态，但你不会结束该变形法术）。

OLfOwMCSsuRGrS9K.name: 造物术(随意施法) Creation (At Will)
OLfOwMCSsuRGrS9K.description:
你使用神秘能量创造一个临时的物体。它必须由植物材料（例如木头或者纸）组成，并且为5立方尺或更小。该物体不能需求复杂的工艺，或者复杂的活动机构，并且无法作为消耗或者类似的作用，并且不能由昂贵材料，或者稀有度在罕见以上的材料组成。它显然是临时创造的，因此无法被卖出或者确实的礼物。

升阶 (5环级) 该物品是金属制，并且可以包括常见矿物，例如长石或者水晶。

WV4gTktX9AuRsFMo.name: 行动自如(恒定法术) Freedom of Movement (Constant)
WV4gTktX9AuRsFMo.description: 你驱散可能会阻碍一个生物或者令其移动减慢的效果。当处于该法术效果中时，法术目标忽视会赋予其速度环境减值的效果。当法术目标尝试 @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{逃脱 Escape} 一个令其 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{禁足 Immobilized}, @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{擒抱 Grabbed}或 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{束缚 Restrained}的效果时，它自动成功，除非该效果是魔法性的，并且其环级比行动自如更高。

97InfsmjP5YZ2B8m.name: 塑石术(随意施法) Shape Stone (At Will)
97InfsmjP5YZ2B8m.description:
你将目标石块变成你选择的粗糙形状。该塑形过程十分粗糙，无法制造复杂的组件，细致的细节，可动部分，或者其他类似的东西。当你塑形一个石头时，站在其上的生物必须尝试一次反射豁免或者特技（Acrobatics）检定。

成功 目标不受影响。

失败 目标在石头上 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{倒地 Prone} 。

大失败 该生物从石头上摔落（如可能）并且倒地着地。

oOjIZXqrVKZq2br0.name: 极化认知(随意施法) Hypercognition (At Will)
oOjIZXqrVKZq2br0.description: 你高速分类整理与你当前情况相关的信息。如施放该法术的一部分，你可以立即使用6个回想知识动作。对于这些动作，你不能使用任何在你回想知识时触发的特殊能力，反应动作，或者自由动作。

BhEYreCA4HM7Wx7r.name: 造粮术(随意施法) Create Food (At Will)
BhEYreCA4HM7Wx7r.description:
你创造了足够六个中型（Medium）生物食用一天的食物。这些食物味道平淡令人乏味，但足够营养。在1天后，如果没有人食用这些食物，它会腐坏并且无法使用。大部分小型（Small）生物食用如同中型（Medium）生物1/4的食物（对于超小型（Tiny）生物而言为1/6)，大部分大型（Large）生物食用10倍的食物（对于超大型（Huge）生物而言为100倍，以此类推）。

升阶 (4环级) 你可以供给1两个中型生物。

升阶 (6环级) 你可以供给50个中型生物。

升阶 (8环级) 你可以供给200个中型生物。

Si2S8oXrk09v5hHB.name: 塑木术(随意施法) Shape Wood (At Will)
Si2S8oXrk09v5hHB.description: 你将目标木头变成你选择的粗糙形状。该塑形能力十分粗糙，无法制造复杂的组件，细致的细节，可动部分，或者其他类似的东西。你无法使用该法术来增加你所塑形的木质物体的价值。

uCNW6nYpJPObPffy.name: 造水术(随意施法) Create Water (At Will)
uCNW6nYpJPObPffy.description: 你将手捧起，水从中涌出。你创造2加仑的水。如果没有人饮用它，水会在1天后蒸发。

vwrcT517AjGLCADE.name: 侦测阵营(随意施法) Detect Alignment (At Will)
vwrcT517AjGLCADE.description:
当你感受到阵营灵光时，视野中会闪动光芒。选择混乱，邪恶，善良或者秩序。你侦测该阵营的灵光。你不会获得存在或不存在以外的任何信息。你可以选择不侦测你知晓已经有该阵营的生物或者效果。

只有6或者更高等级的生物具有阵营灵光——除非是神术施法者，不死生物，或者外层位面（Outer Sphere的存在）。

升阶 (2环级) 你能了解到各个灵光的位置和强度。

wTyVptTaqC4Su8lm.name: Energy Touch
wTyVptTaqC4Su8lm.description: A pleroma's touch deals its choice of [[/r {5d8+18}[positive]+{1d6}[lawful]]]{positive} or [[/r {5d8+18}[negative]+{1d6}[lawful]]]{negative} damage, but neither energy can be used to heal a creature.

MWKHdXGNx9JkkNqR.name: Envisioning
MWKHdXGNx9JkkNqR.description:
Pleromas care little for communication with other creatures, but when they do convey information, they do so wordlessly through a series of psychic projections. This acts as @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.kdhbPaBMK1d1fpbA]{Telepathy} with a range of 100 feet but is understandable to all creatures regardless of whether they have a language, though the aeon's meaning to non-aeons can be vague and is often mysterious.

An aeon can use this ability to communicate flawlessly with any other aeon on the same plane as itself.

w14YL6ltyHxsjfDO.name: Reality Twist
w14YL6ltyHxsjfDO.description:
Trigger The pleroma critically fails the saving throw.

Effect The critical failure becomes a normal failure.

L8ZBoNle0ekONgCk.name: Sphere of Creation
L8ZBoNle0ekONgCk.description:
Three times per day, a pleroma can manifest a 2-foot-diameter sphere of white energy that hovers above its left hand. By using a single action, which has the concentrate trait, the pleroma can cause the sphere to fly 10 feet. The sphere can move in any direction, ignoring difficult terrain, but it can't move farther than 300 feet away from the pleroma.

Wherever the sphere travels, it leaves behind a 5-foot-wide path of new matter, creating either new terrain (the pleroma's choice of normal, difficult, or greater difficult terrain) or a 5-foot-square solid barrier of a single natural substance (such as clay, wood, or stone).

The sphere can enter the space of a creature; when it does, the creature must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:43] save or be absorbed into the sphere. On a successful save, the creature is pushed to a space of the GM's choice away from the sphere. Those who fail take [[/r {20d6}[positive]]]{20d6 positive damage} (even if they are living) and are pushed away as a success. Those who critically fail, or are reduced to 0 HP by the damage from a failure, become one with the new material and can be restored only via a 10th-level spell.

A pleroma can have only one Sphere of Creation in existence at a time, and the sphere automatically vanishes in a flash of blinding light after [[/br 1d4 #minutes]] minutes.

All creatures within 30 feet of the sphere of creation when it vanishes must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:43] save or be permanently @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded}.

wGDHR7b7nFvTcaRz.name: Sphere of Oblivion
wGDHR7b7nFvTcaRz.description:
Three times per day, a pleroma can manifest a 2-foot-diameter sphere of complete and utter darkness that hovers above its right hand. By using a single action, which has the concentrate trait, the pleroma can cause the sphere to fly 10 feet. The sphere can move in any direction, ignoring difficult terrain, but it can't move farther than 300 feet away from the pleroma.

The sphere is an empty void that lasts for 1 minute before collapsing in on itself and winking out of existence.

Once manifested, the sphere can be used as a ranged attack, but it blinks out of existence immediately after that attack is resolved. Any unattended object that touches the void is sucked in and completely destroyed. Larger objects (such as ships or buildings) are destroyed at a rate of one 10-foot cube per round of contact.

The sphere can enter the space of a creature; when it does, the creature must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:43] save or be absorbed into the sphere. On a successful save, the creature is pushed to a space of the GM's choice away from the sphere. Those who fail take [[/r {20d6}[negative]]]{20d6 negative damage} (even to undead) and are pushed away as a success. Those who critically fail, or are reduced to 0 HP by the damage from a failure, are annihilated and can be restored only via a 10th-level spell.

Poracha.name: 八脚猞猁 Poracha
Poracha.publicNotes:
Porachas are feline beasts native to the mystical Forest of Spirits in Tian Xia. In their natural form, these graceful eight-legged creatures sport a gray tabby coat of fur streaked with lines of olive green, but they are rarely seen this way. Even the youngest porachas are capable of hiding within objects, making them incredibly elusive and rarely seen except on their own terms. Because porachas can so effortlessly blend in with the forest and emerge from its dark corners in an instant, superstitious locals believe these beasts are related to kami-nature spirits who embody individual trees, stones, or other elements of nature in the Forest of Spirits. The truth is that while porachas frequently associate with kami, they are their own breed of mysterious monster with powers over time and space that set them apart from nature spirits.

The poracha's most iconic feature is its ability to bend reality to teleport, or jaunt, short distances. But a poracha can also rest within objects, allowing it to safely sleep inside. Given that a poracha experiences time very slowly while hiding within objects, it can sleep inside of one for an extended period. Once it wakes, a poracha departs to play in the living world. Porachas especially enjoy resting inside roadside milestones, to maximize their chances of coming across travelers.

Porachas rarely tread humanoid-occupied lands, preferring the company of the kami and their natural habitat in the Forest of Spirits. Though they enjoy occasional conversation, they're extremely sensitive to sound; they speak softly and request the same from those they speak with. Their territories span vast swaths of the wood, making them ideal allies for hunters or treasure seekers who would otherwise become lost in the dense trees. But porachas are nothing if not flckle, and typically demand inscrutable favors in return for their aid, such as the planting of a rare sapling in a particular grotto or the clearing of an invasive monster species around a treasured spring. Any attempt to coerce or trick a poracha into service is ill advised, for these sacred beasts have many friends among the kami as well as others of their kind. Though they generally don't travel in groups, porachas know where to find more of their kind in times of need, and an organized pack of porachas is a disorienting threat.

zYGuLe2x3OTlMc06.name: Jaunt
zYGuLe2x3OTlMc06.description:
The poracha teleports up to 40 feet. It must have line of sight to the space it teleports to.

It can't use Jaunt again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Jaunt]]{1d4 rounds}.

GzpsUYZPjfrvA0Yh.name: Object Meld
GzpsUYZPjfrvA0Yh.description: The poracha touches an adjacent object of enough volume to contain it. It merges into the object indefinitely, and while it's inside, time moves exceptionally slowly for it and it has only limited perception of the outside world. The poracha can sense what's going on outside the object only using tremorsense. The poracha can use only mental actions or Jaunt; if it Jaunts, it leaves the object and appears where it chooses. If a creature Strikes the object, the poracha is expelled unharmed.

Pugwampi.name: 厄运小魔怪 Pugwampi
Pugwampi.publicNotes:
Mean, dog-faced, and craven, pugwampis take disproportionate enjoyment from the accidents and missteps of other creatures-something that happens often due to the supernatural aura of ill fortune these gremlins project. They enjoy preparing pranks involving spikes, excrement, pits full of spiders, and the like. Pugwampis are somewhat deaf and thus often yell loudly to each other when not hiding. Many pugwampis worship gnolls as gods and aspire to be more like gnolls, although gnolls hate pugwampis even more than most creatures do, due to their sycophantic fawning.

Gremlins are cruel fey tricksters and saboteurs who have fully acclimated to life on the Material Plane, finding distinct niches for their inventive destructiveness. All gremlins delight in ruining or breaking things, whether it's something physical like a device or vehicle or something intangible such as an alliance or relationship. A gremlin's greatest joy is watching the collapse of complex creations, preferably after the lightest and slightest, carefully targeted push from the gremlin. Gremlins tend to denigrate, bully, or even slaughter their lesser kin, particularly mitflits, whom gremlins (and many others) derisively call "mites."

35CTre21nZQseuFC.name: 动物交谈(随意施法) Speak with Animals (At Will)
35CTre21nZQseuFC.description: 你可以对动物提出问题，从动物获得回答，以对动物及使用交涉（Diplomacy）技能。该法术不会令动物比正常更为友好。聪明的动物喜欢简要直说或者避而不谈，不那么聪明的则通常会做出傻瓜式的回复。

AGjtcz0cAWzBXlEx.name: Unluck Aura
AGjtcz0cAWzBXlEx.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:20]{20 feet} @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

Creatures other than animals, gremlins, and gnolls in the aura become extremely unlucky (@Check[type:will|dc:16] save; creature must roll this Will save twice and take the worse result). On a successful save, the creature is temporarily immune to pugwampi unluck auras for 24 hours. On a failure, the creature must roll twice and take the worse result on all checks as long as it is within the aura.

@Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-effects.yxgHWK2rTZKKAzDN]{Effect: Unluck Aura}

Pteranodon.name: 无齿翼龙 Pteranodon
Pteranodon.publicNotes:
Pteranodons are quick and agile reptiles with 20-foot wingspans that enable them to hover on wind currents for hours. These creatures have long beaks and equally long crests that protrude from the backs of their heads.

Pterosaurs are primitive flying creatures. While many are smaller than a human, the two presented below are quite a bit larger. Each of these creatures could pose a serious threat to a person. These flying reptiles can be found in a wide selection of regions, but they tend to soar above warm or temperate climates.

3b7IgOx3d3REF2NR.name: Swoop
3b7IgOx3d3REF2NR.description: The pteranodon Flies up to its Speed and makes one beak Strike at any point during that movement.

Pridespawn.name: 傲慢罪生怪 Pridespawn
Pridespawn.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic, +4 status to all saves vs. mental
Pridespawn.publicNotes:
Sinspawn were created by one of seven ancient wizards known collectively as runelords-each of whom embraced and embodied one of seven sins. The first sinspawn was created by the Runelord of Wrath, utilizing techniques that have since gone on to influence fleshwarping practices. It wasn't long before the technique used to create sinspawn fell into the hands of the other runelords, and while each tried their own hand at crafting variants of their own design, today sinspawn of wrath remain the most numerous and notorious of their kind. Bearing only a vague resemblance to the humanoids from whose flesh they were formed, sinspawn generally appear horrifically emaciated and have unnaturally long arms and digitigrade legs, each with a trio of stubby, taloned digits. Veins bulge across sinspawn's bodies in sanguine patterns that suspiciously resemble twisted runes, and their flesh is pale and hairless. Their heads are elongated, bearing only slits for a nose, red eyes, and disturbing lower jaws that split in half at the chin, revealing pedipalps that end in tiny, three-fingered hands and framing a long, lolling tongue. Sinspawn stand 6-1/2 feet tall and typically weigh as much as an emaciated human of their size. They behave in a manner consistent with their associated sin and have physical characteristics that hint at these qualities. For example, greedspawn's veins appear to run with gold while envyspawn appear even more wasted than the rest of their kin.

Pridespawn are nearly skeletal in their gauntness, and often seek out fine clothes or jewelry to wear, taking strange pleasure in appearing elegant and regal.

hk7qH9BpvzM7rFGe.name: Sin Scent (Imprecise) 30 feet
hk7qH9BpvzM7rFGe.description: A sinspawn can smell creatures that reflect its sin, as the scent ability. The GM determines which creatures are appropriately sinful.

p80DPc7fm2auFNQg.name: +4 Status to All Saves vs. Mental

748MxBiZMmMCjxzu.name: 借机攻击 Attack of Opportunity

MpNlJrdPvv9bECNE.name: Sinful Bite
MpNlJrdPvv9bECNE.description:
A creature hit by the jaws of a sinspawn must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:18] save as it is assailed by sinful thoughts.

Critical Success Unaffected

Success @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}

Failure @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}

Critical Failure sickened 2 plus @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for 1 minute

Quelaunt.name: 奎伦特 Quelaunt
Quelaunt.publicNotes:
This three-armed, three-legged monster has no discernible eyes, nose, ears, or mouth or no visible means of ingesting food. Its limbs are distributed so evenly across its body that it is all but impossible to tell which way the creature is oriented at any given time. Few who witness the quelaunt linger on its alien looks for long though, as the most pressing concern quickly becomes the invasion of their minds, as the quelaunt sows doubt, sorrow, and rage. This monstrosity not only delights in the negative emotions of its prey, but feeds on them, gaining strength and sustenance from their dismay. For the quelaunt, no act is too terrible or cruel to inflict on its victims, since the more a creature suffers, the more the quelaunt feasts.

Quelaunts are known to associate with other aberrant horrors, including brain collectors and other creatures associated with the Dominion of the Black. However, the more prevalent theory paints them as more alien-perhaps invasive beings from another dimension of pure thought and feeling-and claims that in their natural state they have no physical bodies at all. Few dare speculate further; the only known autopsy of a quelaunt resulted in the researcher's suicide just days afterward and all the notes were mysteriously destroyed. Whatever secrets there are to be unlocked in the anatomy of these bizarre monsters are apparently important enough to warrant great protection from quelaunts, even after death.

g2NHoIs5k3anoSdi.name: 凌空而行(恒定法术) Air Walk (Constant)
g2NHoIs5k3anoSdi.description: 目标可以在空气中行走，如同在坚实地面上。它可以如此上升与下降，最大45度角。

oAIpxgEZ30V9uBkj.name: 迷人情态(随意施法) Captivating Adoration (At Will)
oAIpxgEZ30V9uBkj.description:
你变得美丽迷人，令人神魂颠倒，在范围内的生物会因你而分心。你可以令任意你选择的生物不受该效果影响。当一个生物第一次进入该区域时，它必须尝试一次意志豁免骰。如果生物离开并重新进入，它使用原豁免结果。

大成功 该生物不受影响，并且暂时免疫1小时。

成功 该生物的下一个动作被你 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{迷魂 Fascinated} ，之后暂时免疫1小时。

失败 该生物被你迷魂。

大失败 该生物被你迷魂，并且其对你的态度改善一级。

升阶 (+1) 弥漫范围的大小增加15尺。

oHu944Q5McwtiHBT.name: 傲慢妄想(随意施法) Delusional Pride (At Will)
oHu944Q5McwtiHBT.description:
你令目标盲目自信，诱导它将所有失败都归结为外因。如果该目标在攻击骰或者技能检定上失败，它在攻击骰和技能检定上承受-1状态减值，直到该回合结束（或者如果它在其回合外尝试该骰，则持续到它下个回合的结束）。如果该生物在承受该减值时再次失败，该减值增加到-2。该持续时间基于目标的意志豁免。在尝试其豁免后，该生物会暂时面意思24小时。

大成功 目标不受影响。

成功 该持续时间为1轮。

失败 该持续时间为10分钟。

大失败 该持续时间为24小时。

usIMO5SmssEYlw1a.name: 狂笑术(随意施法) Hideous Laughter (At Will)
usIMO5SmssEYlw1a.description:
目标突然充满无法控制的笑意。它必须尝试一次意志豁免。

大成功 目标不受影响。

成功 目标受苦于失控的笑意。它无法使用反应动作。

失败 目标 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1}，并且无法使用反应动作。

大失败 目标 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{倒地 Prone}，并且无法使用动作或反应动作，持续1轮。然后它会承受失败的效果。

HYQnPm7xqWXqvWNi.name: 盲目野心(随意施法) Blind Ambition (At Will)
HYQnPm7xqWXqvWNi.description:
你强化了目标的野心，放大了它对盟友的抱怨，并令其更易被策反。目标必须尝试一次意志豁免。

大成功 目标不受影响。

成功 目标在其豁免骰和其他对胁迫（Coerce）、提出请求（Request）、或者说服他做某事的心灵效果（例如 @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.qwlh6aDgi86U3Q7H]{暗示术 Suggestion} ）的防御上承受-1状态减值。仅当目标被鼓励推进其野心的时候，该减值才会生效。

失败 如同成功，但该减值为-2。

大失败 目标被其野心所吞没，认为任何推动自身利益的行动都高于任何他人，你甚至无需说服目标。

szbtX0OvOcuhJmwr.name: 恐惧术(随意施法) Fear (At Will)
szbtX0OvOcuhJmwr.description:
你将恐惧植入目标；它必须尝试一次意志豁免。

大成功 目标不受影响。

成功 目标获得 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 1}.

失败 目标获得 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 2}.

大失败 目标获得 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 3} 并且 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{逃跑 Fleeing} 1轮.

升阶 (3环级) 你能以至多五个生物为目标。

TuTut6BPwHgd3Xp7.name: Emotional Focus
TuTut6BPwHgd3Xp7.description: The quelaunt can cast the following cleric domain spells as 8th-level occult innate spells at will without spending Focus Points: @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.Dj44lViYKvOJ8a53]{Blind Ambition}, @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.jJphHQlENHFlSElH]{Captivating Adoration}, and @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.J8pL8yTshga8QOk8]{Delusional Pride}.

ady0G6RCsUbZ7gev.name: Emotional Frenzy
ady0G6RCsUbZ7gev.description: The quelaunt casts up to three spells chosen from its at-will innate spells and its emotional focus spells.

AjYmWzjrt54sexgk.name: Feed on Emotion
AjYmWzjrt54sexgk.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The quelaunt feeds on the emotional unrest of a single creature within 30 feet that's under a harmful emotion effect. The target must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:37|traits:damaging-effect] save or take [[/r {4d10}[mental]]]{4d10 mental damage} and be @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned} for 1 round. If the target fails its saving throw, the quelaunt regains the same number of Hit Points and Feed on Emotion does not cost the quelaunt an action, allowing it to use another action this turn.

XIYonpEs96Js86vZ.name: Rapid Strikes
XIYonpEs96Js86vZ.description: The quelaunt makes three melee Strikes, each against a different target within reach. The multiple attack penalty applies to each attack, but increases only after all the attacks have been made.

p90CXzyif81DD51u.name: Spiral of Despair
p90CXzyif81DD51u.description:
Trigger A creature fails a saving throw to resist one of the quelaunt's innate spells or emotional focus spells.

Effect As the quelaunt invades the triggering creature's mind and plants the seeds of negative emotions, it also strips away the target's feelings of hope or positivity. The quelaunt can immediately end a single emotion effect from which the triggering creature is benefiting.

Quetzalcoatlus.name: 风神翼龙 Quetzalcoatlus
Quetzalcoatlus.publicNotes:
Quetzalcoatlus are the largest flying members of the pterosaur family and are often mistaken for dragons due to their immense size and 40-foot wingspans.

Quetzalcoatlus are carnivorous, feeding on a variety of reptiles, mammals, large fish, amphibians, and other invertebrates. They are not inherently aggressive creatures and are happy to scavenge for food, but when presented with live prey they readily attack almost any creature smaller than themselves.

Pterosaurs are primitive flying creatures. While many are smaller than a human, the two presented below are quite a bit larger. Each of these creatures could pose a serious threat to a person. These flying reptiles can be found in a wide selection of regions, but they tend to soar above warm or temperate climates.

JEBTVmt5rc6G8tOb.name: Snatch
JEBTVmt5rc6G8tOb.description: A quetzalcoatlus can move at half Speed while it has a single creature @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}. Both its talons are occupied while it does this.

I7qCrIGJsKvrguZB.name: Swoop
I7qCrIGJsKvrguZB.description: The quetzacoaltus Flies up to its Speed and makes one beak or talon Strike at any point during that movement.

Raja Rakshasa.name: 罗刹王 Raja Rakshasa
Raja Rakshasa.allSaves: 在所有对魔法的豁免上获得+2状态加值，在所有对神术魔法的豁免上获得+3状态加值
Raja Rakshasa.publicNotes:
当没有伪装成人形时，罗刹王有着一颗动物脑袋。而罗刹王的手更是微妙得令人感到不安，这些魔族的手指向外弯曲，远离手掌。

与其他类型的罗刹相比，罗刹王对于宗教的嘲笑更甚。他们懂得神术的力量，却自认为自己才是唯一值得凡人崇拜的事物；甚至连他们中的那些鬼仙们也不配得到这样的荣耀。罗刹王常常会组成紧密的家族一同工作，来摧毁凡人的城市，或是在其阴影之中统治他们。这类罗刹的家族经常会混有其他种类的魔族，常常会将毒噬罗刹当做宠侍或者秘密间谍。尽管一个罗刹王家族会为了一个共同的目标而齐心协力，但是内部的勾心斗角和相互背叛总一把悬在头顶的尖刀。

罗刹是邪恶的精魂，他们披上类人生物的伪装，悄然行走于猎物之中。他们是大多数社会中被视为禁忌之事的具现，伪装成那些他们寻求玷污的形态，罗刹以这些丑恶的行径为食而狼吞虎咽着。罗刹的种类繁多；下面所介绍的是矮小、残忍的毒噬罗刹和臭名昭著的罗刹王，他们是这些魔族中最为普遍和常见的。

uZdepeycCi1DBYTW.name: 在所有对魔法的豁免上获得+2状态加值 +2 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

wbhIx2xtiqZn73im.name: 在所有对神术魔法的豁免上获得+3状态加值 +3 Status to All Saves vs. Divine Magic

fTBOn2wHEnOkR4t9.name: 嗤笑神力 Scoff at the Divine
fTBOn2wHEnOkR4t9.description:
触发 30尺内的一个生物施放神术魔法或者使用神术能力

需求 罗刹王拥有一个未被使用的法术位可以来施放@Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{解除魔法 Dispel Magic}

效果 罗刹王消耗一个可以用于施放解除魔法的法术位，并且尝试反制触发的法术或能力。

罗刹王无法在[[/br 1d4 #Recharge Scoff at the Divine]]{1d4轮}内再次使用嗤笑神力。

0lFm2C1Slc60GuoD.name: 化形 Change Shape
0lFm2C1Slc60GuoD.description: 罗刹王获得任意中型类人生物的外观。这不会改变罗刹王的速度或是打击中攻击和伤害的调整值，但是可能会改变其打击所造成的伤害类型（通常变为钝击）。他通常会失去尖牙打击，除非该类人形态拥有尖牙或者类似的无武装攻击。

fvIjW0iSvoVCNnVG.name: 扰心幻视 Disturbing Vision
fvIjW0iSvoVCNnVG.description:
罗刹王的双眼中闪烁着绿色的光芒，投射出一股覆盖@Template[type:emanation|distance:30]范围的心灵波动。在该区域中的所有生物都将受到来自于罗刹前世那邪恶堕落的幻视的袭扰。该区域内所有非邪恶生物必须成功通过一次@Check[type:will|dc:29]检定，否则陷入@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 1}（在大失败时候还将@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{震慑 Stunned 1}）。幻视持续[[/br 1d4 #Disturbing Visions Duration]]{1d4轮}，并且在此期间，罗刹王和该范围内的所有邪恶生物在所有的检定骰上获得+1状态加值。罗刹王只有在前一次幻视结束后才能再次使用此能力。

@Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-effects.AThOnEYzPO9ssYTB]{效果：扰心乱视}

20rnB59A7ShaRC2n.name: 异能自发法术 Occult Spontaneous Spells

eEwJYKPQM7YTAFt4.name: 异能内在法术 Occult Innate Spells

Vhko4H8tQF1ajGbF.name: 飞行术 Fly
Vhko4H8tQF1ajGbF.description:
目标能够在空气中穿梭，获得等于其速度或者20尺的飞行速度，取较高者。

升阶 (7环) 该持续时间增加到1小时。

EzBWZa36185FReyi.name: 读心术(随意施法) Mind Reading (At Will)
EzBWZa36185FReyi.description:
你通过一次短暂的心灵接触来尝试阅读目标的想法。它必须尝试一次意志豁免。目标会暂时免疫你的读心术1小时。

大成功 目标得知当施放该法术时你模糊的表层想法。

成功 你得知目标的智力调整值是高于，等于，还是低于你。

失败 你得知当施放该法术时目标模糊的表层想法，并且你得知目标的智力调整值是高于，等于，还是低于你。

大失败 如失败，并且在法术持续时间中，你可以维持该法术来再次侦测目标的表层想法。目标不会获得另外的豁免。

25fkgc61wlnMoIb8.name: 侦测魔法 Detect Magic
25fkgc61wlnMoIb8.description:
你发出一股标记魔法存在的脉冲。你不会获得魔法存在或不存在以外的任何信息。你可以选择忽略你完全知晓的魔法，例如你或者你盟友的魔法物品以及持续法术。

仅当幻术魔法的环级低于你的侦测魔法环级时，你才能侦测幻术魔法。但是，具有幻术灵光但是没有在外表上做伪装的物品（例如一瓶隐形术药水），通常能够正常侦测。

升阶 (3环级) 你会了解法术侦测区域中最高环级的效果的学派。如果有相同强度的多个效果，GM决定你了解的为哪一个。

升阶 (4环级) 如3环级，你也能指出最高环级魔法的来源。如同一种模糊感官（imprecise sense），你不会了解具体的位置，但是可以将来源锁定到5尺立方（或者最近的那个五尺立方，如果来源体积比这个区域更大）。

Rat Swarm.name: 鼠群 Rat Swarm
Rat Swarm.publicNotes:
A swarm of rats can cause total chaos within a household or business. Contracting filth fever is all the easier when dozens of these agitated or hungry vermin gather to bite victims en masse, making rat-hunting a viable career in many parts of the world as desperate townspeople seek relief from the disease's spread.

Giant rats are enormous versions of the common vermin. They are typically found in abundant numbers, but since they cannot fit in the nooks where mundane rats typically hide, they are much easier to locate and exterminate. They mostly live in sewers where they can scavenge from the streets above, but some families of giant rats live in more remote locations, such as dank caves or forests and hills. Rats are incredibly adept survivors and can be found nearly anywhere in the world, though they tend to favor temperate or warm climates as opposed to cold regions.

Although its bite alone is not lethal except to the very young or very old, the giant rat carries the filth fever common to rodents around the world-a pestilence more than capable of ravaging rural communities.

DiGgJNOY5Na3eYp8.name: Filth Fever
DiGgJNOY5Na3eYp8.description:
The @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened} and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} conditions from filth fever don't improve on their own until the disease is cured.

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:14]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect ([[/br 1d4 #hours]]{1d4 hours})

Stage 2 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (1 day)

Stage 3 Sickened 1 and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} (1 day)

Stage 4 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} (1 day)

Stage 5 dead

LTwSnVSVWZeWrLAC.name: Swarming Bites
LTwSnVSVWZeWrLAC.description: Each enemy in the swarm's space takes [[/r {1d6}[piercing]]]{1d6 piercing damage} and must attempt a @Check[type:reflex|dc:17|basic:true] save. A creature that fails its save is exposed to filth fever.

Ratfolk Grenadier.name: 鼠族掷弹兵 Ratfolk Grenadier
Ratfolk Grenadier.publicNotes:
Ratfolk grenadiers use alchemy and stealth to defend their communities.

True to their name, ratfolk are rodent-like humanoids well suited to living on the outskirts of mainstream society. Despite common misconceptions that they are dirty or diseased, ysoki, as they call themselves, keep impeccably clean. Ratfolk are also sometimes mistaken for wererats and initially treated with fear until they can correct the mistaken identification-if they get the chance to do so.

In general, ratfolk have a keen understanding of pathological and alchemical sciences, which they employ in trade and self-defense. They make accomplished alchemists and tinkerers, and they often protect their lairs with traps, bombs, and other creations. Ratfolk merchants regularly dispatch large trade caravans that travel widely for a year or more before returning to their home community. During this time they make an effort to learn new things from the people they encounter and collect new, interesting materials and goods that they can bring back to their warrens.
