The adept must still Cast the Spell and meet the spell's other requirements.

Troll.name: 巨魔 Troll
Troll.publicNotes:
Common trolls are dim-witted, gangly giants who stalk the fringes of civilization. They rely on their incredible strength to overpower foes with their vicious claws and toothy maws. A troll's endless hunger drives it to consume all variety of living creatures, and it is their ravenous eating habits that fuel trolls' legendary regenerative abilities. Trolls stand anywhere from 12 to 16 feet tall, though they prefer to hunch for comfort and to lull foes into a false sense of security.

Slavering, cruel, practically invincible brutes: this is the villager's stock description for the dread monsters known as trolls. But words hardly do justice to trolls' capacity for destruction. They are as bloodthirsty as orcs but lacking the discipline, as massive as giants but capable of regenerating wounded flesh in an instant, and as reprobate as ogres but with twice the strength. The only way to really understand the wanton violence of a troll is to experience it firsthand-a fate few would wish even upon their worst enemies.

The first thing that comes to mind when most think of trolls is the creatures' power of bodily regeneration. So potent is this regeneration that the only way to overcome it is to exploit the troll's vulnerability to acid and fire. It is not enough to slay the troll with caustic or flaming weapons, though-even the smallest scrap of a troll's flesh can regenerate into a full-size troll given enough time. The only sure way to eradicate a troll menace is to burn the monster's entire body until nothing remains.

Trolls are solitary hunters, for their wickedness is anathema even to other giants. They occasionally roam in small gangs of two to four, but only when prey is plentiful or a particularly strong counterforce has broached their hunting grounds. In rare instances, an old and powerful troll comes to lead small tribes of trolls. Such "troll kings" possess enough cunning to lead their hordes in devastating raids and massacres, and their presence permanently alters the surrounding ecosystem. A wide variety of trolls exist, from the terrible monster traditionally associated with the name to the water-dwelling scrag and hybrid flood troll. Regional variations exist as well-mountain trolls among stony peaks, for instance, or moss trolls in swampy bayous-but all share the same trademark regenerative powers and insatiable thirst for blood.

6WolzdmuMWdkmSpl.name: 借机攻击 Attack of Opportunity

Troll King.name: 巨魔之王 Troll King
Troll King.publicNotes:
Some trolls have learned the skills necessary to survive well beyond the typical life expectancy for their kind and rally others to follow their lead. These champions develop a number of talents that make them worthy leaders and potent hunters-namely their abilities to willingly boost the rate of their regeneration and to shake off the acid and fire that would hinder it, not to mention a bestial roar that can send would-be predators scurrying off. Troll kings possess a cunning far beyond their younger kin- they know to keep their allies close, and their enemies even closer. If a troll king so much as suspects that one of its followers is plotting to usurp it, retribution is swift and fatal.

Slavering, cruel, practically invincible brutes: this is the villager's stock description for the dread monsters known as trolls. But words hardly do justice to trolls' capacity for destruction. They are as bloodthirsty as orcs but lacking the discipline, as massive as giants but capable of regenerating wounded flesh in an instant, and as reprobate as ogres but with twice the strength. The only way to really understand the wanton violence of a troll is to experience it firsthand-a fate few would wish even upon their worst enemies.

The first thing that comes to mind when most think of trolls is the creatures' power of bodily regeneration. So potent is this regeneration that the only way to overcome it is to exploit the troll's vulnerability to acid and fire. It is not enough to slay the troll with caustic or flaming weapons, though-even the smallest scrap of a troll's flesh can regenerate into a full-size troll given enough time. The only sure way to eradicate a troll menace is to burn the monster's entire body until nothing remains.

Trolls are solitary hunters, for their wickedness is anathema even to other giants. They occasionally roam in small gangs of two to four, but only when prey is plentiful or a particularly strong counterforce has broached their hunting grounds. In rare instances, an old and powerful troll comes to lead small tribes of trolls. Such "troll kings" possess enough cunning to lead their hordes in devastating raids and massacres, and their presence permanently alters the surrounding ecosystem. A wide variety of trolls exist, from the terrible monster traditionally associated with the name to the water-dwelling scrag and hybrid flood troll. Regional variations exist as well-mountain trolls among stony peaks, for instance, or moss trolls in swampy bayous-but all share the same trademark regenerative powers and insatiable thirst for blood.

g4bJ3hTpL9J2uQKp.name: 借机攻击 Attack of Opportunity

zDDzvsB3OrJU9QXn.name: Vigorous Shake
zDDzvsB3OrJU9QXn.description:
Trigger The troll king takes @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent} acid or fire damage.

Effect The troll king shakes itself to remove persistent acid or fire effects. The troll king immediately attempts a @Check[type:flat|dc:15] check to end the persistent damage that triggered this reaction. If the troll king succeeds at this check, it can immediately use Primordial Roar as part of this reaction.

czVzxuwWmCRLgnuc.name: Forced Regeneration
czVzxuwWmCRLgnuc.description:
Requirements The troll king's regeneration is not currently deactivated.

Effect The troll king regains [[/r {15}[healing]]]{15 HP}.

3wMfK5zZSqFhhTgs.name: Primordial Roar
3wMfK5zZSqFhhTgs.description:
The troll king unleashes a bestial roar. Each non-troll creature within @Template[type:emanation|distance:100]{100 feet} must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:29] save. The creature is then temporarily immune for 10 minutes.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}

Failure The creature is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}

Critical Failure The creature is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3}

8xYRzzHeY6uZztPe.name: Unstoppable Charge
8xYRzzHeY6uZztPe.description: The troll king Strides twice in a straight line. It can make up to two claw Strikes during this movement and one jaws Strike at the end of its movement. It can't Strike the same creature more than once.

Tiger.name: 老虎 Tiger
Tiger.publicNotes:
Tigers are solitary and territorial hunters, using their striped hides to blend into the forests and jungles they call home and preferring to attack with surprise.

Few predators of the natural world can match the cat's talent for stalking and stealth.

blGUawuZyyQVnVXf.name: Pounce
blGUawuZyyQVnVXf.description: The tiger Strides and makes a Strike at the end of that movement. If the tiger began this action @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, it remains hidden until after this ability's Strike.

G3Hz9uWIYCEyoBRq.name: 偷袭 Sneak Attack
G3Hz9uWIYCEyoBRq.description:
The tiger deals 1d6 extra precision damage to flat-footed creatures.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.SneakAttack]

g51BzhmOH3vHLWup.name: Wrestle
g51BzhmOH3vHLWup.description: The tiger makes a claw Strike against a creature it is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbing}. If the attack hits, that creature is knocked @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Tyrannosaurus.name: 暴龙 Tyrannosaurus
Tyrannosaurus.senses: 昏暗视觉，嗅觉（模糊感官）30尺
Tyrannosaurus.publicNotes:
暴龙被认为是一般意义上的恐龙之王，它是巨大的掠食者，嘴巴宽大，牙齿锋利无比。暴龙被愤怒和饥饿驱使，是大胆无畏的食肉动物，它们会贪婪地大口咬下大型猎物的肉块，或者一口吞下较小的猎物，比如大多数人类。虽然暴龙可以吃腐肉生存，但它们更偏爱活物。

暴龙用两条粗壮有力的后腿站立，这使它们跑得很快，而它们粗壮的尾巴为它们提供了优良的平衡能力。虽然它们退化的前爪除了在用嘴撕扯猎物的时候起到固定作用以外很少被用到，但是前段也有锋利的尖爪。暴龙单独行动时就够可怕了，但是它们有时也会成群捕食，以杀死更大体型的猎物。只有最强大的生物才能成功驯服暴龙，即便如此，它们也需要为这头贪婪的猛兽提供大量肉食来喂养。

一些巨人部落，尤其是独眼巨人，或是位于原始大陆不为人所知的居民，甚至会训练暴龙称为坐骑或战兽。在其他地方，修格斯用囚犯喂养这些强大的恐龙，作为处决或祭祀仪式的一部分。一些修格斯教派甚至崇拜暴龙，将它们视为暴力的恶魔般的半神。在这些情况下，这些被饲养长大的暴龙已经习惯被人投喂，对喂养者和驯兽师的态度表现得较为友好。暴龙身长50尺，体重达到7吨以上。

暴龙的其他变种中，体型要稍微小些的有异龙（allosaurus），体型更大的有南巨龙（giganotosaurus）。即便是体型最小的暴龙，例如矮暴龙（nanotyrannus），其体型也不会小于大型。然而尽管他们体型要小一圈，但是它们的凶猛程度却不亚于暴龙，那些认为矮暴龙训练起来“更安全”的人应该三思！

这些巨大的爬行动物是世界原始时代的遗留物，现在仍然大量存在于偏僻的荒野中，或者在黑暗之地Darklands 的地下魔法洞穴中。蜥蜴族、半兽人、巨人和其他人形生物有时会把恐龙当作坐骑、守卫或猎兽。众所周知，人类和其他族裔也收集恐龙，把它们放在动物园里展出，或把它们当作异域宠物或守卫。这通常是富人或怪咖喜欢干的事情，但确实也有一些德鲁伊和其他自然的守护者能与恐龙亲密相处，甚至把它们作为动物伙伴。当恐龙在它们正常栖息地以外的地区安家时，通常可能是因为被圈养的恐龙逃进荒野造成的。

r0zMXxalwdgrXzf3.name: 嗅觉（模糊感官）30尺 Scent (Imprecise) 30 feet

24g2FSPaGiTvJB6C.name: 抛掷 Fling
24g2FSPaGiTvJB6C.description:
需求 一个生物被暴龙擒抱在嘴里。

效果 暴龙把嘴里的生物扔到离它嘴10英尺高，20英尺远的空中。目标生物视为坠落25尺（假设暴龙尽可能高地将目标扔到高处），并承受相应的坠落伤害。如果该生物落在另一个生物身上，则被砸中的生物将受到相同数量的钝击伤害。被砸中的生物可以通过@Check[type:reflex|dc:23|basic:true]豁免来躲避。

9gYASQQf328TmVpW.name: 摁死 Pin Prey
9gYASQQf328TmVpW.description:
触发 暴龙用脚踩对大型或更小体型的敌人造成重击。

效果 暴龙脚踩打击命中的生物@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{倒地 Prone}，并且暴龙用它的脚踩牢牢把敌人摁在当前的方格里。只要暴龙一直不移动，被摁死的生物视同被@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{擒抱 Grabbed}。暴龙对被摁死的目标的攻击检定有+2环境加值，但是此时暴龙无法对其使用活吞能力，除非暴龙用嘴咬的方式@Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Tkd8sH4pwFIPzqTr]{擒抱 Grab}目标。

Unicorn.name: 独角兽 Unicorn
Unicorn.publicNotes:
Symbols of grace and purity, unicorns resemble proud and noble horses. They are typically pure white of coat, but they are best known for the single, delicate horn that extends from the center of their forehead. While unicorns often serve as protectors of unspoiled wilderness and sacred places, they are themselves highly sought after for their horns, which are said to possess potent magical properties. To many, the mere idea of hunting such a magnificent creature in the hopes of severing its horn is utterly reprehensible. Indeed, a de-horned unicorn is a sorry sight, and few such unicorns survive much longer in the wild.

Unicorns are found almost exclusively in remote, unsullied areas of wilderness. Sometimes associated with good-aligned deities, other times associated with nature and the fey, unicorns are always known for their righteousness and nobility. They are wary, at best, of most humanoid creatures, due in large part for poachers' tendency to hunt them for their horns, but unicorns are often rumored to have a weakness for those who are pure of both heart and spirit. Despite some tales, unicorns are equally likely to recognize purity in young men as in young women.

XHYldAxPYwosrcOh.name: 侦测阵营(随意施法,仅限善良) Detect Alignment (At Will) (Good Only)
XHYldAxPYwosrcOh.description:
当你感受到阵营灵光时，视野中会闪动光芒。选择混乱，邪恶，善良或者秩序。你侦测该阵营的灵光。你不会获得存在或不存在以外的任何信息。你可以选择不侦测你知晓已经有该阵营的生物或者效果。

只有6或者更高等级的生物具有阵营灵光——除非是神术施法者，不死生物，或者外层位面（Outer Sphere的存在）。

升阶 (2环级) 你能了解到各个灵光的位置和强度。

QL3594a7048GPCem.name: Wild Empathy
QL3594a7048GPCem.description: The unicorn has a connection to the creatures of the natural world that allows it to communicate with them. The unicorn can use Diplomacy to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.OX4fy22hQgUHDr0q]{Make an Impression} on animals and to make very simple @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.DCb62iCBrJXy0Ik6]{Requests} of them.

vNaUr8lkk7o1zXWJ.name: Ghost Touch
vNaUr8lkk7o1zXWJ.description: A unicorn's Strikes have the effects of a @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.JQdwHECogcTzdd8R]{Ghost Touch} property rune.

65E6IqqYN0IW2HsH.name: Powerful Charge
65E6IqqYN0IW2HsH.description: The unicorn Strides up to double its Speed in a straight line and then makes a horn Strike. If the unicorn moved at least 20 feet, it deals an additional [[/r {2d6}]]{2d6 damage} on a hit.

Vampire Bat Swarm.name: 吸血蝙蝠群 Vampire Bat Swarm
Vampire Bat Swarm.publicNotes:
Although the typical vampire bat has a wingspan of 7 inches and doesn't pose a significant threat to larger prey alone (and indeed, these blood-drinkers can feed without their sleeping victims ever noticing), some unusually aggressive species of these bats hunt in deadly swarms. A churning cloud of vampire bats is much more dangerous than the sum of its individual parts and is capable of inflicting an overwhelming number of bleeding wounds in a frighteningly short span of time.

A wide range of bats dwell throughout the world. Most of these nocturnal animals are harmless insectivores, but deadly breeds of vampire bats and oversized bats the size of horses pose much more significant threats to adventurers.

7P4VEdy4KccmQ5Gp.name: Echolocation (Precise) 20 feet
7P4VEdy4KccmQ5Gp.description: A bat swarm can use its hearing as a precise sense at the listed range.

ydBVkEJ8CwcPFkPB.name: Blood Feast
ydBVkEJ8CwcPFkPB.description: Each enemy in the bat swarm's space takes [[/r {1d4}[piercing]]]{1d4 piercing damage} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:16|basic:true] save). Creatures that fail this save also take [[/r {1}[persistent,bleed]]] @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Bleed Damage}.

Vampire Mastermind.name: 吸血鬼阴谋家 Vampire Mastermind
Vampire Mastermind.hp: coffin restoration, fast healing 10, negative healing
Vampire Mastermind.publicNotes:
Vampire masterminds are evil wizards who control entire cabals of the undead and instill fear in the hearts of mortals far and wide.

Vampires are undead creatures that feed on the blood of the living.

rjvFPfDJN8mX263J.name: 支配术() Dominate (At Will) (See Dominate)
rjvFPfDJN8mX263J.description:
你操控目标，强行令其服从你的命令。如果你赋予一项明显是自灭的命令，目标不会行动，直到你下达新的命令。该效果基于其意志豁免。

大成功 目标不受影响。

成功 目标 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{震慑 Stunned 1} 以抵抗你的命令。

失败 你控制了目标，其获得 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.9qGBRpbX9NEwtAAr]{被控制 Controlled} 状态，但在每轮结束时可以尝试一次意志豁免。成功时，法术结束。

大失败 如同失败，但是仅当你施加违抗其天性的命令，例如杀害其盟友时，才会获得新的豁免。

升阶 (10环级) 该持续时间为无限。

8QxvgR5NK6o14S5W.name: 侦测魔法 Detect Magic
8QxvgR5NK6o14S5W.description:
你发出一股标记魔法存在的脉冲。你不会获得魔法存在或不存在以外的任何信息。你可以选择忽略你完全知晓的魔法，例如你或者你盟友的魔法物品以及持续法术。

仅当幻术魔法的环级低于你的侦测魔法环级时，你才能侦测幻术魔法。但是，具有幻术灵光但是没有在外表上做伪装的物品（例如一瓶隐形术药水），通常能够正常侦测。

升阶 (3环级) 你会了解法术侦测区域中最高环级的效果的学派。如果有相同强度的多个效果，GM决定你了解的为哪一个。

升阶 (4环级) 如3环级，你也能指出最高环级魔法的来源。如同一种模糊感官（imprecise sense），你不会了解具体的位置，但是可以将来源锁定到5尺立方（或者最近的那个五尺立方，如果来源体积比这个区域更大）。

iXb7tKWBWggVVxpq.name: Fleet Step
iXb7tKWBWggVVxpq.description:
You gain a +30-foot status bonus to your Speed.

@Compendium[pf2e.spell-effects.ThFug45WHkQQXcoF]{Spell Effect: Fleet Step}

I0GaQls3ghJMJ5Ib.name: Children of the Night
I0GaQls3ghJMJ5Ib.description:
The vampire's presence brings forth creatures of the night to do the master's bidding. These typically include @Compendium[pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.sPClc6y3dT3XZupv]{Rat Swarms}, @Compendium[pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.VAWmwDA08ZLQd8lW]{Bat Swarms}, and @Compendium[pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.Oilfs8Atv2LjAsUS]{Wolves}, but can include other creatures.

The vampire can give telepathic orders to these creatures as long as they are within 100 feet, but they can't communicate back.

9iYmbVoVyCe6SNu9.name: Coffin Restoration
9iYmbVoVyCe6SNu9.description: Unlike other undead, a vampire isn't destroyed at 0 HP. Instead, it falls @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}. If its body rests in its coffin for 1 hour, the vampire gains 1 HP, after which its @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.fJSNOw4zHGbIm4bZ]{Fast Healing} begins to function normally.

S7Khn0wjpXjjyPAp.name: Mist Escape
S7Khn0wjpXjjyPAp.description:
Trigger The vampire is reduced to 0 HP.

Effect The vampire uses Turn to Mist. It can take move actions to move toward its coffin even though it's at 0 HP. While at 0 HP in this form, the vampire is unaffected by further damage.

It automatically returns to its corporeal form, unconscious, if it reaches its coffin or after 2 hours, whichever comes first.

GXr4u9s0uuvI5J6d.name: Vampire Weaknesses
GXr4u9s0uuvI5J6d.description:
All vampires possess the following weaknesses.

  • Compulsions Vampires are creatures of strange and unknowable compulsions. A typical vampire can't voluntarily cross running water unless it is transported while it hides within its coffin, nor can it enter a private dwelling unless invited in by someone with the authority to do so. At your discretion, vampires might have different compulsions-a pirate vampire might not be able to set foot on solid ground without being invited, for example. The vampire can still be forced to do these things and might be able to overcome its compulsion just as it does its revulsion.
  • Revulsion A vampire can't voluntarily come within 10 feet of brandished garlic or a brandished religious symbol of a non-evil deity. To brandish garlic or a religious symbol, a creature must Interact to do so for 1 round (similar to Raising a Shield). If the vampire involuntarily comes within 10 feet of an object of its revulsion, it gains the @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} condition, running from the object of its revulsion until it ends an action beyond 10 feet. After 1 round of being exposed to the subject of its revulsion, a vampire can attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:25|name:Overcome Revulsion] save as a single action, which has the concentrate trait. On a success, it overcomes its revulsions for [[/br 1d6 #rounds]]{1d6 rounds} (or 1 hour on a critical success).
  • Stake A wooden stake driven through a vampire's heart drops the vampire to 0 HP and prevents it from healing above 0 HP, even in its coffin. Staking a vampire requires three actions and works only if the vampire is unconscious. If the stake is removed, the vampire can heal above 0 HP again, and if it's in its coffin the 1-hour rest period begins once the stake is removed. If the vampire's head is severed and anointed with @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.z9T4c1hXwOotsMCp]{Holy Water} while the stake is in place, the vampire is destroyed.
  • Sunlight If exposed to direct sunlight, a vampire immediately becomes @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}. The slowed value increases by 1 each time the vampire ends its turn in sunlight. If the vampire loses all its actions in this way, it is destroyed. Due to their supernatural aversion to light, vampires don't cast shadows or show a reflection in mirrors.

zEz9gGlpNBUnyF2Y.name: Change Shape
zEz9gGlpNBUnyF2Y.description:
The vampire transforms into its animal form or back into its normal form.

  • Bat The vampire changes into a @Compendium[pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.C9s5tBxVValC2HTE]{Giant Bat}
    • Size Large
    • Senses Echolocation 40 feet
    • Speed 20 feet, fly 30 feet
    • Melee fangs [[/r 1d20+19 #Fangs]]{+19}/[[/r 1d20+14 #Fangs]]{+14}/[[/r 1d20+9 #Fangs]]{+9}, Damage [[/r {2d8+9}[piercing]]]{2d8+9 piercing damage}

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

czqtIybNHs8mmEeg.name: Create Spawn
czqtIybNHs8mmEeg.description:
If a creature dies after being reduced to 0 HP by Drink Blood, the vampire can turn this victim into a vampire by donating some of its own blood to the victim and burying the victim in earth for 3 nights.

If the new vampire is lower level than its creator, it is under the creator's control. If a vampire controls too many spawn at once (as determined by the GM), strong-willed spawn can free themselves by succeeding at a @Check[type:will|name:Escape Thralldom] saving throw against the vampire's Will DC.

3ZSVEZBMKleuEd84.name: Dominate
3ZSVEZBMKleuEd84.description:
The vampire can cast @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.OsOhx3TGIZ7AhD0P]{Dominate} at will as a divine innate spell. Casting it requires staring into the target's eyes, giving the spell the visual trait. The save DC uses the DC of the vampire's level, and a creature that succeeds is temporarily immune to that vampire's Dominate for 24 hours.

Fully destroying the vampire ends the domination, but merely reducing the vampire to 0 HP is insufficient to break the spell.

9ewh7tMyC0NRIpZx.name: Drain Bonded Item
9ewh7tMyC0NRIpZx.description:
Frequency Once per day.

Requirements The vampire hasn't acted yet on this turn.

Effect The vampire expends the power stored in its signet ring. This gives the vampire the ability to cast one prepared spell it had already previously cast today, without spending a spell slot. The vampire must still Cast the Spell and meet the spell's other requirements.

HhkalK1aMfqDSiWQ.name: Drink Blood
HhkalK1aMfqDSiWQ.description:
Requirement A @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}, @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}, @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}, or willing creature is within the vampire's reach.

Effect The vampire sinks its fangs into that creature to drink its blood. This requires an Athletics check against the victim's Fortitude DC if the victim is grabbed and is automatic for any of the other conditions.

The victim is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} and the vampire regains [[/r {10}[healing]]]{10 Hit Points}, gaining any excess HP as temporary Hit Points. Drinking Blood from a creature that's already drained doesn't restore any HP to the vampire but increases the victim's drain value by 1. A vampire can also consume blood that's been emptied into a vessel for sustenance, but it gains no HP from doing so.

A victim's drained condition decreases by 1 per week. A blood transfusion, which requires a @Check[type:medicine|dc:20|name:Blood Transfusion] check and sufficient blood or a blood donor, reduces the drain by 1 after 10 minutes.

DD9mP7VmHRk4Lm97.name: Steady Spellcasting
DD9mP7VmHRk4Lm97.description: If another creature's reaction would disrupt the vampire mastermind's spellcasting action, the vampire attempts a @Check[type:flat|dc:15] check. If the vampire succeeds, its action isn't disrupted.

zl24K9E3qEAfVXrR.name: Turn to Mist
zl24K9E3qEAfVXrR.description:
The vampire turns into a cloud of vapor, as the @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.V8wXOsoejQhe6CyG]{Gaseous Form} spell, or back to its normal form. The vampire loses @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.fJSNOw4zHGbIm4bZ]{Fast Healing} while in gaseous form.

The vampire can remain in this form indefinitely.

Tor Linnorm.name: 岩山蛇龙 Tor Linnorm
Tor Linnorm.speed: +1 status to all saves vs. magic
Tor Linnorm.publicNotes:
Tor linnorms dwell in the tallest volcanic mountains, either within natural formed caverns or within molten craters. A tor linnorm's temper can be as hot and destructive as the magma the creature resembles.

Immense, primeval dragons of the northern reaches of the world, linnorms hate those they deem to be lesser creatures and seek to inflict as much suffering as possible upon their unfortunate victims. While these serpentine monstrosities might not be the powerful winged dragons most imagine, they nonetheless possess incredible strength and deadly powers that often rival authentic dragon brutality.

g4YpY2bku4a31XWO.name: 真视术(恒定法术) True Seeing (Constant)
g4YpY2bku4a31XWO.description: 你可以看见60尺内的事物的本来面貌。GM秘密骰反制检定，对抗区域中的所有幻术或者变形效果，但这只会决定你是否能看破它（例如，如果该检定成功对抗了一个变形法术，你可以看见该生物的本来形态，但你不会结束该变形法术）。

YPkNYxysmFk49ni2.name: 行动自如(恒定法术) Freedom of Movement (Constant)
YPkNYxysmFk49ni2.description: 你驱散可能会阻碍一个生物或者令其移动减慢的效果。当处于该法术效果中时，法术目标忽视会赋予其速度环境减值的效果。当法术目标尝试 @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{逃脱 Escape} 一个令其 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{禁足 Immobilized}, @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{擒抱 Grabbed}或 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{束缚 Restrained}的效果时，它自动成功，除非该效果是魔法性的，并且其环级比行动自如更高。

fEbZopQgOxVNZDnI.name: 借机攻击 Attack of Opportunity

zLUOcpj85OOnwvRh.name: Curse of Boiling Blood
zLUOcpj85OOnwvRh.description:
When a creature slays a tor linnorm, it must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:48] save or permanently gain weakness to fire 20 and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} from the agonizing pain it now endures at all times. As long as a character continues to suffer this curse, its slowed condition can never be reduced below slowed 1.

@Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-effects.CUgmb7g65vYNT2hn]{Effect: Curse of Boiling Blood}

mgb2nO0WkJsnZogZ.name: Lava Affinity
mgb2nO0WkJsnZogZ.description: A tor linnorm can breathe and swim freely while submerged in lava and magma.

JvFUFSxHH2EThNAC.name: Breath Weapon
JvFUFSxHH2EThNAC.description:
The tor linnorm expels a @Template[type:cone|distance:60] of flame and ash dealing [[/r {20d6}[fire]]]{20d6 fire damage} to creatures within the area (@Check[type:reflex|dc:46|basic:true] save). At the start of the tor linnorm's next turn, the area affected by the breath weapon is covered in thick, scorching smoke that burns both the lungs and eyes, dealing an additional [[/r {10d6}[fire]]]{10d6 fire damage} to all creatures in the area (@Check[type:reflex|dc:46|basic:true] save). A creature that spends an entire round in the smoke with open eyes must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:44] save or is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 minute. The smoke dissipates after 1 minute; in strong winds, the smoke dissipates in 5 rounds, and in more powerful winds, it may clear even more quickly.

The tor linnorm can't use Breath Weapon again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.

CMfpQM5btdzVWxB5.name: Slashing Claws
CMfpQM5btdzVWxB5.description: A tor linnorm makes four Strikes with its claws, each against a different target. These attacks count toward the tor linnorm's multiple attack penalty, but the multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after the tor linnorm makes all its attacks.

oeOZCitfRoZXCLfy.name: Tor Linnorm Venom
oeOZCitfRoZXCLfy.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:44]

Maximum Duration 10 rounds

Stage 1 [[/r {8d6}[fire]]]{8d6 fire damage} and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}

Stage 2 [[/r {12d6}[fire]]]{12d6 fire damage} and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2}

War Horse.name: 战马 War Horse
War Horse.senses: 昏暗视觉，嗅觉（模糊感官）30尺
War Horse.publicNotes: 在许多社会中，马都是坐骑和驮兽。它们是忠诚的和典型的温和生物，对于那些想长途旅行的人来说，它们是无价之宝。较小的种族，像侏儒和半身人，经常使用矮种马作为坐骑，而马是人类和其他中型类人所喜欢的坐骑。大多数人类遇到的马都是驯养的，尽管这些强壮动物组成的大型群落可以在野外找到。

g2qQpMZqRaylNASw.name: 嗅觉（模糊感官）30尺 Scent (Imprecise) 30 feet

xeAR997MOrxz4cyA.name: 奔驰 Gallop
xeAR997MOrxz4cyA.description: 战马行走两次，在这些行走中有一个10尺的环境加值。

War Pony.name: 矮种战马 War Pony
War Pony.publicNotes: Horses serve as mounts and beasts of burden in many societies. They are loyal and typically gentle creatures, and they are invaluable to those looking to travel long distances. Smaller folk, like gnomes and halflings, often utilize ponies as mounts, while horses are the favored steeds for humans and other Medium humanoids. Most horses that the average humanoid encounters are domesticated, though large herds of these powerful animals can be found in the wild.

b8kddR2Im2nSOnDM.name: Gallop
b8kddR2Im2nSOnDM.description: The war pony Strides twice. It has a +10-foot circumstance bonus to its Speed during these Strides.

Warg.name: 座狼 Warg
Warg.publicNotes:
Wargs hunt in packs and surround their prey like common wolves, but their cunning and penchant for taunting victims makes them easy to distinguish from their less-intelligent cousins. But despite their intelligence, wargs have simple desires for food and shelter, making them easy for evil humanoids such as orcs and hobgoblins to recruit to protect their camps or join them in battle. Most wargs are amenable to this arrangement, but if food should run out, wargs are more than willing to integrate goblinoid flesh into their diet.

The warg is an intelligent and malevolent wolf that dwells among goblins, hobgoblins, orcs, and other violent humanoids.

z4Mouf0sgt0pO2Vz.name: Avenging Bite
z4Mouf0sgt0pO2Vz.description:
Trigger A creature within reach of the warg's jaws attacks one of the warg's allies.

Effect The warg makes a jaws Strike against the triggering creature.

VfGIlE5o88e6ZuW6.name: Pack Attack
VfGIlE5o88e6ZuW6.description: The warg's Strikes deals an extra [[/r {1d4}]]{1d4 damage} to any creature within reach of at least two of the warg's allies.

Warsworn.name: 战殁巨虫 Warsworn
Warsworn.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. positive
Warsworn.publicNotes: A warsworn is an animate mass of corpses composed of dozens, sometimes even hundreds, of victims of battle. They are formed by deities of undeath or war or, rarely, spontaneously manifest from the devastation of an especially horrendous battle.

QKtfubIn7OYITmUL.name: Animated Weapon
QKtfubIn7OYITmUL.description: Four of the weapon's damage dice +9 of the weapon's damage type.

vhMuwHfxhvT3a6e2.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Positive

vcD6GpR7alODPFzn.name: 借机攻击 Attack of Opportunity

83qHKEXcHOEaa6iS.name: Absorb
83qHKEXcHOEaa6iS.description:
Trigger The warsworn moves into a @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.yZRUzMqrMmfLu0V1]{Dying} creature's space.

Effect The warsworn absorbs the dying creature into itself, instantly killing the creature and healing the warsworn for a number of Hit Points equal to the creature's level. As long as the warsworn still exists, absorbed creatures can't be resurrected except by @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.6dDtGIUerazSHIOu]{Wish} or a similarly powerful effect.

qaGJzO6SddpAXZKg.name: Animated Weapons
qaGJzO6SddpAXZKg.description: The warsworn assumes control of unattended weapons within 100 feet, forcing them to levitate around it. The warsworn can telekinetically wield these weapons to make melee Strikes with a reach of 100 feet.

yLFnxHxGno0eHAjr.name: Energy Drain
yLFnxHxGno0eHAjr.description: When a warsworn hits with a corpse wave Strike or damages a creature with Trample, the target must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:35] save or become @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1}. On a critical success, the target becomes temporarily immune to the warsworn's energy drain for 24 hours.

Dzxj1t6HVexa7Wyz.name: Plummet
Dzxj1t6HVexa7Wyz.description: A creature hit by a warsworn's scrap ball Strike must attempt a @Check[type:reflex|dc:37] save. On a failure, the target falls @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}; if the target was airborne, it falls up to 120 feet, taking damage from the fall and landing prone if the descent brings it to the ground. On a critical failure, the target is also held under a pile of scrap (DC 37 to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape}).

Werewolf.name: 狼化人 Werewolf
Werewolf.publicNotes:
The curse of the werewolf-known as lycanthropy to many-instills in its carriers the hungry bloodlust and predatory instincts of the wolf. Werewolves tend to dwell on the fringes of society or in small settlements where, in their humanoid forms, they work as laborers, hunters, farmers, or trappers. At night, however, these same villagers transform into violent killers and sadistic stalkers who prey on their neighbors. Werewolves are the quintessential werecreature, and the first that comes to mind when most people speak of such beings.

Although most werewolves hide their curse by adopting solitary lifestyles, some retain the pack mentality of true wolves. A small group of such werewolves typically forms a family-like pack, with the eldest or most powerful serving as the leader; new pack mates are hand-chosen and inculcated into the family as its influence grows.

Werecreatures are humanoids doomed to transform into animals and animal-humanoid hybrids under the light of the full moon. These shapechanging creatures are the result of an ancient primal curse that they can, in turn, transmit through their own bites. Their ability to lurk unseen in the wilds as well as among people, combined with the contagiousness of their condition, makes werecreatures a perennial cause of panicked suspicion.

62IVWtvdiJi9PSZ1.name: 借机攻击 Attack of Opportunity

oXq7JKUPh72N7tPy.name: Change Shape
oXq7JKUPh72N7tPy.description:
• Human
    • Melee fist [[/r 1d20+11 #Fist]]{+11}/[[/r 1d20+6 #Fist]]{+6}/[[/r 1d20+1 #Fist]]{+1} (agile, nonlethal), Damage [[/r {1d4+8}[bludgeoning]]]{1d4+8 bludgeoning damage}
  • Wolf
    • Speed 40 feet
    • Melee jaws[[/r 1d20+11 #Jaws]]{+11}/[[/r 1d20+6 #Jaws]]{+6}/[[/r 1d20+1 #Jaws]]{+1}, Damage [[/r {1d8+8}[piercing]]]{1d8+8 piercing damage} plus @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.BCLvAx4Pz4MLa2pu]{Knockdown}

The werecreature changes into its humanoid, hybrid, or animal shape. Each shape has a specific, persistent appearance. A true werecreature's natural form is its hybrid shape.

In humanoid shape, the werecreature uses its original humanoid size, loses its jaws and claws Strikes, and gains a melee fist Strike that deals bludgeoning damage equal to the slashing damage dealt by its claw.

In animal shape, its Speed and size change to that of the animal, it gains any special Strike effects of the animal that it didn't already have (such as Grab), and it loses its weapon Strikes.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Xmaw18x2qDwDq7tB.name: Curse of the Werewolf
Xmaw18x2qDwDq7tB.description:
This curse affects only humanoids.

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:19]

On each full moon, the cursed creature must succeed at another Fortitude save or turn into a werewolf until dawn.

The creature is under the GM's control and goes on a rampage for half the night before falling unconscious until dawn.

y22Jw3B6gV1YXd2p.name: Moon Frenzy
y22Jw3B6gV1YXd2p.description:
When a full moon appears in the night sky, the werecreature must enter hybrid form, can't Change Shape thereafter, becomes one size larger, increases its reach by 5 feet, and increases the damage of its jaws Strike by 2.

When the moon sets or the sun rises, the werecreature returns to humanoid form and is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} for [[/br 2d4 #Fatigued duration]]{2d4 hours}.

@Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-effects.dRe8n1nBWMIXd8jh]{Effect: Moon Frenzy}

I5zNTSZyjvhCKz3D.name: Pack Attack
I5zNTSZyjvhCKz3D.description: The werewolf's Strikes deal [[/r {1d6}]]{1d6 extra damage} to creatures within reach of at least two of the werewolf's allies.

Water Mephit.name: 水魔蝠 Water Mephit
Water Mephit.publicNotes:
Water mephits are consummate jokers who are always happy to trade a favor for a good laugh. Just as fire mephits are the ones who cleave closest to evil without fully crossing over into true villainy, water mephits are the friendliest of the mephits and therefore the closest to good. Still, one should take care in making assumptions about a water mephit's benevolence, for no one can reliably count on them to keep their inborn need for pranks and trickery at bay for long. Water mephits have blue-green skin that shimmers in light like fish scales. Though water mephits' wings look more like webbed fins than limbs capable of flight, they can flap their wings to fly through the air as easily as any other mephit. Water mephits prefer to swim, when possible, and they leave the water only when they must.

Mephits-sometimes known as elemental scamps-are little bipedal critters with bat-like wings who serve stronger elementals on the Elemental Planes or neophyte spellcasters who summon them to the Material Plane. All mephits have an inkling of magical power as well as a breath weapon.

0naynsYzlUHn8xiZ.name: Breath Weapon
0naynsYzlUHn8xiZ.description:
The water mephit breathes acid in a @Template[type:cone|distance:15] that deals [[/r {2d6}[acid]]]{2d6 acid damage} to each creature within the area (@Check[type:reflex|dc:17|basic:true] save).

The water mephit can't use Breath Weapon again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.

2xaMJwr5gjV30x3x.name: Drench
2xaMJwr5gjV30x3x.description:
The water mephit puts out all fires in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5].

The mephit extinguishes all non-magical fires automatically and attempts to counteract magical fires ([[/r 1d20+7 #Drench]]{+7} counteract modifier).

Web Lurker.name: 伏网怪 Web Lurker
Web Lurker.senses: darkvision, tremorsense (imprecise) 30 feet (creatures touching its web)
Web Lurker.publicNotes: Web lurkers, known also as ettercaps, are ugly monsters that not only dwell within the lairs of spiders and swarms, but actively cultivate and shepherd such vermin.

Kj1uqisygxPxuaC9.name: Spider Speak
Kj1uqisygxPxuaC9.description: The web lurker can speak with spiders, with the same effects and limitations as @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.BBvV7qoXGdw09q1C]{Speak with Animals}.

gMf2LQ1HIE4bCW8p.name: Spring upon Prey
gMf2LQ1HIE4bCW8p.description:
Trigger A creature touches the web lurker's web while the web lurker is on it.

Requirement Initiative has not yet been rolled.

Effect The web lurker automatically notices the creature and Strides or Climbs before rolling initiative.

P7JMDrm2HB1QPV3N.name: Web Lurker Venom
P7JMDrm2HB1QPV3N.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:19]

Maximum Duration 10 rounds

Stage 1 [[/r {1d6}[poison]]]{1d6 poison damage} and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed} (1 round)

Stage 2 [[/r {1d6}[poison]]]{1d6 poison damage}, flat-footed, and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} (1 round)

Re5HgCWQJTyzGewL.name: Web Trap
Re5HgCWQJTyzGewL.description: A creature hit by the web lurker's web attack is immobilized and stuck to the nearest surface until it succeeds at @Check[type:acrobatics|dc:20|traits:action:escape] check to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape}.

Wemmuth.name: 温姆斯 Wemmuth
Wemmuth.publicNotes:
Fertilized by large quantities of spilled blood, such as that found on bloodstained battlefields or in the war-torn regions surrounding besieged cities, wemmuths are vile swaths of vines that draw sustenance from mortal suffering, lapping up blood like water. Possessing a rudimentary intelligence and an unquenchable thirst for blood, wemmuths lie in wait for most of their lives, growing to incredible size in the bloody soil of their grisly homes. Though the vines that comprise a wemmuth's body are scarcely thicker than rope, a single adult wemmuth system consists of 6 tons of vines, enough to stretch for 6,000 feet if stretched from end to end in a single straight line. Wemmuths never orient themselves this way, however, instead preferring to wrap themselves into massive mounds approximately 15 feet across and equally thick. Although wemmuths are often spotted lazing about, the scent of blood is enough to whip one into a violent frenzy. The creature condenses its entire mass into a sphere of sharp thorns and lashing vines, resembling a hateful tumbleweed the size of an elephant. Wemmuths commonly dig up massive boulders or entire trees from the ground and incorporate them into their rolling mass, using these objects to bolster their defense against many forms of attack or hurling them at faraway foes with terrifying precision.

Some speculate that wemmuths are a form of diabolical corruption let loose upon Golarion by House Thrune of Cheliax, perhaps as a scorched earth tactic against their rivals. Influential nobles from Nirmathas and Molthune both point fingers at one another for the wemmuth's creation, Nirmathas citing Molthune's close ties to Infernal Cheliax and Molthune blaming the primal magic commonly employed by Nirmathas's many druids and rangers. Several Varisian tales describe creatures closely matching the wemmuth's description attempting to apprehend a famous folk trickster, while crusaders from Mendev adhere to the belief that the wemmuths were a blight unleashed upon Golarion by Deskari, former demon lord of locusts, before his defeat at the hands of mortal heroes.

96XPNyAYt1NHy3H5.name: Blood Leech
96XPNyAYt1NHy3H5.description:
Trigger The wemmuth deals damage to a creature with Constrict.

Effect The wemmuth heals a number of Hit Points equal to half the total damage dealt by Constrict.

t4Gnn9gqqcKWerhM.name: Thorny Mass
t4Gnn9gqqcKWerhM.description: Whenever a creature within 10 feet attempts a melee attack against a wemmuth or uses Acrobatics to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.21WIfSu7Xd7uKqV8]{Tumble Through} its space, that creature takes [[/r {1d12+10}[piercing]]]{1d12+10 piercing damage}.

Wendigo.name: 温迪戈 Wendigo
Wendigo.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic
Wendigo.publicNotes: Wendigos are incarnations of the fears of starvation, loneliness, and fatal exposure to cold weather. They haunt the frozen expanses of the world.

xwaCzt4DsfuEQrxR.name: 御风而行(随意施法) Wind Walk (At Will)
xwaCzt4DsfuEQrxR.description: 当你施放该法术时，每个目标会转变成模糊的云团，并且被风按你指定的方向卷走。你可以使用一个具有专注特征的动作改变风的方向。这股风会以20英里每小时的速度携卷目标移动，但如果目标进行一次攻击，施放一个法术，被攻击，或者进入遭遇模式，该法术在它们骰先攻后对于所有目标结束，它们会缓缓地飘落到地面上。

2gsH3ODIUNTtb5cQ.name: 梦魇术() Nightmare (see Dream Haunting)
2gsH3ODIUNTtb5cQ.description:
你向目标送去一段恼人的噩梦。在目标下一次入睡时，它必须尝试一次意志豁免。如果你知道目标的名字但是从未遇见过它，目标在意志豁免上获得+4环境加值。

大成功 目标不承受任何负面效果，并暂时免疫1星期。

成功 目标经历了噩梦，但不会承受除了糟糕回忆以外的负面效果。

失败 目标经历噩梦，并且在醒来时 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{疲乏 Fatigued}。

大失败 目标经历噩梦，醒来时疲乏，并且获得 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{流失 Drained 2} 直到不再疲乏。

LNJkhJSFpg8gvkwp.name: Heatsight 60 feet
LNJkhJSFpg8gvkwp.description: Heatsight is a precise sense that sees heat signatures.

xMc6TnmwsR72HZR7.name: Dream Haunting
xMc6TnmwsR72HZR7.description: A target that fails its save against the wendigo's @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.Uqj344bezBq3ESdq]{Nightmare} is exposed to wendigo torment.

gw66iZEKmcFi0JjW.name: Howl
gw66iZEKmcFi0JjW.description:
Frequency Three times per day

Effect The wendigo unleashes a forlorn howl that can be heard up to 1 mile away. Any creature that hears the howl must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:38] save or be @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}. Any creature that critically fails and is within 120 feet of the wendigo is instead @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3}, and is also fleeing for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds} (or until it's no longer frightened, whichever comes first).

A creature frightened by a wendigo's howl still naturally recovers from its fright but can't reduce it below frightened 1 in this way until 1 hour has passed or magic is used.

Whether it succeeds or fails its save, a creature is then temporarily immune to that wendigo's Howl for 24 hours.

yEzDmYi6aYTiIA8Y.name: Ride the Wind
yEzDmYi6aYTiIA8Y.description:
Trigger The wendigo casts @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.U0hL0LLaprcnAyzC]{Wind Walk} while it has @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} a foe.

Effect The wendigo attempts to turn the grabbed creature into wind and carry it along as part of the action. If the target succeeds at a @Check[type:will|dc:38] save, it prevents itself from being transformed; in this case, the wendigo still transforms, automatically releasing the victim.

A creature forced to Ride the Wind along with the wendigo is exposed to wendigo torment. The target can attempt a new Will save each round to return to normal, though it immediately becomes corporeal and begins falling if it succeeds.

qWBeJdRzUrGmE3Di.name: Wendigo Torment
qWBeJdRzUrGmE3Di.description:
A creature affected by wendigo torment can't recover beyond stage 1 until it has been restored to full HP.

Saving Throw @Check[type:will|dc:38]

Stage 1 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 4} (1 day)

Stage 2 As stage 1 (1 day)

Stage 3 The creature searches for an individual of its own ancestry to kill and devour. It then becomes affected by @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.U0hL0LLaprcnAyzC]{Wind Walk} and sprints into the sky so fast that its feet burn away into jagged stumps. As the creature wind walks into the sky, it is replaced by a new wendigo over [[/br 2d6 #minutes]]{2d6 minutes}.

@Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.6dDtGIUerazSHIOu]{Wish}, similar magic, or a 9th-level @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.kqhPt9344UkcGVYO]{Resurrect} ritual can return the victim to life. The new wendigo remains even if the victim is resurrected.

Werebear.name: 熊化人 Werebear
Werebear.publicNotes:
Unlike many other types of werecreature, a werebear does not become malevolent during its involuntary transformations, but is instead filled with righteous conviction. This indignation can still manifest in violent ways, though, as a transformed werebear becomes temporarily blind to its alliances and has little control over its bestial temper. As a result, werebears are loners, rarely even living together as families longer than necessary. Werebears know that as long as they live solitary lives, they can serve as protectors and guardians in wilderness regions without the overwhelming fear that, when the moon is full and the curse takes hold, they will rage against an innocent bystander or loved one. As long as there is nothing around to threaten it or the natural area it protects (typically a forest), a werebear in its animal form is generally content to forage and sleep away the night.

Werecreatures are humanoids doomed to transform into animals and animal-humanoid hybrids under the light of the full moon. These shapechanging creatures are the result of an ancient primal curse that they can, in turn, transmit through their own bites. Their ability to lurk unseen in the wilds as well as among people, combined with the contagiousness of their condition, makes werecreatures a perennial cause of panicked suspicion.

ERGEti8Jc1RonWRj.name: Change Shape
ERGEti8Jc1RonWRj.description:
• Human
    • Melee fist [[/r 1d20+13 #Fist]]{+13}/[[/r 1d20+8 #Fist]]{+8}/[[/r 1d20+3 #Fist]]{+3} (agile, nonlethal), Damage [[/r {1d4+7}[bludgeoning]]]{1d4+7 bludgeoning damage}
  • Grizzly Bear
    • Speed 35 feet

The werecreature changes into its humanoid, hybrid, or animal shape. Each shape has a specific, persistent appearance. A true werecreature's natural form is its hybrid shape.

In humanoid shape, the werecreature uses its original humanoid size, loses its jaws and claws Strikes, and gains a melee fist Strike that deals bludgeoning damage equal to the slashing damage dealt by its claw.

In animal shape, its Speed and size change to that of the animal, it gains any special Strike effects of the animal that it didn't already have (such as Grab), and it loses its weapon Strikes.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

8fKFzS7zqR9XbC5k.name: Curse of the Werebear
8fKFzS7zqR9XbC5k.description:
This curse affects only humanoids.

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:22]

On each full moon, the cursed creature must succeed at another Fortitude save or turn into a werebear until dawn.

The creature is under the GM's control and goes on a rampage for half the night before falling unconscious until dawn.

yvHOZTfOKMN7JNu7.name: Hunt Prey
yvHOZTfOKMN7JNu7.description:
Requirements The werebear can see or hear the target or is @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.EA5vuSgJfiHH7plD]{Tracking} it in exploration mode.

Effect The werebear gains a +2 circumstance bonus to Perception checks when it @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seeks} its prey and a +2 circumstance bonus to Survival checks when it Tracks its prey. The werebear also ignores the penalty for making ranged attacks within its second range increment against the prey it's hunting. The werebear can designate only one creature as its hunted prey at a time. If it uses Hunt Prey against a different creature, the prior creature loses the designation and the new prey gains the designation. In any case, this designation lasts until the werebear's next daily preparation.

wfMs8RYiuhFeQMau.name: Mauler
wfMs8RYiuhFeQMau.description: The werebear gains a +2 circumstance bonus to damage rolls against creatures it has @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}.

m53HcXgUGgipalh0.name: Moon Frenzy
m53HcXgUGgipalh0.description:
When a full moon appears in the night sky, the werecreature must enter hybrid form, can't Change Shape thereafter, becomes one size larger, increases its reach by 5 feet, and increases the damage of its jaws Strike by 2.

When the moon sets or the sun rises, the werecreature returns to humanoid form and is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} for [[/br 2d4 #Fatigued duration]]{2d4 hours}.

@Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-effects.dRe8n1nBWMIXd8jh]{Effect: Moon Frenzy}

ZQY7WcFFZtddDBnh.name: Precision Edge
ZQY7WcFFZtddDBnh.description: The werebear deals [[/r {1d8}[precision]]]{1d8 additional precision damage} on its first successful Strike against its hunted target on each of its turns.

Wererat.name: 鼠化人 Wererat
Wererat.publicNotes:
Wererats tend to be selfishly opportunistic, avaricious, and paranoid as a result of their curse. Because wererats typically dwell in metropolitan areas where they can hide in plain sight, practically any city-goer could be a wererat in disguise-from the quiet shopkeep to the city's criminal mastermind. The bustle of crowds and countless rat-holes make ghettos and shantytowns favored homes for wererats, especially since in these poorer districts the wererat can kill out of greed or fear with little chance of the authorities noticing. In some cities, wererats operate entire thieves' guilds or organized crime rings, and membership requires willfully submitting to the wererat's cursed bite. Wererats look very similar to ratfolk when in hybrid form, apart from potential differences in size, but ratfolk have no love for these monsters.

Werecreatures are humanoids doomed to transform into animals and animal-humanoid hybrids under the light of the full moon. These shapechanging creatures are the result of an ancient primal curse that they can, in turn, transmit through their own bites. Their ability to lurk unseen in the wilds as well as among people, combined with the contagiousness of their condition, makes werecreatures a perennial cause of panicked suspicion.

3HkWPtBVUhYiB7al.name: Nimble Dodge
3HkWPtBVUhYiB7al.description:
Trigger The wererat is targeted with a melee or ranged attack by an attacker it can see.

Eflect The wererat gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.

E11uRLNnDwbjSmiw.name: Change Shape
E11uRLNnDwbjSmiw.description:
• Human
    • Melee fist [[/r 1d20+10 #Fist]]{+10}/[[/r 1d20+5 #Fist]]{+5}/[[/r 1d20 #Fist]]{+0} (agile, nonlethal), Damage [[/r {1d4+2}[bludgeoning]]]{1d4+2 bludgeoning damage}
  • Rat
    • Size Small
    • Speed 30 feet, climb 10 feet

The werecreature changes into its humanoid, hybrid, or animal shape. Each shape has a specific, persistent appearance. A true werecreature's natural form is its hybrid shape.

In humanoid shape, the werecreature uses its original humanoid size, loses its jaws and claws Strikes, and gains a melee fist Strike that deals bludgeoning damage equal to the slashing damage dealt by its claw.

In animal shape, its Speed and size change to that of the animal, it gains any special Strike effects of the animal that it didn't already have (such as Grab), and it loses its weapon Strikes.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

pK7TW7mAgEFfJu0Q.name: Curse of the Wererat
pK7TW7mAgEFfJu0Q.description:
This curse affects only humanoids.

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:18]

On each full moon, the cursed creature must succeed at another Fortitude save or turn into a wererat until dawn.

The creature is under the GM's control and goes on a rampage for half the night before falling unconscious until dawn.

rBKIlYFoV3vW1kEN.name: Moon Frenzy
rBKIlYFoV3vW1kEN.description:
When a full moon appears in the night sky, the werecreature must enter hybrid form, can't Change Shape thereafter, becomes one size larger, increases its reach by 5 feet, and increases the damage of its jaws Strike by 2.

When the moon sets or the sun rises, the werecreature returns to humanoid form and is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} for [[/br 2d4 #Fatigued duration]]{2d4 hours}.

@Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-effects.dRe8n1nBWMIXd8jh]{Effect: Moon Frenzy}

KiBIFxCCOgpsuMvK.name: 偷袭 Sneak Attack
KiBIFxCCOgpsuMvK.description:
The wererat deals 1d6 extra precision damage to flat-footed creatures.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.SneakAttack]

Wraith.name: 缚灵 Wraith
Wraith.allSaves: 对抗正能量豁免时+1状态加值

dr.exceptions: 除力场、幽冥或正能量；对抗非魔法攻击时抗力翻倍

Wraith.publicNotes:
缚灵是一种汲取生命和阳光的恶毒的不死生物。它们阴暗、无形的身体上点缀着灼烧的眼睛，表达着对生者的仇恨，它们那晦暗的爪子是足以从敌人那里偷走活力的武器。缚灵可能由秽恶的死灵术创造，但它们更常由那些遁世（hermitic）的杀人犯或破坏狂（mutilator）中产生，这些人即便在死后也不愿停下他们的邪恶行径。让事情变得更棘手的是，缚灵通过吞噬并将生者转化为它们秽恶的同类而成倍增长——这意味着一小撮不受约束的缚灵可以很轻易地变为一只黑暗大军。

缚灵没有重量，而且不会受到大多数物理攻击的伤害。它们出没于任何能够以生命为食的地方，尽管它们在阳光下的脆弱限制了它们只能活动于世界的阴暗之处——在那里它们可以无缝地融入环境，然后悄悄地吞没它们的猎物。

在那些死亡和骚乱司空见惯的地方——被战争蹂躏的乡村、被罪犯首脑统治的地下世界、或是举行残酷邪教仪式的场地，缚灵会和其他同类结伙。在这些地方，活人只有依照携带有日光杖的强大牧师的指引才能过得好。由于缚灵仅能在夜晚或黑暗的地方狩猎，废墟、下水道和遗弃的建筑在白天为缚灵提供了避难所。缚灵足够聪明到在战斗中利用它们的虚体优势，因此它们呆在曲折的洞穴或者有走廊的建筑并避开空旷地带。

因为它们纯粹由负能量位面的反生命构成，缚灵遍布那些亵渎的区域。在不死生物统治的国家和城镇中，缚灵有着刺客和间谍的地位。在盖布（Geb）它们属于统治阶级，但乌斯塔拉夫（Ustalav）有着更多的缚灵，在那里成群的缚灵徘徊于坟地和雾气弥漫的小径上，吞噬整个村庄的人口。在世界上的其他地方，缚灵往往不会四处游荡并把它们的活动限制于更小的区域，通常它们只在自己选择的地方及其周围环境出没。

PoFwl1bniXcbhkld.name: 对抗正能量豁免时+1状态加值

6tSYdMbuSY1NSMOt.name: 阳光失能 Sunlight Powerlessness
6tSYdMbuSY1NSMOt.description: 在日光下的缚灵获得@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{震慑 Stunned 2}和@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{笨拙 Clumsy 2}。

zD3l2lGfHmnHF8iq.name: 汲取生命 Drain Life
zD3l2lGfHmnHF8iq.description: 当缚灵使用幽魂之手伤害一个活着的生物时，缚灵获得[[/r 5 #Temporary Hit Points]]{5点临时生命值}，并且目标必须通过@Check[type:fortitude|dc:23]豁免否则获得@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{流失 Drained 1}。缚灵造成的进一步伤害将使流失状态值在再次豁免失败时增加1，最多达到流失4。

cqn01fpxgrAl4NvI.name: 缚灵衍体 Wraith Spawn
cqn01fpxgrAl4NvI.description: 被缚灵的幽魂之手杀死的生物[[/br 1d4 #Wraith Spawn Transformation]]{1d4轮}之后变成一个新的@Compendium[pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.HbROgIcU9Z9m6XuD]{缚灵衍体 Wraith Spawn}。这个缚灵衍体听命于将他杀死的缚灵。当它处于缚灵衍体的状态时，没有吸取生命和制造缚灵衍体的能力，并且一直拥有@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{笨拙 Clumsy 2}状态。如果缚灵衍体的制造者死亡，则该衍体变成完全的、有自主意识的缚灵；它此时获得吸取生命和制造缚灵衍体的能力，并且不再笨拙。

White Kobold Dragon Mage.name: 白鳞狗头人龙术士 White Kobold Dragon Mage
White Kobold Dragon Mage.publicNotes:
Kobold dragon mages use magic to carry out their secret schemes. The presence of a dragon mage in a kobold warren is one of the greatest testaments to the kobolds' claim to draconic heritage.

Kobolds are small, reptilian humanoids who carry physical similarities to true dragons. They lurk in dark spaces, usually tunnels and mines beneath the earth, in either warrens of their own design or complexes discovered and colonized after the original builders have moved on. Though kobolds are far more pragmatic than they are courageous, they use every inch of their cunning to even the playing field between themselves and other, stronger creatures. They attack from the darkness and at range, and kobold artificers and engineers master the art of simple but effective traps, which they use to protect their lairs. Kobolds are skilled at working together by necessity, and they often set up ambushes or hit-and-run assaults that allow them to do the most damage possible without being harmed in return.

Kobolds are diligent and hardworking creatures, though they often turn these virtues toward selfish ends. While some kobolds live in communal collectives that maintain neutral relations with the creatures around them, they can be easily swayed into serving malevolent powers or megalomaniac leaders. This is in part due to kobolds' innate pragmatism, as they would rather concede to servitude than risk being killed, but it is also in part due to a reverence for the power that kobolds generally lack. Dragons in particular are viewed with a deferential awe, and kobolds eagerly offer their services to such mighty and glorious creatures when they can. While kobolds may scheme against other leaders, especially those that control them via subjugation, dragons are usually viewed with adoration, no matter how brutal they might be to their kobold minions.

laJspBpdfBwzH2g9.name: 侦测魔法 Detect Magic
laJspBpdfBwzH2g9.description:
你发出一股标记魔法存在的脉冲。你不会获得魔法存在或不存在以外的任何信息。你可以选择忽略你完全知晓的魔法，例如你或者你盟友的魔法物品以及持续法术。

仅当幻术魔法的环级低于你的侦测魔法环级时，你才能侦测幻术魔法。但是，具有幻术灵光但是没有在外表上做伪装的物品（例如一瓶隐形术药水），通常能够正常侦测。

升阶 (3环级) 你会了解法术侦测区域中最高环级的效果的学派。如果有相同强度的多个效果，GM决定你了解的为哪一个。

升阶 (4环级) 如3环级，你也能指出最高环级魔法的来源。如同一种模糊感官（imprecise sense），你不会了解具体的位置，但是可以将来源锁定到5尺立方（或者最近的那个五尺立方，如果来源体积比这个区域更大）。

1GBTPnqIIGld3Wu1.name: Dragonscaled
1GBTPnqIIGld3Wu1.description:
A kobold dragon mage's resistance depends on the color of its scales:

  • White cold 5

lFKVQJSD5lmRIdIT.name: Illusory Retreat
lFKVQJSD5lmRIdIT.description:
Frequency once per hour

Requirements The kobold dragon mage is adjacent to at least one enemy.

Effect The dragon mage creates an illusion of itself in its square and then becomes @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible} (with the effects of a 2nd-level @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.XXqE1eY3w3z6xJCB]{Invisibility} spell) for [[/br 1d4 #Duration Illusory Retreat]]{1d4 rounds}. The dragon mage can move up to half its Speed, but it must end its movement in a space that's not adjacent to any enemies.

This is a 1st-level spell that requires a somatic component.

8W4is1CtFAUBw0Zd.name: 偷袭 Sneak Attack
8W4is1CtFAUBw0Zd.description:
The dragon mage deals an extra 1d6 precision damage to flat-footed creatures.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.SneakAttack]

Wight.name: 尸妖 Wight
Wight.publicNotes:
Wights are undead humanoids that, much like wraiths, can drain the life from living creatures with but a touch. They arise as a result of necromantic rituals, especially violent deaths, or the sheer malevolent will of the deceased.

As many types of wights exist as types of people from which they might be created. Hulking brutes, skittering sneaks, and cunning tinkers all make for different wights with different niches to fill. Environment, too, plays a part in determining a wight's special abilities and defenses. Frost wights, for instances, can be found in the parts of the world where exposure is a common end. Regardless, wights typically haunt burial grounds, catacombs, or other places of the dead. But their hunger is targeted toward the living-those individuals who remind them of the shackles of mortality and whom they feel compelled to "free" to the state of undeath.

A single wight can wreak a lot of havoc if it is compelled to rise from its tomb. Because creatures slain by wights become wights as well, all it takes is a single wight and a handful of unlucky graveyard visitors to create a veritable horde of these undead. Thus, canny priests and adventurers know that the best solution to a wight problem is swift and total eradication. Care must be taken, though, to destroy wight spawn before attempting to destroy the parent wight, for spawn without a master gain the ability to create spawn of their own.

Durable and sustained as they are by negative energy, wights can last in harsh environments without decaying the way some lesser undead do. They might dwell in high mountain passes, sealed passageways, or submerged in bogs or lakes for decades or even centuries before the passage of an unsuspecting traveler rouses them from their rest.

Kpl3lLjfHM0hWhT5.name: Final Spite
Kpl3lLjfHM0hWhT5.description:
Trigger The wight is reduced to 0 Hit Points.

Effect The wight makes a Strike before being destroyed. It doesn't gain any temporary HP from drain life on this Strike.

v2Ifd6tb1IDRFqFO.name: Drain Life
v2Ifd6tb1IDRFqFO.description: When the wight damages a living creature with its claw Strike, the wight gains [[/r 3 #Temporary Hit Points]]{3 temporary Hit Points} and the creature must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:17] save or become @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}. Further damage dealt by the wraith increases the amount of drain by 1 on a failed save to a maximum of drained 4.

Umi21NTMrg5JA3IQ.name: Wight Spawn
Umi21NTMrg5JA3IQ.description: A living humanoid slain by a wight's claw Strike rises as a @Compendium[pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.ZPjQkKVMi3xoPcU0]{Wight Spawn} after [[/br 1d4 #Wight Spawn Transformation]]{1d4 rounds}. This wight spawn is under the command of the wight that killed it. It doesn't have Drain Life or Wight Spawn and becomes @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} for as long as it is a wight spawn. If the creator of the wight spawn dies, the wight spawn becomes a full-fledged, autonomous wight; it regains its free will, gains Drain Life and Wight Spawn, and is no longer clumsy.

Winter Wolf.name: 冬狼 Winter Wolf
Winter Wolf.publicNotes:
Winter wolves are related to wargs, but are larger, smarter, and far more dangerous. They are capable of exhaling plumes of freezing breath and are big enough to easily serve as mounts for orcs and hobgoblins-provided the winter wolf is willing, of course. Like wargs, winter wolves hunt in packs, but unlike their smaller cousins, they have a notable proud streak. When they deign to serve others, they reserve this privilege for larger and more dangerous creatures such as frost giants, renegade yetis, or even white dragons.

The warg is an intelligent and malevolent wolf that dwells among goblins, hobgoblins, orcs, and other violent humanoids.

HFyEFMKsCld64B15.name: Avenging Bite
HFyEFMKsCld64B15.description:
Trigger A creature within reach of the winter wolf's jaws attacks one of the winter wolf's allies.

Effect The winter wolf makes a jaws Strike against the triggering creature.

dPsbBLbGfNPn6v9L.name: Breath Weapon
dPsbBLbGfNPn6v9L.description:
The winter wolf breathes a cloud of frost in a @Template[type:cone|distance:15] that deals [[/r {5d8}[cold]]]{5d8 cold damage} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:23|basic:true] save).

The winter wolf can't use Breath Weapon again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.

9RRqDOZEOM8rUI1P.name: Pack Attack
9RRqDOZEOM8rUI1P.description: The winter wolf's Strikes deal [[/r {1d6}]]{1d6 extra damage} to creatures within the reach of at least two of the winter wolf's allies.

Wolf.name: 狼 Wolf
Wolf.publicNotes:
Wolves live and hunt in packs, which, contrary to popular belief, are not led by the strongest in the group, but typically consist of a mated pair, their pups, and juvenile offspring from previous mating seasons. Offspring generally leave their parents' pack upon reaching maturity, at which point they seek out mates of their own to go form their own packs elsewhere.

Humanoids are not traditionally viewed as prey animals by wolves, but extraordinary circumstances can lead these animals to attack people, especially in winter months and other situations where traditional prey is scarce. Some beings, such as powerful vampires, can call upon wolves to aid them in combat.

Wolves roam forests, hills, and other wild lands, where they hunt in packs to beleaguer and surround their prey before going in for the kill. Like most predatory animals, wolves prefer to attack the weakest or most vulnerable prey they can find.

GhRRqxvK6T21zheo.name: Pack Attack
GhRRqxvK6T21zheo.description: The wolf's Strikes deal [[/r {1d4}]]{1d4 extra damage} to creatures within reach of at least two of the wolf's allies.

Wyvern.name: 双足飞龙 Wyvern
Wyvern.publicNotes:
A wyvern is a venomous drake with a well-earned reputation for impatience and aggression. As much as 15 feet long and weighing up to 1,000 pounds, a wyvern's resilient body allows it to crash talons-first into large prey without serious risk to itself. A wyvern uses its momentum to stun its target before injecting it with searing venom or carrying it over the side of a nearby cliff. Because a wyvern lacks the strength to haul its prey all the way to its nest intact, it is far more likely to lift and drop its victim over a gully or canyon and let gravity do its work before it descends to pick apart the carcass.

Conversation is of little interest to a wyvern, as the creature typically speaks only to taunt its prey, issue territorial claims, or demand tribute. Even so, many wyverns enjoy grim humor and tales of violent acts, particularly if those acts were committed by the storyteller. A wyvern properly appeased with meat, entertainment, and treasure sometimes agrees to provide assistance ranging from giving directions to serving as a mount for a powerful humanoid. However, these arrangements rarely last more than a few weeks before the wyvern's pride, malice, or insolence inspires it to flee or even betray its allies. Only the truly cruel can cow a wyvern into servitude for an extended period, as most wyverns are so self-interested that they go out of their way to avoid helping others.

Ravenous, bestial, and driven by instinct-drakes are primitive draconic monsters who bear a fraction of the terrifying might of their larger cousins but little (if any) of the cunning. While they're weaker, slower, and less inclined toward reason than dragons, drakes are nonetheless a menace to creatures and settlements around them. Their propensity for forming raiding parties-small social groups fittingly called "rampages"-makes them all the more dangerous; a single rampage of river drakes can quickly lay waste to a waterside village, and roving rampages of desert drakes are a plague to caravan traders.

Drakes share a number of physical characteristics that unite them as one species despite their wide variety of habitats and abilities. For example, drakes lack forearms, leaving them only their formidable jaws and thick-scaled tails with which to attack if engaged at melee range. Most drakes would rather avoid close combat, however, preferring to use their breath weapons to wreak havoc in wide swaths from comfortable distances while flying overhead. Finally, all drakes have small reservoirs of their ancestral draconic power that they can tap into to perform incredible feats of speed.

sHRh4SLqM1rBlpHb.name: 借机攻击 Attack of Opportunity

R8f6nx9jMnFB03qP.name: Savage
R8f6nx9jMnFB03qP.description:
Trigger A creature @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by the wyvern critically fails a skill check to Escape.

Effect The wyvern makes a stinger Strike against the triggering creature.

kq0boAEZsA01NsEH.name: Powerful Dive
kq0boAEZsA01NsEH.description: The wyvern Flies up to its fly Speed and must both move forward at least 20 feet and descend at least 10 feet. If it ends the movement within melee reach of at least one enemy its size or smaller, it can make a claw Strike against that enemy. If the claw hits, as a free action the wyvern can either automatically @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Tkd8sH4pwFIPzqTr]{Grab} the target or knock it @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

2ECIwvcXVQ6w8vi5.name: Punishing Momentum
2ECIwvcXVQ6w8vi5.description:
Requirements The wyvern @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} a creature this turn using Powerful Dive.

Effect The wyvern can Fly at half Speed while holding the creature in its claws, carrying that creature along with it and dropping it at the end of its movement. Alternatively, the wyvern can Strike the creature with its stinger with a +2 circumstance bonus.

Mj7eIolH2KmKRos4.name: Wyvern Venom
Mj7eIolH2KmKRos4.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:22]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 [[/r {5d6}[poison]]]{5d6 poison damage} (1 round)

Stage 2 [[/r {6d6}[poison]]]{6d6 poison damage} (1 round)

Stage 3 [[/r {8d6}[poison]]]{8d6 poison damage} (1 round)

Wrathspawn.name: 愤怒罪生怪 Wrathspawn
Wrathspawn.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic, +4 status to all saves vs. mental
Wrathspawn.publicNotes:
Sinspawn were created by one of seven ancient wizards known collectively as runelords-each of whom embraced and embodied one of seven sins. The first sinspawn was created by the Runelord of Wrath, utilizing techniques that have since gone on to influence fleshwarping practices. It wasn't long before the technique used to create sinspawn fell into the hands of the other runelords, and while each tried their own hand at crafting variants of their own design, today sinspawn of wrath remain the most numerous and notorious of their kind. Bearing only a vague resemblance to the humanoids from whose flesh they were formed, sinspawn generally appear horrifically emaciated and have unnaturally long arms and digitigrade legs, each with a trio of stubby, taloned digits. Veins bulge across sinspawn's bodies in sanguine patterns that suspiciously resemble twisted runes, and their flesh is pale and hairless. Their heads are elongated, bearing only slits for a nose, red eyes, and disturbing lower jaws that split in half at the chin, revealing pedipalps that end in tiny, three-fingered hands and framing a long, lolling tongue. Sinspawn stand 6-1/2 feet tall and typically weigh as much as an emaciated human of their size. They behave in a manner consistent with their associated sin and have physical characteristics that hint at these qualities. For example, greedspawn's veins appear to run with gold while envyspawn appear even more wasted than the rest of their kin.

The most commonly encountered of the sinspawn. Wrathspawn are the bulkiest looking of their kind.

hk7qH9BpvzM7rFGe.name: Sin Scent (Imprecise) 30 feet
hk7qH9BpvzM7rFGe.description: A sinspawn can smell creatures that reflect its sin, as the scent ability. The GM determines which creatures are appropriately sinful.

iP02Y8PDHLNbctbc.name: +4 Status to All Saves vs. Mental

iXBVxZ5RntmImlUb.name: 借机攻击 Attack of Opportunity

MpNlJrdPvv9bECNE.name: Sinful Bite
MpNlJrdPvv9bECNE.description:
A creature hit by the jaws of a sinspawn must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:18] save as it is assailed by sinful thoughts.

Critical Success Unaffected

Success @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}

Failure @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}

Critical Failure sickened 2 plus @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for 1 minute

Xorn.name: 索尔石怪 Xorn
Xorn.publicNotes:
These squat, rotund elementals have three legs, three arms, three eyes, and one massive maw, which they fill with the gems and metals they find so delicious.

Earth elementals make excellent bodyguards for adventuresome spelunkers and are ideal protectors of important subterranean locations such as vaults and treasuries.

jvmfyWcZp1aZiZqS.name: Claw Frenzy
jvmfyWcZp1aZiZqS.description: The xorn makes three claw Strikes; no more than two can be against the same target. These attacks count toward the xorn's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after all the attacks have been made.

ypKdaBzYAIDgW2KT.name: Earth Glide
ypKdaBzYAIDgW2KT.description: The xorn can Burrow through any earthen matter, including rock. When it does so, the xorn moves at its full burrow Speed, leaving no tunnels or signs of its passing.

Xulgath Leader.name: 地蜥人头领 Xulgath Leader
Xulgath Leader.publicNotes:
Xulgath leaders are usually the strongest, most violent members of a community-although in some cases, particularly in larger groups, xulgath tribes are led by powerful demon cultists or other monsters who seek to use the xulgaths as servants or slaves.

Reptilian humanoids who live in the uppermost reaches of the Darklands, xulgaths (known as troglodytes to many surface-dwelling folk) often attack intruders in their territory on sight. They live in simple familial communities, battling rival groups and other aggressive Darklands inhabitants in order to survive. They occasionally raid surface settlements, usually at the behest of cruel, bloodthirsty leaders who are often themselves in the thrall of more powerful creatures like nagas or demons. A typical xulgath has dull gray, dark gray, or ashen scales, with a long tail and bony protrusions that run the length of its spine. A typical xulgath is 5 feet tall and weighs 150 pounds.

Although today the xulgaths are brutal and scattered, they were one of the first intelligent humanoids to rise in the primeval world, once ruling over a mighty empire that stretched throughout the Darklands. Today, all that remains of this era are ruins of massive stone ziggurats and crumbling cities found within some of the larger caverns. Some groups of xulgaths continue to live among these ruins, venerating their ancestors' accomplishments, while others consider these areas taboo and leave them to become infested with Darklands vermin. Sages don't agree on why the ancient xulgath civilization fell. Some suspect it was the result of a loss of several wars waged against serpentfolk, while others suggest that the corruptive influence of demon worship rotted their culture from within.

Certainly, many xulgath settlements continue to worship demons to this day, paying homage and offering live sacrifices to terrible creatures from the Abyss. Occasionally, a xulgath shaman can call forth and bind a lesser demon to help serve the group, but a shaman who delves too deep into occultism might summon a more powerful fiend that either tears the xulgaths to pieces or enslaves them.

gV8plzH46OeVvlNG.name: Stench
gV8plzH46OeVvlNG.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

A creature entering the aura must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:19] save. On a failure, the creature is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}, and on a critical failure, the creature also takes a -5-foot status penalty to its Speeds for 1 round. While within the aura, the creature takes a -2 circumstance penalty to saves to recover from the sickened condition. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune to all xulgaths' stench for 1 minute.

@Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-effects.uB3CVn3momZO9h0L]{Effect: Xulgath Stench}

1BwIo7mgXKcuS2Vg.name: Weakening Strike
1BwIo7mgXKcuS2Vg.description: The target must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:20] save or become @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (or @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} on a critical hit) for 1 round.

Xulgath Skulker.name: 地蜥人潜伏者 Xulgath Skulker
Xulgath Skulker.publicNotes:
Xulgath warrens are patrolled-some might say "haunted"-by the community's skulkers. These xulgaths specialize in stealth, striking swiftly from the shadows and otherwise ambushing foes.

Dn7B8j6FSbVD4U9x.name: Stench
Dn7B8j6FSbVD4U9x.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

A creature entering the aura must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:16] save. On a failure, the creature is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}, and on a critical failure, the creature also takes a -5-foot status penalty to its Speeds for 1 round. While within the aura, the creature takes a -2 circumstance penalty to saves to recover from the sickened condition. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune to all xulgaths' stench for 1 minute.

@Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-effects.uB3CVn3momZO9h0L]{Effect: Xulgath Stench}

iA3NXKVAiWzxGVaO.name: Stench Suppression
iA3NXKVAiWzxGVaO.description: A xulgath skulker can suppress its stench aura as a free action to better hide its presence. The skulker can resume its stench aura as a free action.

c4LXwYKMdM5R7B7K.name: Hidden Movement
c4LXwYKMdM5R7B7K.description: If a xulgath skulker starts its turn @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected} by a creature or merely @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} from it, that creature is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed} against the skulker's attacks until the end of the skulker's turn.

HavBnXAT02rDNben.name: 偷袭 Sneak Attack
HavBnXAT02rDNben.description:
A xulgath skulker deals an additional 1d6 precision damage to flat‑footed creatures.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.SneakAttack]

Xulgath Warrior.name: 地蜥人战士 Xulgath Warrior
Xulgath Warrior.publicNotes:
Xulgath warriors strike with fury and eager cruelty, always ready for the next fight. The taking of prizes from battle-including weapons and items stolen from defeated foes along with grislier trophies harvested from fallen victims' flesh-is a popular pursuit among these vicious reptiles, and those whose armor and scales are most adorned are awarded the greatest respect from their kin.

Reptilian humanoids who live in the uppermost reaches of the Darklands, xulgaths (known as troglodytes to many surface-dwelling folk) often attack intruders in their territory on sight.
