4NqTHQqAkLmiUovi.name: Stench
4NqTHQqAkLmiUovi.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

A creature entering the aura must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:16] save. On a failure, the creature is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}, and on a critical failure, the creature also takes a -5-foot status penalty to its Speeds for 1 round. While within the aura, the creature takes a -2 circumstance penalty to saves to recover from the sickened condition. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune to all xulgaths' stench for 1 minute.

@Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-effects.uB3CVn3momZO9h0L]{Effect: Xulgath Stench}

Yeti.name: 雪人 Yeti
Yeti.allSaves: +4 status to all saves vs. fear and dreams
Yeti.publicNotes:
Nearly a myth, the yeti is rarely seen-and even when it is, it is often too late. Yetis dwell amid the highest, most remote peaks of the world, coming down from their snowy mountain holds to raid, steal livestock, and sometimes feed their insatiable urges for slaughter and destruction. Those folks who live at the foot of a yeti-ruled mountain warn of the "abominable snowmen": monstrous, fur-covered humanoids who leave strange and bloody tracks in the snow.

Normally yetis seek to protect the world rather than hunt its other civilized denizens. They do so by lairing near eldritch portals that form links between the Material Plane and other, much stranger dimensions of reality. From within these snow-covered arches and ancient stone doorways, aliens, living nightmares, fiends, and worse can emerge through dimensional networks into the world. Yetis who guard these portals sometimes succumb to these horrors and are corrupted, taking on the bloodthirsty urges and horrific behaviors of the very monsters they strive to protect the world against. Yetis who manifest such violent tendencies are driven out of their clan and forced to wander the mountaintops alone, thus giving rise to the myth of the legendary abominable snowman. Forced to fend for themselves, these exiled yetis often fully embrace the corrupting elements that caused their exile in the first place, growing more powerful and more deadly as a result. The most vile of these yetis turn to cannibalism, not out of need, but out of a sheer joy at the terror they inflict upon their kin. Invariably such cannibalistic yetis attract the attention of wendigos, which makes a bad situation all the worse.

qaf6YFqcLoAJ5CM4.name: Snowblind
qaf6YFqcLoAJ5CM4.description: When @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hiding}, the yeti is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} by any snowfall, even if it's not thick enough to make other creatures concealed.

eoHwXTgs9Au82i4J.name: Nightmare Guardian
eoHwXTgs9Au82i4J.description: Yetis gain a +4 status bonus to saves against fear and against spells and abilities that affect dreams. A yeti that falls prey to a supernatural nightmare loses this ability and becomes permanently enraged, gaining a +1 status bonus to attack and damage rolls and a -1 status penalty to AC.

wfIAFcaANDUUhMSm.name: Vanish
wfIAFcaANDUUhMSm.description:
Trigger The yeti is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} or @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected} while not in combat, and a creature would observe it.

Effect The yeti Strides or Climbs up to half its Speed to a location where it can @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hide}, then Hides. If its new Stealth check result meets or exceeds the triggering creature's Perception DC, the yeti remains hidden.

hsU755t5zFbchRub.name: Grizzly Arrival
hsU755t5zFbchRub.description:
Trigger The yeti hits a creature in the first round of combat and the yeti was @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} from that creature at the start of combat.

Effect Each enemy within @Template[type:emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} that witnesses the attack (including the target of the attack) must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:23] save. On a failure, the creature is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}; on a critical failure, it's @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 4}.

Young Blue Dragon.name: 青年蓝龙 Young Blue Dragon
Young Blue Dragon.publicNotes:
Blue dragons are the sleek and poised cosmopolitans of the chromatic dragons. Their brand of evil is organized, manipulative, and regal. Blue dragons often lair near or within cities and set out to bend the population to their will and gather hordes of servants. These dragons love spinning webs of conspiracy. A blue dragon's lackeys typically don't even realize that they serve a dragon, but instead think the protection money, tariffs, or taxes they are amassing is treasure for a cruel but legitimate master. In some ways, blue dragons even see their servants as a living hoard and value them like treasure. These dragons have been known to use these tactics even with their own chromatic cousins.

Not all blue dragons work clandestinely. Some lord over desert tribes and hill people like vengeful gods, demanding both tribute and worship. No matter how blue dragons manage their underlings, their bearing is regal and their lairs palatial; they're universally intolerant of insubordination, incompetence, and embezzlement, and punish perpetrators with murderous efficiency.

Blue dragons are also known for their use and mastery of illusion magic. They make use of illusions to augment their manipulations and bewilder their foes in battle. Blue dragons also have some control over water, but use this ability to destroy water, something quite dangerous for those who encounter them in their desert lairs.

The ideal lair for a blue dragon contains multiple passages, rooms, and secret chambers. As social creatures, blue dragons prefer to host guests in comfort-but their dwellings should not be so public that just anyone can come calling. A force of guards keeps out intruders, and clever illusions conceal the edifice from prying eyes. Rather than a pile of coins or gems, a blue dragon's true hoard is the rich furnishings in its citadel- expensive art, ornate furniture, and architectural marvels.

While there are many types of dragons, from the powerful planar dragons to the strange esoteric dragons, few dragon varieties are as well-known and as rightly feared as the chromatic dragons. Differentiated by the hue of their scales, each color of dragon unleashes its own flavor of murderous cruelty-be it by claw, tooth, or breath-and unlike most creatures, dragons only become more powerful as they age. Their lust for treasure, food, bloodshed, and control are legendary. Physically powerful with egos to match, these dragons are often morally depraved and act as criminal masterminds, vicious tyrants, or voracious raiders.

wf1nuRfEXOq0xBtc.name: 造水术() Create Water (At Will) (See Desert Thirst)
wf1nuRfEXOq0xBtc.description: 你将手捧起，水从中涌出。你创造2加仑的水。如果没有人饮用它，水会在1天后蒸发。

dJxa1u0JvHmiIXKG.name: Sound Imitation
dJxa1u0JvHmiIXKG.description: The dragon can mimic any sound it has heard. It must succeed at a Deception check with a +4 circumstance bonus to do so.

gCQ2k3U8EhFrjpCO.name: Wing Deflection
gCQ2k3U8EhFrjpCO.description:
Trigger The dragon is targeted with an attack

Effect The dragon raises its wing, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack. If the dragon is Flying, it descends 10 feet after the attack is complete.

2nWoUs5yTHmZJd6s.name: Breath Weapon
2nWoUs5yTHmZJd6s.description:
The dragon breathes lightning that deals [[/r {5d12}[electricity]]]{5d12 electricity damage} in an @Template[type:line|distance:80]{80-foot line} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:28|basic:true] save).

It can't use Breath Weapon again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.

fYKBzNcZosPojEyp.name: Desert Thirst
fYKBzNcZosPojEyp.description: When casting @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.WzLKjSw6hsBhuklC]{Create Water}, the dragon can attempt to destroy liquid instead of creating it, turning an equal amount of liquid into sand. This destroys liquid magic or alchemical items if they're of a lower level than the dragon (a creature can attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:26] save to protect all liquids in its possession). This doesn't affect the liquids in a creature's body.

MlLvVLQolivhuZFD.name: Draconic Frenzy
MlLvVLQolivhuZFD.description: The dragon makes two claw Strikes and one horns Strike in any order.

UZp9NX0EnCBPGns5.name: Draconic Momentum
UZp9NX0EnCBPGns5.description: The dragon recharges its Breath Weapon whenever it scores a critical hit with a Strike.

Young Brass Dragon.name: 青年黄铜龙 Young Brass Dragon
Young Brass Dragon.publicNotes:
Brass dragons are whimsical tricksters who delight in humor and play. They particularly enjoy conversations with humans and other civilized humanoids, delighting in the naive customs of these diminutive races without showing them haughtiness or scorn. While they may seem merely curious, brass dragons engage in this sort of conversation with the goal of keeping up to date on regional politics so they can anticipate future conflicts. Along the way, they create extensive information networks that begin with their own allies but stretch across all levels of humanoid society-networks which the brass dragon then uses to subtly assist settlements near their lair. Unlike the schemes and manipulations of blue dragons, brass dragons use their informant networks to establish justice and equality.

These carefree dragons value independence and feel that all creatures deserve to live as they please, provided they don't harm others. They are emotional creatures and tend to have short attention spans, sometimes falling victim to depression in their twilight years. To combat this, some brass dragons keep pets and houseplants that they can care for.

Though they may seem childlike in their curiosity concerning mortal affairs, a brass dragon's prowess in battle is no laughing matter. A brass dragon whose territory or allies are threatened is a terrifying foe indeed, quick to shed their innocent guise and unleash their terrifying might upon evildoers.

Most brass dragons live in desert climates, and while they keep their lairs hidden, they often build near humanoid settlements.

Paragons of virtue, nobility, and grace, metallic dragons are benevolent entities revered as mythic beings akin to gods in both their power and majesty. Few have ever seen a metallic dragon firsthand, but tales of their intervention in mortals' lives-and of their passing-always spread far and wide. Named for the way their scales resemble the shining metals humanoids use in commerce, warfare, and industry, these immense beings are diverse in their interests and abilities, and they don't seem to mind being associated with such mundane materials. After all, to compare a gold dragon to a gold coin is like comparing an ocean to a glass of water-though they may seem similar at first glance, the raw power, breadth, and grandeur of one simply overwhelms the other. In addition to metallic dragons and their chromatic counterparts, other types of dragons roam the world and the rest of the multiverse. In the legendary lands of Tian Xia on the other side of the globe are the imperial dragons, serpentine beings who protect the cosmic balance and defend their ancient homeland. Outside the Material Plane, primal dragons such as the domineering brine dragon and reclusive cloud dragon shape the nature and goings-on of the Elemental Planes. Countless other types of dragons are sure to exist, including dragons on far-flung planes of existence and, it is rumored, primeval dragons who soar between the stars.

GkuKYyD5W2XX5dpx.name: 动物交谈(恒定法术) Speak with Animals (Constant)
GkuKYyD5W2XX5dpx.description: 你可以对动物提出问题，从动物获得回答，以对动物及使用交涉（Diplomacy）技能。该法术不会令动物比正常更为友好。聪明的动物喜欢简要直说或者避而不谈，不那么聪明的则通常会做出傻瓜式的回复。

xdClMhhs1mXbf26g.name: Wing Deflection
xdClMhhs1mXbf26g.description:
Trigger The dragon is targeted with an attack

Effect The dragon raises its wing, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack. If the dragon is flying, it descends 10 feet after the attack is complete.

pCYQE7ydvnjQGmPi.name: Breath Weapon
pCYQE7ydvnjQGmPi.description:
The brass dragon breathes fire in a @Template[type:line|distance:60]{60-foot line} that deals [[/r {8d6}[fire]]]{8d6 fire damage} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:26|basic:true] save).

The dragon can't use Breath Weapon again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.

itJzZD6rxkMhtQQZ.name: Draconic Frenzy
itJzZD6rxkMhtQQZ.description: The dragon makes two claw Strikes and one jaws Strike in any order.

a9hdRp8sRfsMk1cJ.name: Draconic Momentum
a9hdRp8sRfsMk1cJ.description: When the dragon scores a critical hit with a Strike, it recharges Breath Weapon.

Young Blue Dragon (Spellcaster).name: 青年蓝龙施法者 Young Blue Dragon (Spellcaster)
Young Blue Dragon (Spellcaster).publicNotes:

Blue dragons are also known for their use and mastery of illusion magic. They make use of illusions to augment their manipulations and bewilder their foes in battle. Blue dragons also have some control over water, but use this ability to destroy water, something quite dangerous for those who encounter them in their desert lairs.

The ideal lair for a blue dragon contains multiple passages, rooms, and secret chambers. As social creatures, blue dragons prefer to host guests in comfort-but their dwellings should not be so public that just anyone can come calling. A force of guards keeps out intruders, and clever illusions conceal the edifice from prying eyes. Rather than a pile of coins or gems, a blue dragon's true hoard is the rich furnishings in its citadel- expensive art, ornate furniture, and architectural marvels.

While there are many types of dragons, from the powerful planar dragons to the strange esoteric dragons, few dragon varieties are as well-known and as rightly feared as the chromatic dragons. Differentiated by the hue of their scales, each color of dragon unleashes its own flavor of murderous cruelty-be it by claw, tooth, or breath-and unlike most creatures, dragons only become more powerful as they age. Their lust for treasure, food, bloodshed, and control are legendary. Physically powerful with egos to match, these dragons are often morally depraved and act as criminal masterminds, vicious tyrants, or voracious raiders.

wf1nuRfEXOq0xBtc.name: 造水术() Create Water (At Will) (See Desert Thirst)
wf1nuRfEXOq0xBtc.description: 你将手捧起，水从中涌出。你创造2加仑的水。如果没有人饮用它，水会在1天后蒸发。

7XXhNN60rTS6EZgN.name: 侦测魔法 Detect Magic
7XXhNN60rTS6EZgN.description:
你发出一股标记魔法存在的脉冲。你不会获得魔法存在或不存在以外的任何信息。你可以选择忽略你完全知晓的魔法，例如你或者你盟友的魔法物品以及持续法术。

仅当幻术魔法的环级低于你的侦测魔法环级时，你才能侦测幻术魔法。但是，具有幻术灵光但是没有在外表上做伪装的物品（例如一瓶隐形术药水），通常能够正常侦测。

升阶 (3环级) 你会了解法术侦测区域中最高环级的效果的学派。如果有相同强度的多个效果，GM决定你了解的为哪一个。

升阶 (4环级) 如3环级，你也能指出最高环级魔法的来源。如同一种模糊感官（imprecise sense），你不会了解具体的位置，但是可以将来源锁定到5尺立方（或者最近的那个五尺立方，如果来源体积比这个区域更大）。

ubXqGq1UdMxmxXga.name: 隐形仆役 Unseen Servant
ubXqGq1UdMxmxXga.description:
你召唤一个隐形仆役（见边栏），你可以通过维持该法术的一部分来命令它。它会为你服务直到其生命值被减少到0，此时法术结束，或者直到你停止维持该法术。隐形仆役获得被召唤特征。

@Compendium[pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.j7NNPfZwD19BwSEZ]{隐形仆役} (无阵营)

dJxa1u0JvHmiIXKG.name: Sound Imitation
dJxa1u0JvHmiIXKG.description: The dragon can mimic any sound it has heard. It must succeed at a Deception check with a +4 circumstance bonus to do so.

gCQ2k3U8EhFrjpCO.name: Wing Deflection
gCQ2k3U8EhFrjpCO.description:
Trigger The dragon is targeted with an attack

Effect The dragon raises its wing, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack. If the dragon is Flying, it descends 10 feet after the attack is complete.

2nWoUs5yTHmZJd6s.name: Breath Weapon
2nWoUs5yTHmZJd6s.description:
The dragon breathes lightning that deals [[/r {5d12}[electricity]]]{5d12 electricity damage} in an @Template[type:line|distance:80]{80-foot line} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:28|basic:true] save).

It can't use Breath Weapon again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.

fYKBzNcZosPojEyp.name: Desert Thirst
fYKBzNcZosPojEyp.description: When casting @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.WzLKjSw6hsBhuklC]{Create Water}, the dragon can attempt to destroy liquid instead of creating it, turning an equal amount of liquid into sand. This destroys liquid magic or alchemical items if they're of a lower level than the dragon (a creature can attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:26] save to protect all liquids in its possession). This doesn't affect the liquids in a creature's body.

Young Brass Dragon (Spellcaster).name: 青年黄铜龙施法者 Young Brass Dragon (Spellcaster)
Young Brass Dragon (Spellcaster).publicNotes:
Brass dragons are whimsical tricksters who delight in humor and play. They particularly enjoy conversations with humans and other civilized humanoids, delighting in the naive customs of these diminutive races without showing them haughtiness or scorn. While they may seem merely curious, brass dragons engage in this sort of conversation with the goal of keeping up to date on regional politics so they can anticipate future conflicts. Along the way, they create extensive information networks that begin with their own allies but stretch across all levels of humanoid society-networks which the brass dragon then uses to subtly assist settlements near their lair. Unlike the schemes and manipulations of blue dragons, brass dragons use their informant networks to establish justice and equality.

These carefree dragons value independence and feel that all creatures deserve to live as they please, provided they don't harm others. They are emotional creatures and tend to have short attention spans, sometimes falling victim to depression in their twilight years. To combat this, some brass dragons keep pets and houseplants that they can care for.

Though they may seem childlike in their curiosity concerning mortal affairs, a brass dragon's prowess in battle is no laughing matter. A brass dragon whose territory or allies are threatened is a terrifying foe indeed, quick to shed their innocent guise and unleash their terrifying might upon evildoers.

Most brass dragons live in desert climates, and while they keep their lairs hidden, they often build near humanoid settlements.

Paragons of virtue, nobility, and grace, metallic dragons are benevolent entities revered as mythic beings akin to gods in both their power and majesty. Few have ever seen a metallic dragon firsthand, but tales of their intervention in mortals' lives-and of their passing-always spread far and wide. Named for the way their scales resemble the shining metals humanoids use in commerce, warfare, and industry, these immense beings are diverse in their interests and abilities, and they don't seem to mind being associated with such mundane materials. After all, to compare a gold dragon to a gold coin is like comparing an ocean to a glass of water-though they may seem similar at first glance, the raw power, breadth, and grandeur of one simply overwhelms the other. In addition to metallic dragons and their chromatic counterparts, other types of dragons roam the world and the rest of the multiverse. In the legendary lands of Tian Xia on the other side of the globe are the imperial dragons, serpentine beings who protect the cosmic balance and defend their ancient homeland. Outside the Material Plane, primal dragons such as the domineering brine dragon and reclusive cloud dragon shape the nature and goings-on of the Elemental Planes. Countless other types of dragons are sure to exist, including dragons on far-flung planes of existence and, it is rumored, primeval dragons who soar between the stars.

GkuKYyD5W2XX5dpx.name: 动物交谈(恒定法术) Speak with Animals (Constant)
GkuKYyD5W2XX5dpx.description: 你可以对动物提出问题，从动物获得回答，以对动物及使用交涉（Diplomacy）技能。该法术不会令动物比正常更为友好。聪明的动物喜欢简要直说或者避而不谈，不那么聪明的则通常会做出傻瓜式的回复。

tEqqvMNATOfUWKfk.name: 侦测魔法 Detect Magic
tEqqvMNATOfUWKfk.description:
你发出一股标记魔法存在的脉冲。你不会获得魔法存在或不存在以外的任何信息。你可以选择忽略你完全知晓的魔法，例如你或者你盟友的魔法物品以及持续法术。

仅当幻术魔法的环级低于你的侦测魔法环级时，你才能侦测幻术魔法。但是，具有幻术灵光但是没有在外表上做伪装的物品（例如一瓶隐形术药水），通常能够正常侦测。

升阶 (3环级) 你会了解法术侦测区域中最高环级的效果的学派。如果有相同强度的多个效果，GM决定你了解的为哪一个。

升阶 (4环级) 如3环级，你也能指出最高环级魔法的来源。如同一种模糊感官（imprecise sense），你不会了解具体的位置，但是可以将来源锁定到5尺立方（或者最近的那个五尺立方，如果来源体积比这个区域更大）。

xdClMhhs1mXbf26g.name: Wing Deflection
xdClMhhs1mXbf26g.description:
Trigger The dragon is targeted with an attack

Effect The dragon raises its wing, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack. If the dragon is flying, it descends 10 feet after the attack is complete.

pCYQE7ydvnjQGmPi.name: Breath Weapon
pCYQE7ydvnjQGmPi.description:
The brass dragon breathes fire in a @Template[type:line|distance:60]{60-foot line} that deals [[/r {8d6}[fire]]]{8d6 fire damage} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:26|basic:true] save).

The dragon can't use Breath Weapon again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.

Zaramuun.name: 活化沙丘 Zaramuun
Zaramuun.publicNotes: Zaramuuns are beings of elemental sand that hide in deserts and wastelands. They disguise themselves as massive dunes before rising up to attack living creatures. The most infamous zaramuuns kill any living creatures they find, but others simply rob their victims of all metal and stone possessions before fleeing. Although zaramuuns insist they are only reclaiming what was taken from their ancestral earth, this is simple self-delusion; most zaramuuns use their stolen goods as payment and material components to conjure fiends, for Zaramuuns were exiled from the Plane of Earth after worshipping fiends who promised to give them power over other elementals. This worship gradually transformed into servitude, and now many zaramuuns believe that if they send enough souls to their masters, they will be set free.

OuCr8UICQ5a4kIDG.name: 次元锚(随意施法,恒定法术) Dimensional Anchor (At Will) (Constant)
OuCr8UICQ5a4kIDG.description:
你妨碍目标传送以及在次元之间旅行的能力。次元锚会尝试反制任何传送效果，以及任何移动目标到另一个位面的效果。法术持续时间由目标的意志豁免决定。

大成功 目标不受影响。

成功 该效果持续时间为1分钟。

失败 该效果持续时间为10分钟。

大失败 该效果持续时间为1小时。

1jpe4LxJZKxw1Rmq.name: 暗示术(随意施法) Suggestion (At Will)
1jpe4LxJZKxw1Rmq.description:
你的甜言蜜语令生物难以抗拒。你向目标指示一系列动作，其用语对目标而言必须是一系列合理的动作，并且它不可以招致自毁或者明显违抗目标自身愿望。目标必须尝试一次意志豁免。

大成功 目标不受影响，并且知道你尝试控制它。

成功 目标不受影响，并且认为你在和它们正常对话，而不是对其施放法术。

失败 目标立即按照你的指示行动。该法术的持续时间为1分钟，或者直到目标完成一个有终点的指示，或者直到指示变得会招致自毁，或具有其他明显的负面效果。

大失败 如同失败，但基本持续时间为1小时。

升阶 (8环级) 你能以至多10个生物为目标。

6MX0hGFGosdch5VS.name: 借机攻击 Attack of Opportunity

XHFapZJB0eCngkyn.name: Dune
XHFapZJB0eCngkyn.description: Until the next time it acts, the zaramuun appears to be a sand dune. It has an automatic result of 47 (50 in sandy terrain) on Deception and Stealth checks and DCs to pass as a sand dune. Any creature that walks onto the zaramuun moves into its body and is Engulfed.

4NNU4WrjaWJrngyL.name: 包卷 Engulf
4NNU4WrjaWJrngyL.description:
@Check[type:reflex|dc:35|traits:damaging-effect], [[/r {4d12}[bludgeoning]]]{4d12 bludgeoning damage} and @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.ksLCg62cLOojw3gN]{Dimensional Anchor}, Escape DC 32, Rupture 28

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Engulf]

wLRqThGwPUufb2HR.name: Raking Sand
wLRqThGwPUufb2HR.description:
Requirements The zaramuun hit with a melee Strike with its last action, or it has a creature Engulfed.

Effect The zaramuun attempts to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{Disarm} one primarily metal or stone object from the Struck or Engulfed creature and casts its innate @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.ksLCg62cLOojw3gN]{Dimensional Anchor} on the target creature.

abrvwmCxto1mr7Xu.name: Sand Glide
abrvwmCxto1mr7Xu.description: The zaramuun can @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.H6v1VgowHaKHnVlG]{Burrow} through sand and dirt (but not stone) at its full burrow Speed, leaving no tunnel or sign of its passing. Any Engulfed creatures are left behind when it Burrows. Loose sand and scree are not difficult terrain for a zaramuun.

mB1mKRbvNa6edeUB.name: Sandblast
mB1mKRbvNa6edeUB.description:
The zaramuun sprays a blast of sand that deals [[/r {11d10}[slashing]]]{11d10 slashing damage} to all creatures in a @Template[type:line|distance:60] (@Check[type:reflex|dc:38|traits:damaging-effect]).

It can't Sandblast again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Sandblast]]{1d4 rounds}.

Critical Success No effect.

Success Half damage.

Failure Full damage.

Critical Failure Full damage and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round.

Zephyr Hawk.name: 西风之鹰 Zephyr Hawk
Zephyr Hawk.publicNotes:
Zephyr hawks drift among the currents of the Plane of Air in great flocks.

Hailing from the Plane of Air, these beings appear in a variety of sizes and shapes.

x8uwJOVGskq8pjOH.name: Circling Attack
x8uwJOVGskq8pjOH.description: The zephyr hawk Flies up to half its Speed, makes two wing Strikes, then Flies up to half its Speed again to return to its original location. The second half of this movement doesn't trigger reactions. Both attacks count toward the zephyr hawk's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after it makes both attacks.

Zombie Brute.name: 蛮力丧尸 Zombie Brute
Zombie Brute.publicNotes:
Necromantic augmentations have granted this zombie increased size and power.

A zombie's only desire is to consume the living. Unthinking and ever-shambling harbingers of death, zombies stop only when they're destroyed.

TtcFIJZjrZ4Vaaml.name: Slow
TtcFIJZjrZ4Vaaml.description: A zombie is permanently @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.

Zombie Hulk.name: 笨重丧尸 Zombie Hulk
Zombie Hulk.publicNotes:
These towering horrors are animated from the corpses of monstrosities.

A zombie's only desire is to consume the living. Unthinking and ever-shambling harbingers of death, zombies stop only when they're destroyed.

TBlBPLZKvFBHjjgU.name: Slow
TBlBPLZKvFBHjjgU.description: A zombie is permanently slowed 1 and can't use reactions.

iTAZj4rMOPRWWJDP.name: Corpse Throwing
iTAZj4rMOPRWWJDP.description: A zombie hulk can throw corpses at foes. While any Medium dead body will do, they sometimes throw @Compendium[pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.0plBflWwrCWQO2RO]{Zombie Shamblers}, who take just as much damage from being thrown as the target they hit. A thrown shambler lands @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}, but if it's not destroyed, it can rise and use other actions normally.

DTXq4teaiLU9haNE.name: Wide Swing
DTXq4teaiLU9haNE.description: The zombie hulk makes a hunk of meat Strike and compares the attack roll result to the AC of up to two foes, each of whom must be within the Strike's reach. This attack counts as two attacks for the zombie hulk's multiple attack penalty.

Air Mephit.name: 气魔蝠 Air Mephit
Air Mephit.publicNotes:
Air mephits are capricious and flighty relative to their kin; they are as likely to fly blindly into battle as they are to whine in terror at a loud noise. They are pale blue in coloration and have thin wings that trail small puffs of vapor as they fly through the skies.

Mephits-sometimes known as elemental scamps-are little bipedal critters with bat-like wings who serve stronger elementals on the Elemental Planes or neophyte spellcasters who summon them to the Material Plane. All mephits have an inkling of magical power as well as a breath weapon.

5Rd1LNWiczurzj0C.name: Breath Weapon
5Rd1LNWiczurzj0C.description:
The air mephit breathes sand and grit in a @Template[type:cone|distance:15] that deals [[/r {2d6}[slashing]]]{2d6 slashing damage} to each creature within the area (@Check[type:reflex|dc:17|basic:true] save).

The air mephit can't use Breath Weapon again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.

Alchemical Golem.name: 炼金魔像 Alchemical Golem
Alchemical Golem.publicNotes:
炼金魔像是行走的炼金术噩梦，能够造成各种各样的痛苦创伤。它漂浮在头顶的圆型容器的大脑赋予了它听从命令的能力。在极其罕见的情况下，在创建炼金魔像过程中所使用的大脑可能会保留一些记忆碎片，甚至拥有部分智力，从而产生一个具有自己性格和计划的个体。

传说中的魔像由基本材料精心制做，然后被魔法活化成为强大的守护者。它会完全服从于创造者的命令，哪怕在其创造者去世后的数年乃至几个世纪的岁月中都是如此。目前已知有两种可以制造魔像的方法。传统的方法为对新制造的魔像注入被收割的灵魂或精华，这种方式被认为是对那些认为灵魂神圣不可侵犯之人的侮辱，那些邪恶或无道德观念的魔像制造者会倾向于使用这样的方法。另一种不那么臭名昭著的方法是将纯净的正能量引入魔像体内，人为地模拟灵魂的创造的过程。这并不能给与魔像真正的灵魂，而且这个方法通常更加昂贵且耗时。不管使用何种方法，最终得到的魔像在功能上是一样的。每种魔像都有独特的生命力量，能让它们受到某些形式的魔法影响，但是除了这些弱点之外，它们通常对魔法免疫，也很难被武器伤害。

在游戏中，魔像更适合作为需要征服的敌人，而不是作为伴随玩家角色冒险的盟友。制造魔像的过程是耗时、昂贵且困难，只有极具天赋的施法者或工匠才有可能完成这种任务。虽然某些魔法典籍，例如所谓的“魔像手册”——据说可以为魔像制造者提供帮助，但大多数情况下制造魔像这样的事情应该有GM来完成。魔像的部件可以作为战利品或魔法物品回收，具体取决于不同的魔像。边栏列举了每种魔像可以被回收的部件的示例。

TpEz65tv1dwJ91cy.name: 炼金容器 Alchemical Chambers
TpEz65tv1dwJ91cy.description:
炼金魔像的身躯里有六个存放不同物质的炼金容器。当炼金魔像使用能力时会产生随机的炼金术效果，投掷1d6来并查阅下表（如果投出的结果是已经破损的炼金容器，则无效果）：

[[/br {1d6}[Alchemical Effect] #Alchemical Chambers]]{1d6} 炼金术效果 Alchemical Effect
1

酸液伤害 Acid Damage
2 寒冷伤害 Cold Damage
3 电击伤害 Electricity Damage
4 火焰伤害 Fire Damage
5 毒液伤害 Poison Damage
6 恶心 Sickness: @Check[type:fortitude|dc:26|name:Alchemical Sickness|traits:disease]豁免，失败则@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 1} (大失败则@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 2})

N0g5xdIF3LC3JDxP.name: 炼金破裂 Alchemical Rupture
N0g5xdIF3LC3JDxP.description:
当炼金魔像受到重击伤害或受到@Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.1xbFBQDRs0hT5xZ9]{粉碎音波 Shatter}魔法影响时，身上的一个玻璃容器会碎裂，对@Template[type:emanation|distance:5]{5尺弥漫}范围喷出炼金液体。

投1d6并查阅炼金容器 Alchemical Chambers表来决定碎裂的是哪个容器——当结果为1-5时，范围中的生物受到[[/r {10d6}]]{10d6}对应类型的伤害（@Check[type:reflex|dc:28|basic:true]豁免）。当结果为6时，生物必须进行对抗恶心效果的强韧豁免检定。

[[/br {1d6}[Alchemical Effect] #Alchemical Rupture]]{1d6} 炼金效果 Alchemical Effect
1

[[/r {10d6}[acid]]]{10d6酸液伤害} @Check[type:reflex|dc:28|basic:true|traits:acid]
2 [[/r {10d6}[cold]]]{10d6寒冷伤害} @Check[type:reflex|dc:28|basic:true|traits:cold]
3 [[/r {10d6}[electricity]]]{10d6电击伤害} @Check[type:reflex|dc:28|basic:true|traits:electricity]
4 [[/r {10d6}[fire]]]{10d6火焰伤害} @Check[type:reflex|dc:28|basic:true|traits:fire]
5 [[/r {10d6}[poison]]]{10d6毒素伤害} @Check[type:reflex|dc:28|basic:true|traits:poison]
6 恶心 Sickness: @Check[type:fortitude|dc:26|name:Alchemical Sickness|traits:disease]豁免，失败则@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 1} (大失败则@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 2})

pOtIHukgdOyL8rMp.name: 魔像抗魔 Golem Antimagic
pOtIHukgdOyL8rMp.description:
被伤害：音波([[/r {5d8}]]{5d8伤害}, 区域效果或可持续伤害则为[[/r {2d6}]]{2d6伤害}; 被治疗：酸液(区域效果[[/r {2d4}[healing]]]{2d4生命值});被减速：寒冷

魔像免疫法术和魔法能力，魔像自身所拥有的除外。但是每种魔像都会被少数几个特定法术以特殊方式影响。这些效果在魔像的具体数据里会以缩写的方式给出，这里则是详细解释。如果列出的条目包含多种类型（例如“寒冷和水”）则这些类型的法术都能对魔像产生影响。

被伤害 Harmed By 任意该种类的魔法以该魔像为目标时，都能对该魔像造成所列伤害（该伤害无伤害类型），并取代原本的法术效果。如果魔像开始回合时位于该种类型的范围魔法效果中，或受到该种魔法的持续性效果影响，则受到括号内所标明的伤害值。

被治疗 Healed By 任意该种类的魔法以该魔像为目标时，都能解除该魔像的缓慢效果并治疗魔像相当于法术伤害一半的HP。如果魔像开始回合时位于该种类型的范围魔法效果中，则获得括号内所列的生命值。

被减速 Slowed By 任意该种类的魔法以该魔像为目标时，都能让魔像陷入@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1}，持续[[/br 2d6 #rounds]]{2d6轮}，并取代原本的法术效果。如果魔像开始回合时位于该种类型的范围魔法效果中，则魔像在该轮中陷入@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1}。

法术弱点 Vulnerable To 每种魔像都会有针对某一种或几种特定的法术的弱点，具体效果会描述在数据中。

tq3HesFWx5P7xPWl.name: 法术弱点-粉碎音波 Vulnerable to Shatter
tq3HesFWx5P7xPWl.description: 对炼金魔像施放@Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.1xbFBQDRs0hT5xZ9]{粉碎音波 Shatter}能正常产生效果，而且有机会导致容器破裂

ahtVNJjKjna3LTc1.name: 炼金注射 Alchemical Injection
ahtVNJjKjna3LTc1.description:
当炼金魔像以注射器打击击中一个生物，投1d6并查阅炼金容器表来决定额外效果。注射器造成[[/r {2d6}]]{2d6}对应类型的额外伤害（或让目标暴露在恶心效果之下，取决于投掷结果）。

[[/br {1d6}[Alchemical Effect] #Alchemical Injection]]{1d6} 炼金效果 Alchemical Effect
1

[[/r {2d6}[acid]]]{2d6酸液伤害}
2 [[/r {2d6}[cold]]]{2d6寒冷伤害}
3 [[/r {2d6}[electricity]]]{2d6电击伤害}
4 [[/r {2d6}[fire]]]{2d6火焰伤害}
5 [[/r {2d6}[poison]]]{2d6毒素伤害}
6 恶心 Sickness: @Check[type:fortitude|dc:26|name:Alchemical Sickness|traits:disease]豁免，失败则@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 1} (大失败则@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 2})

IUmBG7HtxvrIOHUR.name: 生成炸弹 Generate Bomb
IUmBG7HtxvrIOHUR.description:
炼金魔像从炼金容器中汲取物质填满一个小瓶来制造一枚炸弹，并进行一次炸弹打击。

投1d6并查阅炼金容器表来决定炸弹效果。

如果结果为1-4，则它创造的炸弹相当于高等（greater）炼金炸弹：容器1为@Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.jC8GmH0Un6vDxdMj]{酸液瓶 Acid Flask}，容器2为@Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.intVPcEzbE9o4NQd]{霜冻瓶 Frost Vial}，容器3为@Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.r2iTRbt1zpkAqHj2]{瓶装闪电 Bottled Lightning}，容器4为@Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.n5yTlTs63o53n3k6]{炽火胶 Alchemist's Fire}。

如果结果为5，则它创造出一枚能造成3d10毒素伤害和3毒素溅射伤害的毒液炸弹，但没有其他效果。

如果结果为6，则它创造出一枚恶心炸弹，将目标和溅射半径内的所有生物暴露在恶心效果之下；只被溅射影响的生物在强韧豁免检定上有+2环境加值。

[[/br {1d6}[Alchemical Effect] #Generate Bomb]]{1d6} 炼金效果 Alchemical Effect
1

酸液瓶 Acid Flask: [[/r {1}[acid]]]{1酸液伤害}, [[/r {3d6}[persistent,acid]]]{3d6持续酸液伤害}@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{持续酸液伤害}和[[/r {3}[splash,acid]]]{3酸液溅射伤害}
2 霜冻瓶: [[/r {3d6}[cold]]]{3d6寒冷伤害}, [[/r {3}[splash,cold]]]{3寒冷溅射伤害}和-10尺速度状态减值直到目标的下回合结束@Compendium[pf2e.equipment-effects.nJRoiSyd67eQ1dYj]{效果：高等霜冻瓶}
3 瓶装闪电: [[/r {3d6}[electricity]]]{3d6电击伤害}, [[/r {3}[splash,electricity]]]{3电击溅射伤害}和@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{措手不及 Flat-Footed}直到目标下个回合开始
4 炽火胶: [[/r {3d8}[fire]]]{3d8火焰伤害}, [[/r {3}[persistent,fire]]]{3持续火焰伤害}@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{持续火焰伤害}和[[/r {3}[splash,fire]]]{3火焰溅射伤害}
5 毒液炸弹: [[/r {3d10}[poison]]]{3d10 毒素伤害}和[[/r {3}[splash,poison]]]{3毒素溅射伤害}
6 恶心 Sickness: @Check[type:fortitude|dc:26|name:Alchemical Sickness|traits:disease]豁免，失败则@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 1} (大失败则@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 2})

Alghollthu Master.name: 底栖魔鱼 Alghollthu Master
Alghollthu Master.publicNotes:
Aboleths form the core of alghollthu society, and while they are the "common folk" of their own societies, they see themselves as masters of all others. Unlike their leaders, who mask their actions using magical disguises, aboleths revel in their monstrous forms, appearing as primeval fish with tentacles. Masters of psychic manipulation, they are a species so ancient that they were present in the world when it was young, before the gods had turned their attention to the planet. They see all other life as something they have the right to control, so the idea that potential slaves might have faith in a higher power other than themselves enrages aboleths.

In bygone millennia, aquatic monsters known as alghollthus used their occult powers to conquer and rule vast parts of the world. Their empires contained countless mortal slaves treated as little more than cattle. Alghollthus shaped their slaves and other creatures using mental manipulation and physically transformative magic. Aberrant horrors from faceless stalkers to mimics can be traced back to this meddling. The rulers of the alghollthu race, the so-called veiled masters, further shaped entire societies by assuming the forms of those they controlled. From the heights of power to the shadows of poverty, the veiled masters manipulated these societies according to their own dark designs, enslaving, killing, or horrifically transforming those who discovered their plans or acted against them.

In time, the alghollthus grew frustrated with their increasingly upstart slave societies and sought to wipe the slate clean-both starting anew and punishing those who had become too willful and rebellious. They used incredible magical power to call forth a cataclysm, hoping to destroy the rebellious societies they'd manipulated. Yet they miscalculated the strength of faith and will to survive of their pawns and slaves, and in time the world and its empires recovered and grew strong once again-this time without alghollthu influence.

Today, the alghollthus have retreated from their mass-scale manipulation of the surface world, and they have mostly remained within the deep aquatic realms where they still rule without question. Yet they have not abandoned their plots entirely, and the reemergence of servitor races like ugothols points to a frightening possibility-that the alghollthus have turned their hateful eyes to the surface once again.

CRjz5QeNCuFvnsRa.name: 投影术(随意施法) Project Image (At Will)
CRjz5QeNCuFvnsRa.description:
你投射出一个自身的幻影。你必须保持在幻影的射程中，并且当你无法看到幻影时，该法术结束。当你施放一个区域不是弥漫的法术时，你可以令法术效果从你或者幻影上发出。由于该幻影是幻术，它无法从法术中获益，但法术的视觉效果仍然会出现。幻影具有和你相同的AC。如果它被攻击命中，或者豁免失败，法术结束。

升阶 (+2) 你通过维持该法术可以达到的最大持续时间增加到10分钟。

rmOTng6TpYdcY50N.name: 幻象场景(随意施法) Illusory Scene (At Will)
rmOTng6TpYdcY50N.description:
你创造一个幻想的场景，包括至多10个各种大小的生物或者物体，它们都必须在法术区域中。这些组成元素会产生合适的声音和气味，它们摸起来也很正常。幻象场景的组成元素不能说话。不同于 @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.f8SBoXiXQjlCKqly]{幻象生物 Illusory Creature} 法术，在你的场景中的生物没有战斗能力和数据。你的场景不能改变其周围的环境，但你可以将你的场景放在 @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.HBJPsonQnWcC3qdX]{幻景 Hallucinatory Terrain} 法术的幻象环境中。

当你创造该场景时，你可以选择它是静态的还是依某特定程序运动。虽然静态场景是静止的，但它仍包含基础的自然运动。例如，风吹过一张幻术纸时会卷走它。一段程序至多长1分钟，并且在其结束时重复。例如，你可以创造一个两个兽人互相打斗的场景，每次重复中这场战斗都是相同的。如果你创造一个循环，两个战士在场景结束时，会处在场景开始的位置，但你也可以让程序更流畅，从而很难指出哪里是循环的开始和结束。任何观察该场景数分钟的人几乎总会发现它是循环的。你不能在你创造幻术之后改变程序。

任何接触幻象的一部分，或者使用搜索（Seek）动作来检查它的生物可以尝试不相信你的幻觉。如果它和幻象的一部分交互，它仅不相信这部分。仅在大成功时，它才会不相信整个场景。

升阶 (6环级) 在你的场景中的生物或者物体可以说话。你必须在创造你的程序时，念出你的每个演员的每行台词。该法术会依每个演员掩饰你的声音。

升阶 (8环级) 如6环级版本，但是持续时间无限。

mzLQxxUbDe77Znfh.name: 幻景(随意施法) Hallucinatory Terrain (At Will)
mzLQxxUbDe77Znfh.description:
你创造一个幻觉，令自然地形看起来，听起来，感觉起来，闻起来都是另一种地形。这无法掩盖任何区域中的建筑或者生物。任何接触幻觉或者使用搜索（Seek）动作来检查它的生物可以尝试不相信你的幻觉。

升阶 (5环级) 你的幻想也会掩盖建筑或者创造幻象建筑（但仍然无法掩盖生物）。

u1TxAuWi9W8ZlwIx.name: 隐匿之纱(随意施法) Veil (At Will)
u1TxAuWi9W8ZlwIx.description:
你将目标伪装为另一个身形相似身高相仿体重相近的生物。该伪装能够隐藏目标的身份，或者令其如同其他族裔，但这不足以令其扮作另一个特定个人。该法术不会改变声音，气味，或者仪态。你为每个目标分别选择伪装；例如，你可以令一个目标看起来是矮人，另一个看起来是精灵。施放隐匿之纱视为假扮（Impersonate）动作的设立伪装。这令目标忽视任何可能会从扮作不熟悉生物中获得的减值，并且会赋予其在避免他人看破你的伪装的欺骗（Deception）检定上+4状态加值，并且即使你未受训你也加上其等级。你可以解消任一或者所有这些伪装。

升阶 (5环级) 该法术也会伪装目标的声音和气味；并获得听觉特征。

升阶 (7环级) 该目标外观上可以是任何相同体型的生物，甚至是特定个人。你必须曾见过特定个人，才能重现其外观。该法术也会伪装目标的声音和气味；并获得听觉特征。

K5wtDTBvqyxmQgdA.name: 催眠图纹(随意施法) Hypnotic Pattern (At Will)
K5wtDTBvqyxmQgdA.description:
你创造一个漂浮在空中的在几何图形般云雾中变换色彩的图纹。在图纹中的生物 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{目眩 Dazzled}。除此之外，在你施放时处于图纹中的生物，进入图纹中的生物，在图纹中结束回合的生物，或者对图纹使用搜索（Seek）或者交互（Interact）动作的生物在此时必须尝试一次意志豁免。已经被图纹 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{迷魂 Fascinated} 的生物无需尝试新的豁免。

成功 目标不受影响。

失败 目标被该图纹迷魂。

大失败 目标被该图纹迷魂。只要其仍迷魂，它无法使用反应动作。

sG9kkKfuPYIgwtc6.name: 幻象造物(随意施法) Illusory Object (At Will)
sG9kkKfuPYIgwtc6.description:
你创造一个固定物体的视觉幻象。该幻象必须能完全处于法术区域中。该物体会自然活动，但是不会发出声音或者产生气味。举例而言，幻象瀑布中会出现水并流下，但是它会是安静的。

当生物触摸幻像，或者使用搜索（Seek）动作来检查它时，该生物可以尝试不相信你的幻术。

升阶 (2环级) 你的幻象也会发出合适的声音，产生正常气味，并且摸起来也很正常。该法术获得听觉特征。该持续时间增加到1小时。

升阶 (5环级) 如2环级，但是持续时间为无限。

DFaamiHPt04lXEiq.name: Mucus Cloud
DFaamiHPt04lXEiq.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:5]{5 feet} @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

While underwater, an aboleth exudes a cloud of transparent slime. An air-breathing creature adjacent to an aboleth must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:25] save each round or lose the ability to breathe air but gain the ability to breathe water for 3 hours.

cckOUw1gK3GNCnML.name: Slime
cckOUw1gK3GNCnML.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:25]

Stage 1 no ill effect (1 round)

Stage 2 the victim's skin softens, inflicting @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (1 round)

Stage 3 the victim's skin transforms into a clear, slimy membrane, inflicting @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} until the curse ends; every hour this membrane remains dry, the creature's drained condition increases by 1 (permanent).

A @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.RneiyehRO6f7LP44]{Remove Disease} spell can counteract this curse, but immunity to disease offers no protection against it

Ancient Black Dragon.name: 古黑龙 Ancient Black Dragon
Ancient Black Dragon.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic
Ancient Black Dragon.publicNotes:
Murderous tyrants of marshes, swamps, bogs, and fens, black dragons terrorize their domains with intense fervor. Gleefully sadistic, they rule their fetid principalities from a deep cave or otherwise isolated part of the swamp with a mix of lightning-quick raids and subterfuge. Their hatred for other creatures is as acidic as their breath weapons, and they rarely tolerate even other dragons of their kind-except perhaps to mate or temporarily collaborate to take down a mutual enemy.

Black dragons are amphibious-although they breathe air, their gills also allow them to breathe water. Their frills and fins make them accomplished swimmers, well suited to their wetland environments and submerged lairs. They're immune to the fetid water that comes as a result of their magical ability to corrupt water.

Black dragon lairs are as foul as their souls. The floors are littered with rotting meat, and plundered treasures line the muck and slime of their dank caves amid twisted roots and creepers. Such places are often crawling with pests, snakes, and slimes. Though they claim natural caverns when they can, they make do with areas of dense, twisted vegetation within a swamp. Black dragon treasure hoards primarily consist of gems and expensive glass work, as valuables of softer substance can't survive the dragon's acidic presence.

While there are many types of dragons, from the powerful planar dragons to the strange esoteric dragons, few dragon varieties are as well-known and as rightly feared as the chromatic dragons. Differentiated by the hue of their scales, each color of dragon unleashes its own flavor of murderous cruelty-be it by claw, tooth, or breath-and unlike most creatures, dragons only become more powerful as they age. Their lust for treasure, food, bloodshed, and control are legendary. Physically powerful with egos to match, these dragons are often morally depraved and act as criminal masterminds, vicious tyrants, or voracious raiders.

lo9zjzoOZSRs5svZ.name: 黑暗术(随意施法) Darkness (At Will)
lo9zjzoOZSRs5svZ.description:
你创造一片黑暗的帷幕，光线无法穿透，并且光源无法在区域中发光。光线无法进入该区域，并且任何非魔法光源，例如火炬或者提灯，在区域中不会发出任何光线，即使其光照可能到达黑暗术之外也是如此。这也会压制等于或低于你的黑暗术环级的魔法光亮。光线无法穿透，所以在区域中的生物无法看到外面。对于外面，这看起来如同一团纯粹黑暗的球。

升阶 (4环级) 即使具有黑暗视觉的生物（但不包括高等黑暗视觉）也几乎无法看穿这黑暗。它们透过黑暗看到的生物视为 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{隐蔽 Concealed}。

D4C1yHkCqpQckxgr.name: Tail Lash
D4C1yHkCqpQckxgr.description:
Trigger A creature within reach of the dragon's tail takes an action to Strike or attempt a skill check

Effect The dragon Strikes with its tail at the triggering creature at a -2 penalty. If it hits, the creature takes a -2 circumstance penalty to the triggering roll.

@Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-effects.QqC9xymSXSVunDgl]{Effect: Tail Lash (Attack Roll)}

@Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-effects.4HJJdogS751Z04lD]{Effect: Tail Lash (Skill Check)}

GeAJNEdtRdXSvZvk.name: Breath Weapon
GeAJNEdtRdXSvZvk.description:
The dragon breathes a spray of acid that deals [[/r {17d6}[acid]]]{17d6 acid damage} in a @Template[type:line|distance:100]{100 foot line} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:39|basic:true] save).

It can't use Breath Weapon again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.

SRv8Gjga6DHY4U8G.name: Corrupt Water
SRv8Gjga6DHY4U8G.description:
Frequency Once per day

Effect The dragon permanently befouls 10 cubic feet of liquid within 90 feet. The liquid becomes undrinkable and unable to support water-breathing life.

This destroys liquid magic or alchemical items if they're of a lower level than the dragon (a creature can attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:35] save to protect liquids in its possession). This doesn't affect liquids in a creature's body.

hxUuVqQu31iQwmv1.name: Draconic Frenzy
hxUuVqQu31iQwmv1.description: The dragon makes two claw Strikes and one horns Strike in any order in any order.

0oICLdGDJMUmfVhn.name: Draconic Momentum
0oICLdGDJMUmfVhn.description: The dragon recharges its Breath Weapon whenever it scores a critical hit with a Strike

Ancient Copper Dragon.name: 古赤铜龙 Ancient Copper Dragon
Ancient Copper Dragon.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic
Ancient Copper Dragon.publicNotes:
Capricious and always eager to share a good laugh, copper dragons are among the wiliest of the metallic dragons, but this by no means interferes with their mission to spread freedom in oppressive lands. Copper dragons are hedonists who are quick to indulge in simple pleasures, but they're also sympathetic to other creatures, slow to pass judgment, and careful to always examine a situation from as many perspectives as possible. This philosophy has its drawbacks, however, as copper dragons are susceptible to negative influences and prone to forgiving the less serious evil acts performed by their chromatic cousins and other cruel creatures. Copper dragons also have a difficult time keeping their temper in check once they are roused to anger.

Copper dragons tend to lair in warm or temperate hills, but due to their nature, they move their lairs every few years. They sometimes live among other people, especially any dwarves who reside nearby. Some copper dragons even worship gods typically worshipped only by humanoids. Among these dragons, worship of Cayden Cailean is most popular, as they see his love of freedom and penchant for alcohol aligning with the typical copper dragon mindset.

A copper dragon's combat tactics are as unorthodox as its sense of humor, as it is more likely to use mockery and tricks than outright strength to win its battles. As a copper dragon ages, it perfects jokes capable of rendering its foes helpless with laughter.

Paragons of virtue, nobility, and grace, metallic dragons are benevolent entities revered as mythic beings akin to gods in both their power and majesty. Few have ever seen a metallic dragon firsthand, but tales of their intervention in mortals' lives-and of their passing-always spread far and wide. Named for the way their scales resemble the shining metals humanoids use in commerce, warfare, and industry, these immense beings are diverse in their interests and abilities, and they don't seem to mind being associated with such mundane materials. After all, to compare a gold dragon to a gold coin is like comparing an ocean to a glass of water-though they may seem similar at first glance, the raw power, breadth, and grandeur of one simply overwhelms the other.

In addition to metallic dragons and their chromatic counterparts, other types of dragons roam the world and the rest of the multiverse. In the legendary lands of Tian Xia on the other side of the globe are the imperial dragons, serpentine beings who protect the cosmic balance and defend their ancient homeland. Outside the Material Plane, primal dragons such as the domineering brine dragon and reclusive cloud dragon shape the nature and goings-on of the Elemental Planes. Countless other types of dragons are sure to exist, including dragons on far-flung planes of existence and, it is rumored, primeval dragons who soar between the stars.

oEggkejJSMydzPBu.name: 塑石术(随意施法) Shape Stone (At Will)
oEggkejJSMydzPBu.description:
你将目标石块变成你选择的粗糙形状。该塑形过程十分粗糙，无法制造复杂的组件，细致的细节，可动部分，或者其他类似的东西。当你塑形一个石头时，站在其上的生物必须尝试一次反射豁免或者特技（Acrobatics）检定。

成功 目标不受影响。

失败 目标在石头上 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{倒地 Prone} 。

大失败 该生物从石头上摔落（如可能）并且倒地着地。

s4LwP4bMWZ2JSjZt.name: 狂笑术(随意施法) Hideous Laughter (At Will)
s4LwP4bMWZ2JSjZt.description:
目标突然充满无法控制的笑意。它必须尝试一次意志豁免。

大成功 目标不受影响。

成功 目标受苦于失控的笑意。它无法使用反应动作。

失败 目标 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1}，并且无法使用反应动作。

大失败 目标 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{倒地 Prone}，并且无法使用动作或反应动作，持续1轮。然后它会承受失败的效果。

NfHgwhhignIzYPcC.name: 油腻术(随意施法) Grease (At Will)
NfHgwhhignIzYPcC.description:
你创造一片油，其效果基于选择区域还是目标。

  • 区域 [4个连续的5尺方格] 区域中的所有坚实地面复盖上一层油。在油滑的表面上站立的生物必须尝试一次反射豁免，或者一次特技检定，对抗你的法术DC，否则会 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{倒地 Prone}。在法术持续时间内，使用动作移动到油滑表面上的生物必须尝试一次反射豁免或者特技检定来保持平衡。快步（Steps）或者爬行（Crawls）的生物无需尝试检定或者豁免。
  • 目标 [一个1负载或者更低的物体] 如果你对无主物品施放该法术，任何尝试捡起该物体的人必须尝试一次特技检定或者反射豁免，对抗你的法术DC，才能如此做。如果你以被持有物品为目标，拥有该物品的生物必须尝试一次特技检定或者反射豁免。失败时，持握者或者持用者在使用该物体的所有检定上承受-2环境减值；在大失败时，持握者或者持用者会掉落该物品。该物品会掉落在一个GM选择的相邻方格。如果你对一个穿戴物品施放该法术，穿戴着在对抗擒抱该物品的强韧豁免上获得+2环境加值。

2YipTTPgQfiSBAHG.name: Climb Stone
2YipTTPgQfiSBAHG.description: The dragon's climb speed functions only when climbing stone surfaces

ykw7UpzKukRpwEcU.name: Slow Aura
ykw7UpzKukRpwEcU.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:10]{10 feet} @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

Each creature that ends its turn in the aura must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:37] saving throw or be @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round (or @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} on a critical failure). The copper dragon can turn this aura on or off with a single action, which has the concentrate trait, and can choose not to affect allies within the aura.

oSoU8REx8w5hSHcD.name: Twisting Tail
oSoU8REx8w5hSHcD.description:
Trigger A creature within reach of the copper dragon's tail uses a move action or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

Effect The dragon makes a tail Strike at the creature with a -2 penalty. If it hits, the dragon disrupts the triggering action.

hrylbarG87YtJSgb.name: Breath Weapon
hrylbarG87YtJSgb.description:
The copper dragon breathes in one of two ways.

The dragon can't use Breath Weapon again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.

  • Acid The dragon breathes acid in a @Template[type:line|distance:100|traits:acid,arcane,evocation,damaging-effect] that deals [[/r {18d6}[acid]]]{18d6 acid damage} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:38|basic:true] save).
  • Slowing Gas The dragon breathes a @Template[type:line|distance:100|traits:arcane,transmutation] of slowing gas. Each creature in the area must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:38] save or be @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round (or @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} on a critical failure).

ZfNWabALFufsHCUi.name: Draconic Frenzy
ZfNWabALFufsHCUi.description: The dragon makes two claw Strikes and one tail Strike in any order.

QAKar9jh0ZBRftHz.name: Draconic Momentum
QAKar9jh0ZBRftHz.description: When the dragon scores a critical hit with a Strike, it recharges Breath Weapon.

44gZk9CBkA5y9VOb.name: Mass Laughter
44gZk9CBkA5y9VOb.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The copper dragon tells a fantastic joke. Each creature in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:100] must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:39] save or suffer the effects of a 9th-level @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.tlSE7Ly8vi1Dgddv]{Hideous Laughter} spell for 1 minute.

Ancient Copper Dragon (Spellcaster).name: 古赤铜龙施法者 Ancient Copper Dragon (Spellcaster)
Ancient Copper Dragon (Spellcaster).allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic
Ancient Copper Dragon (Spellcaster).publicNotes:
Capricious and always eager to share a good laugh, copper dragons are among the wiliest of the metallic dragons, but this by no means interferes with their mission to spread freedom in oppressive lands. Copper dragons are hedonists who are quick to indulge in simple pleasures, but they're also sympathetic to other creatures, slow to pass judgment, and careful to always examine a situation from as many perspectives as possible. This philosophy has its drawbacks, however, as copper dragons are susceptible to negative influences and prone to forgiving the less serious evil acts performed by their chromatic cousins and other cruel creatures. Copper dragons also have a difficult time keeping their temper in check once they are roused to anger.

Copper dragons tend to lair in warm or temperate hills, but due to their nature, they move their lairs every few years. They sometimes live among other people, especially any dwarves who reside nearby. Some copper dragons even worship gods typically worshipped only by humanoids. Among these dragons, worship of Cayden Cailean is most popular, as they see his love of freedom and penchant for alcohol aligning with the typical copper dragon mindset.

A copper dragon's combat tactics are as unorthodox as its sense of humor, as it is more likely to use mockery and tricks than outright strength to win its battles. As a copper dragon ages, it perfects jokes capable of rendering its foes helpless with laughter.

Paragons of virtue, nobility, and grace, metallic dragons are benevolent entities revered as mythic beings akin to gods in both their power and majesty. Few have ever seen a metallic dragon firsthand, but tales of their intervention in mortals' lives-and of their passing-always spread far and wide. Named for the way their scales resemble the shining metals humanoids use in commerce, warfare, and industry, these immense beings are diverse in their interests and abilities, and they don't seem to mind being associated with such mundane materials. After all, to compare a gold dragon to a gold coin is like comparing an ocean to a glass of water-though they may seem similar at first glance, the raw power, breadth, and grandeur of one simply overwhelms the other.

In addition to metallic dragons and their chromatic counterparts, other types of dragons roam the world and the rest of the multiverse. In the legendary lands of Tian Xia on the other side of the globe are the imperial dragons, serpentine beings who protect the cosmic balance and defend their ancient homeland. Outside the Material Plane, primal dragons such as the domineering brine dragon and reclusive cloud dragon shape the nature and goings-on of the Elemental Planes. Countless other types of dragons are sure to exist, including dragons on far-flung planes of existence and, it is rumored, primeval dragons who soar between the stars.

oEggkejJSMydzPBu.name: 塑石术(随意施法) Shape Stone (At Will)
oEggkejJSMydzPBu.description:
你将目标石块变成你选择的粗糙形状。该塑形过程十分粗糙，无法制造复杂的组件，细致的细节，可动部分，或者其他类似的东西。当你塑形一个石头时，站在其上的生物必须尝试一次反射豁免或者特技（Acrobatics）检定。

失败 目标在石头上 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{倒地 Prone} 。

大成功 目标不受影响。

成功 目标受苦于失控的笑意。它无法使用反应动作。

失败 目标 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1}，并且无法使用反应动作。

大失败 目标 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{倒地 Prone}，并且无法使用动作或反应动作，持续1轮。然后它会承受失败的效果。

y261UKFfM7KkcTYj.name: 侦测魔法 Detect Magic
y261UKFfM7KkcTYj.description:
你发出一股标记魔法存在的脉冲。你不会获得魔法存在或不存在以外的任何信息。你可以选择忽略你完全知晓的魔法，例如你或者你盟友的魔法物品以及持续法术。

仅当幻术魔法的环级低于你的侦测魔法环级时，你才能侦测幻术魔法。但是，具有幻术灵光但是没有在外表上做伪装的物品（例如一瓶隐形术药水），通常能够正常侦测。

升阶 (3环级) 你会了解法术侦测区域中最高环级的效果的学派。如果有相同强度的多个效果，GM决定你了解的为哪一个。

升阶 (4环级) 如3环级，你也能指出最高环级魔法的来源。如同一种模糊感官（imprecise sense），你不会了解具体的位置，但是可以将来源锁定到5尺立方（或者最近的那个五尺立方，如果来源体积比这个区域更大）。

NfHgwhhignIzYPcC.name: 油腻术(随意施法) Grease (At Will)
NfHgwhhignIzYPcC.description:
你创造一片油，其效果基于选择区域还是目标。

  • 区域 [4个连续的5尺方格] 区域中的所有坚实地面复盖上一层油。在油滑的表面上站立的生物必须尝试一次反射豁免，或者一次特技检定，对抗你的法术DC，否则会 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{倒地 Prone}。在法术持续时间内，使用动作移动到油滑表面上的生物必须尝试一次反射豁免或者特技检定来保持平衡。快步（Steps）或者爬行（Crawls）的生物无需尝试检定或者豁免。
  • 目标 [一个1负载或者更低的物体] 如果你对无主物品施放该法术，任何尝试捡起该物体的人必须尝试一次特技检定或者反射豁免，对抗你的法术DC，才能如此做。如果你以被持有物品为目标，拥有该物品的生物必须尝试一次特技检定或者反射豁免。失败时，持握者或者持用者在使用该物体的所有检定上承受-2环境减值；在大失败时，持握者或者持用者会掉落该物品。该物品会掉落在一个GM选择的相邻方格。如果你对一个穿戴物品施放该法术，穿戴着在对抗擒抱该物品的强韧豁免上获得+2环境加值。

2YipTTPgQfiSBAHG.name: Climb Stone
2YipTTPgQfiSBAHG.description: The dragon's climb speed functions only when climbing stone surfaces

ykw7UpzKukRpwEcU.name: Slow Aura
ykw7UpzKukRpwEcU.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:10]{10 feet} @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

Each creature that ends its turn in the aura must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:37] saving throw or be @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round (or @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} on a critical failure). The copper dragon can turn this aura on or off with a single action, which has the concentrate trait, and can choose not to affect allies within the aura.

oSoU8REx8w5hSHcD.description:

Effect The dragon makes a tail Strike at the creature with a -2 penalty. If it hits, the dragon disrupts the triggering action.

hrylbarG87YtJSgb.description:
The copper dragon breathes in one of two ways.

The dragon can't use Breath Weapon again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.

  • Acid The dragon breathes acid in a @Template[type:line|distance:100|traits:acid,arcane,evocation,damaging-effect] that deals [[/r {18d6}[acid]]]{18d6 acid damage} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:38|basic:true] save).
  • Slowing Gas The dragon breathes a @Template[type:line|distance:100|traits:arcane,transmutation] of slowing gas. Each creature in the area must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:38] save or be @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round (or @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} on a critical failure).

44gZk9CBkA5y9VOb.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The copper dragon tells a fantastic joke. Each creature in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:100] must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:39] save or suffer the effects of a 9th-level @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.tlSE7Ly8vi1Dgddv]{Hideous Laughter} spell for 1 minute.

Awakened Tree.name: 觉醒树木 Awakened Tree
Awakened Tree.publicNotes:
Arboreal regents and other wielders of powerful primal magic grant temporary sentience to trees in order to protect the forest. Invested with a workable set of instincts and the ability to mobilize and attack, these awakened trees follow the commands of their master and fight to protect their home. The statistics below work just as well for foliage that has become animate via other methods, such as a mystical influence from another dimension, a capricious fey spirit, or the like.

Arboreals are guardians of the forest and representatives of the trees. As long-lived as the woods they watch over, arboreals consider themselves parents and shepherds of trees rather than their gardeners. Consequently, while arboreals tend to be slow and methodical, they are terrifyingly swift when forced to fight in defense of the woods. Though they rarely seek out the companionship of short-lived folk-even elves are fugacious in the eyes of arboreals-and have an inherent distrust of change, arboreals have been known to tolerate those who seek to learn from their long-winded, rambling monologues, especially if such pupils also express a desire to protect the timberlands. Against those who threaten their realm, such as loggers eager to harvest lumber or settlers aiming to establish croplands or a town, arboreals' wrath is unwavering and devastating. Perhaps ironically, arboreals are gifted at tearing down what others build-a trait that serves vengeful members of their kind well.

4P8IOAM51aWrHmLb.name: Axe Vulnerability
4P8IOAM51aWrHmLb.description: An awakened tree takes 5 additional damage from axes.

Azure Worm.name: 蓝虫 Azure Worm
Azure Worm.publicNotes:
The azure worm is a deep-blue creature that is more at home in flooded tunnels than dry caves. While an azure worm is a strong swimmer, it prefers to lie in wait within the walls, door, or even ceiling of flooded caverns, ready to spring out and ambush creatures swimming past its hiding spot. The azure worm is particularly hated and feared by Darklands-dwelling cultures, due to the fact that an azure worm that burrows into a tunnel often brings with it waters from the submerged river or lake it calls home. When it becomes obvious that an azure worm is near a Darklands settlement, the inhabitants quickly establishing a hunting party to deal with the menace before it can bring ruin.

Cave worms are gigantic scavengers that bore through the depths of the world, eating whatever material they find. Named for their distinctive colorations, these worms are ravenous and display overwhelming destructive capabilities. Cave worms of different colors and abilities lurk in the more remote corners of the world-tales speak of white worms that dwell within immense glaciers or icebergs and gray worms that burrow through the boneyards of long-forgotten ruins, to name a few.

SzReeoNa9jYsialH.name: Inexorable
SzReeoNa9jYsialH.description: The azure worm recovers from the @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}, @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed}, and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned} conditions at the end of its turn. It's also immune to penalties to its Speeds and the @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} condition, and it ignores difficult terrain and greater difficult terrain.

K09n3CnAeuaSeD9k.name: Shake It Off
K09n3CnAeuaSeD9k.description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger The azure worm would be affected by a condition or adverse effect (such as @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.dN8QBNuTiaBHCKUe]{Baleful Polymorph})

Effect The azure worm negates the triggering condition or effect. Effects from artifacts, deities, or a similarly powerful source can't be avoided in this way.

sqZIq7wiLeITXB6q.name: Azure Worm Venom
sqZIq7wiLeITXB6q.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:37]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 [[/r {3d6}[poison]]]{3d6 poison damage} and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} (1 round)

Stage 2 [[/r {4d6}[poison]]]{4d6 poison damage} and clumsy 2 (1 round)

Stage 3 [[/r {6d6}[poison]]]{6d6 poison damage} and clumsy 2 (1 round)

k8mtTYrWrnHjBMCO.name: Breach
k8mtTYrWrnHjBMCO.description: The azure worm Swims up to its swim Speed, then Leaps vertically out of the water up to 30 feet, making a Strike against a creature at the apex of the jump (this lets it attack a creature within 45 feet of the water's surface). After the Strike, the worm splashes back down. It can use @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.i18TlebMzwONyPhI]{Improved Grab} on this Strike and follow it up with Fast Swallow.

IYYi7B0j0PD17IXo.name: Fast Swallow
IYYi7B0j0PD17IXo.description:
Trigger The worm @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabs} a creature.

Effect The worm uses Swallow Whole.

PF9LIocpqPbxqnvR.name: Thrash
PF9LIocpqPbxqnvR.description: The worm makes a Strike once against each creature in its reach. It can Strike up to once with its jaws, up to once with its stinger, and any number of times with its body. Each attack counts toward the worm's multiple attack penalty, but the multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after it makes all the attacks.

Balisse.name: 巴尔伊斯 Balisse
Balisse.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic
Balisse.senses: (+20 to detect lies and illusions); darkvision
Balisse.publicNotes:
Balisses, or confessor angels, seek to assist mortals ensnared by moral dilemmas or crises of faith. Balisses prefer to guide people to their own decisions rather than demand obedience to a higher cause, as intrinsic belief is even more powerful than blind obedience. While most balisses are fundamentally honest, they use their guardian angel ability to seem less intimidating and decrease the chance the mortal will simply acquiesce to the opinion of an obviously divine being. Balisses often form from souls of those who performed evil acts but were redeemed. Many serve the goddess Sarenrae, but they can serve other good deities and empyreal lords as well.

The celestial hosts of angels are messengers and warriors, divided into choirs based on their abilities and purviews. The majority of angels are neutral good and live in Nirvana, the plane of virtue and enlightenment. However, some angels, including several angelic deities, have different alignments, and some even dwell on other planes. Regardless of alignment, angels remain benevolent messengers possessed with magical auras to aid their allies.

J8DYyAUH2MgtwPeM.name: Tongues (Constant)
J8DYyAUH2MgtwPeM.description:
The target can understand all words regardless of language and also speak the languages of other creatures. When in a mixed group of creatures, each time the target speaks, it can choose a creature and speak in a language that creature understands, even if the target doesn't know what language that is.

Heightened (7th) The duration is 8 hours.

AIivVBT37yLmpoiE.name: Invisibility (At Will) (Self Only)
AIivVBT37yLmpoiE.description:
Cloaked in illusion, the target becomes @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible}. This makes it @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected} to all creatures, though the creatures can attempt to find the target, making it @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} to them instead. If the target uses a hostile action, the spell ends after that hostile action is completed.

Heightened (4th) The spell lasts 1 minute, but it doesn't end if the target uses a hostile action.

mW91KOH1mqBVJgBw.name: Remove Fear (At Will)
mW91KOH1mqBVJgBw.description:
With a touch, you ease a creature's fears. You can attempt to counteract a single fear effect that the target suffers from. This frees only the target, not any other creatures under the fear effect.

Heightened (6th) The spell's range increases to 30 feet, and you can target up to 10 creatures.

p0Pe1njRhm7KfrxH.name: Detect Alignment (At Will) (Evil Only)
p0Pe1njRhm7KfrxH.description:
Your eyes glow as you sense aligned auras. Choose chaotic, evil, good, or lawful. You detect auras of that alignment. You receive no information beyond presence or absence. You can choose not to detect creatures or effects you're aware have that alignment.

Only creatures of 6th level or higher-unless divine spellcasters, undead, or beings from the Outer Sphere-have alignment auras.

Heightened (2nd) You learn each aura's location and strength.

E36GUJSTq2NvkRmA.name: Confessor's Aura
E36GUJSTq2NvkRmA.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:20]{20 feet} @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

Creatures in the balisse's aura are subject to @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.aewxsale5xWEPKLk]{Zone of Truth} (DC 23). Additionally, if these creatures choose to honestly express their own conflicted feelings, the aura makes it easier for them to put words to those feelings.

Z4NC0zq5T9vj6Gu8.name: Brand of the Impenitent
Z4NC0zq5T9vj6Gu8.description:
Frequency Once per day

Effect The balisse marks an evil creature within its confessor's aura as irredeemable. It can only do so after a failed attempt to convince the creature to repent. The touched creature takes a -1 status penalty to AC and saves, reduces its resistances by 2 and gains weakness 2 to good damage. The duration depends on the targets @Check[type:will|dc:26] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected

Success The duration is 1 round

Failure The duration is 1 day

Critical Failure The duration is permanent

@Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-effects.BmAw66zEkifSvOtg]{Effect: Brand of the Impenitent}

NtYoVyYPS90gzKOB.name: Flaming Armament
NtYoVyYPS90gzKOB.description: Any weapon gains the effects of a @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.XszNvxnymWYRaoTp]{Flaming} property rune while a balisse wields it.

prLWsWvW54YcYyNa.name: Guiding Angel
prLWsWvW54YcYyNa.description: While invisible, a balisse can spiritually attach itself to a non-evil mortal. When it does so, it merges with the mortal's body and is unable to use any of its spells and abilities other than to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.pvQ5rY2zrtPI614F]{Interact} with the mortal. It must use Guiding Angel again to leave the mortal. While merged with the mortal, the balisse can see, such as a small angel on the mortal's shoulder. Alternatively, it can communicate with the mortal using a bodiless voice only the mortal can hear.

Banshee.name: 报丧女妖 Banshee

dr.exceptions: 除力场、幽冥或正能量；对抗非魔法时双倍抗力

Banshee.publicNotes:
报丧女妖是愤怒且痛苦的灵魂，她们是在生命的最后时刻由于被背叛而束缚在主物质位面的精灵。部分报丧女妖的诞生是因为精灵被最信任的同伴和朋友所杀害，或者是在临终时被所爱之人所背叛。而另一些由精灵衍生出的报丧女妖则是因为其死前的背信行为在灵魂上留下了污点。无论报丧女妖自身的起源是哪个种类，她们都会蔑视生灵。这种对生者的仇恨往往是其生前性格的可怖翻转。有人猜测越是善良热心的精灵（在遭遇越发痛苦的背叛后），由其诞生的报丧女妖越是残忍无情。

报丧女妖很少远离自身的殒命之地，她们通常会在阳光很少能照耀的地点作祟，比如茂密的森林或昏暗的沼泽。在精灵之国奇奥尼（Kyonin）可以找到许多报丧女妖，尤其是在扭曲棘林（Tanglebriar）——恶魔毁木者（Treerazer）的邪恶领地。同样地，幽暗地域（Darklands）的卓尔定居点周边也潜伏着大量的报丧女妖，因为卓尔文化中不乏大量残忍的背叛行为。

报丧女妖仅靠碰触就能带来痛苦与源自内心的原始恐惧，那些暴露在她们悲伤哀嚎中的人很难存活下来。

74wDKknM5LCOcK73.name: 60尺洞见心跳（模糊）
74wDKknM5LCOcK73.description: 报丧女妖能听到60尺范围内的心跳声（模糊感官）。

rQT7KUvA4yzEm4PO.name: 阳光削弱 Sunlight Powerlessness
rQT7KUvA4yzEm4PO.description: 在阳光的直射下，报丧女妖会陷入@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1}，且无法使用具有攻击特征的动作。

NKs8hoGb4IyfFWCw.name: 复仇之怨 Vengeful Spite
NKs8hoGb4IyfFWCw.description:
触发 有敌人对报丧女妖造成重击或者报丧女妖在对抗敌人的伤害性效果时投掷出了大失败。

效果 报丧女妖向折磨她的人进行反击，对其造成[[/r {4d10+14}[mental]]]{4d10+14心灵伤害}（@Check[type:will|dc:38|basic:true]豁免），并根据相同的意志豁免结果将惊骇之触的效果应用至目标。

q8ASqdiBd9SflYVU.name: 幽体涟漪 Spectral Ripple
q8ASqdiBd9SflYVU.description: 当报丧女妖行走了至少10尺时，她们会获得@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{隐蔽 Concealed}直至其下个回合开始为止。

ePRrl3MsWtcXXzD7.name: 惊骇之触 Terrifying Touch
ePRrl3MsWtcXXzD7.description: 被报丧女妖的触摸所伤害且还未陷入@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened}的生物必须尝试一次@Check[type:will|dc:38]豁免（若她的攻击造成重击则为@Check[type:will|dc:43]）。若目标生物豁免失败，则会陷入@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 2}；大失败时还会因恐惧而畏缩，陷入@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{震慑 Stunned 4}。若该生物由于法术或魔法物品的保护而可以对抗恐惧的话，报丧女妖的触摸首先会尝试反制该保护效果，该效果相当于9环的@Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{解除魔法 Dispel Magic}法术。

IFPnmQpUJLW9TJa9.name: 哀嚎 Wail
IFPnmQpUJLW9TJa9.description:
报丧女妖发出了让人心悸的@Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.FEsuyf203wTNE2et]{女妖之嚎 Wail of the Banshee}（@Check[type:fortitude|dc:38]）。这声哀嚎会克服5环或更低环级的@Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.gIdDLrbswTV3OBJy]{沉默术 Silence}或类似效果。报丧女妖可以使用三动作的行动来替代哀嚎的行动，这使得她能够克服至多8环的上述效果。

报丧女妖的哀嚎会在1轮内持续共鸣，在此期间进入此区域的任何生物都必须尝试一次豁免对抗该效果。同一名生物不会被同一个哀嚎影响多次。

报丧女妖在[[/br 1d4 #Recharge Wail]]{1d4轮}内无法再次进行哀嚎。

Baomal.name: 巴莫 Baomal
Baomal.publicNotes: Few sea monsters are as dreaded and feared as the two-headed baomal. These massive predatory beasts typically dwell in the deepest waters and compete with krakens and other monsters for food. They feed on whales and other large sea creatures, sometimes following them to the water's surface. Near the surface, baomals that encounter ships quickly learn that they contain a variety of tasty morsels. The creatures use their devastating spikes to rip open the ships' hulls, then leisurely feed on the helpless sailors.

XxKXmsn4wSfWyyXp.name: 借机攻击 Attack of Opportunity

LZ3htI7JRHvcwAhU.name: Double Opportunity
LZ3htI7JRHvcwAhU.description: A baomal gains an extra reaction each round that it can use only to make an Attack of Opportunity. It must use a different head for each one it attempts, and it can't make more than one Attack of Opportunity for the same triggering action.

LkBIOwt4NW6BfYFE.name: Psychic Static Aura
LkBIOwt4NW6BfYFE.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:120]{120 feet} @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

All creatures, except aberrations, that begin their turn in the area take [[/r {5d6}[mental]]]{5d6 mental damage}.

74Xu2C6KzxtSFcNe.name: Two Heads
74Xu2C6KzxtSFcNe.description: Any ability that would sever a baomal's head (such as a critical hit with a @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.6xaxxKfvXED6LfIY]{Vorpal} weapon) severs one head at random. Losing one head doesn't kill a baomal, but it does prevent the baomal from making Strikes with the lost head and from using Double Opportunity or Two-Headed Strike.

ZuxcOScsfkdklfi8.name: Breath of the Sea
ZuxcOScsfkdklfi8.description: A baomal can inhale tremendous amounts of water, drawing everything in the sea nearby closer. All creatures and objects in the water within @Template[type:emanation|distance:60]{60 feet} of the baomal (including ships) are pulled toward it. Creatures must succeed at a @Check[type:athletics|dc:42] check or be pulled up to 20 feet toward the baomal (40 feet on a critical failure). For ships, use the captain's Sailing Lore in place of Athletics. Unattended objects are automatically pulled.

y6bETzshaXTYx4Wq.name: Shell Rake
y6bETzshaXTYx4Wq.description: The baomal Swims or Strides alongside a creature or the hull of a vessel, dealing damage with the strong spikes on its shell. Each creature or ship the baomal is adjacent to at any point during its movement takes [[/r {6d6+10}[slashing,piercing]]]{6d6+10 slashing and piercing damage} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:42|basic:true] save). Against vessels, Shell Rake ignores the first 5 Hardness and creates an explosion of splinters that deals [[/r {3d6+5}]]{3d6+5 damage} to every creature within @Template[type:burst|distance:10]{10 feet} of the deck's edge (@Check[type:reflex|dc:42|basic:true] save).

Barbazu.name: 胡须魔 Barbazu
Barbazu.allSaves: 对所有魔法效果的豁免有+1状态加值
Barbazu.publicNotes:
巴霸魔，通常也被称为胡须魔或步兵魔，是一种嗜杀成性的魔鬼，它们充当炼狱军队的步兵来满足自己的毁灭欲望，通常会带领成群的下级魔鬼例如小魔鬼或劣魔加入战斗。胡须魔会挥舞着带锯刃的大砍刀，造成锯齿状的伤口能抵抗治疗法术，造成大量失血。当地人靠的太近时，胡须魔会用它们蠕动的尖刺胡须发起攻击，造成一种叫做“地狱热疫”的可怕疾病，它们也会津津有味地看着猎物的力量从内部被慢慢地吞噬。

胡须魔总是野蛮地沉迷于来自地狱各层的地狱领主们的邪恶念头，热衷于为它们散播谋杀、悲惨和痛苦。

作为散播腐败和征服的大师，魔鬼们试图诱惑凡人生命加入它们对亵渎事物的追求中来，并将暴政传播到各个世界。它们向人类提出各种条件，从签署一份地狱契约而获取的强大力量，到向邪神低语换来的扭曲恩惠，甚至还有许多更微妙的交易。那些屈服于这些诱惑的人，会发现自己死后会在地狱的深坑中遭受无尽的折磨，在那里唯一逃脱的希望就是晋升为地狱中的魔鬼。从士兵、学者到检察官、律师、法官和刽子手，每一种恶魔在维持冷酷无情的地狱官僚机器上扮演着特定的角色，这就是地狱。低级的劣魔和小魔鬼服从于更强大和专业的恶魔，比如契约魔和狂怒魔，做着卑下的工作，而最强大的深狱炼魔指挥着整个地狱军团。

GZ55vWFhwaHyhnfM.name: 地狱热疫 Avernal Fever
GZ55vWFhwaHyhnfM.description:
豁免 @Check[type:fortitude|dc:23]

阶段 1 携带疾病但是不受影响（1 日）

阶段 2 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{力竭 Enfeebled 1} (1 天)

阶段 3 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{力竭 Enfeebled 2} (1 天)

SNJ0RSCREyP9YYKY.name: 地狱创伤 Infernal Wound
SNJ0RSCREyP9YYKY.description:
胡须魔的大砍刀打击也会造成@Localize[PF2E.PersistentDamage.Bleed1d6.success]，并且能抵抗对流血伤害的治疗尝试。

终止流血伤害的纯骰检定@Check[type:flat|dc:20]。只有当流血生物得到盟友成功进行协助之后该DC才会减少到@Check[type:flat|dc:15]。对有地狱创伤生物@Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.MHLuKy4nQO2Z4Am1]{进行急救 Administer First Aid}的DC增加5。

施法者或物品试图对受到地狱创伤的生物使用治疗魔法时，必须通过DC 21的反制检定，否则法术无法生效。

zQUhdB7kvudfGv5Z.name: 移位 Reposition
zQUhdB7kvudfGv5Z.description:
触发 魔鬼的大砍刀打击命中目标

效果 魔鬼将目标朝任意方向移动5尺。目的地方格必须在魔鬼大砍刀的触及范围内。

此移动不会触发反应动作。

6zbiPHhWaAV5pJd6.name: 蠕动胡须 Wriggling Beard
6zbiPHhWaAV5pJd6.description:
频率 每轮一次

效果 胡须魔进行一次胡须打击。此打击不受多重攻击减值，并且也不计入多重攻击减值。

6F6RBqJmz0JUvLc3.name: 神术内在法术 Divine Innate Spells

j5nOoy2JdxGbg96d.name: 次元门(随意施法) Dimension Door (At Will)
j5nOoy2JdxGbg96d.description:
你通过开启一扇绕过通常空间的门，将自身以及任何你穿戴和持握的物品从你当前所在的空间立刻传送到你能看见的范围内的开阔空间。如果此时另一个生物会与你随行—即使你使用异次元存储空间—你会失去该法术。

升阶 (5环级) 该射程增加到1英里。你无须看见你的目标，只要你曾经去过那里，并且了解其与你的相对位置和距离。你会暂时免疫1小时。

fOXEVyfWiHQRSyiC.name: 高等黑暗视觉 Greater Darkvision

T108hwN1OhACYQdQ.name: 借机攻击 Attack of Opportunity

Basilisk.name: 石化蜥蜴 Basilisk
Basilisk.publicNotes:
The basilisk is an eight-legged reptile with a nasty disposition and the ability to turn creatures to stone with its gaze. Folklore holds that, much like for the cockatrice, the first basilisks hatched from leathery eggs laid by snakes and incubated by roosters, but little in the basilisk's physiology lends any credence to this claim.

A basilisk prefers to eat petrified flesh. Once a victim has been turned to stone, the basilisk crunches the fossilized corpse with its powerful jaws and lets its potent stomach acids do the rest. This digestive process is extremely slow and inefficient, causing the basilisk to move so lethargically that it appears as if in mid-petrification itself. This has even led to the saying "as slow as a well-fed basilisk." Certainly basilisks are well-known for their slow gait and slothful nature, but a predator that can turn its prey to stone with a glance hardly has much need for speed.

An adult basilisk is 13 feet long from head to tail and weighs roughly 300 pounds. These reptiles make hissing sounds when moving about that turns to a guttural gurgle when they're agitated. Though they are normally solitary creatures that come together only to mate and lay eggs, there are periodic reports of regions being infested with unusual numbers of basilisks. What causes these unusual congregations of basilisk activity is unknown.

For unknown reasons, weasels and ferrets are immune to the basilisk's stare, and they sometimes sneak into basilisk lairs while a parent is hunting in order to consume eggs or freshly hatched young. Some legends suggest that a basilisk's blood can transmute common stones into other material, but this is likely a case of witnesses misinterpreting the magical restoration of previously petrified creatures or body parts.

Nl15bkRTLq869IPi.name: Petrifying Glance
Nl15bkRTLq869IPi.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

Trigger A creature within 30 feet that the basilisk can see starts its turn.

Effect The target must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:20] save. If it fails, it's @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 minute as its body slowly stiffens.

tOCS9mkYR5K1LuOZ.name: Petrifying Gaze
tOCS9mkYR5K1LuOZ.description:
The basilisk stares at a creature it can see within 30 feet. That creature must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:22] save. If it fails and has not already been slowed by Petrifying Glance or this ability, it becomes @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}. If the creature was already slowed by this ability or Petrifying Glance, a failed save causes the creature to be @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.dTwPJuKgBQCMxixg]{Petrified} permanently.

A creature petrified in this manner that is coated (not just splashed) with fresh basilisk blood (taken from a basilisk that has been dead no longer than 1 hour) is instantly restored to flesh.

A single basilisk contains enough blood to coat [[/br 1d3 #Medium Creatures]]{1d3 Medium creatures} in this manner.

Bloodseeker.name: 觅血者 Bloodseeker
Bloodseeker.publicNotes:
Scourges of swamps and damp, abandoned places, bloodseekers are ravenous blood drinkers. Farmers curse the creatures for sucking their livestock dry. It is from such beleaguered people that the bloodseeker's regional name "stirge," possibly a corruption of the word "scourge," comes. Folk wisdom holds that the appearance of bloodseekers in a region signals a healthy herd of livestock, but more often it means bogs or old buildings that haven't been properly tended to. Certainly, no amount of folksy parable can assuage a farmer driven to destitution by a bloodseeker infestation. But despite their role as parasites, bloodseekers aren't hated by all villages. In some cases, the inhabitants of remote backwoods thorps even keep the things as pets or use them as doubtful medicinal "tools" to drain away unwanted humors or test for evil spirits possessing the blood. Worshippers of gods of pestilence and parasites often view bloodseekers as sacred to their faith and allow the creatures to feed freely from their bodies. In such societies, those who accidentally give too much are considered to have been "blessed" by the village's hungry god.

Bloodseekers seem to be constantly hungry, but they are not inherently malevolent. They can be scared away fairly easily and prefer to swiftly retreat rather than risk death. Some adventurers report that these creatures can be scared away by waving torches at the flying pests. However, bloodseekers are much bolder when encountered in larger numbers, as bringing down one victim lets an entire colony feed. Bloodseeker colonies are called clots, for obvious and disgusting reasons. If a lone bloodseeker finds a likely victim while its clot is nearby, it emits a high-pitched, keening noise to summon reinforcements.

Most humanoids avoid bloodseekers, but boggards sometimes cultivate bloodseeker nests around the perimeter of their territory. These colonies serve as a deterrent to intruders, and the boggards sometimes check for bloodseeker prey, collecting the hides or bodies of animals killed by the pests. Meals prepared from slain bloodseekers that have gorged on the blood of specific creatures are a staple among certain boggard communities. The boggards not only eat the actual bloodseekers, but they also make a gelled slurry from the drained blood.

A typical bloodseeker is about a foot long, with mottled, reddish-brown skin and a yellow underbelly. Its four wings resemble bat wings. When gorged with blood, the creature becomes bloated and pink, and it tends to wobble unsteadily in the air as it flies off to digest its meal.

QEvRlTqwOEac04ov.name: Attach
QEvRlTqwOEac04ov.description:
